## Overview[](#toc_1)

Apollo allows you to create **Custom Fields** for contacts, accounts, opportunities, and users. Within a custom field, you have the option to choose the field **Type**. One of the more commonly used field **Types** is a **Picklist**.

**Picklists** are defined lists of values (options) that you can use within custom contact, account, and user fields. They come in two varieties:

*   Picklist: Allows you to select one option from a pre-defined list
*   Picklist (Multi-Select): Allows you to select one or more options from a pre-defined list

The Apollo **Global Picklist** feature provides a way for you to leverage the same list of values for different custom **Picklist** fields. For example, say you have three custom **Picklist** fields—one for contacts, one for accounts, and one for opportunities—and they are all named "Health". In this case, rather than manually entering the same options for each custom **Picklist** field, you can create a **Global Picklist** that you can use in all three (or more).

Refer to the section below for additional details about how to create global picklists within custom contact, account, and user fields.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create Global Picklists[](#toc_2)

Log into Apollo and then click **Settings**.

[![Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i1.png)

Click **Global Picklists**.

[![Global Picklists](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i2.png)

Click +**\+ New Global Picklist Value Set**.

[![New Global Picklist Value Set](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i3.png)

In the new modal, type a **Name** for the **Global Picklist Value Set**.

[![Name](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i4.png)

Click **\+ Add Option** to add a new **Picklist Option** to the **Picklist**. Repeat this process for as many options as you'd like to include.

[![Picklist Options](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i5.png)

If you need to remove an option, click the **Delete** ![Delete](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i7.png) button next to it.

[![Delete Options](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i6.png)

When you finish editing the **Picklist**, click **Save**.

[![Delete Options](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i8.png)

The **Global Picklist** is now available for you to use in any custom contact, account, or user field.

[![Global Picklist](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i9.png)

For any existing **Global Picklist**, refer to the **Currently Used By** column on the **Global Picklist** page to determine which (if any) custom fields currently use it.

[![Currently Used By](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_global_picklists/i10.png)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

Dynamic variables enable you to personalize emails for individual contacts by leveraging Apollo's data, and, in the case of [custom dynamic variables](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409494161677), your own data research. By adding basic dynamic variables to the subject line and body of your email template, you can automatically add details such as contacts' names, the time of day, and information about contacts' companies to your emails.

The following sections show how to add dynamic variables to email templates and test them, as well as details about every basic dynamic variable available in Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Add Basic Dynamic Variables To An Email Template[](#toc_1)

You can add basic dynamic variables to new and existing email templates, including those used in [sequences](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837). For more information about creating email templates, refer to [Create and Use Email Templates](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409238165389).

To add a basic dynamic variable to an email template, click **{}**. Then click the variable that you want to use. You can add multiple variables to the same template.

[![Add a basic dynamic variable to your email.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_basic_dynamic_variables/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_basic_dynamic_variables/i1.png)

The dynamic variable is inserted in the email. You can insert dynamic variables in both the subject line and body of your email template. Either place your cursor in the desired spot before adding the variable, or cut and paste the variable to a new spot after adding it.

[![View and move the added variables.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_basic_dynamic_variables/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_basic_dynamic_variables/i2.png)

To test the dynamic variable on a contact, click the **here** link in the template preview.

[![Test a variable.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_basic_dynamic_variables/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_basic_dynamic_variables/i3.png)

Then, enter a contact's name or choose a contact from the drop-down to generate an email preview using their data. If Apollo has the necessary data, the template preview will populate the variable with the contact's information.

[![View and move the added variables.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_basic_dynamic_variables/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_basic_dynamic_variables/i4.png)

If data isn't available for a contact, the preview highlights the variable in red.

[![View variables without data.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_basic_dynamic_variables/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_basic_dynamic_variables/i5.png)

Basic Dynamic Variables Without Available Data

Dynamic variables without any data for a specific contact may result in Apollo moving the email to that contact to the [Not Sent](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5403737512589-Why-Didn-t-My-Email-Send#toc_9) folder. To avoid this, leverage the conditional logic operators provided by [advanced dynamic variables](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409735256845).

[Back to Top](#top)

## Understand Basic Dynamic Variables[](#toc_2)

Basic dynamic variables enable you to leverage information about the individual contacts, the time of day, and the contact's employer. Basic variables are organized into the following 3 categories.

### Basic Dynamic Variables[](#toc_3)

| Dynamic Variable | Description | Example |
| --- | --- | --- |
| {{first\_name}} | Displays the first name for the recipient when it is available | John |
| {{last\_name}} | Displays the last name for the recipient when it is available | Smith |
| {{company}} | Displays the name of the company that the recipient works for when it is available | Apollo |
| {{company\_unprocessed\_name}} | Displays the full name of the company that the recipient works for when it is available | Apollo, Inc. |
| {{email}} | Displays the email address of the recipient | recipient@domain.com |
| {{domain}} | Displays the domain for the recipient's email address | domain.com |
| {{location\_city}} | Displays the recipient's city location when it is available | Boston |
| {{location\_state}} | Displays the recipient's state location when it is available | Massachusetts |
| {{location\_country}} | Displays the recipient's country location when it is available | United States |
| {{phone}} | Displays the recipient's phone number when it is available | 1 555 123 4567 |
| {{sender\_first\_name}} | Displays the sender's first name when it is available | David |
| {{sender\_last\_name}} | Displays the sender's last name when it is available | Smith |
| {{sender\_email}} | Displays the sender's email address when it is available | user@apollo.io |
| {{primary\_intent\_signal}} | Displays the saved [buying intent topic](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/8135721478925) with the highest ranking score for your team. | Performance Marketing |
| {{secondary\_intent\_signal}} | Displays the saved buying intent topic with the second highest ranking score for your team. | Modern Marketing |

[Back to Top](#top)

### Time Dynamic Variables[](#toc_4)

| Dynamic Variables | Description | Example |
| --- | --- | --- |
| {{now\_day}} | Displays the current day of the month | 15  |
| {{now\_month}} | Displays the current month | September |
| {{now\_time\_of\_day}} | Displays the current phase of the day | morning/afternoon/evening |
| {{now\_weekday}} | Displays the current day of the week | Wednesday |
| {{now\_year}} | Displays the current year | 2024 |

[Back to Top](#top)

### More Dynamic Variables[](#toc_5)

| Dynamic Variable | Description | Example |
| --- | --- | --- |
| {{company\_location\_city}} | Displays the city where the recipient's company is located | San Francisco |
| {{company\_location\_state}} | Displays the state where the recipient's company is located | California |
| {{company\_location\_country}} | Displays the country where the recipient's company is located | Colombia |
| {{latest\_funding\_type}} | Displays the latest funding stage for the recipient's company | Seed-Stage/Series X/Late-Stage |
| {{company\_size}} | Displays the number of people who work at the recipient's company | 200 |
| {{vertical}} | Displays the vertical for the recipient's company | Cloud Computing |
| {{industry}} | Displays the industry for the recipient's company | Computer Software |
| {{title}} | Displays the recipient's title | Marketing Director |
| {{opt\_out\_message}} | Displays the unsubscribe message that you defined for your account's email settings. Refer to [Configure Your Unsubscribe Email Link](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409140379661) for additional information. | If you don't want to receive emails from me anymore, please [let me know](mailto:%20test@apollo.io). |

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Custom fields allow you to capture individualized research about a contact, account, or user and leverage them in Apollo sequence email templates for open-time personalization. **Custom Account** fields allow you to capture information about individual companies so you can easily re-use it in a template.

Refer to the section below for additional details about how to create custom fields for accounts.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create a Custom Account Field[](#toc_2)

Launch Apollo and then click **Settings**.

[![Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i1.png)

Click **Accounts**.

[![Contacts](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i14.png)

Click **Custom Fields**.

[![Contacts](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i15.png)

Click **\+ New Field**.

[![New Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i16.png)

On the "Add Custom Account Field" modal, type a descriptive name in the **Name** text-box.

[![New Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i17.png)

Select the field **Type** from the drop-down.

[![Field Types](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i18.png)

The available field types include:

| Field Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Single-line text | Allows you to include a single line of text for the field. You must specify the maximum number of characters for the field. |
| Multi-line text | Allows you to include a string of text that spans multiple lines. You must specify the maximum number of characters for the field. Line breaks count against the total character count. |
| Number | Allows you to include a number with or without decimals. You cannot use non-numeric characters. |
| Date | Allows you to type a date in the format of `Day/Month/Year` or select a date with the calendar widget. |
| Date/Time | Allows you to type a date in the format of `Day/Month/Year` or select a date with the calendar widget. Allows you to select a time in half-hour increments from the drop-down. |
| Checkbox | Allows you to specify either `True` or `False` within the field's drop-down. |
| Picklist | Allows you to include an existing picklist or create a new picklist with defined values. You can only select one value from the picklist. For additional information about creating picklists, please see [Create Global Picklists.](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412498624269) |
| Picklist (Multi-Select) | Allows you to include an existing picklist or create a new picklist with defined values. You can only select multiple values from the picklist. For additional information about creating picklists, please see [Create Global Picklists.](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412498624269) |
| Lookup-User | Allows you to specify a user from your account via a drop-down. |

No Type Changes After Creation

Please note, once you create a custom field you cannot change the type.

Once you define the field **Type**, if you have connected Salesforce to your account, you can select a **Salesforce Account Field** with which to link this field. This field is optional.

[![Salesforce Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i19.png)

Use the checkbox below the Salesforce options to mark this **Account Field** as read-only. This means that Apollo will pull data directly from the mapped Salesforce fields but will not push data to Salesforce.

[![Read Only](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i20.png)

If you have selected **Picklist** or **Picklist (Multi-Select)** for the field **Type**, you have 2 options:

*   Select a previously created **picklist value set**. Click the drop-down for your available options.

[![Previous Picklist Options](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i38.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i38.png)

*   Create a new **picklist value set** and add the options that you would like to appear in the contact's profile.
    
    [![Picklist Options](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i21.png)
    

After you finish configuring the custom **Account Field**, click **Save**.

[![Global Picklist Name](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i22.png)

Your new custom **Account Field** is now usable in an Account's profile.

[![Completed Custom Contact Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i34.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_custom_fields/i34.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Lists allow you to consolidate related contacts and accounts in a common location so you can easily prospect and engage with them. You can [use lists in a search](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview#h_01HVKXNZY517JCQNQDGE685P2X), [add lists to a sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409231193101-Create-a-Sequence) to automate outreach, or [add lists to plays](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413804036109-Create-a-Play) for task scheduling and sequence maintenance.

Check out the following sections to create, edit, and use lists.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create a List[](#toc_2)

To create a list of contacts or accounts:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Search** > [**People**](https://app.apollo.io/#/people) or [**Companies**](https://app.apollo.io/#/companies).
2.  [Use search filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview) to narrow your results.
3.  Check the box next to each contact or account you want to add to your list, or use bulk selection at the top.

[![An example search shows 2 people checked](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i1.png)

4.  Click **Lists** > **Add to Lists**.

[![The list, add to lists button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i2.png)

5.  Add the selected contacts or accounts to an existing list, or type a name and click **Create new list**. Then click **Save**.

[![An example list is saved named Prospect list 1](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i3.png)

Credit Where It's Due

It costs 1 email credit per verified email to add net new contacts to a list. It doesn't cost credits to add previously saved contacts to a list. To track your credit usage, launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Manage Plan**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/plans). Check out [Apollo plans](https://www.apollo.io/pricing) to see plans and credit packages.

6.  To view your new list, click **Saved Lists**.

[![The Saved lists tab is highlighted with Prospect list 1 shown in results](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i4.png)

Now you're ready to [use your list](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409728608525-Create-and-Edit-a-Contact-or-Company-List#toc_3).

[Back to Top](#top)

## Use a List[](#toc_3)

Use lists to [email prospects](https://app.apollo.io/#/emails), add them to [sequences](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences) or [plays](https://app.apollo.io/#/plays), export to a [CSV](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237712141-Export-Contacts-from-Apollo-to-a-CSV) or CRM, or [enrich the data](https://app.apollo.io/#/enrichment-status) in your list, all in Apollo's [engagement suite](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/10316295330573-Watch-A-Bite-Sized-Apollo-Demo#toc_8).

To use a list:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Search** > [**Saved Lists**](https://app.apollo.io/#/people/tags).
2.  Click **People Lists** or **Companies Lists**, then choose **All**, **My**, or **Team** lists.

[![Example people lists are shown under the Team tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i11.png)

3.  Click **Add to sequence** to add a list to a [sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview). To manage a list, click **...** > **Edit** or **Delete**.

[![The Add to Sequence and More options buttons are highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i12.png)

4.  Click a list to view the contacts or accounts on it.

[![Multiple contacts are chosen and the action bar is highlighted along the top](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i0.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i0.png)

5.  Check one or more records, or use bulk selection. Then click an action along the top:

*   [Email prospects](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/15396174946445-Use-the-AI-Writing-Assistant-in-Your-Emails)
*   [Find people](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/a)
*   [Add to playbooks](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/6985034817677-Playbooks-Overview-BETA)
*   [Create tasks](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4411331110925-Create-a-Task)
*   [Prospect on LinkedIn](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409229262093-Prospect-in-LinkedIn-Using-the-Apollo-Chrome-Extension)
*   [Add to a sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409231193101-Create-a-Sequence)
*   [Add or remove from lists](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409728608525-Create-and-Edit-a-Contact-or-Company-List#toc_5)
*   [Export to a CSV](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237712141-Export-Contacts-from-Apollo-to-a-CSV)
*   [Enrich information](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413921630989-CRM-Enrichment-Overview)
*   [Export to a CRM](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414469523981-Configure-Your-Salesforce-Push-Settings#toc_9)
*   [Set stage](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410623601165-Contact-and-Account-Stages-Overview)
*   [Assign custom fields](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412498825869-Create-Custom-Contact-Fields)
*   [Assign owners or accounts](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5631686093069-Edit-a-Contact-or-Account-Owner)
*   [Delete or merge duplicates](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413326420621-Merge-Duplicate-Records-to-Consolidate-Your-Data)

[![Multiple contacts are chosen and the action bar is highlighted along the top](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i13.png)

You have now used a list in Apollo. You can edit and update your lists over time.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Edit or Delete a List[](#toc_4)

To edit or delete a list:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Search** > [**Saved Lists**](https://app.apollo.io/#/people/tags).
2.  To rename or delete a list, click **...** > **Edit** or **Delete**.

[![An example list is selected with More options, Edit or delete shown](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i10.png)

3.  Click a list to review the contacts or accounts on it.
4.  To remove a contact or account, check the box next to their name. Click **Lists** > **Remove from Lists**.

 [![An example person is chcked with Remove from list button highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_lists/i9.png)You have now edited or deleted a list in Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

Custom dynamic variables allow you to leverage custom field data directly in email templates.

After you have created a custom field in Apollo, whether it is a custom field for a contact, account, or user, Apollo automatically generates a corresponding custom dynamic variable for it that you can use in an email template.

You can make custom dynamic variables a simple field, like the name of a prospect’s competitor, or something more complicated like a sentence regarding your thoughts on a contact's blog post. This enables you to send personalized emails with the help of automation.

Refer to the section below for instructions on how to use a custom dynamic variable in an email template.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Use A Custom Dynamic Variable in an Email Template[](#toc_1)

Launch Apollo and click **Engage**.

[![Engage](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i1.png)

Create a new sequence or click one of your existing sequences to edit it.

[![Sequences](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i2.png)

Click one of the "New Threads" in any manual or automatic email step.

[![Threads](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i3.png)

Place your cursor in the **Body** section of the "Edit Template" pop-up where you would like to add a custom dynamic variable, and then click **Insert snippet**.

[![Insert Snippet](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i4.png)

Click the **Custom fields** tab.

[![Insert Snippet](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i5.png)

Click a custom dynamic variable from the list to add it to your email template.

[![Custom Snippet](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i6.png)

The dynamic variable renders in the "Preview" window if data is available for it.

[![Preview Window](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i14.png)

If you would like to use the dynamic variable in the subject line for your email template, cut and paste it into the **Subject** text box.

[![Subject Line](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i7.png)

Click **Save Changes** when you finish.

[![Save Changes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i8.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Test Custom Dynamic Variables in an Email Template[](#toc_2)

To generate a dynamic variable for a custom field, it needs to be updated for a specific contact or account profile. For this reason, you may want to test what will be displayed for a custom dynamic variable from an email template.

Navigate to any thread in any manual or automatic email task within an Apollo sequence.

[![Email Thread](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i9.png)

To add a custom dynamic variable to the body of your email, click **Insert dynamic variable**.

[![Add Snippet](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i10.png)

Then, click the **Custom fields** tab.

[![Custom Fields Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i15.png)

Now that you've added the custom dynamic variable to the body of your email, click the **here** link above the "Preview" window.

[![Here Link](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i11.png)

Type a contact's name or select them directly from the **Generate Preview for Contact** drop-down. You should check whether this contact has the custom field updated for their profile if you want to see the dynamic variable rendered in the "Preview" window.

[![Contact Preview](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i12.png)

With the contact selected, Apollo renders the dynamic variable in the "Preview" window with the data if it is available. If there is no available data for this contact, Apollo highlights the dynamic variable in red in the "Preview" window.

[![Failed Snippet Render](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_custom_snippets/i13.png)

Advanced Dynamic Variable Types With Conditional Logic

Please note, dynamic variables without any data for a specific contact may result in Apollo moving the email to that contact to the **Not Sent** folder. To avoid this, you may want to leverage the conditional logic operators provided by advanced dynamic variables. For additional information, please see the [Use Advanced Dynamic Variables](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409735256845) article.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

The control center in Apollo gives you a holistic view of your recent activity and allows you to easily compare key engagement statistics. It also helps you to better manage your tasks, view alerts, and stay on top of your workload week-on-week.

Refer to the sections below for more information about the main features to leverage.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Your Weekly Stats[](#toc_2)

If you use [the Apollo engagement suite](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/10316295330573-Watch-A-Bite-Sized-Apollo-Demo#toc_9) in your day-to-day workflow, visit the control center to view a synopsis of your most recent engagement stats from the previous, current, and coming week.

[![Weekly stats in control center](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i1.png)

On the left of your screen, you can see the number of emails delivered in the selected week in comparison to the previous one. You can also see a summary of the percentage of emails your contacts have opened, replied to, unsubscribed from, shown interest in, and that have bounced that week.

[![Weekly email stats in control center](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i2.png)

If you use [the dialer](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409140527757-Configure-the-Dialer) to connect with your contacts, you can also see the number of calls connected in the selected week in comparison to the previous one. For more granular insights, you can see the number of calls dialed, the average duration of those calls, the percentage of voicemails you left, and the neutral and positive outcomes you received that week.

[![Weekly call stats in control center](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i3.png)

To compare the more granular email or call stats with the previous week, hover your mouse over the **ellipsis** icon.

[![Comparison stats](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i4.png)

On the right, you can visualize your due and completed tasks for the selected week.

[![Tasks graph](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i5.png)

If you haven't created any tasks yet, click **\+ New task** to get started.

[![New task button on tasks graph](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i6.png)

More Info, Please!

New to tasks and want a little more context? Hop on down to the ["Tasks" section below](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/14845941738637-Use-the-Control-Center#toc_4) to learn more.

To view the statistics of the previous or upcoming week, click the **arrow** icons.

[![Arrow icons in weekly stats](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i7.png)

If you don't use the dialer in your engagement strategy, you may want to hide the call data. Click the **additional options (...)** button and then click **Hide call stats**.

[![Hide call stats button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i8.png)

You have now accessed the weekly stats in the control center. Refer to the section below for more information about the **To-do list**.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Your To-Do List[](#toc_3)

There are currently 2 types of actions available on the control center to-do-list:

## Tasks[](#toc_4)

Tasks are reminders of the manual actions you need to take with each of the contacts in your pipeline. Tasks include phone calls, LinkedIn messages and requests, manual emails, and action items.

Apollo displays your upcoming tasks from the control center in the **Tasks** tab on your **To-do list**.

[![Tasks tab under to-do list](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i10.png)

From this tab, you can view the due date, priority level, and actions of all the contacts in your task pipeline.

[![Task categories](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i11.png)

Click a contact's name to view their full profile page and take action from there.

[![Contact name in tasks list](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i12.png)

Hover your mouse over a contact's account name to gain a synopsis of the company for whom they work.

[![Company info modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i13.png)

Click on a contact's task to load the task manager and profile information for that contact.

[![Open task in control center](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i14.png)

Take action from here or click the **collapse** icon to return to your task list.

[![Collapse icon and action buttons](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i15.png)

Use the action icons to address the next steps for each contact.

[![Action icons](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i16.png)

Or click the checkboxes to select multiple contacts. You can then bulk skip, reschedule, reassign, set priority, or mark actions as complete.

[![Checkboxes and action buttons](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i17.png)

Click the **Group by** drop-down to decide the order in which you want to view your tasks. You can choose to group by status, activity date, due date, or priority level.

[![Group by drop-down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i18.png)

Click **\+ New Task** if you want to create new tasks directly from the control center.

[![New task button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i19.png)

Select the saved contact(s) that you want to create the task for, select the type of task, the assignee, the due date and priority, and add any notes to provide more context.

[![Create a task modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i20.png)

When ready, click **Create task**.

[![Create task button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i21.png)

Apollo displays the upcoming tasks in the **Tasks** tab and in the **Your statistics** section.

[![Tasks in control center](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i22.png)

It's Here, There, and Everywhere!

Please note, the control center is not your tasks' only home in Apollo! For more information on the alternative ways to access, view, and create tasks, refer to the [Create a Task](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4411331110925-Create-a-Task) article.

You have now leveraged the tasks section of the control center.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Alerts[](#toc_5)

Alerts are notifications that appear in your control center dashboard and prompt you to take manual action on contacts or accounts that fit the criteria of a play.

When you set up a play, you can create an alert for manual actions such as calling, emailing, or adding contacts or accounts to a list or a sequence.

[![Create an alert in play modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i9.png)

Hold the Phone—What's All This About Plays?

New to Apollo plays and feeling a little lost? For more context, refer to the [Plays Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/14296116597901) article.

When Apollo finds contacts or accounts that are eligible for a play, Apollo notifies you in the **Alerts** tab on your **To-do list**.

[![Alerts tab in control center](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i23.png)

From here, you can then take manual action on the contacts or accounts that meet the conditions of the play.

[![Alert action buttons](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i24.png)

You can also review the eligible contacts or accounts before making a decision.

[![Eligible contacts from an alert](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i25.png)

If you want to dismiss an alert, click the **Dismiss** icon.

[![Dismiss icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i26.png)

If you want to dismiss multiple alerts, click the checkboxes on the left and then click **Dismiss**.

[![Checkboxes and dismiss icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i27.png)

To edit the conditions of a play that's triggering an alert, click the name of the play. Apollo then redirects you to the settings for that play so you can edit and save your changes.

[![Name of play in alerts](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_control_center/i28.png)

Want to Play?

Need help setting up a play? Sneak a peek at the [Create a Play](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413804036109-Create-a-Play) article for the steps to get started.

You have now leveraged the alerts section of the control center.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Watch the Video[](#toc_0) ## Overview[](#toc_1) [![Data health center dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_the_data_health_center/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_the_data_health_center/i16.png) Data is constantly evolving. Every time an employee changes roles or a business undergoes acquisition, the data in your CRM becomes outdated. Apollo consistently updates its high-accuracy B2B database to reflect the latest contact and account changes. By integrating your CRM with Apollo and leveraging Apollo data, you can prevent data decay from jeopardizing your sales pipeline. Use the Apollo data health center to gain a more holistic view of the current depth and breadth of your CRM or CSV data and take action. Refer to the following sections for some core benefits and example use cases. [Back to Top](#top) ## The Benefits[](#toc_2) There are many benefits to leveraging the data health center to uncover your total addressable market and identify market gaps, including: | Job Role | Benefit | Example Use Cases | | --- | --- | --- | | SDRs and AEs | Access the up-to-date, verified emails of your ideal contacts to book more meetings and smash your sales targets. | * Automatically enrich stale data.
* Access timely job change insights.
* Target the contacts that best fit your [ICP](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416471135245-Identify-Your-Ideal-Customer-Profile-ICP-). | | Sales Leaders | Increase your team's go-to-market efficiency with actionable insights your sales reps can leverage to increase revenue and drive more pipeline. | * Monitor and improve your data depth and breadth.
* Save new leads in bulk.
* Fine-tune your core personas and account segments to identify gaps in your CRM data.
* Empower your reps to build more high-quality pipeline. | | Sales Ops | Empower your team to save time, increase efficiency, and leverage timely insights on contacts that have recently changed jobs or have a missing email. | * Schedule the automatic sync of net new data to your CRM.
* Auto-enrich your existing CRM data to increase accuracy and efficiency.
* Set criteria to find duplicate contact records, then merge them | [Back to Top](#top) ## Eliminate Duplicate Contact Records[](#toc_3) When you integrate CRMs like [Salesforce](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/7525314188173#toc_3) and [HubSpot](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/19745130546573#toc_3) with Apollo, there are several steps you can take to reduce the risk of duplicating records. However, if duplicate data is already present, you can reduce those duplicate records using Apollo's data deduplication tool. The tool enables you to set the criteria for what is considered a duplicate record and review the potential duplicates before Apollo merges them. This improves data integrity and ensures that your team can trust the data in Apollo. Refer to [Eliminate Duplicate Contact Records in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/20787907489421) for more information on how to set up and use the data deduplication tool. [![Access duplicate records for a contact.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i44.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i44.png) [Back to Top](#top) ## Set Up the Data Health Center[](#toc_4) Ready to get started? Hop into [Set Up the Data Health Center](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/8862101479565) to get the rolling. [Back to Top](#top)

### Overview[](#toc_0)

Personas help you group the contacts and accounts that best represent your ideal customers. In Apollo, you can build personas using sets of filters to search faster and target the right people within accounts.

Wait, How Do I Build a Persona in Apollo?

For help creating a persona for the first time, refer to [Create a Persona](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409500253837).

You can modify or delete personas in Apollo. Refer to the following sections to find out more about how to manage the personas you create.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Access Your Personas[](#toc_1)

To access your personas:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Search** > [**People**](https://app.apollo.io/#/people).
2.  Click **Persona** in the filters section. Then, click **All Personas**. [![All Personas](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i12.png)
3.  The **Manage Personas** pop-up lists the personas you've created. Here, you can edit, clone, delete, or re-order the personas. [![Persona List](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i13.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Clone a Persona[](#toc_2)

To clone a persona:

1.  In the **Manage Personas** pop-up, click the **clone** icon on the right of the persona that you want to clone.
2.  Name your new persona and apply filters. Then, click **Save Persona**. [![Rename Persona](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i20.png)

You have now cloned a persona.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Edit a Persona[](#toc_3)

To edit a persona:

1.  In the **Manage Personas** pop-up, click the **pencil** icon on the right of the persona that you want to edit. [![Edit Persona](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i9.png)
2.  Add or remove filters to make any changes you need. Apollo displays the filtered records on the right. [![Persona Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i19.png)
3.  Click **Save Persona** to activate the changes.

You have now edited a persona.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Deactivate a Persona[](#toc_4)

To deactivate a persona, go to the **Manage Personas** pop-up and turn the slider off for the persona.

[![Deactivate Persona](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i23.png)

Deactivating a persona removes it from [Apollo reports](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410826842381). To add a persona back to your reports, return to the same place in Apollo and activate the persona.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Delete a Persona[](#toc_5)

To delete a persona:

1.  In the **Manage Personas** pop-up, click the **trash can** icon on the right of the persona that you want to delete. [![Delete Persona](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i17.png)
2.  Click **Delete** to confirm that you want to delete the persona. [![Delete Confirm](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i18.png)

You have now deleted a persona.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Re-order Personas[](#toc_6)

To change the order that personas appear in search page filters, go to the **Manage Personas** pop-up. Then, click and drag the 2 bars on the left side of the persona to move it to a different position.

[![Rearrange Personas](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/update_edit_personas/i21.png)

You have now re-ordered your personas.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

If you have a list of accounts that you want to use in Apollo, import them as a CSV. You can then find contacts who work at companies on your CSV, enabling you to manage and engage with your accounts directly in Apollo.

Check out the following sections to upload an account CSV.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Import a CSV of Accounts[](#toc_2)

### 1\. Format Your CSV[](#toc_3)

Before you import accounts, format your CSV to include at least 1 of the following columns:

*   `Account Name`
*   `Account Website (Domain)`

If possible, include both columns in your CSV. These columns improve the import process.

Column Care

If your CSV includes a column with multi-select options, each value in a cell should be separated by a semicolon (`;`).

[![Special CSV Column Circumstances](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i21.png)

If your CSV includes values that should be mapped to a checkbox in Apollo, enter `True` for checked and `False` for unchecked.

Avoid uploading CSV files with more than 10,000 rows. Instead, split large CSVs into separate, smaller files.

With your CSV formatted, you're ready to import accounts.

[Back to Top](#top)

### 2\. Upload Your CSV[](#toc_4)

To upload a CSV of accounts:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Search** > [**Companies**](https://app.apollo.io/#/companies).
2.  Click **Import** > **Bulk import from CSV**.

[![The bulk import from CSV button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i22.png)

3.  Click **Select CSV File** under **Import accounts**. Choose a CSV file to upload.

[![The Select CSV File button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i23.png)

4.  Next, map your CSV column headers to the corresponding Apollo fields.

[![The Select CSV File button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i24.png)

5.  Configure settings for the imported accounts:

*   **What stage would you like to set the accounts to**: Select the contact stage that best represents the engagement status for all of the accounts in the CSV. Select **Use stage from CSV** to set the stage for each account directly from your CSV file.
*   **If account already exists**: Select whether to update or skip the record if the contact already exists.
*   **If the owner value is missing in your CSV, assign owner to**: Select a user that should own the imported records in Apollo.
*   **If existing accounts already have owner**: Select what happens if records in your CSV already have an owner in Apollo. If you select **Update Ownership**, Apollo will assign the user that you selected in **If the owner value is missing in your CSV, assign owner to**.
*   **Add to a List**: Enter the name of a new list or select an existing list. This step is optional.
*   **Intelligent Enrichment**: Choose whether to intelligently enrich websites or locations.

Account Stage Matters

Set the correct account stage on your upload. This enables you to efficiently message accounts once they're in a sequence.

[![The CSV upload settings are highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i25.png)

6.  When finished, click **Import**.

Your upload will begin. To check the status of your upload, click **Settings** > **Imports & Exports** > [**Account Imports**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/imports-and-exports/accounts).

Time to Launch

Most uploads finish in a few minutes, but large CSVs can take a few hours.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Find Contacts from Imported Accounts[](#toc_5)

Once you upload a file of accounts, use Apollo to find contacts who work at the associated companies.

To find contacts from imported accounts:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Search** > [**Companies**](https://app.apollo.io/#/companies).
2.  Click **Filters** > **More Filters**.

[![The More Filters button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i26.png)

3.  Click **Account CSV Import**, then select the file name of your CSV. Click **Apply Filters**.

[![CSV Files](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i27.png)

4.  Use the checkboxes to select the companies where you want to find prospects. Then, click **Find People**.

[![The find people button is highlighted with several companies checked](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i28.png)

5.  Apollo shows contacts associated with the selected companies. Use more [search filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview) to narrow your search.

[![Search filters are highlighted on a list of contacts](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i29.png)

6.  You're ready to engage the new prospects. Click the checkbox for each contact you want engage, then [add them to a list](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409728608525-Create-Edit-and-Use-a-List), [add them to a sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396985741-Add-Contacts-to-a-Sequence), or [dial them](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4734516058893-Make-Calls-with-Local-Phone-Numbers-from-the-Dialer).

[![Engagement actions on search page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_accounts_to_apollo/i30.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

Leverage Apollo meetings to remain in control of your schedule while empowering your prospects to proactively book time on your calendar.

The following sections walk through how to connect your calendar and configure your meeting settings, including setting your default availability and meeting location.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Connect Your Calendar[](#toc_1)

Calendar Compatibility

Meetings is currently only compatible with Google Calendar and Microsoft Outlook accounts.

To connect your calendar and enable prospects to book meetings with you:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Meetings**](https://app.apollo.io/#/meetings/meeting-types).
2.  Click **Connect your calendar**. [![Connect a calendar.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i43.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i43.png)
3.  Apollo pre-populates your default email address. To connect using a different email, type in the email address. Then, click **Connect**. [![Enter your email address.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i44.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i44.png)
    
    This Town Ain't Big Enough for 2 Calendars!
    
    You can only connect 1 calendar per user, so choose your calendar wisely!
    
4.  Click **OK**.

You have now connected your calendar.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Set Your Meeting Preferences[](#toc_2)

Now that you've connected your calendar, you are ready to configure your default meeting settings:

1.  To find your personal meeting link, click the **Settings** tab. Share this link with your future guests so they can schedule time on your calendar. You can edit the text to personalize the link. [![Find your personal meeting link.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i45.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i45.png)
2.  Click the **copy** icon to copy your meetings link. [![Copy your meeting link.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i46.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i46.png)
3.  Then, scroll to **Set your default availability**. Apollo automatically adds your default timezone. If you want to change it, click the **Current time zone** drop-down and select an option. [![Choose a timezone.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i47.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i47.png)
4.  By default, Apollo sets your availability to Monday-Friday from 9am to 5pm. To change your availability, click the checkboxes next to the days you want to appear available to prospects. Then, set your available time slots using the drop-down options on the right of each day. [![Day Checkbox and Time Drop-Down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i8.png)
5.  You can also add more than one time slot per day. This is useful if you want to factor in breaks or set time aside to focus on other projects or tasks throughout the day.
    
    To add extra time slots, click the **+** icon on the right and then use the additional drop-down boxes to configure your availability on a given day. Click the **trash can** icon to delete an additional time slot. [![+ Button to Add More Time Slots](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i13.png)
    
6.  If you want to replicate your availability for other days of the week, click the **copy** icon. Then, click the checkbox next to the days you want to enable the same open time slots. [![Copy Time Slots Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i18.png)
7.  Click **Apply**. [![Apply Button in Copy Time Slots Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i19.png)
8.  To give yourself time between events, click the **Before** and **After** checkboxes. Then, use the drop-down fields to select the time you want to leave before and after each meeting. [![Before and after checkboxes on the meetings set up page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i20.png)
9.  Set a minimum schedule notice to prevent prospects from scheduling last-minute meetings with you. Use this option to set the minimum amount of time that you need between a prospect scheduling a meeting and the meeting taking place.
    
    For example, if you set the minimum schedule notice at 1 day, prospects can only schedule a meeting with you that is at least 1 day from the current time. [![Minimum Schedule Notice Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i9.png)
    
10.  Click the **meeting location** drop-down to set a default location. Apollo supports Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, and Zoom natively. To use a different video conferencing solution, click **Custom meeting link** and paste the link to your meeting room. [![Choose a video conferencing solution.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i41.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i41.png)
11.  Click **Continue** to complete the set-up process.

You have now configured the default settings for your meetings. You can access and edit the settings from the **Settings** tab at any time.

## Set a Default Meeting Location[](#toc_3)

If you connected multiple video conferencing platforms, you can choose which one to set as default. The default selection is used for your meeting location every time you create a new meeting type or customize an existing meeting type.

It's Not the Be-All and End-All

Even with a default meeting location set, you can still edit the location settings for each meeting type at any time. For more information about how to edit a meeting type, refer to [Manage Your Meetings in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/9040988124173).

To set a default meeting location, click **...** > **Set as default** for the video conferencing solution of your choice. Then, scroll down and click **Save** to update your default location.

[![Additional options drop-down next to web conference platform](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i25.png)

Apollo displays a **Default** icon next to your selection.

[![Default icon in settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i26.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Disconnect Zoom, Google Meet, or Microsoft Teams[](#toc_4)

To remove a video conferencing solution as a location option for your meetings:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Meetings**](https://app.apollo.io/#/meetings/meeting-types).
2.  Click the **Settings** tab, then click **...** > **Disconnect** for the video conferencing solution that you want to remove. [![Disconnect integration.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i42.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_meetings_in_apollo/i42.png)
3.  Click **Disconnect** again to confirm your decision.

You have successfully disconnected your video conferencing account from meetings.

Only Applies to Apollo Meetings

When you disconnect a video conferencing platform from your meeting location settings, Apollo only disconnects the integration from meetings.

Apollo does not disconnect the integration from other connected features such as [conversations](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/8274034041997).

## Overview[](#toc_1)

You may want to upload a CSV file of contacts to Apollo if:

*   You don't have a CRM or haven't [connected your CRM with Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414356051725).
*   You have a list of contacts that you want to engage with and track in Apollo.
*   You have contacts that you want to add to a list in Apollo
*   You have contacts you want to save in Apollo first and then enrich with verified emails or phone numbers.

Enrichment and Uploads Go Head-to-Head!

Pondering the difference between enriching a CSV file and uploading one? Let's take a closer look at both:

*   **CSV Uploads**: Use this feature to save your contacts in Apollo and then take action on them, such as enroll them in [a sequence](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences), call them from [the dialer](https://app.apollo.io/#/phone-calls), add them to an [Apollo list](https://app.apollo.io/#/people/tags), leverage [conversation insights](https://app.apollo.io/#/conversations) from any meetings you have with them, [track your engagement](https://app.apollo.io/#/analytics) with them through Apollo, and much more. When you upload your CSV file, Apollo matches the contact and enriches the record with missing data. Apollo does not enrich email or phone number fields when you upload a CSV file.
*   [**CSV Enrichment**](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409226361229-Improve-Your-CSV-Data-With-CSV-Enrichment): Use this feature to improve the overall data of the records in your CSV. You can choose from over 38 data points with which to enrich your records and then export the enriched CSV file. You can also choose to use credits to enrich the contacts' email and phone numbers if you want to. This feature does not save contacts to the Apollo database.

Refer to the following sections for more information on how to correctly prepare your CSV, upload it into Apollo, and then apply the CSV to a search and engage or enrich the contacts with verified emails and phone numbers.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Step 0: Prepare Your CSV File[](#toc_2)

Before you import a CSV of contacts into Apollo:

1.  Make sure your file includes the following mandatory columns:
    
    *   First Name
    *   Last Name
    *   Company
    *   Company Website
    
    However, the more data you include in your CSV, the better. Apollo can then match the contact in the database and enrich the record with any missing information found. To further improve your chances of a match, Apollo recommends you include the contact email and/or LinkedIn profile if you have it.
    
    Only Have LinkedIn Data?
    
    Please note, if you only have the URL to a contact's LinkedIn profile, Apollo doesn't recommend you import this data from a CSV. Instead, you can use the Apollo Chrome Extension to save the contact directly from their LinkedIn profile. For more information, please refer to the [Apollo Chrome Extension Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409226637453-Apollo-Chrome-Extension-Overview) article.
    
2.  Check that you have set the language settings in your PC to one of the following supported delimiters:
    
    *   Comma (,)
    *   Semicolon (;)
    *   Colon (:)
    *   Pipe (|)
    
    If you encounter any formatting issues when you upload your file, you likely need to change your default settings. For more information, refer to the [How Do I Change the Default Delimiter on My Computer?](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409161532045-Upload-a-CSV-of-Contacts-to-Apollo#toc_8) FAQ.
3.  Make sure you convert your file to CSV format. Apollo does not currently support TSV files.

Special CSV Column Circumstances

If your CSV file includes values that you want to map to a checkbox in Apollo, enter `True` for checked and `False` for unchecked.

If your CSV file includes a column featuring a multi-picklist field, you should separate each value in the cell with a semicolon.

[![Special CSV Column Circumstances](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i8.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Step 1: Upload a CSV of Contacts[](#toc_3)

To upload a CSV file of contacts into Apollo:

1.  Launch Apollo and then click **Search** > [**People**](https://app.apollo.io/#/people/).
2.  Click **Import** > **Bulk Import from CSV**. [![Bulk Import](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i4.png)
3.  Click **Select CSV File** in the **Import contacts** section. [![Select CSV File](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i5.png)
4.  Select your CSV file from your computer and then click **Open** to upload it. [![Select CSV File](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i6.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Step 2: Map Your Columns[](#toc_4)

Now you've uploaded your CSV file, you need to map each column header to the correct Apollo field.

Psst...This Is Important!

If you want to pull the data from your CSV file into Apollo successfully, Apollo needs to know which fields to map your data to. So sit back, take a deep breath, and make sure you map correctly. And remember, you can only map one Apollo field to one column header. No more, no less. After all, nobody likes a data pickle!

To map your CSV column headers to the corresponding Apollo fields:

1.  Use the drop-down menus for each unmapped column and select the Apollo field. [![Mapping](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i7.png)
2.  (Recommended) If you don't see the correct Apollo field for a column header in your CSV, you'll need to create a custom field before you can map it.  
    To create a custom field:
    
    Curious About Custom Fields?
    
    For more information on all things custom contact fields, sneak a peek at the [Create Custom Contact Fields](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412498825869-Create-Custom-Contact-Fields) article.
    

[Back to Top](#top)

## Step 3: Configure the Settings and Import Your CSV[](#toc_5)

Now that you've mapped your fields, it's time to configure the settings and import your CSV.

To finalize the CSV upload:

1.  Scroll to **Settings** and click the **What stage would you like to set the contacts to?** drop-down. Then, choose the contact stage that best represents the engagement status for all of the contacts in the CSV. [![Stage](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i9.png)
    
    Why does "Contact Stage" matter?
    
    It's important to set your CSV list to [the correct stage](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410623601165-Contact-and-Account-Stages-Overview), especially if you plan to enroll the contacts in [an Apollo sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview). That way, you can efficiently tailor your messaging according to their stage in your sales pipeline.
    
2.  Click the **If contacts already exist in Apollo** drop-down to choose whether to skip or update any contacts you've already saved in Apollo. [![Existing Behavior](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i10.png)
    
    What criteria does Apollo use to match existing contacts in Apollo to contacts in a CSV file?
    
    If you choose to update existing records in Apollo with the data in your CSV, Apollo uses 3 sets of unique identifiers in order of most to least unique. Those identifiers include:
    
    *   `linkedin_URL`
    *   `first_name` + `last_name` + `organization`
    *   `email address`
    
    This means that if you include `linkedin_URL`, you can update all of the other data for a person. If you include `first_name` + `last_name` + `organization`, but you do not include a different `linkedin_URL`, you can update `email address` and other data. If you include only `email_address` and you do not include the `linkedin_URL` or `first_name` + `last_name` + `organization`, then you can only update other fields for the people in your file.
    
    If you opt to update existing records in Apollo from your CSV, Apollo only updates records that have a matching email address, a matching name (first and last), and a matching company.
    
    When duplicate people exist in your CSV, Apollo only accepts the highest row in the file to update the record in the platform.
    
3.  Click the **If owner value is missing in your CSV, assign owner to** drop-down to decide which user you want to own any imported contacts without a specified owner. [![Set Record Owner](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i11.png)
4.  Click the **If existing contacts already have owner** drop-down to choose whether or not you want to override an existing owner in Apollo with the one specified in your CSV. [![Existing Owner](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i12.png)
    
    What happens if I update ownership?
    
    If you choose to update contact ownership from the drop-down, Apollo assigns the user you selected in the **If the owner value is missing in your CSV, assign owner to** drop-down.
    
5.  Select an option from the **Auto-assign accounts?** drop-down to determine whether or not Apollo should assign accounts based on the website or email domain for the contacts in your CSV. [![Auto-Assign](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i13.png)
    
    Calling All Salesforce Users!
    
    If you've integrated Salesforce with Apollo, you can also decide whether or not Apollo should create and update records in Salesforce based on the uploaded CSV.
    
    [![Accounts With Salesforce Integrated](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i14.png)
    
6.  (Optional) Click the **Add to a List?** drop-down to select an existing list or create a new one. When you import your CSV, Apollo adds the contacts from your file to a list in Apollo. [![Add To List](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i15.png)
7.  Click **Import** to finish uploading your CSV to Apollo. [![Import](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/upload_a_csv_of_contacts_to_apollo/i16.png)

Your upload will now begin.

How long will the upload take?

Most uploads only take a few minutes to complete, but depending on the size of your CSV and the time of day, it may take a few hours for your upload to finish. Apollo does not recommend uploading a file that includes more than 10k rows. Instead, you should split your CSV into two smaller files. You can check on the status of your upload by browsing to **Settings** > **Imports & Exports** > [**Contact Imports**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/imports-and-exports/contacts).

    Please note, when you enrich an email, Apollo charges you 1 credit. When you enrich a mobile number, Apollo charges you 1 credit. For more information about how credits work in Apollo, refer to the [What Are Credits?](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/credits/about) page.
