## Overview[](#toc_1)

Standard Features for Everybody!

All users across [all plans](https://www.apollo.io/pricing) can access analytics features such as email tracking and Apollo-provided reports and dashboards for email messaging, deal metrics, and more. If you require customizable reports and dashboards, work with your Apollo representative or contact the [Apollo Sales Team](mailto: sales@apollo.io) to move to a Custom plan.

**Apollo Analytics** provide you with actionable data you can use to transform your company's sales efforts. One facet of the **Analytics** suite is the **Dashboards** feature. **Dashboards** provide you with a means of visualizing several related reports in a common interface.

Refer to the sections below to learn how to create custom **Dashboards**, access existing **Dashboards**, and better understand the various features you have at your disposal.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Access Dashboards in Apollo[](#toc_2)

To access **Dashboards**, launch Apollo and click **Engage**.

[![Engage](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_reports/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_reports/i1.png)

Click **Analytics**.

[![Analytics](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_reports/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_reports/i2.png)

Click **Dashboards**.

[![Dashboard Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i1.png)

Any previously created **Dashboards** are available on the left-hand side of the screen.

[![Dashboards View](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i2.png)

If you would like to create a new **Dashboard**, click **\+ New Dashboard**.

[![New Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/I3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/I3.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create a New Custom Dashboard[](#toc_3)

From the **Dashboards** section of the **Analytics** page, click **\+ New Dashboard**.

There are 3 main configuration components of any **Dashboard**: **Reports**, **Filters**, and **Data Range**. The sections below outline how to set up each of these **Dashboard** components.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Add Reports[](#toc_4)

From the new **Dashboard**, there are several ways to add **Reports**.

**Reports** aggregate in-app metrics into various visualization types while using specific filters to refine the visualizations. **Dashboards** aggregate those **Reports** into a single location. You can include as many **Reports** in a **Dashboard** as you would like.

#### Add Existing Reports[](#toc_5)

You can use the search bar on the right-hand side of your screen to find a **Report** to add to your **Dashboard**.

[![Search Reports](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i4.png)

Once you find the **Report**, click it to add it to the **Dashboard**.

[![Click Reports](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i41.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i41.png)

Search is Optional

Please note, if you know which **Reports** that you want to add to the **Dashboard** you can click them directly and ignore the search feature.

You can [rearrange the report tiles](#14) as needed.

#### Create and Add New Reports[](#toc_6)

Although the process is less streamlined, you can create new **Custom Reports** directly from a new **Dashboard**. To add a new **Report** to the **Dashboard**, make sure you give the **Dashboard** a name and save it.

[![Name Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/I5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/I5.png)

Dashboard Naming

As a best practice, consider a **Dashboard** name that reflects its intended **Data Range** (for example, "Monthly"), its intended use (for example, "SDR Performance"), and if necessary, the intended audience for which it's meant (for example, "SDR Manager").

Once it's saved, click **Edit Dashboard**.

[![Edit Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i6.png)

Click **\+ New Report**.

[![New Report](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i7.png)

Follow the instructions in the [Build and Access Reports in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410826842381#13) article to create your **New Report**.

After you create and save the new **Report**, click the **Dashboard** tab on the left-hand side of your screen.

[![Dashboard Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i1.png)

Then, click the name of the **Dashboard** that you want to add the new **Report** to.

[![Click Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i8.png)

Click **Edit Dashboard**.

[![Edit Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i6.png)

Click the new **Report** that you just created on the right-hand side of your screen to add it to the **Dashboard**.

[![Add Reports to Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i9.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Configure Filters[](#toc_7)

Within a **Dashboard**, you can apply additional filters to all of the included **Reports**.

After you save your **Dashboard**, click **Filters**.

[![Dashboard Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i10.png)

Click **\+ Add Filter**.

[![+Add Filter](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i11.png)

**Filters** allow you to include or exclude specific subsets of data in every **Report** on your **Dashboard**. You can add as many **Filters** as you need to each **Dashboard**.

Dashboard-Level Filters

Please note, the **Filters** that you apply on a **Dashboard** do not override the **Filters** from individual **Reports**. They act as add-ons to the already existing filters in each **Report**.

Apollo groups filters into the following categories:

| Category | Description |
| --- | --- |
| User | Filter related to the specific individual(s) taking the action in the Apollo platform |
| Date | Filters related to the time period of the action taken in the Apollo platform (for example, day, hour, month, year, etc.) |
| Contact/Person | Filters related to the information about the individuals contacted from the Apollo platform (for example, their persona type, their location, their stage in the sales pipeline, etc.) |
| Account/Company | Filters related to the information about the companies contacted from the Apollo platform (for example, the account name, the number of company employees, the industry, related keywords, etc.) |
| Email | Filters related to the type of emails sent from the Apollo platform (for example, email subject, template used, etc.) |
| Phone Call | Filters related to the purpose and disposition of the phone calls made from the Apollo platform |
| Sequence | Filters related to the name of the sequence or the specific step that was used to engage with the prospects in the Apollo platform |

Click **Select Filter** to choose the relevant dimensions that you want to include in your **Dashboard**.

[![Dashboard Filter Dimensions](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i12.png)

Click the **Select** drop-down to include or exclude additional metrics.

[![Dashboard Filter Metrics](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i13.png)

Click **Run** to update the **Dashboard** with the new **Filters**.

[![Run Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i14.png)

To delete a **Filter**, click the trash can icon on the right-hand side of the screen.

[![Delete Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i15.png)

Then, click **Run** to implement the changes.

[![Run Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i16.png)

Overlapping Filters

Please note, if you apply a **Dashboard Filter** that's in direct conflict with a **Filter** from any of the **Reports** in your new **Dashboard**, Apollo discards and replaces the **Report Filter** with the **Dashboard Filter** whenever you view the **Dashboard**; however, when you view the individual **Report**, the original **Filter** will remain in effect.

To make the best use of **Dashboard Filters**, first, build each report with the **Filters** you have in mind. When you add **Reports** to the **Dashboard** and want to view the same metrics for a different set of users, emails, contacts, etc., you can then apply a **Dashboard Filter** to further refine the visible data.

For example, you can create a report for a specific SDR or ADR. You can add it to an SDR/ADR team **Dashboard** and add a filter on the **Dashboard** to view metrics for all of your SDR/ADRs instead of just the one.

Dashboard Filters

Please note, you do not have to set **Filters** for a new **Dashboard**. If you choose not to set **Dashboard Filters**, the original **Filters** on each **Report** remain in effect.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Configure Data Range[](#toc_8)

From the new **Dashboard**, click the timeframe on the right-hand side (in this instance, the label displays **No Data Range Specified**).

[![Dashboard Data Range](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/I17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/I17.png)

Click **Select Data Range**.

[![Select Data Range](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i18.png)

Think about the **Data Range** like the gap of time for all of the data in the **Dashboard**. Apollo provides several defined timeframes for the data that you want to visualize in your **Dashboard**.

[![Dynamic Data Ranges](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i19.png)

You can also define your own timeframe using the **Custom Range** option.

[![Custom Data Range](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i20.png)

If you apply a **Dashboard Data Range**, it overrides the **Data Range** set in every individual **Report** included in the **Dashboard**. This change only applies to the **Dashboards** page. If you view any of the individual **Reports** in your **Dashboard** from the **Reports** page, the original **Data Range** remains in effect.

After you apply a **Dashboard Data Range**, you can change it to another **Data Range** any time you like; however, you cannot delete it altogether.

If you choose a **Dynamic Data Range** (for example, **Current Week**, **Last 90 Days**, or **This Quarter**), remember to click **Run** on a regular basis. This will ensure that the data you view is always up-to-date.

Dashboard Data Ranges

Please note, you do not have to set a **Data Range** for a new **Dashboard**. If you choose not to set a **Dashboard Data Range**, the original timeframe set on each **Report** remains in effect.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Launch Existing Dashboards[](#toc_9)

As the name implies, **Existing Dashboards** are the **Dashboards** already present in the Apollo platform. They include any **Dashboards** you or your team have created.

**Public Dashboards** and **Private Dashboards** are both available from the **Analytics** page. From that page, click the "Dashboards" tab, scroll down the "Dashboards" column, and click the **Dashboard** you want to open.

[![Dashboards View](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i2.png)

Another way to find an **Existing Dashboard** is to use the **Search Bar**.

[![Dashboard Search bar](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i21.png)

There are several features available when you work with **Existing Dashboards**.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Edit Existing Dashboards[](#toc_10)

From the **Analytics** page, click the **Dashboards** tab.

[![Dashboard Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i1.png)

You can use the **Search bar** to find a **Dashboard** or browse through folders on the left-hand side and click the **Dashboard** that you want to edit.

[![Dashboards View](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i2.png)

Select the **Dashboard** and then click **Edit Dashboard** on the right-hand side.

[![Edit Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i6.png)

You can also click the additional options (**...**) button next to any **Dashboards** and then click **Edit**.

[![Edit Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i22.png)

From the **Dashboard**, you have several editing options:

*   [Add or Remove Report Tiles](#12)
*   [Edit Reports](#13)
*   [Re-size, Drag, and Drop Report Tiles](#14)
*   [Move and Rename Existing Dashboards](#15)
*   [Reorganize Dashboards](#16)

#### Add or Remove Reports From a Dashboard[](#toc_11)

To add new and existing **Reports** to a **Dashboard**, follow the instructions in the [Add Reports](#4) section above.

To remove a **Report** from a **Dashboard**, click the additional options (**...**) button on the right-hand side of a **Report** on the **Dashboard**. Then, click **Remove Tile**. As a result, the **Report** is no longer visible on the **Dashboard**.

[![Remove Report Tile](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i23.png)

#### Edit Reports in a Dashboard[](#toc_12)

From a **Dashboard**, choose the specific **Report Tile** that you wish to edit. Then, click the additional options (**...**) button on the right-hand side of the **Report Tile**.

[![Edit Report Tile](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i24.png)

From the selected **Report**, you can customize the components as needed. Follow the instructions in the [Build and Access Reports in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410826842381) article for further details on how to edit an individual **Report**.

After you edit the **Report**, return to the "Dashboards" tab. To review the changes, click the **Dashboard** that includes the **Report**.

[![Review Report Changes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i42.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i42.png)

Click **Run** to view the most up-to-date data.

[![Refresh Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i43.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i43.png)

#### Resize and Arrange Report Tiles in a Dashboard[](#toc_13)

From the **Dashboard**, you can change the layout of included reports.

Click the blue resize icon on the bottom right-hand side of the **Report Tile** that you want to resize. Hold down your mouse and drag the cursor to reshape the **Report Tile**.

[![Reshape Report Tile](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i25.png)

From the **Dashboard**, you can also reposition the **Report Tiles**.

Click the **Report Tile** you want to move, hold down your mouse, and drag the tile to a new position on the **Dashboard**.

[![Rearrange Report Tiles](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i26.png)

#### Move and Rename Existing Dashboards[](#toc_14)

From within a **Dashboard**, click the existing name in the yellow toolbar towards the top of your screen. Then, edit the name as needed.

[![Rename Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i27.png)

To move a **Dashboard** to another location, click the drop-down arrow next to the folder in which the **Dashboard** currently resides. Then, from the drop-down, select a new folder.

[![Move Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i28.png)

After you have edited the name and location of the **Dashboard**, click **Save & Finish**.

#### Reorganize Dashboards[](#toc_15)

You can reorganize the position of any **Dashboard** from the "Dashboard" tab on the left-hand side of the **Analytics** page.

[![DESCRIPTION](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i1.png)

[![Drag and Drop Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i30.png)

Private and Public Dashboards

Please note, if you drag a **Dashboard** into a **Public Folder**, your entire team will have access to it. You can arrange **Public Dashboards** into specific **Shared Folders** to organize all the Dashboards meant for a certain user, group, or purpose. If you drag your **Dashboard** into a **Private Folder**, you alone will have access.

From the **Analytics** page, click the "Dashboards" tab, scroll down the "Dashboards" column, and hover your mouse over the **Dashboard** you want to clone.

[![Dashboards View](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i2.png)

[![Clone Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i31.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i31.png)

Refer to [the section above](#8) to edit the **Dashboard** to your specific needs. Then, give the **Dashboard** a name, select the folder where it will reside, and then click **Save & Finish**.

[![Save Dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/analytics_overview_custom_dashboards/i29.png)

### Overview[](#toc_0)

With the [Apollo Chrome extension installed](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/apolloio-find-b2b-contact/alhgpfoeiimagjlnfekdhkjlkiomcapa), you can search for and request details about prospects from LinkedIn, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, or directly from the Apollo database. View detailed information about a chosen company or contact, build detailed lists for use in Apollo sequences, view insights about a company, or view a contact's colleagues. These details help you find the right prospects to engage and grow your business.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Research an Individual Prospect[](#toc_1)

To research a prospect in LinkedIn using the Chrome extension:

1.  Go to a user's profile on LinkedIn. Then, click the Apollo icon on the right side to launch the Chrome extension. [![Launch the Chrome extension.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i16.png)
2.  (Recommended) Access the other tabs in the Chrome extension to uncover more information about the prospect and their company. For example, the **Insights** tab shows [signals](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/13152837789837) related to the company, along with information about the company's technologies, hiring trends, and funding rounds. [![Access the extension tabs for more information.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i7.png)
3.  Go back to the **Prospect** tab. If you want to save the prospect's profile to your Apollo account, click **Save Contact**.
    
    You can also use credits to view the prospect's email address and phone numbers. [![Save the prospect.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i18.png)
    

Verified Emails and Mobile Numbers

Apollo charges 1 credit each to enrich a contact with a verified email address or mobile phone number. If you are an Apollo admin and want to track how many credits your team has used, launch Apollo and click **Settings** \> [**Credit Usage**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/credits/current).

[Back to Top](#top)

### Find Bulk Prospects[](#toc_2)

To find several prospects in LinkedIn using the Chrome extension:

1.  Go to a company's profile on LinkedIn. Then, click the **People** tab. [![Open the people tab.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i9.png)
2.  Click **Select All** to select all of the contacts now listed in the Chrome extension. [![Select all the prospects.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i5.png)
3.  Click **Net New** to select only the contacts that you have not yet saved to Apollo. [![Select only net new prospects.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i6.png)
4.  The Chrome extension also adds a toolbar to the **People you may know** section of the company's people page. The toolbar enables you to:  
    • Batch select all prospects or net new prospects.  
    • Save prospects to Apollo.  
    • Email prospects.  
    • Export prospects.  
    • Add prospects to a list in Apollo  
    [![Use the extension toolbar in LinkedIn.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/prospect_in_linkedin/i20.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

A Bit of Beta Makes it Better!

This feature is currently in Beta. If you cannot access all the latest and greatest scoring updates yet, we haven't forgotten you! Please bear with us while we fine-tune the magic formula.

## Overview[](#toc_0)

When you integrate CRMs like [Salesforce](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/7525314188173#toc_3) and [HubSpot](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/19745130546573#toc_3) with Apollo, there are several steps you can take to reduce the risk of duplicating records.

However, if duplicate data is already present, you can reduce those duplicate records using Apollo's data deduplication tool. The tool enables you to set the criteria for what is considered a duplicate record and review the potential duplicates before Apollo merges them. This improves data integrity and ensures that your team can trust the data in Apollo.

Admin Only

Only users with admin permissions in Apollo can use the data deduplication tool. If you do not have access, please contact the Apollo admins in your organization.

## Step 1: Set Criteria for Identifying Duplicate Records[](#toc_1)

Apollo identifies duplicate records based on your criteria. By adjusting the criteria, you increase the likelihood of identifying the duplicates you want to merge.

To set the criteria for data deduplication:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Data enrichment**](https://app.apollo.io/#/data-health-center).
2.  Click **Configure duplicate detection rules**. [![Set up rules.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i39.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i39.png)
3.  In the **Matching rules** tab, click the checkbox for each rule that you want Apollo to use to identify duplicate records. For example, select **Email address** if you want contact records with the same email address to be considered potential duplicates.
    
    Add multiple rules to increase match confidence. If you use multiple rules, click **Mark as main** to use a rule as the primary criterion for determining the contact record to keep after merging records.
    
    Then, click **Next**. [![Determine how duplicates are identified.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i41.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i41.png)
    
4.  In the **Primary record selection** tab, drag and drop the prioritization rules to place them in order of importance. Apollo uses these rules to determine which record among duplicates is the primary record, which is the record that remains after the merge. Click **Show rule details** to review an explanation of each rule.
    
    With the rules in order, click **Configure**. [![Set rules for determining the primary record.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i42.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i42.png)
    

With your rules set, you are ready to merge duplicate records.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Step 2: Merge Duplicate Records[](#toc_2)

With your criteria for identifying duplicate records set, you are ready to merge duplicate records in Apollo.

To merge a set of duplicate records:

1.  Click **View duplicates**. [![View your duplicate records.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i43.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i43.png)
2.  Find a set of contact records that you want to merge, then click **View duplicates**. [![Access duplicate records for a contact.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i44.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i44.png)
3.  Review the full details for each duplicate contact record. Apollo determines the primary record based on the rules you established in the [Step 1](#toc_1) section. If you want to change the primary record, click the **trophy** for the record you want to make the primary.
    
    Differences between the duplicate records are highlighted in red. For example, if most duplicate records use the same job title, the records with a different title might be highlighted red. [![Review the duplicate records](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i37.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i37.png)
    
4.  To merge all of the records in a group, click **Merge all**.
    
    To merge specific records, click the checkbox for each record you want to merge, then click **Merge selected**.
    
    Click **Reject selected** or **Reject all** to reject records from being merged. [![Merge the duplicate records.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i40.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/eliminate_duplicate_records/i40.png)
    
5.  Click **Confirm merge**.

The duplicate contact records are now merged in Apollo. Repeat this process to merge more sets of duplicate records.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

If you've [linked your mailbox(es)](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409127806093-Link-Your-Mailbox-to-Apollo-io) to Apollo, you can also unlink them from your Apollo account at any time.

There are several reasons you may want to do so, including if:

*   You want to increase the number of emails you send out via the mailboxes you've connected to Apollo while keeping your [domain safe](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409225311885-Avoid-Spam-Filters#toc_4).
*   A team member left Apollo and you want to unlink their connected mailbox(es).
*   You've reached your [plan limits](https://www.apollo.io/pricing) and want to remove a mailbox to link a different one.

Refer to the following steps to unlink a mailbox from your account, or if you have admin access, for other users in your Apollo instance.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Unlink a Mailbox From Your Own Account[](#toc_2)

To unlink a mailbox from your account:

1.  Launch Apollo, click **Settings**, and then click the [**Mailboxes**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/account/mailboxes) tab.
2.  Click the **additional options (...)** button on the right-hand side of the mailbox that you want to unlink. Then, click **Unlink Mailbox**. [![Additional options button in mailbox settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i15.png)
3.  If you want to reassign any scheduled emails from the mailbox you're unlinking, click the **Unlink current mailbox and select another mailbox** radio button. Then, click the drop-down arrow to select the mailbox to which you want to reassign the emails. [![Select mailbox drop-down in unlink pop-up](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i22.png)
4.  If you want to cancel all emails due to be sent out from the mailbox you're unlinking, click the **Unlink current mailbox** radio button. [![Unlink current mailbox](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i23.png)
5.  Then, click the **Unlink** button. [![Select mailbox drop-down in unlink pop-up](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i24.png)

Only Rocking One Mailbox?

Please note, you only see the radio buttons in the warning pop-up if you have more than 1 mailbox connected to your Apollo instance. If you want to unlink a mailbox but only have 1 connected, click **Unlink mailbox**, and voila!

 [![Unlink mailbox button in warning pop-up](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i25.png)Before you go though, don't forget to [link another mailbox](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409127806093-Link-Your-Mailbox-to-Apollo-io#toc_3) to gain full functionality of the [Apollo engagement suite](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/10316295330573-Watch-A-Bite-Sized-Apollo-Demo#toc_8).

You have now unlinked a mailbox from your Apollo account.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Unlink A User's Mailbox From Your Apollo Instance[](#toc_3)

If you are an admin, you can also unlink mailboxes for other users in your team.

Saying Goodbye to a User?

Please note, if a user leaves your company and you want to revoke their access to your Apollo instance, you must also deactivate them from your Apollo account. For more information about how to deactivate users, refer to [this section](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409130537101-Add-Deactivate-and-Reactivate-Users#toc_3) of the "Add, Deactivate, and Reactivate Users" article.

To unlink a mailbox for other users:

1.  Launch Apollo, click **Settings**, and then click [**Users**](https://app.apollo.io/#/users).
2.  Click on the user for whom you want to unlink a mailbox. [![https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/account/mailboxes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i17.png)
3.  Click **Manage Mailboxes** in the email settings. [![Manage mailboxes button in general user settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i18.png)
4.  Click the **additional options (...)** button on the right of the mailbox that you want to unlink. Then, click **Unlink mailbox**. [![Additional options button in mailbox settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i19.png)
5.  If you want to reassign any scheduled emails from the user's mailbox that you're unlinking, click the **Unlink current mailbox and select another mailbox** radio button. Then, click the drop-down arrow to select the mailbox to which you want to reassign the emails. [![Select mailbox drop-down in unlink pop-up](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i22.png)
6.  If you want to cancel all emails due to be sent out from the user's mailbox that you're unlinking, click the **Unlink current mailbox** radio button. [![Unlink current mailbox](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i23.png)
7.  Then, click the **Unlink** button. [![Select mailbox drop-down in unlink pop-up](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_your_email_mailbox_to_apollo/i24.png)

You have now unlinked a mailbox for a user in your team.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

There may be times when you encounter inaccurate **Contact** or **Account** data. Apollo tries to keep everything up to date but also allows you to flag inaccuracies.

Keep Up To Date

Some data, such as [Job Change Alerts](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5130064363661-Use-Job-Change-Alerts-to-Update-Contacts), update automatically. You still have to manually accept the updates.

Review the sections below for details on how to flag **Contact** or **Account** data.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Flag a Contact[](#toc_2)

Just Between Us

The data you flag is instance-specific. No other Apollo customers will see your flags.

Launch Apollo and click **Search**.

[![Search](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i1.png)

Click the **Contact** you want to flag.

[![Contact](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i2.png)

### Job Title or Company[](#toc_3)

Hover your mouse over the profile information on the left to flag the job title or company for which the **contact** works. Then, click the **Thumbs Down** icon.

[![Flag](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i3b.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i3b.png)

To provide further feedback, click **Tell us more**.

[![Tell Us More](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i21.png)

In the **What were the main issues?** modal that appears, click the checkbox(es) that apply and use the text boxes to fill in what you believe to be the correct information.

[![Checkbox and Text box](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i4b.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i4b.png)

Then, click **Submit feedback**.

[![Submit Feedback](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i5b.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i5b.png)

Apollo Data Only

Please note, you can only flag Apollo data. Apollo disables the checkbox for any other data in the **What were the main issues?** modal. [![Disabled Fields Message in Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i26.png)

### Email[](#toc_4)

Hover your mouse over an email address on the right to flag the **contact's** primary or secondary email. Then, click the **Thumbs Down** icon.

[![Primary Email Flag Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i15.png)

To provide further feedback, click **Tell us more**.

[![Tell Us More](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i20.png)

In the **What were the main issues?** modal that appears, click the checkbox(es) that apply and use the text boxes to fill in what you believe to be the correct email.

[![Email Checkbox and Text box](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i16.png)

Then, click **Submit feedback**.

[![Submit Feedback](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i17.png)

### Phone Number[](#toc_5)

Hover your mouse over a contact number on the right to flag the **contact's** phone number. Then, click the **Thumbs Down** icon.

[![Primary Number Flag Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i18.png)

To provide further feedback, click **Tell us more**.

In the **What were the main issues** modal that appears, click the checkbox(es) that apply and use the text boxes to fill in what you believe to be the correct phone number.

[![Number Checkbox and Text box](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i22.png)

Then, click **Submit feedback**.

[![Submit Feedback](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i23.png)

You have now flagged a **Contact's** data. Apollo displays any data you flag in your instance in red.

[![Flagged Data](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i24.png)

## Unflag a Contact[](#toc_6)

If you make a mistake and want to unflag information that you previously flagged, hover your mouse over the information that you want to unflag. Then, click the **Thumbs Down** icon again.

[![Flag Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i25.png)

In the modal that appears, click **Unflag**.

[![Flag Complete](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i6b.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i6b.png)

You have now unflagged a contact's data.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Flag an Account[](#toc_7)

Launch Apollo and click **Search**.

[![Search](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i1.png)

Click **Companies**.

[![Companies](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i14.png)

Y'all Got Options

Please note, you can also view a **Company's** information from the **People** tab. Click the **Company** name in a **Contact's** information to view the **Company**. [![Company Name](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i7.png)

Search for a **Company** and then click on the **Company name**.

[![Company Name](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i8.png)

Click the **Flag** icon.

[![Flag](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i9.png)

Click the **checkbox** for the field you want to change.

[![Checkbox](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/data_flags/i10.png)

Each field provides you with a text box. Fill in what you believe to be the correct information here.

You Can't Change the World

You can't edit every **Contact** or **Account**. If information on a **Contact** or **Account** does not come from Apollo, then you cannot flag it as inaccurate. ## Overview[](#toc_1)

When you merge duplicate contact information in the platform, Apollo only merges certain information into the correct record.

How to Merge Duplicate Records

For more information on how to merge duplicate records, [click here](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413326420621-Merge-Duplicate-Records-to-Consolidate-Your-Data).

Refer to the section below for information about rules Apollo applies when merging records in your account.

[Back to Top](#top)

## General Rules for Merging[](#toc_2)

Generally speaking, when a duplicate entry merges with your source of truth, Apollo migrates the following fields into the source of truth:

*   Account custom field values that aren't null
*   Account lists
*   Contacts
*   User activities

The merge process in Apollo operates on priority. The source of truth entry takes precedent over the entry you merged in. For example, when Apollo merges custom fields, if the source of truth has a different value for the same custom field, it is **not** overwritten. If the custom field is empty in the source of truth, Apollo merges the data into the source of truth.

Account lists, contacts, and user activities are added to the existing list in the source of truth.

In addition, the following information is also copied over in a merge, if it is available:

*   Account Name
*   Account Enrichment Information
*   Account Website
*   Account Notes
*   Account Stage
*   Account Owner

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

In Apollo, you can create scores to automatically rank potential contacts and accounts based on the demographics and behaviors that are most important to you.

Context is Key

New to scores? Hop into the [Scores Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4988048582285) article for more information.

Review the sections below to learn how to create a score, set your score as primary, and keep your contact and account scores synced with Salesforce.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create a Score[](#toc_2)

To create a score in Apollo:

1.  Launch Apollo, click **Settings**, and then click **Scores**. [![Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i1.png)
2.  Click **\+ Create score**. [![New Scoring Model](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i2.png)
3.  Select your target type. [![Target Type](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i3.png)
4.  Give your score a name, add a description, and select a category to give your team more context. [![Name](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i4.png)
5.  Click **\+ Add Filters** in the **Customer fit** and **behavioral attributes** sections. [![Add filter button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i5.png)
6.  Click the filter(s) that you want to add. [![Filters modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i6.png)
7.  Then, click the drop-down to select the values you want to assign to a score. [![Values drop-down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i7.png)
8.  Use the scores slider to assign points based on the importance of the values you have selected. The number you choose is up to your discretion. [![Scores slider](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i8.png)
9.  Click **\+ Add more values** to assign points to other attributes within the same filter. [![Add more values button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i9.png)
10.  Want to take a data-driven approach? Click **See historical data** to view a summary of your best-performing values for that filter. [![See historical data button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i10.png)
11.  Click **\+ Add Filters** to add more customer fit or behavioral attribute filters to your score. [![Add filters button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i11.png)
    
    Spoilt For Choice!
    
    For more information about the available scoring filters, refer to the [Define Your Scoring Criteria](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4988048582285#toc_5) section of the Scores Overview article.
    
12.  When you finish adding filters to your score, you can gain a holistic view of how your contacts or accounts rank according to the filters. To do so, scroll up and click **Render distribution**. Apollo then displays the percentage of contacts or accounts that rank within each of the score categories. [![Render distribution button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i12.png)
13.  Apollo automatically applies the default category settings to a new score. However, you can adjust the ranges in the settings to narrow or broaden each category. To do so, click the **settings** cog. [![Score settings cog](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i13.png)
14.  When you finish editing the category ranges, click **Save**. [![Save button in score category modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i15.png)
15.  Click **Save** when you're done configuring your score. [![Save button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i14.png)

You have now created a new score.

(Scoring) Rules of the Road

Please note that scores are ranked in descending order. Higher number scores take priority.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Manage Your Scores[](#toc_3)

If you are an admin or you have [the correct permissions](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4988048582285#toc_13), you can edit, clone, and delete scores at any time. You can also set a primary score.

### Set a Primary Score[](#toc_4)

One at a Time

You can set 1 primary score for people and 1 for companies. Apollo then automatically displays this score in your default table layout on the search page and the contact and account profile pages in Apollo. It is also the primary score that [syncs with your CRM](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4877935868045#toc_6).

To set a primary score:

1.  Launch Apollo, click **Settings**, and then click **Scores**. [![Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i1.png)
2.  Click the **additional options (...)** button on the right of the people or company score that you want to set as primary. Then, click **Set score as primary**. [![Set score as primary button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i16.png)
3.  Click **Set primary** in the modal that appears. [![Set primary button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i17.png)

You have now set your score as primary.

[![Primary score tag](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i18.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Edit, Clone, or Delete a Score[](#toc_5)

There's Always One!

Please note that you cannot edit the auto-scores generated by Apollo. For more information about who has access to auto-scores and how they work, refer to the [Scores Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4988048582285#toc_3) article.

To edit, clone, or delete a score:

1.  Launch Apollo, click **Settings**, and then click **Scores**. [![Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i1.png)
2.  Click the **additional options (...)** button on the right of a score. Then, click **Edit Score**, **Clone Score**, or **Delete Score**. [![Additional options button next to a score](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i19.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Sync Contact and Account Scores to Salesforce or HubSpot[](#toc_6)

Primary Rules!

Only the primary score syncs with your CRM. Double-check that you set the right score as primary before you proceed.

To make the most out of Apollo scores, also make sure you create and map your custom fields. This allows you to connect and leverage the behavioral data from your CRM in your scoring model. For more info on how to link your custom fields to Salesforce, refer to [this article](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412668190733). Or to read up on all things custom fields in Apollo, refer to the [custom account field](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412498754445), [custom contact field](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412498825869), and [custom user field](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412499090189) articles.

To sync your contact and account scores to Salesforce or HubSpot:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings**. [![Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i1.png)
2.  Click **Contacts**. [![Contacts](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i23.png)
3.  Click **Default Fields**. [![Default Fields](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i24.png)
4.  Scroll down to **Recommendation Score**. This setting maps your score to the **Salesforce or HubSpot Contact Field** (left) and for Salesforce users the **Salesforce Lead Field** (right). [![Recommendation Score](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i25.png)
5.  Click the drop-down to map the **Salesforce or HubSpot Contact Field**. [![Salesforce Contact](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i26.png)
6.  For Salesforce users, click the drop-down to map the **Salesforce Lead Field**. [![Salesforce Lead](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i27.png)
7.  Click **Save**. [![Save](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_scoring_model/i28.png)

You have now synced your score with Salesforce or HubSpot.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

When you use Apollo for prospecting, it's possible that you will get duplicate contact information when you sync Apollo to your Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platform. Apollo automatically notifies you if there is a probable duplicate, which allows you to merge the duplicates and clean up your contact list.

Can't Win Them All

Please note, despite our best efforts, Apollo will never be entirely duplicate free. Apollo will always experience around a 1% duplication rate in our database.

See the sections below for instructions on how to merge duplicate accounts in Apollo and preserve your source of truth.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Merge Duplicate Contacts or Companies[](#toc_2)

Launch Apollo and then click **Search**.

[![Search](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i13.png)

Click either the **People** or **Companies** tab depending on whether you are searching for contacts or accounts.

[![People or Companies](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i14.png)

Merge Process

Please note, the merge process is identical for contacts and accounts. The instructions below demonstrate the process for contacts, but if you need to merge data for duplicate accounts, follow the same steps but click the **Companies** tab first.

When you complete a filtered search for **People** or **Companies**, you may find data records that look identical to each other.

[![Search](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i1.png)

Click the duplicate record to show the **Card**. If there is a potential duplicate, Apollo displays a merge banner.

[![Merge Banner](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i2.png)

There are multiple ways to merge a duplicate record:

[Back to Top](#top)

### The Merge Banner[](#toc_3)

Click **Click here to merge this duplicate with the current contact.** in the banner.

[![Merge Banner](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i3.png)

Click **Yes** in the modal to merge the duplicate record with the source of truth that you would like to keep. This will remove the duplicate.

[![Merge Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i4.png)

Delete From Your CRM

Please note, you should delete the duplicate record from your CRM as well as merge it in Apollo to prevent it from syncing again.

[Back to Top](#top)

### The Contact Card[](#toc_4)

To merge a contact from the Contact Card, click the additional options (...) button and then click **Merge Duplicate**.

[![Merge Duplicate](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i5.png)

In the modal, **Merge this contact:** will be auto-filled with the existing contact that Apollo should merge it with. You cannot change this field.

[![Merge this contact](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i6.png)

Use the **Into this contact:** search bar to find the contact you want to merge into your source of truth.

[![Search](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i7.png)

Click **Merge** to join the two contacts.

[![Merge](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i8.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Contact Checkboxes[](#toc_5)

The last method to merge contacts is by using the contact checkboxes on the **People** search page.

Click the checkbox for each contact.

[![Contact Checkboxes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i9.png)

Click the additional options (...) button and then click **Merge Duplicates**.

[![Additional Options](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i10.png)

In the Merge Duplicate Contact modal, click the **Choose the master contact to merge the selected contacts into** drop-down and then choose the contact you want to use as your source of truth.

[![Master Merge Contact](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i11.png)

Click **Merge** to merge the two contacts.

[![Merge Two Contacts](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/manage_duplicate_records/i12.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

If you have integrated your CRM with Apollo, Apollo automatically syncs any **parent accounts** you have set up between the two platforms.

You can also assign and edit **parent accounts** in Apollo. This helps you keep your **accounts** organized if an **account** has different subsidiaries or undergoes acquisition.

You Gotta Save It First!

Please note, you can only assign, edit, and view the account hierarchy of **saved accounts**. If you want to assign a **parent account** to another account, please make sure you save both the parent and child accounts before following the steps below. For more information about how to save accounts in Apollo, please refer to the "[**Save Contacts and Accounts**](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413032484493-Save-Contacts-and-Accounts)" article.

Refer to the sections below to assign a **parent account** and view the **account** hierarchy of your **saved accounts**.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Assign or Edit Parent Accounts[](#toc_2)

Launch Apollo, click **Search**, and then click **Companies**.

[![Companies Tab on Search Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i1.png)

Use the search filters on the left to find the **saved account** to which you want to assign a **parent account**.

[![Search Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i2.png)

Click on the name of the account to access its profile page.

[![Saved Account on Search Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i3.png)

Scroll to the account overview card on the **Overview** tab and hover your mouse over the **Parent Account** field. Then, click **Edit**.

[![Edit Parent Account Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i4.png)

Use the drop-down bar to find the company that you want to assign as the **parent account**. Then, click **Save**.

[![Parent Account Drop-Down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i5.png)

You have now assigned or updated the parent-child account relationship for a **saved account**.

[Back to Top](#top)

## View Account Hierarchy[](#toc_3)

To view the parent/child hierarchy for an account, launch Apollo, click **Search**, and then click **Companies**.

[![Companies Tab on Search Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i1.png)

Use the search filters on the left to find a **saved account**.

[![Search Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i2.png)

Click on the name of the **account** to access its profile page.

[![Saved Account on Search Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i3.png)

Click the **Hierarchy** icon at the top of the page.

[![Hierarchy Icon on an Account Profile Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i6.png)

Can't See the Icon?

Please note, you can currently only view the hierarchy of an **account** for which you have already set up a parent-child account relationship. If you have not assigned a **parent account** to any of your **saved accounts**, you will not see the hierarchy icon on a company profile page. Follow the steps in [the section above](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/10279502128397#toc_2) and then refresh the page to view the new hierarchy.

Apollo displays an **Account Hierarchy** modal. From here, you can view the **parent account**, along with the account owner, stage, and location.

[![Account Hierarchy Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i7.png)

To view the other **child accounts** mapped to this same **parent account**, click **View More Accounts** and scroll through the list.

[![View More Accounts Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/view_and_edit_the_account_hierarchy_of_saved_accounts_in_apollo/i8.png)

You have now viewed the hierarchy of an **account**.

Send Out the Search Party!

If you have mapped multiple **child accounts** to the same **parent account**, you can use the **parent accounts** filter in Apollo to search for all associated **child accounts**. Check out [Search Filters Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview) to learn more.

[![Build An Outbound Sales Process: Metrics](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/academy/build_an_outbound_sales_process_metrics/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/academy/build_an_outbound_sales_process_metrics/i1.png) ## Setting the Scene[](#toc_1) [![Setting the Scene](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/academy/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/academy/i1.png) Outbound sales is a numbers game. Before you get started with your outreach, you need to set concrete goals, decide upon the metrics that you wish to use to measure your success, and set a benchmark of comparison from which you can build. Start by thinking about: * How many accounts and contacts do you wish to engage with * How many emails you will send out per day * How many touches—or, number of times you engage a prospect—you will include in each sequence If you have run previous campaigns, you can use your historical data as a benchmark of comparison. If this is your first outbound campaign, you can use the sample metrics in this module as a reference so that when you start to gather the results from your new campaigns, you will have quantitative data to measure against your results. There are a number of data points you can focus on. We’d recommend concentrating on the following to begin with: * % of email open rates * % of replies * % of interested contacts * The number of meetings set * The number of closed/won deals Start by drafting out the data points that you want to gather in your own **Outbound Sales Metrics** table: | Type of Metric | Data Points to Measure | Benchmark Metrics | | --- | --- | --- | | Targeting | * \# Accounts
* \# Contacts/Accounts
* \# Emails/Contacts | | | Activity | * \# Emails | | | Quality of Activity | * % Email Open
* % Email Reply
* % Email Interested Rate | | | Results | * \# Meetings from Email | | | Sales Cycle | * Meeting — Win Rate
* Closed/Won Deals | | Each metric you measure will provide you with key insights into the growth and health of your sales strategies. Gathering the data and analyzing the performance of your sales efforts allows you to constantly review, experiment, and improve to reach your sales targets. [Back to Top](#top) ## Apollo Example[](#toc_2) [![Apollo Example](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/academy/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/academy/i2.png) In the table below, we have included sample metrics that you can use as a benchmark when first starting out. | Type of Metric | Data Points to Measure | Benchmark Results | My Metrics: Month 1 | Analysis | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | Targeting | * \# Accounts
* \# Contacts/Accounts
* \# Emails/Contacts | * 100-1000
* 2-5
* 2-5 | | | | Activity | * \# Emails | * 200-500 per day | | | | Quality of Activity | * % Email Open
* % Email Reply
* % Email Interested Rate | * 30%-50%
* 1%-10%
* 0.2%-2% | | | | Results | * \# Meetings from Email | * 10-20 per month | | | | Sales Cycle | * Meeting — Win Rate
* Closed/Won Deals | * 20%-30%
* 2-5 per month | | | Start Here, but Don't Stay Here! The more data you gather and metrics you measure, the less relevant these benchmark statistics will become. Over time, you will need to use your historical data as the biggest judge of your progress; adapting your target metrics to fit your specific business, industry, and market. [Back to Top](#top) ### Dissecting the Numbers[](#toc_3) Once you decide upon the number of companies that you want to target—between 100 and 1,000 is a good starting point—you need to decide how many contacts you will target within each account and how many times you will engage with each person. We recommend that you start by contacting at least 2-5 contacts from within the same company and sending at least 2-5 emails to each. Pro Tip! Make sure you don’t engage with all of the contacts at the same company at the same time. Instead, try to space out your communications with prospects from the same company across multiple days. Now that you know how many accounts you want to target, think about how many emails you should send in a day. A good benchmark for Apollo users is anywhere between 200-500 emails per rep, per day. This provides you with a large enough sample size to analyze the quality of the activity and calculate the conversion rates between opened emails, replies, meetings set, and closed deals. You should also pay close attention to the % email interest rate. This is a key statistic that provides insight into the number of contacts that have confirmed they would like to attend a meeting from the total number of emails you sent out in a month. Using this information, you can then determine the conversion rates per sales rep. Generally speaking, each sales rep should be aiming to secure at least 10-20 meetings per month, but depending on your industry, coaching methods, and approach, one rep could set up as many as 50-100 meetings per month. The more meetings you set, the better chance you have of closing deals. As a benchmark, try to achieve at least a 20%-30% win rate by closing 2-5 deals per month per rep. But always keep in mind that these target metrics are according to the industry average. They give you an idea of the baseline statistics for outbound sales. However, after the first few months of outreach, you should be able to gain a better understanding of what’s possible for your company in your specific market. You can then adapt your sales targets accordingly. * Closed/Won Deals | * 2-5 per month
