## Overview[](#toc_1)

There are certain scenarios when one contact may match multiple accounts in your CRM or in Apollo. For example, if you have purposeful duplicates. If this applies to you, Apollo provides you with 2 options:

*   Receive a prompt to decide which of the related accounts you want to map a contact to. This allows you to select the appropriate account on a case-by-case basis.
*   Enable automatic mapping. This allows Apollo to map a contact to the first of the multiple accounts that you created.

Refer to the sections below for the steps to take to first configure the settings and then map contacts to the correct duplicate account.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Configure the Settings for Duplicate Account Handling[](#toc_2)

Admin Only

Please note, only admin users can access the **Duplicate Account Handling** settings. If you want to receive a prompt every time Apollo finds a duplicate **account** to map a **contact** to, please contact your admin and they can enable the settings for you.

Launch Apollo, click **Settings**, and then click **Prospecting Config**.

[![Prospecting Configuration Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i1.png)

Scroll to **Duplicate Account Handling**.

[![Duplicate Account Handling Options](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i2.png)

Click the **Enable Automatic Mapping** radio button if you want to automate the workflow.

[![Automatic Mapping Radio Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i3.png)

Contemplate Before You Automate!

Please note, if you enable this option, Apollo automatically maps the selected **contact(s)** to the first of the multiple **accounts** that you created in Apollo or in your CRM. If you have created purposeful duplicate **accounts** as part of your account-based sales strategy, this may not be the best choice for you.

Click the **Prompt users to select an account to save to** radio button if you want to manually select the most appropriate account whenever there are duplicates.

[![Prompt users to select the appropriate account radio button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i4.png)

When you have selected your preference, click **Save**.

[![Save Selected Preference](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i5.png)

You have now configured the settings for duplicate account handling.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Map Contacts to the Correct Duplicate Accounts[](#toc_3)

Now that you have enabled the account mapping prompt, every time that you take action on a **Net New contact** that matches multiple **accounts** in Apollo or your CRM, you can choose which **account** to map the **contact** to.

There are 2 ways to map **contacts** to the correct duplicate **accounts**—from the Search tool or from a **contact** or **account's** profile page.

### Map Contacts to a Duplicate Account From the Apollo Search Tool[](#toc_4)

Launch Apollo and click **Search**.

[![Search Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i6.png)

Use the filters on the left to find the **Net New contact(s)** that you want to start prospecting.

[![Find Contacts with Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i7.png)

Click the checkboxes next to your chosen **contact(s)** and then click **\+ Save**.

[![Save Contacts Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i8.png)

Select the actions that you want to take in the **Save the Contact** modal and then click **Confirm**.

[![Confirm](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i9.png)

No Changes Here!

Please note, the process remains the same no matter which action you take on a **Net New contact** that matches multiple **accounts**. This means that whether you try to save the **contact**, add the **contact** to a **sequence** or a **list**, export the **contact** as a CSV, or add them to a campaign in your CRM, Apollo displays the same "multiple accounts found" modal below.

If the contact(s) that you selected match multiple **accounts**, Apollo displays a modal.

[![Multiple Accounts Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i10.png)

Click the drop-down arrow on the right of a **contact** and scroll through the options. Click the specific **account** to which you want to map each **contact**.

[![Account Drop-Down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i11.png)

When you have selected the appropriate **account** for each **contact** in the modal, click **Save**.

[![Save Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i12.png)

You have now mapped the **contact(s)** to a specific **account** when prospecting on the **Search** page.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Map a Contact to the Correct Account from the Profile Page.[](#toc_5)

You can also select the **account** to which you want to map a **contact** from the respective **contact** or **account** profile page.

Launch Apollo and click **Search**.

[![Search Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i6.png)

Use the filters on the left to find the **contact** or **account** that you want to start prospecting.

[![Find Contacts with Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i7.png)

Click on the name of the **contact** or **account** that you want to review.

[![Name of Account](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i13.png)

From an **account** profile page, scroll to the **People** tab and click the checkboxes to select the **contact(s)** of your choice.

[![Contact Checkboxes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i14.png)

Select the appropriate icon according to the prospecting action that you want to take.

[![Action Icons](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i15.png)

Account Vs. Contact

The workflow differs slightly on a **Net New contact's** profile page. When you click on a **contact's** name from the **Search** page, click **Access Email & Phone Number** at the top of the page.

[![Net New Contact Actions](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i16.png)

The remaining steps are the same for both **contacts** and **accounts**.

Select the action(s) that you want to take in the modal that appears and then click **Confirm**.

[![Confirm](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i17.png)

No Changes Here!

Please note, the process remains the same no matter which action you take on a **Net New contact** that matches multiple **accounts**. This means that whether you try to save the **contact**, add the **contact** to a **sequence** or a **list**, export the **contact** as a CSV, or add them to a campaign in your CRM, Apollo displays the same "multiple accounts found" modal below.

If the contact(s) that you selected match multiple **accounts**, Apollo displays a modal.

[![Multiple Accounts Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i18.png)

Click the drop-down arrow on the right of each **contact** and scroll through the options. Click the specific **account** to which you want to map each **contact**.

[![Account Drop-Down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i19.png)

When you have selected the appropriate **account** for each **contact** in the modal, click **Save**.

[![Save Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i20.png)

You have now mapped the **contact(s)** to a specific **account** from the **contact** or **account** profile page.

Here, There, and Everywhere!

Please note, you do not have to be in the Apollo web app to perform this action. You can also map **contact(s)** to the correct duplicate **account(s)** from the Apollo Chrome Extension. All the same steps as above apply.

[![Map Contacts to Account Modal in the Extension](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/map_a_contact_to_the_correct_duplicate_account/i21.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

Every time a contact updates their LinkedIn profile with a new position, Apollo triggers a **Job Change** on the contact's record.

If Apollo displays a **Job Change** for a contact that doesn't seem to have changed companies or roles, the contact may have removed their newly added position from their LinkedIn profile. In this case, Apollo does not automatically remove the **Job Change** trigger from the contact's record.

To ensure the contact's information is up-to-date on their record, launch Apollo, hover your mouse over **Search** in the navbar, and then click **People**.

[![People Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_deleted_job_change/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_deleted_job_change/i1.png)

Use the **Search** bar to find the contact whose profile you want to update.

[![Search Bar](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_deleted_job_change/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_deleted_job_change/i2.png)

Click the LinkedIn icon.

[![LinkedIn Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_deleted_job_change/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_deleted_job_change/i3.png)

Apollo updates the record and clears the trigger that showed the contact's deleted **Job Change**.

[Back to Top](#top)

If you use the Apollo extension to track emails, it may create **Placeholder Profiles** in Apollo.

A **Placeholder Profile** is a profile that Apollo creates when you send a message outside of Apollo to an email that isn't assocaited with a saved contact. This occurs when you enable the **Track** checkbox on emails that you send through Gmail.

[![Track](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i1.png)

When no existing contacts match the email address to which you have sent a tracked email, Apollo creates a **Placeholder Profile** to avoid cluttering your database.

Placeholder Profiles Are Not Contacts

Please note, **Placeholder Profiles** do not represent contacts in the Apollo database. This means that you cannot use the Apollo **Search** feature to find these email addresses.

To find a **Placeholder Profile** for a tracked email address, launch Apollo, hover your mouse over **Engage** in the navbar, and then click **Emails**.

[![Engage_Email](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i2.png)

Click the **Filter** icon to expand the available filters.

[![Filter Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i3.png)

Type the email address into the **Search** bar.

[![Search Bar](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i4.png)

Click the name associated with the email.

[![Click Name](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i5.png)

You can now view the **Placeholder Profile** associated with the tracked email address.

[![Placeholder Profile Example](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/FAQ_placeholder_contacts/i6.png)

Placeholder Profiles Do Not Replace Contacts

Please note, Apollo does not create **Placeholder Profiles** for existing contacts. If you send a message outside of Apollo to an email that belongs to an existing contact, Apollo always associates the message with the contact's profile in Apollo. This happens regardless of whether you have installed the [Apollo Chrome Extension](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409226637453-Apollo-Chrome-Extension-Overview) or not. For more information about how to add a contact to Apollo, please refer to the ["Save Contacts and Accounts"](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413032484493-Save-Contacts-and-Accounts) article.

[Back to Top](#top)

Launch Apollo and click **Search**.

[![Search](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i1.png)

Click **Show More Filters**.

[![More Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i2.png)

In the "Filters" modal, scroll to the **Created Source** section. Find **Contact Data Request** and then expand the accordion.

[![Data Request](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i3.png)

Click the drop-down and select the **Data Request** that you want to view.

[![Data Request Drop-Down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i4.png)

Click **Apply Filters**.

[![Apply Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i5.png)

Apollo displays your results in the search.

[![Results](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/find_contacts_requested/i6.png)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

LinkedIn is a valuable tool to gain individualized information that helps you connect with your ideal customers. Leverage LinkedIn to access key information about your target **Contacts**, such as:

*   Work history and experience
*   Current employer
*   Hobbies and Interests
*   Current colleagues

Apollo allows you to leverage LinkedIn in your **Sequences** to store a contact's personalized information and set reminders for yourself.

**Sequences** in Apollo allow you to refine your messaging. You can use **Sequences** to A/B test messages and ensure that you successfully engage with your customers. You can then hyper-focus your messaging and personalize your approach with information from LinkedIn.

This use case explores the steps you can take to leverage LinkedIn with **Sequences**.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Sample Workflow[](#toc_2)

### Find the Right Contacts[](#toc_3)

The first thing you need to do before you can launch an effective campaign is to find the right contacts that match your vision. Randomly contacting people is inefficient and won't yield positive results. You need to find a targeted audience.

*   **Prospect with LinkedIn**

*   It's easy to leverage data from LinkedIn to prospect with the tools Apollo provides. The first thing you should do is search for and request details about prospects from LinkedIn Sales Navigator, LinkedIn, or directly from the Apollo database. Read the ["Prospect in LinkedIn"](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409229262093-Prospect-in-LinkedIn) article for in-depth instructions. [![Prospect](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i29.png)

*   **Use the Apollo Chrome Extension**

*   The Apollo Chrome Extension works in conjunction with LinkedIn to help you get the data you need to reach your goals. You can prospect contact and account data directly from LinkedIn and complete many tasks through Apollo directly from LinkedIn, such as: request an email address, make a call, and add a saved contact to a list or **Sequence**. Read the ["Apollo Chrome Extension Overview"](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409226637453-Apollo-Chrome-Extension-Overview) for more information.

*   **Create Personas**

*   **Personas** are sets of titles, seniorities, and departments that define different groups of people that you can target within key accounts. This allows you to find contacts faster with Apollo's search tool, receive better recommendations, and improve analytics. You can use **Personas** to narrow your LinkedIn searches. For more on Personas, read the ["Create a Persona"](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409500253837-Create-a-Persona) article. [![Persona](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i30.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Plan Your Strategy[](#toc_4)

Now that you have a solid list of prospects, you can start to plan your strategy. Apollo offers automation tools like **Sequences** and templates to help you organize and standardize your messaging.

*   **Create a Sequence**

*   You can leverage the LinkedIn steps capability in the Apollo **Sequences** feature to organize your messaging and categorize your contacts. For each contact in your **Sequence**, you can add steps to track interacting in LinkedIn from initial contact to sending a direct message. Apollo reminds you when you should complete different steps in the **Sequence** to keep you on task. For more information, read the ["Complete a LinkedIn Task in a Sequence"](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5646233248269) article. [![Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i3.png)

Oh, The Things You Can Do!

You can use Apollo **Sequences** for much more than tracking LinkedIn tasks. Check out the ["**Sequences Overview**"](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview) and ["**Create a Sequence**"](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409231193101-Create-a-Sequence) articles for more information on how **sequences** are used in Apollo.

*   **Draft LinkedIn Messaging**

*   You can draft personalized messages through Apollo. Some general best practices for LinkedIn messaging are:

*   Personalize your messages
*   Be direct and keep it short
*   Clearly communicate your goal
*   Suggest ways to meet or speak further
*   Have a clear and concise signature
*   Time your messages during normal business hours

*   You should use the dynamic variables and snippets features in the message template to personalize your messaging at scale. For more information on how snippets work, read the ["**Create and Edit Snippets**"](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/11509551262093) article. For more information about dynamic variables, hop into the ["**Use Basic Dynamic Variables**"](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409415084813) article. [![Template](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i6.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Execute Your Strategy[](#toc_5)

Now that you found your ideal prospects and planned your messaging strategy, it's time to put your plan into motion. Part of executing your strategy is finding the perfect way to communicate your message and sometimes that requires trial and error to hone your skills. Here are some steps you can take to execute and perfect your strategy.

*   **Add Contacts to Your Sequence**

*   Now that you created your LinkedIn **Sequence**, you need to add contacts to it. When you add contacts to the LinkedIn **Sequence**, Apollo will track each contact through the steps you added to the **Sequence**. For more on how to add contacts to a **Sequence**, read the ["**Add Contacts to a Sequence**"](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396985741-Add-Contacts-to-a-Sequence) article. [![Contacts](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i28.png)

*   **Implement Your Sequence**

*   You already created your tasks and now you can begin tracking your correspondence with your contacts. Apollo shows you which step a contact is in while they are in a **Sequence** when you visit their contact card. In this manner, you can track where exactly a contact is in the LinkedIn **Sequence**. [![Contact Card](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linkedin_use_case/i27.png)

*   **Refine Your Message**

*   While you can't A/B test with LinkedIn messaging, you can refine your message to optimize your results. You should always be on the lookout for clearer wording and more personalized messaging to help grab the attention of your potential contacts. Over time, you should develop a comfort level with LinkedIn messaging and your results should improve.

No Overnight Successes

Please note, developing the right messaging strategy takes time and effort. Be patient, be dedicated, and be persistent.

You have now completed a LinkedIn **Sequence** workflow.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

The Apollo platform equips you with the engagement tools you need to target the right people with the right message, through the right channels, at the right time.

This use case explores the steps you can take if you want to use Apollo to create and automate personalized messages at scale for your key **Personas**.

Refer to the sections below for a sample workflow that walks you through how to integrate your CRM, set up your mailbox and email signature, create **sequences**, add **contacts**, and A/B test to consistently improve your sales approach and increase conversions.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Sample Workflow[](#toc_2)

If you want to leverage key Apollo **Engagement** tools like **sequences** and **analytics**, you can follow this example workflow with best practices.

A Message From Yoda We Have!

Patience you must have my young Padawan, for every user is on their own path and has their own objectives. This is an example workflow. Use it as a guideline and alter the process to best fit your individual needs. Only then, great results you will see.

To start sending personalized, automated messaging to your ideal prospects directly from an Apollo sequence, you first need to complete a few important preparatory steps.

### Integrate Your CRM With Apollo[](#toc_3)

If your company uses a CRM, you should begin by integrating it with the Apollo platform. This means that when you begin your outreach efforts, you can ensure that your data is always up-to-date and in sync. It also means that you can visualize and stay in control of which team members contact which prospects.

CRM Integration

Please note, Salesforce offers the largest degree of enrichment functionality in Apollo, but Apollo also supports CRM integrations with HubSpot.

Use the links below for the CRM that you want to integrate and configure with Apollo.

What if my company doesn't use a CRM?

If your company does not use a CRM to maintain information about your customers, you should upload a CSV of "Do Not Contact" customers to avoid reaching out to them. For more information about importing **contacts** into the Apollo platform, see the "[Upload a CSV of Contacts to Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409161532045-Upload-a-CSV-of-Contacts-to-Apollo)" article.

[Back to Top](#top)

#### Salesforce[](#toc_4)

**Integration**

*   [Connect Apollo to Your Salesforce Account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414356051725-Connect-Apollo-to-Your-Salesforce-Account)
*   [Understand Opportunity Stages and Salesforce](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415294726029-Understand-Opportunity-Stages-and-Salesforce-)

**Credentials**

*   [Salesforce Credentials Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415287562893-Salesforce-Credentials-Overview)
*   [Connect "Team Sync" Authentication Credentials to Your Salesforce Integration](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415294638733-Connect-Team-Sync-Authentication-Credentials-To-Your-Salesforce-Integration)

[Back to Top](#top)

#### HubSpot[](#toc_5)

**Integration**

*   [Connect Apollo to Your HubSpot Account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416619021837)

Once you've connected your CRM to Apollo, your customer data stays accurate and in sync. Now, you're ready to connect your mailbox and set up your email signature.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Connect Your Mailbox[](#toc_6)

If you want to leverage Apollo **Engagement** tools to start sending messages in a **sequence** and convert more leads into sales, you must connect your mailbox first.

Linking an email mailbox to Apollo allows you to email directly from an Apollo **sequence**. You can link any type of mailbox to Apollo. For a full list of the Email Service Providers (ESPs) that Apollo supports, refer to the "[Supported Email Service Providers (ESPs)](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409140697101)" article; however, Gmail provides the most compatibility and functionality in Apollo.

[![Connected Mailbox](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i9.png)

Follow the step by step instructions in the "[Link Your Mailbox to Apollo.io](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409127806093-Link-Your-Mailbox-to-Apollo-io)" article to get set up.

[Back To Top](#top)

### Set Up Your Email Signature[](#toc_7)

Now that you have linked your mailbox, it's time to set up your email signature.

[![Email Signature](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_your_email_signature/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_your_email_signature/i4.png)

There are several key advantages of using an email signature in your engagement emails.

*   **Gaining trust**: The recipient can easily identify who has contacted them and from which company. If they want to research you before replying, they can do that.
*   **Providing context and building rapport**: Your title and company name help indicate the nature and reason for your message. If you or your company are well-known in the industry, your signature may even add credibility to your email.
*   **Encouraging responses**: If you include your contact information in the email, you increase the chances of a response. You also give the recipient the freedom to respond through the channel that suits them best.

To set up a unique signature for each mailbox that you have linked, follow the steps in [this article](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409140295949-Set-Up-Your-Email-Signature).

SPAM Filters and Links

Please note, as a best practice, you should avoid including links in your signature because they may trigger SPAM filters for new **contacts** that you have not emailed before. For more information, please refer to the "[Avoid SPAM Filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409225311885-Avoid-SPAM-Filters)" Overview article.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Plan Your Outreach Campaign (Sequence)[](#toc_8)

Now that you have integrated your CRM, connected your mailbox, and set up your email signature, you are ready to start planning your outreach campaign.

Before you create and execute your **sequences** in Apollo, ask yourself 3 key questions:

*   Who do you want to target and why?
*   When do you want to target them?
*   What steps will you take to engage with them?

If you haven't already done so, follow the instructions in the [Use Apollo to Find New Customers](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413044057741) use case to identify the answers to the first and second questions.

Below, we will focus on the third point—the steps you should take once you have identified your **Ideal Customer Profile**, built your **Personas**, and are ready for engagement.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Create a Sequence[](#toc_9)

Apollo **sequences** are outreach campaigns with any number of sequential contact points and tasks that you can customize to personally engage your target audiences at scale. They help your team deliver communications to your customers and complete the right tasks at the right time to speed your prospects through your pipeline and turn them into paying customers as efficiently as possible.

As you use Apollo to hone in on your **Ideal Customer Profiles**, you can create **sequences** to match each type of prospect with automatic and manual messages, LinkedIn engagement, calls, and action items that speak directly to the needs and challenges of your target audiences.

**Sequence** steps are the individual messages and activities you design for your team to successfully engage with prospects. **Sequences** are made up of as many steps and with as much time between each step as you choose. An ideal outreach campaign requires multiple touches and interactions. You first need to decide upon the type of sales strategy that you want to implement. Is the purpose of your **sequence** to create demand, to generate pipeline, or to expand upon your existing business? This decision will influence whether you decide to follow an inbound, outbound, nurture-based, event-inspired, upselling, or other sales strategy. Depending on the approach that you choose, the number of steps in your **sequence** will vary. In most cases, Apollo recommends you follow up with someone at least 5 times.

Step by Step

For more information about the types of steps available in Apollo, please refer to the "[Available Steps in a Sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview#toc_2)" section of the "Sequences Overview" article. You can also refer to [this section](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview#toc_2) of the "Craft Killer Sales Email Messaging" article for 3 example options to consider when planning your **sequence** strategy.

When you have strategized the number and types of steps to include in your **sequence**, you are ready to build these steps within Apollo.

[![Sequence Example](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequences_overview/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequences_overview/i2.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Draft Your Messaging[](#toc_10)

We will focus on drafting email messaging in a **sequence**. However, Apollo strongly recommends adopting an omnichannel selling strategy to engage your users with multiple touches across a number of the most common channels that they interact with daily.

Email is a powerful sales tool. When done correctly, sales emails can help you raise awareness, build rapport, and convert qualified leads into sales opportunities at scale. There are several best practices you can follow to increase your email conversion rates:

*   Understand the pain points of your target audience
*   Make it personal
*   Create intrigue in the subject line
*   Keep it simple and concise
*   Include a powerful CTA
*   Add multiple touch-points
*   Learn when and how to link
*   Avoid SPAM triggers in your email content
*   A/B test

When you have brainstormed your messaging strategy, add the messages into the **sequence** you created earlier.

Launch Apollo, click **Engage**, and then click **Sequences**.

[![Engage-Sequences](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i1.png)

Open the **sequence** that you created earlier.

[![Click Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i2.png)

Click the email step that you want to edit.

[![Click Email Step](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i3.png)

Specify the type of email, add the subject line, and copy your message into the body of the template.

[![Create Template](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i4.png)

Remember to take full advantage of [Apollo Snippets](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409415084813-Use-Basic-Snippets) to keep your automated messages personalized.

Click the **Save as a new template** checkbox if you want to save and use this template in other **sequences**. Then, give your template a name.

[![Save as a template](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i5.png)

Contemplating Templates?

Please note, you do not have to save your message as a template; however, there are advantages of doing so. For example, you can access template analytics, collaborate and share successful templates with team members, and update templates en masse. For more information about Apollo templates, please refer to the "[Create and Edit Email Templates](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409238165389-Create-and-Edit-Email-Templates)" article.

Click **Save Changes**.

[![Save Changes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i6.png)

Apollo saves your message. Repeat this process until you have added the copy for each email in your **sequence**.

[![Messages Saved in Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i7.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Add Contacts to Your Sequence[](#toc_11)

Now that you have your messages at the ready, it's time to add your **contacts**.

There are 3 different ways to add **contacts** to a **sequence** in Apollo. You can use the Apollo **Search** tool, upload a CSV file, or select **contacts** from a list.

It's Your Way or the Highway

You can choose to add **contacts** in the way that best suits you and your team. For more information about the steps to take for each, please refer to the "[Add Contacts to a Sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396985741-Add-Contacts-to-a-Sequence)" article.

Once you have added your **contacts**, remember to activate the **sequence**. Click the toggle on the top right of the screen and check that you have activated the toggles on the left of each step.

[![Activate Toggles](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i8.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Test, Analyze, and Improve[](#toc_12)

Your **sequence** is now live, but the journey to achieving a successful sales campaign has only just begun! If you are serious about achieving long-term success through your email strategy in Apollo, you need to use the tools and data at your disposal to drive smart decision-making.

To ensure you are constantly improving your **sequences** and achieving optimal results, you can leverage 2 key components of the Apollo **Engagement** tool:

*   A/B Testing
*   Analytics

### A/B Test[](#toc_13)

**A/B testing** allows you to test multiple messages in a **sequence** step. Apollo sends an even traffic distribution to each message variant in the test.

[![A/B Test](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/ab_testing/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/ab_testing/i4.png)

There are several advantages of **A/B testing**:

*   Determine which messages best engage which prospects.
*   Better reach your intended audience through data-driven trial and error.
*   Leverage the data from your A/B tests to improve the effectiveness of future messages and increase conversions.
*   Reduce bounce rates by eliminating techniques that don't work well on your target audience.

For more information about the recommended sales metrics to aim for when starting out, please refer to the "[Build an Outbound Sales Metric](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5120718002701-Build-an-Outbound-Sales-Process-Metrics)" article.

To set up **A/B testing** in Apollo, follow the instructions in the "[Add an A/B Test to an Email Step in a Sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410749683597-Add-an-A-B-Test-to-an-Email-Step-in-a-Sequence)" article.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Access Sequence Analytics[](#toc_14)

With your **sequence(s)** live and your **A/B testing** underway, it's time to leverage the Apollo **Analytics** tool. Apollo **Analytics** provides you with the insights that you need to identify key trends and define what is and isn’t working. You can also use the data to decide which tests to run and which improvements to make to repeatedly smash your monthly and yearly targets on a consistent basis.

When you send emails in Apollo, you can track your **Open**, **Click**, and **Response** rates.

[![Sequence Analytics](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i11.png)

To access this data directly from within the **sequence** you created, please refer to the "[Access Apollo Email Analytics](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4425592135821-Access-Apollo-Email-Analytics-)" article for step by step guidance.

From the **Reports** tab in a **sequence**, you can also gain a deeper understanding of how your emails are performing across the different audience and company attributes.

[![Sequence Reports Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i12.png)

To gain a more holistic view of all your campaign data, you can leverage the Apollo **Analytics** tool. To take full advantage of this feature in Apollo, please refer to the [Build and Access Reports in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410826842381-Build-and-Access-Reports-In-Apollo)" article.

[![Sequence Analytics](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_case_engagement_email/i10.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## What's Next?[](#toc_15)

Now that you have successfully integrated your CRM, set up your mailbox and email signature, created and added **contacts** to your **sequences**, set up **A/B testing**, and taken advantage of Apollo **Analytics**, there are some additional actions that you can take to leverage an omnichannel strategy with Apollo.

The "[Leverage Sequences with LinkedIn to Organize Your Personalized Messaging](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5694087661325-Leverage-Sequences-with-LinkedIn-to-Organize-your-Personalized-Messaging)" article deep dives into another key channel that you can leverage with Apollo to increase personalization at scale. In this LinkedIn use case, you can learn how to make the most of LinkedIn to prospect, engage, and convert your ideal customers as part of your Apollo **sequences**.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Sequence rulesets allow you to set custom rules about who you can email within your [sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview). Sequence rulesets protect you from sending emails to the wrong people, and they help you work faster with automations and triggers.

Check out the following sections to create a sequence ruleset and leverage it in sequences.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create a Sequence Ruleset[](#toc_2)

To create a sequence ruleset:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/sequence/sequence-rulesets).
2.  Click **\+ New Sequence Ruleset**. [![New Ruleset](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i2.png)
3.  Name your sequence ruleset, then configure the [triggers](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396858509-Create-Sequence-Rulesets#toc_3) and [other settings](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396858509-Create-Sequence-Rulesets#toc_4) you want to use in the ruleset. [![Ruleset Name](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i3.png)
4.  When finished, click **Save**. 

Pricing Tiers and Sequence Rulesets

Anyone can set sequence rulesets on individual sequences, but the ability to save a sequence ruleset is based on your [Apollo plan](https://www.apollo.io/pricing/).

5.  Your sequence ruleset is now ready to use and will appear in the advanced settings when you [create or edit a sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409231193101-Create-a-Sequence).

[![Advanced Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i1.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Configure Triggers[](#toc_3)

Triggers offer automations for sequence rulesets, like creating tasks or configuring the maximum number of sequences per 24-hour period.

You can determine how to treat contacts in a sequence when someone from the same company replies to an email from your Apollo instance. Choose an option from the drop-down beside **When there is another reply within the same account**:

*   Do nothing
*   Mark subsequent emails for that account as not sent
*   Delay subsequent emails sending for that account

[![Same Account Behavior](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i4.png)

You can create phone call tasks based on the number of times an active contact opens an email. Click the **Create a phone call task...** checkbox, then enter the amount of times an email should be opened before the task is created.

[![Call Task](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i5.png)

To trigger a sequence to end if a recipient clicks on a link in an email, click the **Mark contact as finished** checkbox.

[![End Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i6.png)

Enable Click Tracking

The **Mark contact as finished** setting requires you to enable [click tracking](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409803614093-Click-Tracking-in-Apollo-) for your account.

To control the number of days before Apollo marks a recipient as unresponsive if they don't respond or book an appointment, choose the number of days for the **Mark contacts as unresponsive...** option.

[![End Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i7.png)

You can control if emails aren't sent when a contact is in a particular contact stage. By default, the following contact stages are selected:

*   Replied
*   Interested
*   Do Not Contact
*   Bad Data

To edit this setting, click a default stage to remove it, or click the drop-down to add more contact stages.

[![Contact stage](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i8.png)

You can control if emails aren't sent when an account is in a particular account stage. When a sequence includes this trigger in its ruleset, Apollo moves contacts in any of the selected stages to the Not Sent Emails list. By default, the following account stages are selected:

*   Current client
*   Active opportunity
*   Dead opportunity

To edit this setting, click a default stage to remove it, or click the drop-down to add more account stages.

[![Contact stage](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i9.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Edit Default Triggers[](#toc_4)

Some default triggers are applied to all sequence rulesets. Click **Show Default Triggers** to view and modify these settings:

*   Mark contact as finished in sequence when there is a reply.
*   Pause contact in sequence when there is an out-of-office reply.
*   Mark contact as finished when a calendar meeting is scheduled with the contact.

For your account's protection, there are some default triggers you can't modify. These include:

*   Mark contact as finished in sequence when they unsubscribe.
*   Mark contact as finished in sequence when a phone call is connected.
*   Mark contact as failed when there's a bounce or if email is rejected as spam.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Other Settings[](#toc_5)

There are a few optional settings for sequence rulesets.

You can set the maximum number of emails you send from the sequence in a rolling 24-hour period. To edit this setting, enter the maximum number of emails to send per 24-hour rolling period.

[![Max Emails](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i10.png)

You can also add carbon copy (CC) or blind carbon copy (BCC) email address or addresses to emails sent through the sequence. This is useful for quality control and testing purposes. To edit this setting, enter the email addresses to CC or BCC, separating each address by a comma.

[![Max Emails](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_rulesets/i11.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Watch the Video[](#toc_1)

## Overview[](#toc_2)

Contact and account stages in Apollo help you track progress on sales and marketing pipelines. Stages associate a progress tag with each account or contact for quick insights into your pipeline health.

Check out the following sections to learn how to set up contact and account stages.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Default Contact Stages[](#toc_3)

The following table describes the default stages that can be assigned to your contacts:

| Stage Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Cold | This is a new contact that you have not emailed, called, or reached out to before. |
| Approaching | You have sent the contact at least 1 message or have called them. |
| Replied | This contact has replied to your email. |
| Interested | Your contact is interested in working together further. Apollo updates the contact to the Interested stage automatically if your contact's email is detected in a Gmail calendar invitation. This only works when you have your Gmail account linked and you use Google Calendar. |
| Not Interested | The contact responded that they are not interested. You can try to re-engage with the contact at a later date if they fit your buyer profile. |
| Unresponsive | Apollo marks a contact as Unresponsive if they never reply or engage with your messaging. If you want to amend the default number of days in which Apollo marks a contact as unresponsive, refer to [Create Sequence Rulesets](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396858509). You might want to re-engage with these leads every 30-90 days, as different positioning, more education about your product, a change in a contact's role, or better timing could still lead to a sale. |
| Do Not Contact | Apollo automatically assigns a contact to the **Do Not Contact** stage if a contact actively unsubscribes from your emails. You can also [configure contact triggers](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/6134748003725) in the settings if you want to set up additional automation. For one-off cases, such as when a contact personally requests for you to stop reaching out, or for competitors, you can manually assign saved contacts to the **Do Not Contact** stage from the search page. [![Assign stage](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i17.png) |
| Bad Data | The prospect's email bounced because the email was incorrect. |
| Changed Job | Apollo informs you when a contact changes jobs so you can email them as they settle into their new role. |

[Back to Top](#top)

## Default Account Stages[](#toc_4)

The following table describes the default stages that can be assigned to your accounts:

| Stage Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Cold | This is a new account you have never engaged with. |
| Current Client | You are actively doing business with these accounts. |
| Active Opportunity | This is a prospective account that someone in your team is currently working on closing. |
| Dead Opportunity | This is an account that your team was unable to close, and you are no longer actively engaging. |
| Do Not Prospect | This is an account that you want to blacklist from your engagement efforts. You can manually assign saved accounts to the **Do Not Prospect** stage from the search page. [![Assign account stage](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i18.png) |

[Back to Top](#top)

## Change Stages for Contacts and Accounts[](#toc_5)

To manually change the stage for a contact or account:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Search**](https://app.apollo.io/#/people).
2.  Select one of **People**, **Companies**, or **List**. [![Access your contacts and accounts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i20.png)
3.  For companies, choose your filters on the left side. For people, click the **Saved** tab. For lists, choose the list you want to update.
4.  Click the checkbox for each contact or account that you want to update. [![Choose the contacts or accounts to update.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i22.png)
5.  For companies, click the **Edit** drop-down, then click **Set Stage**. [![Open the set stage pop-up.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i23.png) ](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i23.png)For people, click \[ **. . .** \] > **Set Stage**. [![An example Search page in Apollo shows 3 results, with a contact selected and Ellipsis - Set stage highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i38.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i38.png)
6.  Select the stage you want to assign to the contacts or accounts. If you have connected a CRM, you can also choose to create records for accounts in the CRM. Then, click **Set Stage**. [![Set the stage for accounts or contacts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i25.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Custom Stages[](#toc_6)

Add custom stages to identify specific statuses for your Contacts and Accounts. Custom stages help you sync information between Apollo and your CRM.

When creating custom stages, make sure to overwrite or delete existing stages that could leverage their current mappings to the triggers that run the automated stage changes. For example, when a contact replies, the contact is automatically updated to the **Replied Contact Stage**.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Create a New Contact Stage[](#toc_7)

To add a new stage for your contacts in Apollo:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Contacts**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/contacts/stages).
2.  Click **Add Stage**. [![Add a new stage for contacts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i26.png)
3.  Enter a name for your contact stage. Then, click **Create Stage**. [![Create the new stage.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i27.png)
4.  (Optional) If you have connected a CRM, choose a field in your CRM to sync with your new Apollo contact stage. Then, select the status that displays in your synced CRM field. [![Map the new stage to your CRM.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i32.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i32.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Recommended Stages for Contacts[](#toc_8)

The following table provides Apollo's recommendations for custom stages you might want to create and the default stages to override. You don't need to follow these recommendations.

| Default Stage | Overwritten / Custom Stage | Category | 'Do Not Override' Checked? |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Nurturing |     | No Category | No  |
| Approaching |     | In Progress | No  |
| Replied |     | In Progress | No  |
|     | Meeting Set | Succeeded | Yes |
| Interested |     | Succeeded | Yes |
|     | SQO | Succeeded | Yes |
|     | Active Evaluator | Succeeded | Yes |
|     | Current Client | Succeeded | Yes |
|     | Closed: Check Back Quarterly | Not Succeeded | Yes |
| Unresponsive | Closed: Unresponsive | Not Succeeded | No  |
|     | Closed: Referred Elsewhere | No Category | Yes |
| Not Interested | Closed: Not Interested | Not Succeeded | Yes |
|     | Closed: Bad Fit | Not Succeeded | Yes |
| Do Not Contact | Closed: Do Not Contact | Not Succeeded | Yes |
|     | Closed: Bad Data | Not Succeeded | Yes |
|     | Closed: Changed Job | Not Succeeded | Yes |
| Bad Data |     | No Category | Yes |
| Changed Job |     | No Category | Yes |

[Back to Top](#top)

### Create a New Account Stage[](#toc_9)

To add a new stage for your accounts in Apollo:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Accounts**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/accounts/stages).
2.  Click **Add Stage**. [![Add a new stage for accounts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i29.png)
3.  Enter a name for your contact stage. Then, click **Create Stage**. [![Create the new stage.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i30.png)
4.  (Optional) If you have connected a CRM, choose a field in your CRM to sync with your new Apollo contact stage. Then, select the status that displays in your synced CRM field. [![Map the new stage to your CRM.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i33.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i33.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Recommended Stages for Accounts[](#toc_10)

The following table provides Apollo's recommendations for custom stages you might want to create. You don't need to follow these recommendations.

| Default Stages | Overwritten / Custom Stage | Category |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Nurturing |     | No Category |
|     | Working | In Progress |
|     | Engaged / Hot | In Progress |
|     | Meeting Set | Succeeded |
| Active Opportunity |     | Succeeded |
| Current Client |     | Succeeded |
| Dead Opportunity |     | Not Succeeded |
|     | Churned | Not Succeeded |
|     | Bad Fit | Not Succeeded |
|     | Nurture - Timing | Not Succeeded |
|     | Nurture - Not Interested | Not Succeeded |
|     | Nurture - Unresponsive | Not Succeeded |
|     | Closed | Not Succeeded |
| Do Not Prospect |     | Not Succeeded |

[Back to Top](#top)

## Triggers Based on Stages[](#toc_11)

Account and contact stages are associated with triggers that automate responses in a sequence. Triggers can be edited for each stage.

To customize contact stage triggers:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Contacts**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/account).
2.  Click the **Triggers** tab. [![Find the triggers for your contacts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i34.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i34.png)
3.  For each of the email and call triggers, choose a contact stage that will be set when the trigger occurs. [![](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i14.png)
4.  Click **Save**.

To customize account stage triggers:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Accounts**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/accounts/triggers).
2.  Click the **Triggers** tab. [![Find the triggers for your contacts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i37.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i37.png)
3.  Choose an account stage that will be set when the trigger occurs. You can also add account stages that deliver warnings to your team during their searches. [![Account Trigger Change](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i36.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/contact_and_account_stages/i36.png)
4.  Click **Save**.

For more information on triggers, check out [Use Stage Triggers to Manage and Track Sales Engagement](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/6134748003725). 

[Back to Top](#top)

## Watch the Video[](#toc_0)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Sequences are outreach campaigns with any number of sequential contact points and tasks that are customized to personally engage your target audiences at scale. They help your team deliver communications to your customers and complete the right tasks at the right time to speed your prospects through your pipeline and turn them into paying customers as efficiently as possible.

The following sections detail the options you have for creating new sequences and how to edit your existing sequences.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Use AI Content to Create New Sequences[](#toc_2)

Use Apollo's AI content to generate new sequences that capture the attention of your prospects. You only need to provide a few key details and Apollo generates a 3-step sequences with unique emails based on the details you provide.

To create a new sequence using AI-generated content:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click **New Sequence**. [![Create a new sequence.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i1.png)
3.  Click **AI-assisted**. [![Choose an AI-assisted sequence.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i2.png)
4.  Enter details about your product that you want to use to generate this sequence. If you are targeting a specific type of prospect, include pain points and value propositions that are relevant to that prospect type.
    
    Then, click **Generate content**. [![Provide details about your product.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i3.png)
    
5.  Apollo takes a few moments to generate content for your sequence. Once the content is available, you can review the subject and body for each email. You can also edit the content, including changing the text formatting, adding links, and adding dynamic variables.
    
    When the content is set, click **Save & activate sequence**. [![Review and edit the AI-generated emails.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i5.png)
    

Your AI-generated sequence is now active. You can continue to edit this content or [add more steps](#add-more-steps-to-a-sequence) to the sequence.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create New Sequences With an Email Template[](#toc_3)

To create a new sequence using an email template that you already made:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click **New Sequence**. [![CAPTION](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i1.png)
3.  Click **From scratch**. [![Create a fresh sequence.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i8.png)
4.  Enter a name for the sequence. You can also choose to limit who can view and use the sequence, and change when the sequence will run. Then, click **Create**. [![Enter a name and schedule for your sequence.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i9.png)
5.  Click **Add a step** to add a new step to the sequence.
6.  Click **Automatic email**. If you prefer to set tasks to manually send emails, you can choose **Manual email** instead. [![Choose your email type.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i10.png)
7.  Set the amount of time that Apollo should wait before sending out the email included in this step. Then, click **Continue**. [![Set the wait time for the email.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i11.png)
8.  In the **Edit template** section, click **Load templates**. [![Load your email templates.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i12.png)
9.  Select the template you would like to use for the sequence email.
10.  Click either **Clone** or **Link**. Cloning the email template means that changes made to the template do not impact other templates. Linking to the original email templates means changes made to the template could impact other places in Apollo where the same template is used. [![Clone or link the email template.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i13.png)
11.  Continue to edit your email manually or [use Apollo's AI to gain help editing your email](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/15396174946445). Then, click **Save**.

Continue to add more steps to your sequence using this same process. When your sequence is ready, toggle the Inactive slider to **Active**.

[![Activate your sequence.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i15.png)

Find the Sweet Spot!

For more information on how to take advantage of sequence schedules and wait time between steps, refer to [Create and Edit Sequence Sending Schedules](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409477927309).

Also, the optimal timing for your target audience depends on the type of sales strategy you choose. Research your industry, plan your strategy, and then A/B test to find the approach that works best for your ideal customers. For an example use case of how to leverage Apollo sequences, refer to [Leverage Apollo Email to Increase Your Conversion Rates](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5492860902669). For general best practices when building an outbound sales process, check out [this overview article](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5120728520205).

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create New Sequences Without an Email Template[](#toc_4)

To create a new sequence without a template:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click **New Sequence**. [![CAPTION](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i1.png)
3.  Click **From scratch**. [![Create a fresh sequence.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i8.png)
4.  Enter a name for the sequence. You can also choose to limit who can view and use the sequence, and change when the sequence will run. Then, click **Create**. [![Enter a name and schedule for your sequence.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i9.png)
5.  Click **Add a step** to add a new step to the sequence.
6.  Click **Automatic email**. If you prefer to set tasks to manually send emails, you can choose **Manual email** instead. [![Choose your email type.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i10.png)
7.  Set the amount of time that Apollo should wait before sending out the email included in this step. Then, click **Continue**. [![Set the wait time for the email.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i11.png)
8.  Write your email manually or [use Apollo's AI to gain help writing your email](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/15396174946445).
9.  (Optional) To save this email as a new template, click the **Save as a new template** checkbox, then enter a name for the template and click **Save**. [![Save your email as a template.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i14.png)
10.  Click **Save**.

Continue to add more steps to your sequence using this same process. When your sequence is ready, toggle the Inactive slider to **Active**.

[![Activate your sequence.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i15.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Add More Steps to a Sequence[](#toc_5)

To add more steps to a sequence that you already created:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click the sequence that you want to change. [![Choose Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_sequence/img8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_sequence/img8.png)
3.  Click **Add step**. [![Add a step.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i16.png)
4.  Select the type of step you would like to add.
5.  Set the amount of time that Apollo should wait before triggering the step. If you selected a task-based step, you also need to set the priority for the task. Then, click **Continue**. [![Set the wait time for the step.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequences/i17.png)

You have now added a step to the sequence. Repeat this process to add more.

## Rearrange Sequence Steps[](#toc_6)

To change the order of the steps in your sequence:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click the sequence that you want to change. [![Choose Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_sequence/img8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_sequence/img8.png)
3.  Click and hold the horizontal bars on the right side of each step. Drag the step to the new position. [![Drag Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_sequence/img10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_sequence/img10.png)
4.  Click **Yes** to confirm your choice. [![Confirm Drag](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_sequence/img11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_sequence/img11.png)

You have now rearranged the steps in your sequence.
