## Overview[](#toc_1)

Use sequence schedules to control the day and time that you send out emails. Customize your schedule to:

*   Adjust to a contact's local time.
*   Optimize the possibility of positive contact.
*   Adjust the wait time between steps.

Refer to the following sections to create and edit sequence schedules and adjust the wait time between the steps in a sequence.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create a Sequence Schedule[](#toc_2)

To create a sequence schedule:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/sequence/schedules). Then, go to the **Schedules** tab.
2.  Click **New Schedule**. [![New Schedule](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i18.png)
3.  Enter a name for your schedule. [![Schedule Name](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i3.png)
4.  Choose a time zone on which to base your schedule. [![Time Zone](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i4.png)
5.  (Recommended) Click the local time zone checkbox to enable or disable the use of a contact's local time zone if location data is available. [![Local Time Zone](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i5.png)
6.  Click the national holidays checkbox if you want to skip sending emails on US national holidays. [![Holidays](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i6.png)
7.  Click **Create** to move on to the next step.
8.  Adjust the blocks of time when you can send emails via a mailbox connected to Apollo. Click **Add Time Block** for each day that you want to add a sending window. [![Sending Window](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i8.png)
9.  Use the drop-downs to select the time block. [![Time Frame](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i9.png)
10.  Click **Add Time Block** to save your schedule. Repeat this process for each day. [![Add Time Block](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i10.png)
11.  Then, click **Save**. [![Save](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i12.png)

Edit a Schedule

You can return to this process and edit the sending windows in your sequence schedule at any time.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Change the Schedule for a Sequence[](#toc_3)

To change a sequence's schedule:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click a sequence to change its schedule. [![Select Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i13.png)
3.  Click **Settings**. [![Sequence Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i14.png)
4.  Click the **Schedule** drop-down to choose a schedule. [![Choose Schedule](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i15.png)
5.  Click **Save Changes**. [![Save Changes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i16.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Adjust Wait Time Between Sequence Steps[](#toc_4)

To adjust the wait time between steps in a sequence:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click a sequence to edit the wait time between its steps. [![Click Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i19.pngg)
3.  Click the **Additional options** (...) button on the right of a step. Then, click **Edit**. [![Edit Wait Time](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i20.png)
4.  Use the **When to start this step** options to update the amount of wait time between steps. [![Wait For Drop-down Options](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i21.png) ](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_sequence_schedules/i21.png)If you select days, Apollo counts from the days in your sequence schedule, not days in general. The wait counter starts on the day that Apollo completes a given step. If the wait time is 3 days, the next step fires on the third day after the day of the completed step.
5.  Click **Continue**.

You have now updated the wait time between steps in a sequence.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

When you [create a sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409231193101-Create-a-Sequence) and [add contacts to it](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396985741-Add-Contacts-to-a-Sequence), you need to consider which mailbox you want to use to reach your **contacts**. By default, this could be the mailbox you linked directly to your user name, but there may be instances when you need to change this to another mailbox linked to your account.

There are many locations in the platform where you can change your **linked mailbox**:

*   The "Contacts" page
*   Individual Contact records
*   The "Emails" tab in a **sequence**
*   The "Emails" tab in the **Engage** section

The sections below highlight 3 of the easiest ways to update which mailbox you use to email **contacts** from Apollo.

Change a Linked Mailbox

Please note, you can update a **linked mailbox** at any time. The mailbox you link is not permanent.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Add Contacts to a Sequence and Select a Linked Mailbox[](#toc_2)

You can select a **linked mailbox** when you add a **contact** to a **sequence**. Launch Apollo, hover your mouse over **Search** in the navbar, and then click **People**.

[![People Search](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i1.png)

Add filters to your search to find the right people for the **sequence**.

[![Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i14.png)

Use the checkbox to select the **contact(s)**.

[![Select Contact](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i15.png)

Click the **Sequence** drop-down.

[![Add to Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i16.png)

Then click **Add to Sequence**.

[![Add to Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i4.png)

Next, click the **Sequence** drop-down in the **Add to Sequence** modal and select the **sequence** to which you would like to add the **contact(s)**.

[![Drop-down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i18.png)

Click **View all sequences** if you want to open a new tab to review all your options from the **Sequences** page.

[![View all sequences button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i31.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i31.png)

Click the **Send Emails From:** drop-down and click the email address you would like to use to email the newly added **contacts**.

[![Adding a contact](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i19.png)

Then, click **Add now** to immediately add your **contact(s)** to the **sequence** with the selected mailbox.

[![Linked Mailbox](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i20.png)

If you don't want to add the **contact(s)** to the **sequence** right away, you can schedule when Apollo adds them. First, click **Schedule**.

[![Schedule button in add to sequence modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i32.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i32.png)

Then, click the radio button next to your preferred scheduled time or manually select a custom date and time for which you want Apollo to add the **contacts** to the **sequence**.

[![Schedule radio buttons in schedule add to sequence modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i33.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i33.png)

Click **Schedule**.

[![Schedule button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i34.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i34.png)

You have now added **contact(s)** to a **sequence** and selected a **linked mailbox**.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Update the Linked Mailbox for a Contact in a Sequence[](#toc_3)

Once you add **contacts** to a **sequence**, you can change the **linked mailbox** at any time.

Launch Apollo, hover your mouse over **Engage** in the navbar, and then click **Sequences**.

[![Sequences](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i8.png)

Click the **Sequence** for which you want to edit a **contact's** **linked mailbox**.

[![Choose Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i9.png)

Click **Contacts** to display the **sequence contacts** list.

[![Contacts](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i10.png)

Click the checkbox next to a **contact** or **contacts** to select them.

[![Check-boxes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i11.png)

Click **...** and then click **Email From Different User**.

[![Email From Different User](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i21.png)

In the modal, use the **In the current sequence, send emails from:** drop-down to select a linked email address.

[![Select Address](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i22.png)

When you're finished, click **Save**.

[![Change Email](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i23.png)

## Update the Linked Mailbox for Any Email[](#toc_4)

Once you have sent an email, you can choose to re-send from a different user or to update the sender for all subsequent sequence steps.

Launch Apollo, click **Engage**, and then click the **Emails** tab.

[![Engage-Emails](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i24.png)

Click the **If a scheduled email is in an active sequence, would you like to change the send from email for subsequent steps as well?** drop-down.

Then, select **Email from different user for subsequent steps in sequence as well** if you want to change the linked mailbox for the selected contact(s) for all remaining steps in the sequence.

[![Subsequent Steps Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i28.png)

Alternatively, click **Only email from different user for the selected emails** if you want to change the linked mailbox for the selected emails only.

[![Only Selected Emails Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i29.png)

Click **Email from Different User**.

[![Email for Different User Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/linked_mailbox_in_a_sequence/i30.png)

Choose Your Mailbox Wisely, Folks!

Have you selected a Microsoft Exchange mailbox that you did not create in your name? If so, please note that when you send an email the name of the mailbox owner may appear as the sender in the recipient’s inbox. If you want to continue using this mailbox, consider adjusting your Microsoft Exchange settings first. Please refer to the [Manage User Mailboxes](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/recipients-in-exchange-online/manage-user-mailboxes/manage-user-mailboxes) article in the Microsoft Knowledge Base for more information about user settings. Alternatively, select a Microsoft Exchange mailbox that you created in your name or use any other connected mailbox from a [supported email service provider](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409140697101-Supported-Email-Service-Providers-ESPs-). Apollo recommends sending your emails from a Gmail mailbox to get the most out of Apollo’s functionality.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

If you send a message to a **contact** that has set up an out-of-office auto-reply, Apollo pauses the **contact** in the **sequence**. Apollo can auto-resume messaging a **contact** in a **sequence** if a contact specifies the return date in the out-of-office response. If Apollo cannot detect a return date, you can manually resume messaging a paused **contact**.

Multilingual Algorithms!

Please note, Apollo's detection algorithms currently detect auto-response messages in English, Spanish, French, German, Portuguese, Swedish, and Dutch. Refer to the "Out-of-Office Detection Logic" section below for more details.

Refer to the sections below for more information about how to view the different types of paused **contacts** in a sequence and how to know which **contacts** you need to manually resume.

[Back to Top](#top)

## View Paused Contacts[](#toc_2)

To identify whether Apollo has paused a **contact** in a **sequence**, launch Apollo, click **Engage**, and then click **Sequences**.

[![Sequences](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i1.png)

Click the **Sequence** that you want to review.

[![Open Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i2.png)

Click **Contacts** and then click the **Filters** icon on the left to display the available filters.

[![Contacts Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i5.png)

To filter for all your **paused contacts** in sequences, expand the **Sequence Status Accordion** and then click **Paused**. Click the **Auto resume date scheduled** or **Auto resume date not scheduled** checkboxes to filter further.

[![Paused Contacts Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i3.png)

Hover your mouse over the "Paused" **sequence status** next to a **contact** for more details such as when a message will auto-resume.

[![Paused Status](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i4.png)

Contacts Got Stage Fright?

For more information about the different contact stages, please refer to [this section](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409233647373-Sequence-Statistics-Overview#toc_2) of the "Sequence Statistics Overview" article.

[Back to Top](#top)

## View Auto-Resume Contacts in a Sequence[](#toc_3)

If Apollo detects that a **contact** has stated their return to office date in their auto-response, Apollo automatically resumes the **contact** in the **sequence** when they are scheduled to return to work.

To identify an auto-resume date, launch Apollo, click **Engage**, and then click **Sequences**.

[![Sequences](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i1.png)

[![Contacts Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/out_of_office_reply/i5.png)

Expand the **Sequence Status Accordion** and click the **Auto resume date scheduled** checkbox.

To identify which **contacts** do not have an auto-resume date, launch Apollo, click **Engage**, and then click **Sequences**.

## Out-of-Office Detection Logic[](#toc_5)

Apollo detection algorithms are multi-lingual, statistic-oriented, and always evolving. When the Apollo detection algorithms identify an Out-Of-Office message, Apollo pauses the **contact** and does not count this message as "Replied." However, if you notice an Out-of-Office auto-response that falls through the cracks, please share the message with the [Apollo Support Team](mailto: support@apollo.io). Alternatively, you can [Submit a Request](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/requests/new) with your feedback.

The Language Lord!

Apollo detection algorithms may be multi-lingual, but they still have lots to learn! Please make sure that any messages you share are in one of the following languages:

*   English
*   Spanish
*   French
*   German
*   Portuguese
*   Swedish
*   Dutch

## Read the Doc[](#toc_2)

### Overview[](#toc_3)

You can add contacts to new or existing [sequences](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences) at any time. If a sequence is active when you add a contact to it, Apollo enrolls them in the first step according to the [sequence sending schedule](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409477927309-Create-and-Edit-Sequence-Sending-Schedules).

There are several ways to add contacts to your sequences:

*   From the [search page](https://app.apollo.io/#/people).
*   Upload a [CSV file](https://app.apollo.io/#/contacts/import).
*   Select contacts from a list.

One Trip Per Contact!

Please note that each contact you enroll only gets one trip through each sequence step. Apollo tracks a contact's progress within the sequence to avoid sending duplicate messaging. If you need a contact to repeat the same sequence steps, clone the original sequence and add the contact to it.

[![Clone sequence button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_to_sequences/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_to_sequences/i28.png)

Refer to the sections below for more info on how to add contacts to your sequences.

[Back to Top](#top)

So Many Options!

Please note, you can add contacts to a sequence using the Apollo search tool from a sequence or directly from a search. The steps remain the same. We just like to give you options.

To add contacts to a sequence from the Search screen:

5.  Add filters to your search to find the right people for your sequence. [![Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_to_sequences/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_to_sequences/i5.png)

## Why Do I See a Warning Message?[](#toc_7)

Apollo sends you a warning message if any of the contacts you want to add:

*   Are already part of another sequence
*   Have unverified email addresses
*   Have out-of-date information, for example, if a contact has recently changed jobs
*   Don't have an email address

You also see a warning message when you do not have ownership permission for a contact that you try to add to a sequence. If you are an admin, [click here](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5631686093069-Edit-a-Contact-or-Account-Owner) for more info on how to edit ownership or [here](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409154208269-Create-Permission-Profiles#toc_7) to update ownership permissions

Click the **X** if you decide not to add any of the contacts to the current sequence.

[![Click X](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_to_sequences/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_to_sequences/i22.png)

If you still want to add some of the contacts to the sequence, click the checkbox(es) and then click **Sequence Contacts**. If you do not click the checkbox(es), Apollo excludes the contacts in the warning modal when adding the contacts to the sequence.

[![Select List](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_to_sequences/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_to_sequences/i21.png)

Apollo **Sequences** allow you to reach out to your customers at scale. That means you may contact hundreds—or even thousands—of people at the same time. With that kind of volume, it is possible that you may accidentally add the same contact to multiple **Sequences**.

What's All This Sequence Mumbo-Jumbo?

Did you get a little ahead of yourself? If you stumbled upon this article and you're not sure what a **Sequence** is or how to add **Contacts** to one, you may want to check out the "[Sequences Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview)" and "[Add Contacts to a Sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396985741-Add-Contacts-to-a-Sequence)" articles for more information about how to get started.

Apollo has a few safeguards in place in the event that you attempt to add **Contacts** to a **Sequence** when they are already included in one or more other **Sequences**. When you add a **Contact** to a **Sequence**, Apollo checks for the following criteria:

*   Is the **Contact** included in any sequence with an **Active**, **Paused**, or **Failed** status?
*   Is the **Contact** included in any **Sequence** with a **Finished** status?
*   Has the **Contact** recently changed jobs?
*   Does the **Contact** include a non-verified email address?
    
    [![Warning Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/avoid_contacts_in_multiple_sequences/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/avoid_contacts_in_multiple_sequences/i1.png)
    

If Apollo displays the modal above when you add a **Contact** or **Contacts** to a **Sequence**, you have 3 options:

1.  **Do Nothing**: You can choose to ignore these warnings and click **Sequence Contacts**. This will omit any of the **Contacts** that are included in warnings in this modal and ensure that they are not added to the current **Sequence**.
2.  **Review Each Warning**: You can also expand the accordion for each warning and click the checkbox next to individual **Contacts**. Apollo adds any **Contacts** that you check to the **Sequence**, even if they exist in other **Sequences**.
3.  **Include All Contacts**: You can choose to include all of the **Contacts** in each warning category by clicking the checkbox next to it.

Wait—Did I Do Something Wrong?

There are often real business reasons to add a **Contact** to multiple **Sequences** at the same time. Take a deep breath—this modal is intended to provide a warning and should not deter you from adding **Contacts** to multiple **Sequences** when you need to.

Sometimes you need to include a table in your emails. There are 2 ways to create tables: ## HTML[](#toc_1) To create a simple table in HTML, you can use this formatting as your basis: ```
Add Column Title Here   Add Column Title Here   Add Column Title Here  
Add Info for Row 1, Column 1 Here Add Info Row 1, Column 2 Here Add Info Row 1, Column 3 Here
Add Info for Row 2, Column 1 Here Add Info Row 2, Column 2 Here Add Info Row 2, Column 3 Here
``` Click the **Edit Raw HTML** button in the email template that you want to include the table in. [![Edit HTML](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_tables_in_email/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_tables_in_email/i1.png) Paste and edit your **table HTML code**. [![HTML Code](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_tables_in_email/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_tables_in_email/i2.png) Your **table** renders in real-time in the **preview pane**. [![Preview](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_tables_in_email/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_tables_in_email/i3.png) [Back to Top](#top) ## As an Image[](#toc_2) Alternatively, you can add an existing table as an image. Click the **Upload Image** button in the email template that you want to include the table in. [![Upload Image](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_tables_in_email/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_tables_in_email/i4.png) Choose an image to upload from your computer. Apollo inserts the image into the **body** and renders it in the **preview pane**. ## Overview[](#toc_1)

In Beta

We're still building inbox ramp-up. While this feature is in beta, some functionality may change.

Apollo recommends inbox ramp-up if you already have an established email domain and have had a strong sender reputation for at least 1 year, but are newly connecting the domain to Apollo.

Inbox ramp-up improves email deliverability by increasing email volume naturally over time across the automated emails and [sequences](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview) associated with a mailbox, so your messages reach contacts more effectively. This aligns your inbox behavior with mailbox provider standards and reduces the risk of providers identifying your email as junk or spam.

Check out the following sections to get started with inbox ramp-up.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Use Inbox Ramp-up[](#toc_2)

To use inbox ramp-up on one or more mailboxes, you first need to [link your mailboxes](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409127806093-Link-Your-Mailbox-to-Apollo-io) in Apollo.

Once you set up your mailbox:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Mailboxes**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/account/mailboxes).
2.  Review your linked mailboxes.

[![An example mailbox is shown with setup progress and quick metrics](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/email_warmup/i0.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/email_warmup/i0.png)

3.  Next, click **...** beside your mailbox, then click **Start warm up**.

[![The ellipsis button is clicked with the Start warm-up option highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/email_warmup/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/email_warmup/i1.png)

4.  Click **Start warm up** to confirm.

[![The Start warm-up button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/email_warmup/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/email_warmup/i2.png)

5.  Apollo shares the estimated completion date for the inbox ramp-up.
    

Slow Down to Speed Up

It can take around 2 weeks for inbox ramp-up to complete. During this time, expect a delay in some of the emails in your sequences.

You have now enabled inbox ramp-up.

Next, [create sequences with automated email steps](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409231193101-Create-a-Sequence) using this mailbox. Inbox ramp-up will gradually increase email volume naturally over time across the automated emails. You can [check the status](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/26772718460045#toc3) of inbox ramp-up at any time, or stop ramp-up if necessary.

If you made a mistake and need to stop inbox ramp-up, navigate to **Settings** > [**Mailboxes**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/account/mailboxes), then click **...** beside your mailbox > **Stop warm up**.

[![The stop warm-up button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/email_warmup/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/email_warmup/i5.png)

Click **Stop warm up** to confirm. You can start the ramp-up again later.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

It Depends on Your Plan

Open tracking is only available on certain plans. For a breakdown of the features available in each Apollo plan, please refer to [the pricing page](https://www.apollo.io/pricing#compare). If you want to upgrade your plan to access open tracking, please reach out to the friendly [Apollo sales team](https://apollo.na.chilipiper.com/router/sales_router?leadsource=Inbound&lead_source_details__c=KnowledgeBase) for further assistance.

Email tracking systems, which inform you when your emails are opened, use a 1-pixel image called a tracking pixel to obtain interaction data. Each tracking pixel contains individualized code to attribute to the recipient and to the email that they receive. Additionally, if the recipient downloads the image, Apollo also logs it as an email open event.

Pixel Tracking Image URL

Apollo's tracking pixel is hosted on Heroku, so that pixel displays as a Heroku URL.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Open Tracking Considerations[](#toc_2)

Sometimes, email tracking systems mark an email as opened when they are not actually opened. The following scenarios cause false positives:

*   In Outlook, the recipient can view the email from the preview pane.
    *   This causes the tracking pixel to download even though they didn't actually click on the email. 
*   The email recipient has a Google or G Suite address
    *   As Google always proxies every link in an email, they may visit the link as a test. This can trigger an open event without the recipient ever reading the email. It is not a guaranteed outcome, but it is possible.
*   On mobile, the Gmail app displays the email on a preview screen.
    *   This sometimes triggers an email open event without the user seeing more than just the subject and first few words.

On the other hand, false negatives are also possible. This occurs when a contact opened your email and the tracking pixel was not downloaded so it did not trigger an open event. If your contact has set their email to not download images automatically, you may get incomplete data.

The easiest way to combat this and improve your open data is to include a clickable link in your email. This ensures that anyone who clicked your link opened and read your message.

Try Turning it Off and On Again!

Please note, if you make changes to an active sequence, you need to turn it off and then on again to activate the changes.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Enhance Open Rates with A/B Testing[](#toc_3)

A/B Testing helps to increase your open rates. By sending multiple versions of the same email, you can analyze the data to discover which version the recipients find most engaging. Use this data to tweak your messaging and enhance your open rates.

Read [Add an A/B Test to an Email Step in a Sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410749683597) for more information.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Low Open Rate Concerns[](#toc_4)

More often than not, low open rates for your emails are the direct result of bad deliverability and issues with your domain's reputation.

Some email providers may report emails as successfully delivered, but instead, move them to a contact's SPAM folder. That means a contact never actually viewed or opened the email. If a contact doesn't view your email, open rates remain low.

To help avoid emails blocked by SPAM filters, please see the [Avoid SPAM Filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409225311885) article to review Apollo's suggestions for improving your domain's reputation.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Emails are a powerful engagement tool. With the right messages, you can build and strengthen relationships with your customers. However, writing emails is a time-consuming business! With the Apollo AI writing assistant, create and send effective messaging to your contacts at scale to maximize your productivity and outreach.

Apollo AI generates subject lines, copy, and personalized openers for your emails. Additionally, Apollo analyzes your emails against millions of successful exchanges to provide you with the latest email best practices, actionable tips to improve your subject lines and email copy, and scores.

Apollo Keeps Data Private

Apollo takes data privacy seriously, and this includes any content generated using AI capabilities. If you have questions about data privacy, please read [Apollo's AI policy](https://www.apollo.io/ai-policy). You can also [email us](mailto:privacy@apollo.io) with any data privacy concerns.

Refer to the following sections to learn how to write and improve your emails using AI-generated content and analysis.

## Use Personalized Email Openers[](#toc_5)

Personalization is a key component of [successful email messaging](https://www.apollo.io/files/cold-email-deliverability-checklist.pdf). When you enable AI-generated personalized openers for emails, Apollo tailors the opener of each message to the specific events or information most relevant to each contact. This helps grab their attention, build rapport, and increase the likelihood of a response while significantly reducing your research time.

Depending on the data available for a contact, there are several types of personalized openers that Apollo generates, including:

*   **Company mission**: Speak to contacts on their level with openers tailored to their core company goals and values.
*   **Current role**: Meet contacts where they are at with openers that relate to their current position within a company.
*   **Upcoming anniversary**: Build rapport by anticipating upcoming milestones.
*   **Job focus**: Tailor the start of your message to the specific areas that contacts care most about.
*   **Solution focus**: Focus on resolving your recipient's pain points.
*   **Work history**: Mention your recipient's past work experience.
*   **Work anniversary**: Show you've done your research with timely openers that touch on a recent anniversary.

If you've [set up signals](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/13152837789837), Apollo also generates signal-based openers for individual emails.

The following tabs walk through how to generate and use personalized openers for both individual emails and emails in a sequence.

To add personalized openers to an individual email, click **Generate** > **Email opener**. [![Generate personalized openers for the contact.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the__ai_writing_assistant_in_your_emails/i77.png) ](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the__ai_writing_assistant_in_your_emails/i77.png)Find the opener that you want to use, then click the **copy** icon and paste the text into your email. [![Copy and paste a opener.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the__ai_writing_assistant_in_your_emails/i78.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the__ai_writing_assistant_in_your_emails/i78.png)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Email is a powerful sales tool. When done correctly, sales emails can help you raise awareness, build rapport and convert qualified leads into sales opportunities at scale. There are several best practices you can follow to increase your email conversion rates.

Refer to the steps below to learn how to write effective sales emails.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Understand the Pain Points of Your Target Audience[](#toc_2)

Every 60 seconds, around [197.6 million emails](https://www.allaccess.com/assets/img/content/merge/2021/m-4-13-pic2.jpg) are sent. Before you write a sales email, ask yourself 3 important questions:

*   What challenges are your ideal customers facing?
*   How can you help them overcome their biggest challenges?
*   Why should they care about what you have to say?

You need to speak in your ideal customer's language, focus each email on one of their biggest needs or concerns, and ensure you provide content of value. Make sure you answer relevant questions in the content of your emails. Your readers need to be able to identify the reason for your email right away.

Turn generic terms, such as "better" and "faster" into specific outcomes, such as "our company can increase sales by 20%." The more relevant, specific, and quantifiable your statements are, the more impactful your messages will be.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Make It Personal[](#toc_3)

It is only when you fully understand the needs and concerns of your ideal customers that you can personalize your emails effectively. Before you write a single message, you first need to segment your customers into smaller groups that share the same key characteristics and challenges.

Follow the recommendations below to reach the right audience, with the right message, at the right time:

*   Set the goals for your campaign(s) and decide the parameters by which you will segment your ideal customers.
    
*   Use [Search Filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview) when prospecting to find the specific contacts and accounts that fit your criteria for a certain campaign.
    
*   Create your key [Buyer Personas](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409500253837-Create-a-Persona), identify their defining characteristics and determine their biggest pain points. This information should frame the content of the emails in every sequence.
    
*   [Build Lists](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409728608525-Create-and-Edit-a-Contact-or-Company-List) to segment your target contacts and accounts into the appropriate categories.
    
*   [Create Sequences](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409231193101-Create-a-Sequence) with highly targeted messaging that speaks directly to each of your buyer persona's specific needs.
    
*   Use [Sequence Statistics](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409233647373-Sequence-Statistics-Overview) to analyze and refine your segmentation tactics and further personalize your approach.
    

When you are ready to write your emails, let your audience know that you see and hear them. Speak to their needs by making your messages relatable, personalized, and clear.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create Intrigue in the Subject Line[](#toc_4)

Subject lines hold the key to high open rates. Keep it short, create intrigue, and make it personal.

*   **Length**: Try to capture your message in as few words as possible. Between 10 and 60 characters is ideal.
*   **Intrigue**: Leave your reader wanting more. Relate to their key interests or concerns, offer value, and create a fear of loss.
*   **Personalization**: Avoid generic terms and phrases. Instead, use {{company}} snippets to personalize your approach and give your emails a more human touch.

Subject Line Taboo

Although personalization is important, try to stay away from first name snippets in the subject line. While {{company}} name snippets tend to increase open rates, email servers often flag as SPAM any subject lines that include {{first\_name}} snippets.

Here are some examples of effective subject lines:

*   Idea for {{company}}
*   {{company}} + \[Your Company Name\]
*   How competitive is {{company}}’s _Sales_ team?
*   10x {{company}}’s traction in 10 minutes
*   Question about _Employee Loyalty_ at {{company}}

A/B Test with Apollo

Please note, every industry, niche, and target audience is different. Follow best practices as a starting point, but make sure you [A/B Test](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410749683597-Add-an-A-B-Test-to-an-Email-Step-in-a-Sequence) your subject lines to improve your open rates and uncover what works best for your specific niche.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Keep it Simple and Concise[](#toc_5)

Attention spans are short so be concise and get straight to the point. Your ideal customers are not interested in your life story. They want to know why your message is beneficial to them. If they don't see value immediately, your email will end up in the trash folder. So keep to one focal point per email and make your message digestible.

Simplicity is also key in sales emails. You need to strike a balance between approachable, casual, and informative. Don't overcomplicate or provide too much detail. Keep your emails clean, concise, and conversational. Avoid bullet points and heavy punctuation, make your point clear, and provide just enough value to spark their interest and leave them wanting more.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Include A Powerful CTA[](#toc_6)

A CTA (Call-to-Action) is a question, link, or button that draws immediate attention to the offer or focus of your email and encourages the reader to take action.

CTAs should be easy to spot, action-oriented, thoughtful, and persuasive.

Follow the tactics below to engage with your readers and encourage a response:

*   Mention a specific time or date to make it easier for your contact to commit to a meeting. For example:

Are you available for a call on {{now\_weekday->plus\_1}} 
or {{now\_weekday->plus\_2}}?"

Can you touch base on a call this week?

Let's talk. How does this {{now\_weekday->plus\_1}} work 
for you, {{first\_name}}?

*   Be polite but persistent:

Have you given any thought to my last email, 
{{first\_name}}?

Are you still the best person to talk to about 
\[topic\]? If not, who would you recommend I speak to?

What are your thoughts about the proposal?

*   Be helpful:

Do you have any questions at all?

Want me to run you through your options?

Does it still make sense for us to sync up?

*   Give context:

Can I share a \[short video\] about 
\[overcoming related pain point\], {{first\_name}}?

[Click here](https://www.apollo.io/) to discover, engage, and convert your ideal 
customers.

Got 15 minutes to talk about \[topic\]?

*   Add Urgency:

Sign up now.

How much time does it currently take your team to do 
\[X task\]?

Reply by EOW to receive your discount.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Add Multiple Touchpoints[](#toc_7)

Every point of contact that you make in a campaign is a touchpoint. This refers to email, LinkedIn, call, voicemail, SMS, etc. The ideal number of touchpoints that you should make per contact in any given campaign will vary depending on the type of buyer personas, the stage they are in the sales cycle, and the specific industries with which you engage.

No matter the circumstances, don't give up after the first hurdle. You need to nurture your prospects, provide valuable content, and have confidence in your approach. Remember the reason why you are contacting your ideal customers and the value that your product or services can bring to them.

Touch Points

On average, 5-8 touches is a good place to start—provided you segment your leads correctly and share a clear, valuable message with every touch. Don't forget to A/B Test though. Analyzing the data will help you to find the ideal number of touchpoints for each specific campaign you run.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Learn When And How To Link[](#toc_8)

In an outbound campaign, you start as a stranger to those whom you are contacting. You need to build trust and prove that your message is worth the readers' time before you can expect them to click on any content you send.

If you want your readers to open the links you share, provide context and entice them. Use short, action-oriented CTAs and give them a rough idea of what they will gain from clicking. Refer to the example below:

[Click here](https://www.apollo.io/customers/coder/) to find out how Coder achieved a 50x ROI 
within one month using Apollo.

Avoid SPAM

Please note, you should keep the number of links down to 1 or 2 maximum per email or your bounce rate may rise. In the first touch email, it's very important to avoid sending any links, attachments, or images as the recipient's server is more likely to flag you as SPAM.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Avoid SPAM Triggers in Your Email Content[](#toc_9)

To improve delivery rates and avoid email servers flagging your sales emails as SPAM, there are several content best practices that you can follow:

*   Try not to over-promise or sensationalize the information in your emails. Avoid words and phrases such as cost, payment, earn, buy direct, and make money.

SPAM Trigger Words

For a more detailed list of words and phrases to avoid in your emails, refer to this [HubSpot Article](https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/30684/the-ultimate-list-of-email-spam-trigger-words.aspx).

*   Remove unnecessary links from the body of your email and your signature. It's especially important to avoid links in a first-touch email.
    
*   Do not include images or attachments in the body of your email unless it is 100% necessary. Again, this is especially important in first-touch emails.
    
*   Keep your paragraphs concise. Long content can activate SPAM blockers.
    
*   A/B test your messaging to discover which versions of your emails have the lowest bounce rate.
    

Avoid SPAM Filters

Please refer to the [Avoid SPAM Filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409225311885-Avoid-SPAM-Filters) article for a more comprehensive look at how to improve the delivery rates for the emails that you send through Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## A/B Test[](#toc_10)

What works for others may not work for you and your target audience. The best way to determine the most effective sales messaging for your campaigns is to let the data do the talking. A/B Testing allows you to test multiple messages in a sequence step. With more than one email template per step, you can analyze and leverage the data to tweak your messaging and improve the effectiveness of future emails.

[Back to top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

When done correctly, outbound email is an effective way to engage with new prospects. It can help grow your business and expand your audience reach.

Experimentation is an important aspect of a successful, fully optimized outbound campaign. Be prepared to [A/B test](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410749683597) different messaging styles to find what works best for your target audiences.

Modify the Templates to Fit Your Needs

Customization is key to ensuring your outbound emails are a success. Remember to keep your target audience, your company voice, and your main goals in mind when you modify the templates below to meet the needs of a specific campaign.

Use the following templates as a base to craft effective outbound emails.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Before You Start: Follow Outbound Email Best Practices[](#toc_1)

Even the best crafted emails run the risk of landing in a prospect's spam folder. So, before using these templates, ensure that you understand and follow best practices to [avoid spam filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410749683597).

Also, when you're ready to revamp your company's outbound sales process, Apollo Academy's free course [Building a World-Class Outbound Program](https://www.apollo.io/academy/building-a-world-class-outbound-program) teaches you how to establish targeting frameworks, build effective sequences, and automate your outbound processes.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Initial Contact Templates[](#toc_2)

Each of these templates features [basic dynamic variables](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409415084813) and [advanced dynamic variables](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409735256845) to automatically pull in relevant information from a contact's profile. The templates also include blanks to indicate where you should add additional personalization details.

While these templates are a good starting point, you should refine and customize them to best fit your goals and personalize them to each of your prospect's needs.

### Sample 1:[](#toc_3)

**Subject:** `{{company}}` <> \[Your Company Name\]

Hi {{first\_name}},

My name is \_\_\_\_\_ from \_\_\_\_\_.

We help {{industry}} companies with \_\_\_\_\_\_\_. I wanted to learn about how you handle \_\_\_\_\_\_ at {{company}} and show you what we're working on.

Are you available for a brief call on {{now\_weekday->plus\_1}} or {{now\_weekday->plus\_2}} this week?

### Sample 2:[](#toc_4)

**Subject:** `{{company}}` <> \[Your Company Name\]

Hi {{first\_name}},

I’m trying to figure out who is in charge of {{vertical}} at {{company}}.

Would you mind pointing me towards the right person and letting me know the best way to get in touch with them?

Thank you!

### Sample 3:[](#toc_5)

**Subject:** How to \[insert value prop pitch\]

{{first\_name}},

I’d like to discuss your \_\_\_\_\_\_\_. 

We’re helping other {{industry}} companies collect their prospects straight from professional social networks and import them directly into their CRMs (while enriching them with phone numbers and email addresses).

Quick question: can you put me in touch with whoever is responsible for {{vertical}} at {{company}}?

### Sample 4:[](#toc_6)

**Subject:** `{{company}}` + \[Your Company Name\]

Hi {{first\_name}}, 

My name is \_\_\_ and I’m a \_\_\_ at \_\_\_. We help {{title->plural}} ramp up their {{vertical}} efforts in minutes at companies like {{#if industry == industry marketing}}Sparks, Jumpshot, and Deepcrawl{{#else}} Segment, TalentBin, Sprig, and Poppin.{{#endif}} 

I wanted to learn about how you currently handle outbound sales and also show you what we’re working on.

Are you available for a quick call {{now\_weekday->plus\_1}} or {{now\_weekday->plus\_2}}?

### Sample 5:[](#toc_7)

**Subject:** Sales idea for `{{company}}`

Hello {{first\_name}},

What would it mean to your top-line revenue if you saw a 70% increase in contact rates, a 50% improvement in closes, and a 40% increase in quota-hitting sales reps?

Let’s find a few minutes to talk about how {{company}} provides these results to our clients.

I’m available in the {{now\_time\_of\_day}} on {{now\_weekday->plus\_1}} or {{now\_weekday->plus\_2}}. Can we sync up?

### Sample 6:[](#toc_8)

**Subject:** \[Your company/product's core value proposition\]

Hi {{first\_name}},

I hope this message finds you well.

I work for a company called \_\_\_\_\_ that specializes in {{vertical}} solutions. Considering your role at {{company}}, I thought we might be a good fit for your group.

At \_\_\_\_\_\_, we have garnered a lot of attention and I think it’s something that your organization might see immediate value in.

Can you help me get in contact with the right decision-maker?

[Back to Top](#top)

## Follow-Up Templates[](#toc_9)

### Sample 1:[](#toc_10)

**Subject:** RE: \_\_\_\_\_

Hi {{first\_name}},

I just wanted to circle back on my email below _re: Getting you a comments widget for your site._ 

Are you free for a quick call on {{now\_weekday->plus\_1}} or {{now\_weekday->plus\_2}}? 

Across our partners' websites, we’re seeing an average increase of 1 minute on site with the addition of our widget.

### Sample 2:[](#toc_11)

**Subject:** RE: \_\_\_\_\_

Hi {{first\_name}},

I didn’t hear back from you last week when I was looking for the appropriate person managing \_\_\_\_\_\_ at {{company}}.

That’s not a problem. If it makes sense to talk, please let me know what your schedule looks like this week. If not, who is the appropriate person to speak with?

### Sample 3:[](#toc_12)

**Subject:** RE: \_\_\_\_\_

{{first\_name}},

I’m hoping you can help me. 

Who handles the _\[insert pain point here\]_ decisions at {{company}} and how might I get in touch with them?

### Sample 4:[](#toc_13)

**Subject:** \[Competitor X and Competitor Y\]

Hi {{first\_name}},

Just wanted to send you an example of how we’re working with {{#if industry == industry sales}}_Competitor Name, and Competitor Name_ {{#else}} Competitor Name and Competitor Name{{#endif}} to deliver \_\_\_\_\_. 

Check it out here _\[link to example\]_.

So far, feedback has been extremely positive. Would love to get you up and running—do you have a few minutes to chat this week?

### Sample 5:[](#toc_14)

**Subject:** How we can help `{{company}}`

{{first\_name}},

We have a service that will help you _\[insert quick one-liner about the value your service delivers\]._ We've helped similar businesses achieve \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_.

What’s the best day/time this week or next for a quick 15-minute conversation?

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

You can send emails [manually](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/15396174946445-Use-the-AI-Writing-Assistant-in-Your-Emails#toc_3), through [sequences](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview), or in [plays](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/14296116597901-Plays-Overview). If you're having issues with email delivery, a few troubleshooting steps can help.

Several factors can impact whether emails sent in Apollo arrive in a contact's inbox. In general, Apollo characterizes email delivery issues into 3 main groups:

*   [Apollo hasn't scheduled or delivered any of your emails.](#toc_2)
*   [Apollo sent your emails, but they failed to deliver.](#toc_7)
*   [Apollo hasn't attempted to send your emails.](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5403737512589-Why-Didn-t-My-Email-Send#toc_10)

Refer to the following sections to learn how to resolve email delivery issues.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Apollo Hasn't Scheduled or Delivered Any of Your Emails[](#toc_2)

If you added contacts to a sequence, but Apollo hasn't scheduled or delivered any of your emails, there are 3 possible causes:

*   [You haven't activated the sequence.](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5403737512589-Why-Didn-t-My-Email-Send#toc_3)
*   [You haven't activated the steps in the sequence.](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5403737512589-Why-Didn-t-My-Email-Send#toc_4)
*   [You need to update the wait time between steps.](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5403737512589-Why-Didn-t-My-Email-Send#toc_5)
*   [A sequence email requires manual review.](#toc_6)

### Activate Sequence[](#toc_3)

Ensure you activated the sequence associated with the email you expected to send. To activate your sequence:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Toggle the sequence on. [![Example sequences are toggled on](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i1.png)

### Activate the Sequence Steps[](#toc_4)

Ensure you activated the sequence step associated with the email you expected to send. To activate sequence steps:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click the sequence that you need to review.
3.  Toggle the sequence steps on. [![Example sequence steps are toggled on](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i2.png)

### Verify Wait Time Between Steps[](#toc_5)

Check the wait time between each sequence step associated with the email you expected to send. To verify wait time:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click the sequence that you need to review.
3.  Check the wait time shown to the right of each step. Apollo won't send your contacts any emails until this time has passed. [![An example wait time is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i3.png)
4.  To edit the wait time, click \[**. . .**\] > **Edit**. [![The ellipsis button is clicked with Edit highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i4.png)
5.  Use the **When to start this step** option to adjust the wait time between steps. [![The when to start wait time is highlighted with 1 hour set](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i5.png)
6.  When finished, click **Continue**.

### An Email Requires Manual Review[](#toc_6)

If you configure a manual email step in a sequence, the email won't send automatically. You need to send the email manually:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click the sequence that you need to review.
3.  Click **Tasks**. [![The Task tab is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i6.png)
4.  Then click the **Email**. [![An example email is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i7.png)
5.  Personalize the email for the contact, then click **Schedule**. Choose whether to send the email immediately or schedule delivery for later.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Apollo Sent Your Emails, But They Failed to Deliver[](#toc_7)

If Apollo sent your emails but they failed to deliver, use [deliverability scoring](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/23432467200781-Improve-Your-Email-Deliverability#toc_1)) to confirm your mailbox's deliverability rating. If your deliverability scores are good, there are 3 possible causes for email delivery issues:

*   [The email bounced.](#toc_8)
*   [The emails haven't been sent.](#toc_9)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Bounced Emails[](#toc_8)

If an email bounces, it means that the recipient's email address no longer exists or there's an error in the recipient's information. When this happens, the email is returned and the email status is updated to _Bounced_.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Not Sent[](#toc_9)

If you tried the troubleshooting steps in this article, but you're still having issues with emails not delivering, check out the following table for possible solutions:

| Reason | Explanation | Solution |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Blocked Contact Stage | When you create a sequence, you have the option to mark emails as `Not Sent` when a contact is in a selected contact stage through a [sequence ruleset](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396858509-Create-Sequence-Rulesets). If you then try to send an email to a contact in one of the selected stages, Apollo won't send the email. | You can change the stage of a contact that you want to email, or you can change the settings in the [sequence ruleset](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396858509-Create-Sequence-Rulesets) so that Apollo no longer blocks emails to contacts in the stage. After making this change, try sending the email again. |
| Blocked Account Stage | When you create a sequence, you have the option to mark emails as `Not Sent` when an account is in a selected account stage through a [sequence ruleset](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396858509-Create-Sequence-Rulesets). If you try to send an email to an account that is in one of the selected stages, Apollo won't send the email. | You can change the stage of a specific account that you want to email, or you can change the settings in the [sequence ruleset](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396858509-Create-Sequence-Rulesets) so that Apollo no longer blocks emails to any accounts in the stage. After making this change, try sending the email again. |
| Same Account Replied | If you set a sequence rule not to send when another contact from the same account replies in any sequence, Apollo won't send the email. | Update the settings in the [sequence ruleset](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396858509-Create-Sequence-Rulesets), then send the email again. |
| Unverified Email | If it's your first time sending an email to a contact with an unverified email, Apollo won't send the email as a failsafe. | Unverified emails have a 60-80% success rate. Try sending the email again. |
| Missing Snippet | If you include [snippets](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/11509551262093-Create-and-Edit-Snippets) in a message and the contact you want to email doesn't have a value for the snippet, Apollo won't send the email. | Edit the contact's profile to add a value for the missing field. Alternatively, change the [snippet](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/11509551262093-Create-and-Edit-Snippets) to an [advanced snippet](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409735256845-Use-Advanced-Snippets) and add a fallback for this type of scenario. |
| Missing Dynamic Variable | If you used [dynamic variables](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409415084813-Use-Basic-Dynamic-Variables) in a message and the contact you want to email doesn't have a value for a dynamic variable, Apollo won't send the email. | To fix the issue, edit the contact's profile to add a value for the missing field. Alternatively, change the dynamic variable to an [advanced dynamic variable](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409735256845-Use-Advanced-Dynamic-Variables) and add a fallback for this type of scenario. |
| Missing Thread Info | If you set the email type as "Reply to a Previous Thread" and the contact deletes the previous email, Apollo won't send the email. | You can send this contact a manual email. To ensure the next emails in the sequence are sent, adjust any other emails in the sequence to send as part of a new thread. |
| No Send From Mailbox Selected | When you add contacts to a sequence, you must assign a mailbox. If one of your teammates removes a mailbox to which you linked your contacts in the sequence, Apollo won't send the email. | You can update an existing mailbox or [link the sequence to another mailbox](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4411178322573-Update-a-Linked-Mailbox-in-a-Sequence). |
| Email Missing or Invalid | If you added a contact with no email address to your sequence, Apollo won't send the email. | Update the email address on the contact's profile. When the information is up-to-date, resend the message. |
| Contact Account Not Owned by User | You might only have permissions to send emails to the contacts you own. If you try to email another user's contact or account, Apollo won't send the email. | Re-assign ownership of the contact, or ask an Apollo admin to [change your permissions](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409154208269-Create-Permission-Profiles#toc_5) so you can send emails to other users' contacts and accounts. |
| Email Service Provider Error | If a contact's email server is unable to deliver the email and returns an error to Apollo, Apollo can't send the message. | Hover your mouse over the "Email Service Provider Error" in Apollo to find out more about the error. Use this information to troubleshoot email delivery, or reach out to [Apollo Support](https://www.apollo.io/submit-a-request). |
| Other | If an email fails to deliver for any other reason, Apollo shows an `Other` error. | Reach out to [Apollo Support](https://www.apollo.io/submit-a-request) for assistance. |

[Back to Top](#top)

## Apollo Has Not Attempted to Send Your Emails[](#toc_10)

If Apollo hasn't tried to send your emails, there are 2 possible reasons for this:

*   An admin in your team has deleted the user associated with the contacts in your sequence. To solve this issue, you need to re-assign ownership of the contacts, and then send the email again.
*   The time or date you scheduled the email to send has already passed. To solve this issue, [edit the send time](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5403737512589-Why-Didn-t-My-Email-Send-#toc_5) for the step.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Resend an Email[](#toc_11)

After you've diagnosed a delivery issue, send the email again:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Emails**](https://app.apollo.io/#/emails).

*   All of your emails will display, including undelivered emails. Click the checkbox for each email you want to resend, then click the **Retry Undelivered Emails** icon.

[![The Retry Undelivered Emails button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i8.png)

*   Review the information, then click the checkboxes if they apply to you. Click **Retry**.

[![The Retry button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/why_didn't_my_email_send/i9.png)

Apollo will indicate if it can reschedule the emails.

[Back to Top](#top)

Your email client's rate limit could be the cause of sending delays. A rate limit impacts how many emails you can send at a given time.

To check if there is a rate limit on your emails, launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Emails**](https://app.apollo.io/#/emails).

Click **Scheduled**.

[![Scheduled Emails](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_email_provider_delaying_emails/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_email_provider_delaying_emails/i2.png)

Hover your mouse over the right-hand side of an email to review the email status.

[![Rate-Limited Message](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_email_provider_delaying_emails/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_email_provider_delaying_emails/i3.png)

If you see the above rate-limited message, it means your email client has placed a sending limit on your account.

Sending Limit

Please note, you need to communicate directly with your email client to resolve this issue. If you use Gmail, you can find more information on how to lift the sending limit on [this Google Support page](https://support.google.com/a/answer/166852).

​​ Once you have lifted the email rate limit, Apollo sends your delayed emails.

Once you have resolved the issue, here are some best practices to keep in mind for the future:

*   Set your sending limits lower in Apollo to account for any emails you're sending outside of Apollo.
*   Set your hourly limit lower to prevent sending too many emails at once.
*   Monitor your email performance closely and keep your email activity as close to average as possible. This is especially important if you have a new domain, as you need time to build your reputation. Once your reputation is in good standing, you can send higher volumes of emails with a lower risk of [getting flagged as spam](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409225311885-Avoid-Spam-Filters).

To set up your sending limits, follow the steps in the [Email Sending Limits Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409233349005-Email-Sending-Limits-Overview) article. Apollo recommends starting with a daily send limit of 100 and an hourly limit of 45. Then, if you encounter any issues, you can make further adjustments to [keep your domain safe](https://getapollo.wistia.com/medias/n29swfovkx).

[Back to Top](#top)

Your contacts may have multiple email aliases or domains. If a contact has set up email forwarding between their accounts, they can respond to your emails within the same thread but from an alternate email address.

When this happens, Apollo recognizes that the response is part of the same email thread and logs the reply in the **Activities** section of the original contact's profile.

[![Email Logged In Activities](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i1.png)

However, Apollo does not yet recognize the alternate email as a contact. This means that if you search for the email, Apollo prompts you to create a new contact.

Click **\+ Add** to create a new contact with this email address.

[![Create New Contact](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i2.png)

Or navigate to the contact's profile and replace the original email address. To do so, hover your mouse over the contact's email and click the edit icon.

[![Edit Email](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i3.png)

Update the email address and then click **Save**.

## Push Emails to Unknown Contacts in Salesforce[](#toc_1)

If you use the Salesforce integration, you can push emails even if the sender or recipient doesn't exist as a contact.

Be Careful What You Wish For!

Please note, this option may create new contacts in your Salesforce instance. Enable this feature with caution.

Click **Settings** and then click **Integrations**. Click **View** under the Salesforce section.

[![View Salesforce Integration](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i5.png)

Click **View** under **Push Records (Apollo > Salesforce)**.

[![View](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i6.png)

Click the **Activities, Tasks, Meetings, and Notes** tab. Then, click to enable the toggle for **Push emails even if sender or recipient doesn't exist in Salesforce**.

[![](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_contact_responded_can't_find/i7.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

By default, Apollo does not send messages on the following United States federal holidays:

*   Labor Day
*   Independence Day
*   Memorial Day
*   Thanksgiving
*   Christmas Eve
*   Christmas Day
*   New Year's Day

If you want to skip sending messages on other federal holidays, you need to [pause the sequence manually](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/6793821340429).

Schedules and Sequences

Please note, each sequence has a schedule. Make sure that when you adjust a schedule, you link it to the correct sequence(s). For more information about how to edit a sequence schedule, please refer to the [Create and Edit Sequence Sending Schedules](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409477927309) article. For an intro to all things sequences, hop into the [Sequences Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview) article.

To deactivate the federal holiday setting in Apollo:

1.  Launch Apollo, click **Settings**, and then click [**Schedules**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/schedules). [![Schedules](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/does_apollo_send_during_holidays/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/does_apollo_send_during_holidays/i2.png)
2.  Click the saved schedule that you want to edit. [![Saved Schedule](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/does_apollo_send_during_holidays/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/does_apollo_send_during_holidays/i3.png)
3.  Click the **Skip the following national holidays** checkbox, and then click **Save**. [![Checkbox](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/does_apollo_send_during_holidays/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/does_apollo_send_during_holidays/i4.png)

You can now send messages during United States federal holidays.
