## Overview[](#toc_0)

Plays help you automate actions in Apollo that would otherwise require manual input. The automated steps include the option to add or remove contacts from sequences and lists and the ability to schedule tasks for your reps.

What's the Plan, Stan?

Access to plays depends on your Apollo plan. Refer to Apollo's [pricing page](https://www.apollo.io/pricing) for more information.

The following sections explain how to create and configure plays from an existing template or from scratch in Apollo. If you need more inspiration before starting with plays, check out [Plays Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/14296116597901#toc_3) for details about some of the most popular use cases.

## Before You Create Plays[](#toc_1)

Before you start creating new plays, make sure you have set up and mapped the appropriate custom fields. For more information on how to do so, refer to [Leverage Plays to Automate Your Workflow](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/14062758984717#toc_10).

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create a Play from an Existing Template[](#toc_2)

To create a play from an existing Apollo template:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Plays**](https://app.apollo.io/#/plays).
2.  Click **All templates**. [![Access templates,](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i2.png)
3.  Browse through the [play templates](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/14296116597901#toc_3), use the search bar at the top, or click the categories on the left to find the type of play you want to run. [![Play template library](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i31.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i31.png)
4.  When you find a play template to use, click **Try it**. [![Select a template.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i4.png)
5.  Review the play summary and the actions you can automate. If you do not want to automate an action from the list, click the checkbox to deselect it. Then, click **Create**. [![Choose your automation options.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i34.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i34.png)
6.  Review the play to ensure that you agree with all configurations. If a section has orange highlighting, it requires action from you before you can proceed. The **When**, **If**, and **Then** sections in this article can help you better understand the available configuration and automation options. [![Review the play.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i33.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i33.png)
7.  When you have reviewed your play, click **Save changes**.

You've successfully created a new play from a play template.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create a Play from Scratch[](#toc_3)

To create a play without a template:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Plays**](https://app.apollo.io/#/plays).
2.  Click **New play**. [![New play button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i3a.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i3a.png)
3.  Click **Create from scratch**. [![Create from scratch button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i40.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i40.png)

Calling All Play Pros!

The play templates are here to help, not to hinder. If you know which actions you want to automate, click the **Show when creating new play** checkbox to stop the template library from appearing every time you create a new play. [![Show when creating new play checkbox](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i41.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i41.png)

There are 4 settings to configure when you create a new play:

*   **When**: Decide whether you want the play to run on a repeat schedule or based on a specific event.
*   **If**: Apply filters to narrow down the specific people, companies, or deals that you want this play to target.
*   **Then**: Decide which actions you want to automate when your chosen conditions are met.
*   **Play details**: Enter a name and description for your play.

Refer to the following sections for help in configuring each setting.

[Back to Top](#top)

### When[](#toc_4)

Click either **Based on a trigger event** or **Based on a date or schedule** to confirm when you want the play to run.

[![Choose when a play will run.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i1.png)

**Event**

If you are triggering the play based on an event, choose your target type and select an event.

[![Choose target type and event.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i22.png)

You can select multiple events for your play. To add more events, click **Add event** and use the drop-down fields to configure the details.

[![Add more events.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i24.png)

Use the **Advanced options** to limit how often the same contact, company, or deal should be added to your play.

The **every time** setting allows an entity to run through a play every time it meets the criteria for the filters. The **only once** setting limits a contact to run through a play one time. The **once every** setting allows an entity to run through the play when it meets the criteria for the filters at a time interval you specify.

[![Limit how many times an entity is added to the play.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i23.png)

**Date/Schedule**

If you are triggering the play based on a date or schedule, choose the start date, how frequently the play should run, and the end date.

[![Schedule your play to run.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i25.png)

Use the **Advanced options** to limit how many contacts, companies, or deals should be added to your play, and how often the same entity should be added to a play.

The **every time** setting allows an entity to run through a play every time it meets the criteria for the filters. The **only once** setting limits a contact to run through a play one time. The **once every** setting allows an entity to run through the play when it meets the criteria for the filters at a time interval you specify.

[![Limit how many times an entity is added to the play.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i26.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### If[](#toc_5)

If you selected an event as your play trigger, the target type and and filter are already added. Click **Edit filters** to change your filter criteria.

[![Add filter button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i27.png)

If you selected a date or schedule as your play trigger, choose a target type, then click **Add filters** to show the complete list of filter options.

[![Add a target type and filters for your scheduled play.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i12.png)

Be Careful What You Wish For!

If you don't apply any filters, your play targets all contacts, companies, or deals. That's a lot to handle! Apollo recommends that you apply filters to segment your audience and target the specific types of entities to which the play is most relevant.

Select the filters you want to apply to your play. As you [add filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661), Apollo shows you a preview of the entities that would meet your criteria. Then, click **Save filters**.

[![Choose your filters.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i13.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Then[](#toc_6)

There are several types of automations that that Apollo can run for you. The automations that will be available for a play are based on your selections for the trigger type and filters.

[![Choose your automations.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i28.png)

For most automations, you only need to make a few selections from drop-down fields to add the automation.

If you want to set up email alerts, click **Send alert via email**. Then, click the **Email** toggle to access the email alert settings.

[![Set up email alerts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i29.png)

Toggle on the **Send alert to your team via email** slider, then click **Save**.

[![Send email alerts for plays.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i30.png)

Deals Automation = Your Elation

If you're currently updating your deals manually in Apollo, consider saving yourself some time and automating it! Plays enables you to [create and update your deals](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415062486669) using account-based and contact-based triggers.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Play Details[](#toc_7)

In the **Play details** section, enter a name for your play. You can also add a description to help explain what your play automates, and save the play to a specific folder in Apollo.

[![Name your play.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i17.png)

You have now successfully created a play from scratch in Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Edit Plays[](#toc_8)

To edit a play, launch Apollo and click [**Play**](https://app.apollo.io/#/plays).

To deactivate a play, toggle the play's slider off.

[![Deactivate a play.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_play/i20.png)

To change a play, click **additional options** (...) button, then click **Edit play**. You can also use this drop-down to clone, move, or archive the play.

[![Additional options button on play homepage.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i39.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/rules_engine/i39.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

To run a successful account-based sales motion (ABSM), your sales reps need to effectively target a potentially small set of accounts and regional [territories](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665806989). This often means undertaking the time-consuming process of manually identifying and targeting prospects with the right messaging.

Apollo enables your team to automate your ABSM with plays. Set up plays that focus on surfacing contacts for your highest priority accounts. Then, either automatically move those contacts into your sequences, or add tasks to account queues so account owners can manually decide how to engage them with them.

The following sections describe how to create a play in Apollo for your ABSM strategy and manage contacts that are added to account queues.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Example: Create a Play to Target Priority Accounts[](#toc_1)

The following walkthrough explores how your team can set up a play to surface contacts at a high-priority account, but plays in Apollo offer a variety of automations beyond this specific use case. To explore more automations, refer to [Plays Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/14296116597901) and [Create a Play](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413804036109).

Do Not Pass Without a Sequence

To apply this example effectively, you should feed the contacts that are surfaced into a sequence. If you've never created a sequence, or just haven't created the right sequence for the accounts you will be targeting, refer to [Sequences Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837) to get started.

To create an account-based play:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [Plays](https://app.apollo.io/#/plays).
2.  Click **New Play**. [![Create a new play.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i11.png)
3.  Click **Create from scratch**. [![Create a play from scratch.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i2.png)
4.  For **When**, choose triggers for the play. For this example, click **Based on a date or schedule**, then set the frequency to run every 1 week. Check out [Create a Play](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413804036109-Create-a-Play#toc_4) to learn more about the trigger options. [![Choose play triggers.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i20.png)
5.  For **If**, click the **Companies** tab, then click **Add filters**. [![Target companies and add filters.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i21.png)
6.  Click the **Company** filter and add the accounts you want to target with your play. Then, click **Save filters**. [![Add accounts to target.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i22.png)
7.  For **Then**, click **Add contacts to sequence**. [![Select an automation.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i23.png)
8.  Choose a sequence from the **Sequence** drop-down. Contacts that are surfaced by this play will be added to the sequence you select.
    
    Then, select **Account owner** to send emails. Select **Specific user** to send emails if an account doesn't have an owner, then add yourself as the backup option. [![Add sequence and email sender.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i25.png)
    
9.  Click **Filters** to further identify the contacts to target within your chosen accounts. [![Add sequence and email sender.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i26.png)
10.  Add [people search filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412658716941) to narrow the potential contacts at your high-priority accounts. Click the [Job Titles](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661) filter and add the job titles you want to target. Then, click **Save filters**. [![Add sequence and email sender.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i27.png)
11.  For the target settings, click the **Max per account for this action** checkbox and enter the maximum number of contacts you want processed per each play action. Enter `30`. [![Set a limit on number of contacts to process.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i28.png)
12.  For **Settings**, click the **Max people per account** checkbox and enter the maximum number of contacts you want processed for each account in this play. Enter `10`. [![Set a limit on number of contacts to process for each account.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i29.png)
13.  Click **Manual approval**. For each contact surfaced by this play, this option adds a [task](https://app.apollo.io/#/tasks) for account owners to manually determine whether to add the contact to the chosen sequence. Refer to the [Manually Approve or Reject Contacts](#toc_2) section to learn more. [![Add manual tasks for account owners.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i30.png)
14.  Name your play and click **Save changes**.

Your play is now active. It will run as the trigger conditions you set are activated.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Manually Approve or Reject Contacts[](#toc_2)

If you followed this [example play](#toc_1) and set account owners to manually approve contacts, Apollo will assign tasks to the account owners on your team to manually determine whether the contact should be added to the chosen sequence. Contacts that are added to sequences will be displayed on account engagement plans.

What If I Drive Automatic Instead of Manual?

If you added contacts surfaced by your play directly to sequences, skip to the end of this section. Whether contacts are added manually or automatically via the example play, they all move to the engagement plan for an account.

If you are an account owner that wants to take manual action on the tasks:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Tasks**](https://app.apollo.io/#/tasks).
2.  Go to the **Add People on Account** tab, then click the **Add People** task for the account you want to review. A separate task is listed for each account that you targeted with your play. [![Access manual tasks for play.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i31.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i31.png)
3.  The **Pending contacts** tab shows the contacts that have been surfaced for review by the account owner. Click **Accept** to move a contact to the **Queued contacts** stage and add them to the chosen sequence.
    
    If you click **Reject**, the contact is moved to the **Rejected contacts** stage, where you can still accept them in the future. [![Complete tasks to add contacts to sequence.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i32.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i32.png)
    
4.  After you take action on all of the pending contacts, click **Complete Task**.

Accepted contacts will be added to your chosen sequence's first step.

Whether you add them manually or automatically, contacts that you add to a sequence are also added to the engagement plan for the associated account. To view these contacts, go to an account profile page, then click **Employees** > **Engagement plan**.

[![View the accepted contacts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i33.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/run_absm_using_plays/i33.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

With plays in Apollo, you can automate fundamental steps in your sales workflow, including [adding or removing contacts from a sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396985741-Add-Contacts-to-a-Sequence) or list, scheduling tasks for your reps, and updating contact job changes.

You can also configure notifications to remind you when you need to take manual actions. If you utilize the Slack-Apollo integration, you can send those notifications directly to your Slack workspace, enabling you and your team to instantly know when a play is ready to work.

The following sections detail how to set up the Slack integration and how to add Slack notifications to your plays.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Connect Slack to Apollo (Admins Only)[](#toc_1)

Set Up Needs Admin

Only Apollo admins can access the settings page that is required to set up the Slack integration. If you do not have the required access, please contact the Apollo admins at your organization for help.

Once Slack is connected, any user can receive notifications.

To set up the Slack-Apollo integration:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations).
2.  Click **Connect** for the Slack integration. [![Connect to Slack.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i1.png)
3.  If you are not already signed into a Slack workspace, you need to provide your Slack credentials. Then, review the permissions for the integration and click **Allow**. [![Give permission to access your Slack workspace.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i6.png)
4.  You will be returned to Apollo. The integration tile shows the connected Slack workspace. [![Slack is connected.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i3.png)

Slack will show the Apollo.io app in the Apps section of the workspace you connected. When a notification is triggered, Apollo will send it to the Messages section of the app in Slack.

[![Find Apollo in Slack.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i21.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Add Slack Notifications for Plays[](#toc_2)

If you have never created a play in Apollo, please refer to [Create a Play](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413804036109#toc_6) for more information. Slack notifications are only added during the `Then` portion of the play set-up process.

To add a Slack notification to a play in Apollo:

1.  In the `Then` section of your play, click **Add action**. Then, click **Send alert via Slack**. [![Add a Slack notification.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i14.png)
2.  Toggle on the **Slack** notification channel. If you have not added the Apollo.io app to Slack previously, you will be asked to sign in to your Slack account. [![Turn on Slack notification.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i19.png)
3.  (Optional) By default, you receive Slack notifications via the Apollo.io app in Slack, but you can also direct notifications to public Slack channels. To do so, click **Configure channels**. Then, choose a Slack channel from the **Send to** drop-down and click **Save**. [![Choose a Slack channel.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i17.png)
4.  Select a call-to-action, then decide which users at your company will be able to view the Slack notification. Click **Continue** to save your notification. [![Configure your Slack notification.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i16.png)

You have now added a Slack notification for your play. Proceed with configuring your play and save the changes.

[![Confirm the notification is added.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i18.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Receive Conversation Summaries[](#toc_3)

As part of [recording video conversations](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/9632855570701), Apollo provides an AI-generated summary of the call, including the outcome of the call and any next steps that you should take.

When you connect Slack to Apollo, you receive notifications in Slack that include the outcome of the call summary and a link to view the full summary. These notifications are only triggered when you are the meeting host.

To receive these notifications, you only need to [connect Apollo to Slack](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/22464817775117#toc_1). No additional setup process is required. The notifications appear in the Apollo.io app in Slack.

[![View a call summary in Slack.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_slack_integration/i20.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Many Apollo users leverage plays to:

*   Automate administrative and prospecting activities to book more meetings
*   Improve efficiency and create repeatable, scalable sales processes
*   Generate more pipeline and drive more revenue

This use case explores the steps you can take to use plays to automate actions in your sales workflow.

Refer to the sections below for a sample workflow that walks you through the recommended steps to set up an example play. This includes setting up a sequence, a list, and custom fields for your play, mapping the custom fields to your CRM, and customizing a play template with the assets you created.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Sample Workflow[](#toc_2)

A Message From Yoda We Have!

Patience you must have, young Padawan, for you are on your own path and have your own objectives. This is just one sample workflow of one of the many plays you can run. Use it as a guideline and alter the process to fit your goals. Only then great results you will see. For more context and use case inspiration, hop into the [Plays Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/14296116597901) article.

### Plan Your Play[](#toc_3)

Let's say you're Head of Customer Success at a growing software company. You want to create a play to reach out to your customers 3 months before their contract is due for renewal.

Your goal is to increase retention and strengthen customer relationships. So, you set up a play to encourage your CSMs to be proactive, maintain a personalized approach, and automate manual tasks to increase their overall efficiency.

You want to ensure each contact you enroll in the play is contacted by their dedicated Customer Success Manager.

Let's run through the steps you take in Apollo to set up a killer play that helps your team get ahead of renewals.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Create Users in Apollo[](#toc_4)

Before you begin, you need to ensure that all the CSMs you want to enroll in your play exist in Apollo and have a mailbox from which to send emails.

### Integrate Your CRM with Apollo[](#toc_5)

If you haven't already, you also integrate your CRM with the Apollo platform.

Salesforce or HubSpot

Please note, Apollo's CRM integrations come in 2 delicious flavors: Salesforce and HubSpot. Use the links below for the CRM that you want to integrate and configure with Apollo.

#### Salesforce[](#toc_6)

**Integration**

*   [Connect Apollo to Your Salesforce Account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414356051725-Connect-Apollo-to-Your-Salesforce-Account)
*   [Understand Opportunity Stages and Salesforce](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415294726029-Understand-Opportunity-Stages-and-Salesforce-)

**Credentials**

*   [Salesforce Credentials Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415287562893-Salesforce-Credentials-Overview)
*   [Connect "Team Sync" Authentication Credentials to Your Salesforce Integration](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415294638733-Connect-Team-Sync-Authentication-Credentials-To-Your-Salesforce-Integration)

#### HubSpot[](#toc_7)

**Integration**

*   [Connect Apollo to Your HubSpot Account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416619021837)

Once you've connected your CRM to Apollo, your customer data stays accurate and in sync. Now, you're ready to create a sequence for your renewal play.

### Create a Sequence[](#toc_8)

You work with your CSMs to build a personalized multi-channel sequence to engage with your contacts in the run-up to their contract end date.

[![Upcoming renewals sequence example](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i1.png)

### Create a List[](#toc_9)

Then, you create a company renewal list specifically for this play so that when a contact meets the play criteria, you can automatically add them to this list.

[![Example renewal list](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i2.png)

### Create Custom Fields in Your CRM[](#toc_10)

Next, you create 2 custom fields in your CRM:

*   1 for your CSMs so that Apollo enrolls the right CSM for each contact.
*   1 for the renewal date so that Apollo only enrolls the contacts who are due for renewal

**Salesforce**

[![New custom field screen in Salesforce](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i4.png)

Salesforce Users

Need a helping hand creating a custom field in Salesforce? Feast your eyes on the [Create a Custom Field](https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/modules/custom-fields-quick-look/create-a-custom-field) article in the Salesforce Knowledge Base.

**HubSpot**

[![Create a Property in HubSpot](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i5.png)

### Create and Map the Custom Fields in Apollo[](#toc_11)

Now, you're ready to create the custom fields in Apollo and then map them to the equivalent custom fields you created in your CRM. This allows you to sync custom data back and forth between Apollo and your CRM to run your play with ease.

**Apollo**

You can create 3 types of custom fields in Apollo: custom contact, account, or user fields. For this specific use case, you create a custom contact field for your CSMs. You also create one for the contract renewal date.

[![Create a custom contact modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i7.png)

**Salesforce**

If you are a Salesforce user, you map the custom contact and/or lead fields in Salesforce with the equivalent custom contact fields when you [create or edit them in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412498825869-Create-Custom-Contact-Fields#toc_3).

[![Create custom contact modal with Salesforce mapping field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i3.png)

Apollo supports linking your custom contact fields to a Salesforce Contact Field or Salesforce Lead Field—depending on what makes the most sense for your integration. You can also sync to both object types at the same time. If you do so, the Apollo custom contact field automatically becomes "Read Only." You can disable the "Read Only" setting by removing one of the mapped objects.

**HubSpot**

If you are a HubSpot user, you map the custom contact fields you created in HubSpot with the equivalent custom contact fields when you [create or edit them in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412498825869-Create-Custom-Contact-Fields#toc_3).

[![Create custom contact modal with HubSpot mapping field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/plays_use_case/i6.png)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

One of the most common use cases for the Apollo platform is to enrich customer data in your CRM. Enriching your data allows you to fill in the blanks about what you know about your customers and helps you to find new ways to leverage that information to better engage with them.

**CRM Enrichment** allows you to update and enrich the existing records in your CRM. Oftentimes, contact and account information is subject to change—companies undergo acquisition or open new offices; people change roles or move to new cities. **CRM Enrichment** allows you to more readily capture those changes and keep the data in your CRM and the data in Apollo in sync.

To automatically keep track of changes and stay up-to-date with the latest Contact and Account information, use the **CRM Enrichment** feature in Apollo.

CRM Compatibility

Please note, full functionality of **CRM Enrichment** is currently available for Salesforce and HubSpot.

Refer to the sections below for a sample workflow that takes you through the process of setting up your CRM and then leveraging Apollo **CRM Enrichment** to fill in the gaps in your data.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Wait for the Data to Sync and Map Fields[](#toc_6)

After you connect a CRM to Apollo, you should wait at least 1-2 hours for your data to fully sync with the Apollo database. You should avoid prospecting any people in Apollo who are actively synced between the two systems during this initial waiting period.

In the meantime, you should verify that your CRM is configured properly and update any field mappings. Refer to the documentation links below to properly configure your CRM. You may also want to learn some more about the way that [bi-directional](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412668783117-Bi-Directional-Sync-Overview) data sync works.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Begin CRM Enrichment[](#toc_9)

After you've waited for Apollo and your CRM to fully sync with each other, you can begin to enrich your data.

Enable Autofill and Auto Overwrite

Please note, in order to run **CRM Enrichment** automatically, you need to first enable the **Auto Overwrite** and **Autofill** options. This is available on the "Default Fields" tab for **Contacts** [here](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/contacts/default_fields) and on the "Default Fields" tab for **Accounts** [here](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/accounts/stages). You need to click the **Auto Overwrite** and **Autofill** checkbox for every field that you want to enrich in Salesforce.

*   When you enable **Autofill** for a Salesforce field, Apollo only enriches the fields with Apollo data where there isn't already a value in Salesforce.
*   When you enable **Auto Overwrite** for a Saleforce field, Apollo will enrich the field with Apollo data whenever new information is available.
*   Due to infrastructure limitations, both settings only run whenever Apollo pulls an update from Salesforce.

Before you begin to enrich your CRM data, you may want to learn a bit more about how [Apollo CRM Enrichment](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413921630989) works. Once you understand how the feature works, it's time to use it.

When you're ready to begin enriching your data, follow the steps outlined in the "[Improve Your Data With CRM Enrichment](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413930806797-Improve-Your-Data-With-CRM-Enrichment)" article. Keep in mind, it can take up to 24 hours to fully enrich your CRM data.

## CRM Enrichment Overview[](#toc_0)

## Watch the Video[](#toc_1)

## Read the Doc[](#toc_2)

### Overview[](#toc_3)

**CRM Enrichment** allows you to update and enrich the existing records in your CRM. Oftentimes, contact and account information is subject to change—companies undergo acquisition or open new offices; people change roles or move to new cities. CRM Enrichment allows you to more readily capture those changes and keep the data in your CRM and the data in Apollo in sync.

To automatically keep track of changes and stay up-to-date with the latest **Contact** and **Account** information, use the **CRM Enrichment** feature in Apollo.

[![CRM Enrichment Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment_overview/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment_overview/i1.png)

CRM Compatibility

Please note, full functionality of **CRM Enrichment** is currently available for Salesforce and HubSpot.

Refer to the section below for a brief overview of the available components in Apollo's **CRM Enrichment** tool.

[Back to Top](#top)

### The Components of CRM Enrichment[](#toc_4)

There are several components of **CRM Enrichment** in Apollo.

[![CRM Enrichment Components](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment_overview/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment_overview/i2.png)

Don't Go **Lead**ing Me Astray!

Please note, the **Lead** component only applies to Salesforce. If you have connected your HubSpot account with Apollo, you will not see the **Lead** tab.

| Component | Description |
| --- | --- |
| All Records | The **All Records** tab provides you with a holistic view of the records in your CRM that include missing or out-of-date information. From this section, you can filter by fields, enrich all records, or select the specific records that you want to enrich. |
| Contacts | The **Contacts** tab allows you to view, filter, and enrich in bulk all of the current **contacts** in your CRM with updates available in Apollo. |
| Leads | If you have integrated Apollo with Salesforce, the **Leads** tab allows you to view, filter, and enrich in bulk all of the current **leads** in your CRM with updates available in Apollo. |
| Accounts | The **Accounts** tab allows you to view, filter, and enrich in bulk all of the current **accounts** in your CRM with updates available in Apollo. |
| Dismissed | The **Dismissed** tab provides you with a holistic view of all of the records with updates available, but which you have chosen not to enrich. |
| History | The **History** tab provides you with a list of the records that you have previously enriched. From this section, you can view, filter, and open your up-to-date records in Apollo. |
| Settings | The **Settings** tab allows you to amend the way you map your **contact** and **account** fields between your CRM and Apollo. From this section, you can also manually enable **autofill** or **auto overwrite** for **contacts** and **accounts** in bulk. |

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Bi-Directional Sync Availability

Please note, bi-directional syncing is only available on certain plans. See the [Apollo Pricing Guide](https://www.apollo.io/pricing/) for more information.

Bi-directional syncing allows two datasets in two different systems to act as one. This kind of synchronization allows you to keep consistent data across multiple platforms. It also helps you prevent stale data and resolves conflicts between Apollo and your CRM.

Apollo uses bi-directional syncing to streamline your experience. Refer to the following sections to discover how Apollo protects and integrates your existing contact data from your CRM with the Apollo contact database.

[Back to Top](#top)

### How Does Apollo Use Bi-Directional Syncing?[](#toc_2)

Apollo allows you to sync contact data between your saved contacts and HubSpot or Salesforce.

Use bi-directional syncing to keep your contact data consistent between your CRM and your saved contacts in the ever-evolving Apollo database.

Since the sync is bi-directional, you can both sync your CRM to your saved contacts in Apollo and sync your saved contacts in Apollo to your CRM. Do this regularly to keep your contact data up-to-date on both platforms.

When you [sync your CRM](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414356051725) with Apollo, Apollo cross-references your data with your saved contacts in the Apollo database and enriches any missing or inaccurate data.

CRM Integration

Please note, you can only connect 1 CRM to Apollo at a time. For example, if you connect a Salesforce account to Apollo, you can't also connect a HubSpot account.

[Back to Top](#top)

### How Does Apollo Protect Its Database?[](#toc_3)

With bi-directional syncing, it is possible to import or export corrupt data. To protect your data and the Apollo database from data pollution, you work within your own instance of Apollo.

This protects your data and shields the Apollo database from accidental corruption. Each user has the base instance of Apollo and can sync with [HubSpot](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416619021837-Connect-Apollo-to-Your-HubSpot-Account) or [Salesforce](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414356051725-Connect-Apollo-to-Your-Salesforce-Account).

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Teams with large contact lists can keep contact data updated with CSV enrichment. Enrichment improves both people and company data, providing the most updated information on names, job titles, location, employment, company funding, and more. CSV enrichment is a great way to leverage the vast amount of data available in Apollo for the most effective outreach to your existing contacts.

Check out the following sections to use CSV enrichment for your people or company data.

1,000 Paths to Enrichment

You can upload a maximum CSV file size of 1,000 total rows. Files with more than 1,000 rows will cause an error. To work around this limitation, split large files into smaller separate CSVs that include fewer than 1,000 rows. 

[Back to Top](#top)

## Upload a CSV to Enrich People[](#toc_2)

Check Your Plan

Check out [Apollo plans](https://www.apollo.io/pricing) to see which plans include CSV enrichment or credit packages. Your plan may limit the total number of record enrichments. Enrichment record limits don't reset at the end of your billing cycle. If you'd like to purchase a credit package or upgrade your plan, [manage your plan](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/plans).

CSV enrichment doesn't save contacts to Apollo, but you can separately [upload a CSV of contacts](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409161532045-Upload-a-CSV-of-Contacts-to-Apollo).

To enrich a CSV of people:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Data enrichment** > [**CSV**](https://app.apollo.io/#/enrichment-status/csv-enrich/upload). Click **\+ Select CSV**.
2.  Under Enrich people, click **Edit settings** to configure the fields you want to enrich with Apollo data.

[![The Edit settings button is highlighted under enrich people](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i1.png)

3.  By default, all fields are selected, but you can pick and choose which data you want to enrich without impacting your team.

[![Default enrichment fields are shown](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i2.png)

4.  When finished, click **Save settings**.
5.  Click **Select CSV**.

[![The Select CSV button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i3.png)

6.  Select and open the CSV file on your computer.
7.  Review your available enrichment credits. Click **Increase limits** if your team requires more enrichment credits.

[![Example enrichment credits are highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i4.png)

8.  Next, map the columns from your CSV to default fields in Apollo. You must map at least one of the following: (first name, last name, company URL) or (first name, last name, company name) or (LinkedIn URL) or (email), but map as many fields as possible to optimize enrichment results.

[![Example field mapping is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i5.png)

9.  When finished, click **Next**.
10.  Choose whether to enrich email addresses, mobile numbers, or both. Credits are charged separately if both are enabled.

[![Options are highlighted to enrich emails and phone numbers](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i6.png)

11.  Apollo will enrich the data in your CSV and email you when the file is [ready to download](#toc_4). Click **Done** or upload another CSV.

[![The Done button is highlighted on the CSV enrichment processing page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i7.png)

When you get the enriched file, [upload the contacts to Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409161532045-Upload-a-CSV-of-Contacts-to-Apollo) to engage with them. You can [enroll them in a sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview), [add them to a list](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409728608525-Create-and-Edit-a-Contact-or-Company-List), [reach out with the dialer](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409140527757-Configure-the-Dialer), or [book meetings](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/8797408392589-Apollo-Meetings-Overview) to engage and win sales — all in Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

Check Your Plan

Check out [Apollo plans](https://www.apollo.io/pricing) for information on which plans include CSV enrichment or credit packages. Your plan may limit the total number of record enrichments. Enrichment record limits don't reset at the end of your billing cycle. If you'd like to purchase a credit package or upgrade your plan, [manage your plan](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/plans).

[![Default enrichment fields are shown](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i9.png)

4.  When finished, click **Save settings**.
5.  Click **Select CSV**.

[![The Select CSV button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i10.png)

6.  Select and open the CSV file on your computer.

9.  When finished, click **Next**.
10.  Apollo will enrich the data in your CSV and email you when the file is [ready to download](#toc_4). Click **Done** or upload another CSV.

[![Upload Complete](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i7.png)

When you get the enriched file, [upload the accounts to Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409154067981-Upload-a-CSV-of-Accounts-to-Apollo) to manage and engage with them. You can [add them to a list](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409728608525-Create-and-Edit-a-Contact-or-Company-List), [create plays](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413804036109-Create-a-Play) and [tasks](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4411331110925), or [book meetings](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/8797408392589-Apollo-Meetings-Overview) to engage and win sales — all in Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Check Enrichment Status and Download CSV[](#toc_4)

Once you've uploaded a CSV file, you can check the enrichment status and download an enriched CSV:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Data enrichment** > [**CSV**](https://app.apollo.io/#/enrichment-status/csv-enrich/upload).
2.  Review all of your uploaded files, and click **Download** to download an enriched CSV.

[![Example enriched CSVs are highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i13.png)

3.  If you have a large number of CSV files, filter by most recent, contact enriched, or account enriched:

[![Enriched CSV filters are highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i14.png)

Apollo lists the following information for each uploaded file:

*   **Name**: The file name
*   **Type**: One of `Account` (companies) or `Contact` (people)
*   **Progress**: The number of rows Apollo has reviewed
*   **Total Records**: The total number of rows
*   **Matched Records**: The number of rows that Apollo was able to match to an entry in the database
*   **Duplicates**: The number of rows that contain a duplicate account or contact
*   **View Report**: Click to view the CSV enrichment report, which shows how much data Apollo enriched in your CSV:

[![Enriched CSV filters are highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i-15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment/i-15.png)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

**CRM Enrichment** allows you to update and sync your existing records from your CRM with Apollo. Contact and account data are subject to change. Using the Apollo enrichment feature helps ensure data accuracy. For an overview of CRM Enrichment, read [CRM Enrichment Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413921630989-CRM-Enrichment-Overview).

CRM Compatibility

Please note, full functionality of **CRM Enrichment** is currently available for Salesforce and HubSpot.

Refer to the section below for instructions on how to use **CRM Enrichment**.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Configure CRM Enrichment[](#toc_2)

Before you enrich any records, you need to map Apollo's default fields with your CRM fields to ensure full enrichment functionality.

Permission to Map

Please note, you can only map default fields if you have permission to edit integration-related settings. If you do not have access but want to configure default mapping, please contact an admin user from your team to enable the correct permissions for your account. For more information about permission profiles, please refer to the [Create Permission Profiles](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409154208269-Create-Permission-Profiles) article.

To do so, launch Apollo and navigate to **Enrich**. Then, click **View Records** in the **CRM Enrichment** menu.

[![Enrich](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i1.png)

Click **Settings** and then click **Contact Fields** or **Account Fields**.

[![Settings Tab on Enrichment Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i13.png)

Select the drop-down arrow next to the CRM field that you want to map to an Apollo default field. Then, select the appropriate field from the list.

[![CRM Drop-Down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i14.png)

Being Mindful Matters!

Please note, Apollo applies any changes you make at the instance level. This means that the fields you select here also impact the other users in your team.

If you want to automate the enrichment process for specific fields, click the **Autofill** or **Auto Overwrite** checkboxes on the right of a default field. You can either choose to activate the **Autofill** option on its own or you can activate both **Autofill** and **Auto Overwrite** together.

[![Autofill and Auto Overwrite Checkboxes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i15.png)

Don't Fix What Isn't Broken

Please note, Apollo can only auto-overwrite a default field if Apollo has information available that differs from the data in your CRM. Likewise, Apollo can only autofill a default field that is empty in your CRM if Apollo has relevant information available. Please also note that these settings only run whenever Apollo pulls an update from your CRM.

Repeat the process for all default **account** and **contact** fields that you want to map with your CRM. Then, click **Submit**.

[![Submit Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i16.png)

You are now ready to enrich your CRM records.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Enrich Your CRM Records[](#toc_3)

Launch Apollo and navigate to **Enrich**. Then, click **View Records** in the **CRM Enrichment** menu.

[![Enrich](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i1.png)

CRM Categories

Please note, there are different categories for your CRM entries: **leads** (for Salesforce-connected teams), **contacts**, and **accounts**. The process for enrichment is the same for every category.

Click the checkboxes to select one or more of the entries that you would like to enrich.

[![Checkboxes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i2.png)

Click **Enrich Selected** to enrich the selected records.

[![Enrich Selected](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i3.png)

Enrich Selected

Please note, for the selected records, clicking **Enrich Selected** will override any auto-fill, auto-overwrite, or push settings that you have enabled or disabled for the enriched field. You can find these settings in **Settings**—>**Contacts**—>**Default Fields** or **Settings**—>**Accounts**—>**Default Fields**.

To enrich all of the available records, click **Enrich All**.

[![Enrich All](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i4.png)

Enrich All

Please note, when you click **Enrich All**, you will enrich your CRM with every update available in Apollo. The number listed next to **All Records** tells you how many records Apollo will enrich. [![Record Number](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/crm_enrichment/i12.png)

Filters by Category
