## Overview[](#toc_1)

**CSV Enrichment Reports** provide you with a high-level overview of how well Apollo did at enriching the contacts in a CSV that you uploaded.

[![CSV Enrichment Report](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i2.png)

Refer to the sections below to learn how to access **CSV Enrichment Reports** and better understand what data is available within them.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Access CSV Enrichment Reports[](#toc_2)

Launch Apollo and click **Enrich**.

[![Enrich](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i5.png)

Click **CSV Enrichment**.

[![CSV Enrichment](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i6.png)

Click **View Report** for the enriched CSV file that you want to analyze.

[![View Report](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i7.png)

When you're done analyzing the **CSV Enrichment Report**, click **Back to Listing** to return to the list of enriched CSV files.

[![Back to Listing](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i8.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## CSV Enrichment Report Features[](#toc_3)

There are several components to the CSV Enrichment Report. Each section is described in detail below.

### Records Enriched[](#toc_4)

The **Records Enriched** section displays the total number of CSV records submitted to Apollo in a pie graph. This graph is segmented by "Matched Records," "Duplicate Records," and "Not Found."

[![Reports Enriched](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i1.png)

*   **Matched Records**: The number of CSV records that Apollo could match to the database
*   **Duplicate Records**: The number of duplicate records in the CSV
*   **Not Found**: The number of CSV records that Apollo could not match to the database

Hover your mouse over an individual segment to see the number of records for that segment.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Completeness Score[](#toc_5)

The **Completeness Score** section of the **CSV Enrichment Report** provides a "before and after" snapshot of your CSV data based on the number of individual data points found in the CSV before and after enrichment. Within the bar chart, the "Before" bar shows the percentage of available fields that were completed within the CSV prior to enrichment. The "After" bar shows the percentage of fields completed after Apollo enriched the CSV.

[![Completeness Score](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i3.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Enrichment Result[](#toc_6)

The **Enrichment Result** section provides you with a bar chart view of the data. The left bar ("Total Fields Enriched") reflects the number of enriched columns over the total number of columns in the CSV. The right bar (Total Data Points) reflects the total number of enriched data points over the total number of possible data points.

[![Enrichment Result](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i4.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Matched Fields[](#toc_7)

The **Matched Fields** section provides you with an overview of the fields that you mapped during the upload process. The first bar provides you with the number of fields that you mapped during this process. The second bar provides you with the total number of mapped CSV fields that Apollo was able to match values from. The third bar provides you with the total number of mapped CSV fields that Apollo could not match values from.

[![Matched Fields](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i9.png)

Why do I have "Unmatched Fields?"

Typically, "Unmatched Fields" result from fields mapped incorrectly during the upload process. For example, if you mapped your CSV's "Title" column to Apollo's "First Name" field, Apollo would not be able to match any values for it.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Emails Enriched[](#toc_8)

The **Emails Enriched** section provides you with the total number of records (rows) in your CSV. It is displayed as a pie graph and is segmented by rows enriched with "Verified" email addresses, rows enriched with "Not Verified" email addresses, and rows where an email address was "Not Found."

[![Emails Enriched](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i10.png)

*   **Verified**: The total number of verified emails that Apollo matched to the records in the CSV
*   **Not Verified**: The total number of unverified emails that Apollo matched to the records in the CSV
*   **Not found**: The total number of records for which Apollo could not find an email

Hover your mouse over an individual segment to see the number of records for that segment.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Phone Numbers Enriched[](#toc_9)

The **Phone Numbers Enriched** section provides you with two fields. The first bar reflects the total number of enriched company-headquarter phone numbers ("HQ Phone"). The second bar reflects the total number of mobile numbers enriched in the CSV ("Direct Dial").

[![Phone Numbers Enriched](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i11.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### All Enrichment Fields[](#toc_10)

The **All Enrichment Fields** section provides you with the total number of enriched data points for each enriched field (column) in the CSV.

[![All Enrichment Fields](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/csv_enrichment_reports_overview/i12.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

Deals helps you to track possible deals with prospective customers. In addition to people and company records, deals enables you to manage your entire sales pipeline directly within Apollo.

This allows you to engage prospects in more meaningful ways, keep track of everything in one place, and move deals faster. You can associate deals with both companies and people, and you can also sync them to or from Salesforce.

The following sections detail the features that are available on the deals page, as well as information about how specific roles can benefit from using them.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Learn How Deals Impacts Your Role (SDRs and AEs)[](#toc_1)

While deals is a useful tool for most Apollo users, the following roles often benefit the most from deals.

**SDRs**

Sales Development Reps (SDRs) gain visibility on current or historical deals to help guide contextual conversations at both the individual and account levels. SDRs can also use the deals screen to help coach their teams and unlock additional sales dollars.

**Account Executives**

Account Executives gain a seamless workflow for contacts, accounts, and deals. This eliminates the need to navigate to multiple applications (Apollo, Salesforce, etc.) to access and update critical data as the sales cycle progresses. This gives you a full view of your sales funnel, from top to bottom, in one location.

Additionally, Account Executives can send and track messages and add contextual information to deals to ensure things are recorded for posterity.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Enable Deals for Non-Admins[](#toc_2)

By default, users with non-admin roles in your Apollo account cannot access or edit deals. If you are an Apollo admin that wants to provide deals functionality to non-admins:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Permission Profiles**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/permissions-profiles).
2.  Click a user profile to access the permissions for it. [![Access a user profile.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i37.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i37.png)
3.  Find the **Deals** permissions. Click the **Can access & view Deals data** checkbox to allow non-admins to access deals. Click the **Can add or edit deal roles** checkbox to also provide non-admins the ability to add or change a contact's role in a deal. [![Add deals permissions for non-admins.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i36.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i36.png)
4.  Click **Save Changes** to update the permission profile.

Repeat these steps to add deals permissions to other user profiles.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Access and Understand the Deals Page[](#toc_4)

The Apollo deals page allows you to explore, filter, and create deals from a centralized location. To access deals, launch Apollo and click [**Deals**](https://app.apollo.io/#/opportunities).

The following sections detail how to navigate and use the deals page.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Use Table View[](#toc_5)

Click **Table view** to see your deals in a table format. By default, deals are placed in order based on when they were created. Use the arrows at the top of each column to sort by other values.

[![Use table view.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i23.png)

To customize the columns in the table view, click **Table Column Settings**.

[![Change the table columns.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i24.png)

### Use Board (Kanban) View[](#toc_6)

Click **Board view** to see your deals in a Kanban board format. This option enables you to more easily view all of your deals organized by the current stage.

[![Deals](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i3.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Use Filters to Find Deals[](#toc_7)

Use the search bar to find specific deals.

[![Search deals.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i21.png)

Use filters to find deals based on details such as stage or deal owner.

[![Filter deals.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i22.png)

When using search filters on the deals page, [save your searches](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409803718669) to use them again as you would in other areas of Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Access More Deal Information[](#toc_8)

The table on the deals page shows high-level details about all of your deals.

To access more information about each deal, either click the empty space in a row for any deal to open the details sidebar, or click the deal title to access the same information on a separate page. The deal details are the same in both areas. Depending on the contact information available, you can call or email the contact for the account.

[![Columns to Show](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i18.png)

From the **Overview** tab, you can view and add contacts, tasks, and [conversations](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/9632855570701#toc_12) related to the deal.

[![View items related to the deal.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i33.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i33.png)

From the **Activity** section of the Overview tab, you can view a timeline of activities related to the deal, including any emails, notes, and conversations that have been added. You can also add a note or [associate a conversation to the deal](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/9632855570701#toc_12) from this section.

[![View activities related to the deal.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i32.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i32.png)

From the **All fields** tab, you can review every Apollo field related to the deal and manage those fields.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Export Deals[](#toc_9)

To export deals data to a CSV file:

1.  Click the checkbox next to one or more deals.
2.  Click **...** > **Export**. [![Export deals data.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i25.png)
3.  Click **Download** to finish your CSV export.

To push deals to Salesforce:

1.  Click the checkbox next to one or more deals.
2.  Click **...** > **Push to Salesforce**. [![Push deals to Salesforce.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i25.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Learn About the Salesforce Integration and Deals[](#toc_10)

If you've integrated Salesforce with your Apollo account, Apollo uses the Opportunity stages you have configured on the Salesforce side for your deals stages, and automatically disables the creation of new deal stages. Refer to [Configure Your Salesforce Pull Settings](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414496822797) for help with mapping fields to deals.

Apollo does this because it is not possible to create or update Opportunity stages through the Salesforce API. The Salesforce Opportunity page is configured as read-only, which means Apollo can only pull this data from Salesforce.

Also, removing a contact from a deal in Apollo does not remove them from your Opportunity in Salesforce. Unlike Apollo, Salesforce does not allow the same contact to have multiple contact roles listed. Instead, any contacts with multiple roles will appear multiple times (once for each role) in the **Contact Roles** section of a Salesforce Opportunity.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create Deals[](#toc_11)

Ready to create a new deal in Apollo? Check out [Create Deals in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415062486669) to learn more, including how to keep track of your deals-related action items with tasks.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Turn Off Deals[](#toc_12)

If your team wants to hide deals-related functionality for operational reasons, launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Deals**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/opportunities/stages). Then, toggle the **Show Deals related functions...** slider off.

[![Disable the deals feature.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i1.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

Deals help you to track possible deals with prospective customers. In addition to people and company records, [deals](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415062467725) enables you to manage your entire sales pipeline directly within Apollo.

You can also add tasks specifically related to your deals. These tasks ensure that you are aware of any actions you need to take to progress your deals to the next stage on time.

Refer to the following section to learn how to create new deals and add tasks for your deals.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create a New Deal[](#toc_1)

To create a new deal:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Deals**](https://app.apollo.io/#/opportunities).
2.  Click **New Deal**. [![Create a new deal.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i2.png)
3.  Enter information for the required fields:
    
    •**Deal name**: This is the name of the deal. It can be anything that you choose, but it is best to keep it specific and descriptive.  
    •**Deal stage**: This is the stage for the deal in the pipeline. The available options in the drop-down are populated by the stages you have defined in your settings.  
    •**Account**: This is the company that is associated with the deal.  
    •**Next step**: Enter details about the next action that needs to be taken on this deal.
    
    You can decide whether to enter details for the other fields, including any custom fields that your team includes in deals. [![Enter deal information.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i4.png)
    
4.  Click **Save**.

Once created, your deal is added to the deals page.

Deal Stages and Salesforce

If you've integrated Salesforce with your Apollo account, Apollo uses the Opportunity stages you have configured on the Salesforce side for your deals stages, and automatically disables the creation of new deal stages.

Apollo does this because it is not possible to create or update Opportunity stages through the Salesforce API. The Salesforce Opportunity page is configured as read-only, which means Apollo can only pull this data from Salesforce.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Change Fields in Deal Form[](#toc_2)

There are 3 places that include the **New Deal** button in the Apollo platform: the Deals page, account profiles, and contact profiles. The process to create new deals is the same regardless of what page you start from.

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Deals**](https://app.apollo.io/#/opportunities).
2.  Click **New Deal**. [![Create a new deal.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i2.png)
3.  Click **Customize deal form**. [![Customize your deal form.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i26.png)
4.  Click the **Set as required** checkbox for a field to make it a required field or not. [![Set a field as required.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i27.png)
5.  Click and drag a field's left handle to change its position in the order when creating a new deal. [![Sort the fields.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i28.png)
6.  Click the **trash can** icon to remove a field from the deal creation form. [![Remove a field from the form.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i29.png)
7.  Click **Save** to update the deal creation form for your team.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Add Deal Tasks[](#toc_3)

Tasks help keep you on track with any action items that you need to complete for a deal.

To add a task for a deal:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Deals**](https://app.apollo.io/#/opportunities).
2.  Click **My Deal Tasks**. [![Find your deal tasks.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i5.png)
3.  Click **New task**. [![Add a new task.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i13.png)
4.  Select and enter all relevant details for the task, including: the task's deal, the name of the task, a due date, and the priority of the task. Then, click **Create task**. [![Enter details for your task.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i14.png)
5.  Click the **Upcoming** tab to view you task.

Alternatively, you can add a task from the deal's page. To do so:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Deals**](https://app.apollo.io/#/opportunities).
2.  Either click the empty space in a row for any deal to open the details sidebar, or click the deal title to access the same information on a separate page. [![Columns to Show](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i18.png)
3.  In the **Details** tab, find the **Tasks** section. Then, click the **+** icon. [![Add a task.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i34.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i34.png)
4.  Select and enter all relevant details for the task, including the name of the task, a due date, and the priority of the task. Then, click **Create task**. [![Enter task details.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i35.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i35.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Track Deal Tasks[](#toc_4)

You can track and complete your tasks in several areas across Apollo, including:

*   The Apollo [task manager.](https://app.apollo.io/#/tasks)
*   The Apollo control center.
*   The **My Deal Tasks** sidebar.
*   A deal's page.

To find your tasks in the control center:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Home** [**Control center**](https://app.apollo.io/#/control-center).
2.  Find the **To-do list** section and click **Tasks**. Here, you can find all of your action items in Apollo, including your deal-related tasks. [![Find your tasks.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i15.png)
3.  If you click the checkbox for a task, you can perform a variety of actions, including reassigning the task to someone else and marking the task as complete. [![Take action on your tasks.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i16.png)

## Create and Update Deals Automatically[](#toc_5)

[Plays](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/14296116597901) enable you to create and update your deals automatically based on account and contact triggers. These automations help you better track your deals and reduces the time you spend on deal management.

To use plays to manage your deals:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Plays**](https://app.apollo.io/#/opportunities).
2.  Begin to [create a play](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413804036109). You can create one from scratch or use a template.
3.  For the `When` part of your play setup, select the **Based on a trigger event** option. Then, choose either **People** or **Companies** to find the contact-based and account-based trigger options and select your trigger event. This example shows the **Account updated** trigger event. [![Set when a play runs.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i42.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i42.png)
4.  Click **Continue**. Then, if needed, edit the `If` part of your play.
5.  For the `Then` part of your play setup, click either **Update deal** or **Create deal** depending on the automation you want to build. [![Choose to update or create deals.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i46.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i46.png)
6.  To update deals, choose the deal field that will be updated and potentially related information such as the deal pipeline. [![Update deals.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i45.png) ](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i45.png)To create deals, choose the relevant deal pipeline and select the stage the deal will update to when the automation is triggered. If this play is intended for only you or a single member of your team, choose a deal owner. [![Create deals.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i44.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i44.png)
7.  Click **Continue** to save your automation selection.
8.  (Optional) Click **Add action** within the `Then` part of your play to add more automations such as email or [Slack](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/22464817775117) notifications. Refer to [Create a Play](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413804036109) for more information.
9.  Name your play, then click **Save changes**. [![Save your deal.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i43.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_deals/i43.png)

Your deal-related play is now active. Repeat these steps to create or update more deals using automations in Apollo.

## Overview[](#toc_0)

The Apollo API enables you to connect CRMs and other third-party software to Apollo.

If you need help upgrading, reach out to the [Apollo sales team](https://apollo.na.chilipiper.com/router/sales_router?leadsource=Inbound&lead_source_details__c=KnowledgeBase) for guidance.

## Create a New API Key[](#toc_1)

To create a new API key:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations).
2.  Find the **API** option and click **Connect**. [![Connect API](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i2.png)
3.  On the Apollo API Quickstart page, click **Get Started** to read the technical documentation on how to enrich your data with an API and how to search with an API. [![Get Started](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i14.png)
4.  Click **API Keys** to view or create new API keys. Then, click **Create New Key** to generate a new API Key. [![Create New Key](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i15.png)
5.  Name your API Key and add a description. [![Name and Description](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i16.png)
    
    Don't Call Me Shirley!
    
    Give your new API Key a name that provides context to its use. Choose names like `Bulk Enrichment` or `Contact Search` and add thorough descriptions for additional context.
    
6.  Click the **APIs** drop-down, then click the checkboxes for the APIs you want to associate with the key. You can select multiple APIs. [![API Drop-Down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i17.png)
7.  Click **Create API Key**.

You have now created an API key.

## Test the Apollo API[](#toc_3)

There are many options for testing the API. For this article, Apollo is going to use [Postman](https://www.postman.com/downloads/), but the same information can be applied to your preferred testing methods.

To get started, create a new request in Postman. Select the **GET** method, then copy and paste `https://api.apollo.io/v1/auth/health` in the URL field.

[![New Request](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/postman_api_testing/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/postman_api_testing/i1.png)

Click the **Authorization** tab, then select **No Auth** from the **Auth Type** drop-down.

[![NO AUTH](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/postman_api_testing/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/postman_api_testing/i2.png)

Click the **Headers** tab, then add the following keys and values:

| Key | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Content-Type | application/json |
| Cache-Control | no-cache |
| X-Api-Key | Enter your Apollo API key |

[![Keys and Values](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/postman_api_testing/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/postman_api_testing/i3.png)

Click **Send**. This sends a request to the Apollo server to log into the API. If your setup is correct, you will receive the following JSON response:

```

{
"healthy": true, 
“is_logged_in”: true
}
```

If both values in the response are `true`, you are ready to [use the API](#toc_4).

False Response

If either object has a value of `False`, check your request details again. Delete any erroneous spaces or returns after your API key. Once you are sure your request is formatted appropriately, click **Send** to try again.

## Overview[](#toc_0)

If you have a CRM or other external system that Apollo does not support with a native integration, leverage Apollo's API to build custom solutions and integrations. The API enables you to update custom fields in Apollo programmatically, including pulling your own custom values from a CRM or external system.

API Key Required

Do you have an Apollo API key? You must configure access to the Apollo API before you can follow the steps in this article. Refer to [Configure Access to the Apollo API](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415734629773) to learn how to create an Apollo API key and test it.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Update a Contact's Custom Field Value[](#toc_1)

This process details how to find the IDs for custom fields and any accompanying picklist values. It then explains how to update those values using the appropriate endpoint. To review reference information for the API, refer to [Apollo's developer documentation](https://apolloio.github.io/apollo-api-docs/#introduction).

To update a custom field value for an Apollo contact:

1.  Call the following endpoint to retrieve a list of all custom fields in Apollo. Add your API key to the header (**Key**: `X-Api-Key`; **Value**: Enter your API key.).

```
GET https://api.apollo.io/v1/typed_custom_fields
```

2.  In the response, find the ID of each field for a contact that you want to update. To update picklist values, collect the IDs for each of the values.
    
    For this example, Apollo will update a custom field called `Custom Field Test`, as shown in the following sample response. The ID for the field is `5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702a`, and the ID for the `Option 1` picklist value is `5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702d`.
    

```
{
    "id": "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702a",
    "modality": "contact",
    "name": "Custom Field Test",
    "type": "picklist",
    "picklist_options": [],
    "mapped_crm_field": null,
    "additional_mapped_crm_field": null,
    "is_readonly_mapped_crm_field": null,
    "picklist_options_last_synced_at": "2020-12-03T01:04:44.000+00:00",
    "picklist_value_set_id": "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702b",
    "mirrored": false,
    "system_name": null,
    "text_field_max_length": null,
    "picklist_values": [
        {
            "_id": "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702d",
            "mapped_crm_values": {
                "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702a": null
            },
            "name": "Option 1",
            "id": "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702d",
            "key": "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702d"
        },
        {
            "_id": "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702e",
            "mapped_crm_values": {
                "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702a": null
            },
            "name": "Option 2",
            "id": "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702e",
            "key": "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702e"
        },
        {
            "_id": "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702f",
            "mapped_crm_values": {
                "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702a": null
            },
            "name": "Option 3",
            "id": "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702f",
            "key": "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702f"
    }
]
```

3.  With the IDs for your chosen field(s) and picklist value(s), call the following endpoint. Again, add your API key to the header.

```
PUT https://api.apollo.io/v1/contacts
```

4.  Insert the IDs in the `typed_custom_fields` parameter, as shown in the following example.

```
{
    "id": "RECORD_ID",
    "typed_custom_fields": {
        "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702a": [
            "5fc8399eb6ae07008cb7702d"
            ]
    }
}
```

A `200` response status confirms you updated the values successfully. To check, refresh the record in Apollo and review the information in the updated fields.

## Watch the Video[](#toc_1)

## Overview[](#toc_2)

If you have data in HubSpot that you'd like to make available in Apollo or if you want to keep your data in Apollo synchronized with HubSpot, you need to first integrate your HubSpot instance with Apollo.

Only One CRM at a Time

Please note, you can only connect one CRM to Apollo at a time. If you've already connected Salesforce to Apollo, you must first disable that integration before you can connect HubSpot.

Refer to the following steps to connect Apollo with HubSpot.

You Need Admin Superpowers

Please note, you need to be a super admin user in HubSpot and either have CRM edit permissions or be an admin in Apollo to connect the two platforms. For more information about HubSpot user permissions, hop into the [Super Admin](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/settings/hubspot-user-permissions-guide#super-admin) article in the HubSpot Knowledge Base. To learn more about user permissions in Apollo, feast your eyes on the [Create Permission Profiles](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409154208269-Create-Permission-Profiles) article in the Apollo Knowledge Base.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Connect Apollo to HubSpot[](#toc_3)

To integrate your HubSpot account with Apollo:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations).
2.  Click **Connect** in the **HubSpot** section. [![Connect](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i3.png)
3.  In the "Connect an Account" modal, click **Yes, Continue**. [![Yes, Continue](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i4.png)
4.  HubSpot redirects you to a page where you can select your Apollo account. Click the radio button next to Apollo and then click **Choose Account**. [![Choose Account](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i5.png)
5.  Review the permission settings on the HubSpot page and then click **Connect app**. [![Connect App](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i6.png)
6.  Click the checkbox next to **I'm not a robot** to confirm authorization. [![I'm not a robot](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i7.png)
7.  Your HubSpot account is now connected to Apollo. [![Integration Complete](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_hubspot_account/i8.png)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

Once you [connect your HubSpot account to Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416619021837), you can configure some of the fundamental ways that Apollo interacts with HubSpot.

Refer to the sections below for information about how to configure record visibility, manual sync between HubSpot and Apollo, push data to HubSpot from Apollo, and unlink your HubSpot account.

## Configure Record Visibility[](#toc_1)

To configure whether records pulled from HubSpot are visible to your team:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations).
2.  Click **View** for the HubSpot integration. [![View HubSpot Integration](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i3.png)
3.  In the **Record Visibility** section, you can configure whether contact, lead, and account records pulled from HubSpot are visible to other users in your account. By default, Apollo enables both settings.
    
    Enabling or disabling these options section does not impact data sync between Apollo and HubSpot. [![Record Visibility](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i11.png)
    
4.  When you're finished, click **Save**. [![Save](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i12.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Manually Pull Data from HubSpot[](#toc_2)

To manually pull data from HubSpot:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** \> [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations).
2.  Click **View** for the HubSpot integration. [![View HubSpot Integration](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i3.png)
3.  In the **Sync Now** section, you can manually pull records from HubSpot into Apollo. This is useful if you have made manual changes to HubSpot records that you want to capture in Apollo. Because you can only manually change the stage of a contact to a previous stage within HubSpot, these settings also capture those changes in Apollo. [![Sync Now](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i13.png)
4.  Click **Pull all HubSpot Contacts to Apollo Contacts** to initiate a manual sync for contacts. Click **Pull all HubSpot Companies to Apollo Accounts** to initiate a manual sync for companies.
5.  Click **Pull Now** to confirm your request. [![Pull Now](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i15.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Configure Your Push Settings[](#toc_3)

To access the push settings for the Apollo-HubSpot integration:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** \> [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations).
2.  Click **View** for the HubSpot integration. [![View HubSpot Integration](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i3.png)

Here, you can access several configuration options for your push settings. The following sections detail the various push settings available to you.

When you finish configuring your push settings, click **Save**.

[![Save](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i27.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

**Contacts**

1.  In the **Contacts** section, enable **Push Contacts** to push any newly created Apollo contacts to HubSpot. [![Push contacts to HubSpot.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i34.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i34.png)
2.  (Optional) If you only want to push contacts that are in specific stages, enable **Only create contacts in HubSpot if at certain stages**. Then, select the stages.
    
    You must enable the **Push Contacts** option in the previous step for this option to work. Otherwise, no contacts will be pushed to HubSpot. [![Stages](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i35.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i35.png)
    

  
**Emails**

1.  In the **Emails** section, configure how Apollo pushes outgoing and incoming emails to HubSpot. You can configure the following options:
    
    • **Outgoing emails sent within Apollo**: Pushes any outgoing emails that you send through Apollo to HubSpot.  
    • **Outgoing emails not sent within Apollo**: Pushes any outgoing emails that you send outside of Apollo through a mailbox connected to the platform to HubSpot.  
    • **Incoming emails that are replies to emails sent within Apollo**: Pushes replies to emails that you send through Apollo to HubSpot.  
    • **Incoming emails from all other sources**: Pushes any replies to emails that you send outside of Apollo through a mailbox connected to the platform to HubSpot.  
    • **Push emails even if sender or recipient doesn't exist in HubSpot**: Pushes emails from any of the enabled categories above to HubSpot, even if the sender or recipient does not have records in HubSpot. Enable this setting with caution—it may create contacts that you don't want in HubSpot.  
    [![Email Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i6.png)
    
    Apollo Chrome Extension Override
    
    If you use the Apollo Chrome extension, you can override the **Outgoing emails not sent within Apollo** option from the extension settings in Gmail.
    
2.  To configure the template format that Apollo uses when it pushes emails to HubSpot, click the cog icon. [![Advanced Options](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i8.png)
3.  Click the **Customize Title** checkbox, then edit the title template using the supported dynamic variables that Apollo lists in the pop-up. When you finish, click **Done**. [![Customize Title](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i17.png)

  
**Tasks**

1.  In the **Tasks** section, enable **Push Completed Tasks** to push completed Apollo tasks to HubSpot. [![Tasks](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i7.png)
2.  To configure the template format that Apollo uses when it pushes tasks to HubSpot, click the cog icon. [![Advanced Options](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i19.png)
3.  Click the **Customize Title** checkbox, then edit the title template using the supported dynamic variables that Apollo lists in the pop-up. When you're finished, click **Done**. [![Customize Title](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i20.png)

  
**Notes**

In the **Notes** section, toggle on **Push Notes** to push Apollo notes to HubSpot. [![Notes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i22.png)  
**Phone Calls**

1.  In the **Phone Calls** section, enable **Push Phone Calls** to push Apollo phone calls to HubSpot. [![Phone Calls](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i23.png)
2.  To configure the template format that Apollo uses when it pushes phone calls to HubSpot, click the cog icon. [![Advanced Options](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i24.png)
3.  Click the **Customize Title** checkbox, then edit the title template using the supported dynamic variables that Apollo lists in the pop-up. When you're finished, click **Done**. [![Customize Title](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i25.png)

**Contact Source and Account Source**

HubSpot does not have a default contact or account source field for Apollo to use, so you can choose with which HubSpot field you would like to sync this information.

To choose a HubSpot field for contacts:

1.  In the **Contact Source** section, click the **Pick one here** link. [![Pick one here](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i28.png)
2.  Choose a source option from the **Contact Source Field** drop-down. This HubSpot field type should be single-line text, and it should not be read-only.
    
    Click **OK** to save your changes. [![Contact Source Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i29.png)
    

To choose a HubSpot field for accounts:

1.  In the **Account Source** section, click the **Pick one here** link. [![Pick one here](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i31.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i31.png)
2.  Choose a source option from the **Account Source Field** drop-down. This HubSpot field type should be single-line text, and it should not be read-only.
    
    Click **OK** to save your changes. [![Account Source Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i32.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i32.png)
    

Create a Custom Contact or Account Field in HubSpot

For more information about how to create a custom contact or account field in HubSpot, refer to HubSpot's [Create and edit properties](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/crm-setup/manage-your-properties) article.

  
**Save Push Settings**

When you finish configuring your push settings, click **Save.** [![Save](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i27.png) ](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i27.png)[Back to Top](#top)

## Remove Duplicate Records[](#h_01HKD9MZHRG27CJPGNE3KZ2JP8)

If duplicate records have already been synced from HubSpot to Apollo, you have 2 options for removing them:

*   **Delete**: If you enable the appropriate settings in Apollo, you can delete duplicate records in either Apollo or HubSpot and the deletion will sync for both.
*   **Merge**: If you enable the appropriate settings in Apollo, you can merge duplicate records in HubSpot and the changes will sync to Apollo. Once you merge a duplicate, Apollo will only sync information for the remaining record with HubSpot.

To change these settings, launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations). Then, click **View** for the HubSpot integration. Here, you can adjust the deletion and merge sync settings for the HubSpot integration. [![Edit the merge and deletion sync settings.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_hubspot_integration_works_in_apollo/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_hubspot_integration_works_in_apollo/i8.png)

It Pays to Be Proactive!

If you pull duplicate records from HubSpot and then [merge them in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413326420621), Apollo does not merge them in HubSpot. To prevent the records from syncing again, either delete them or merge the duplicate in HubSpot.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Unlink Your HubSpot Account[](#h_01HKD9GFKBYV738DP1BPHZ9DZ1)

All Users Must Unlink Their Accounts

To fully disconnect HubSpot from Apollo, all users in Apollo must unlink their accounts. When you have all followed the instructions below, make sure you check your profiles in the **Settings** section to confirm you have unlinked your HubSpot account.

To unlink your HubSpot account from Apollo:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations).
2.  Click **View** for the HubSpot integration. [![View HubSpot Integration](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i3.png)
3.  Click **Unlink Account**. [![Unlink Account](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_hubspot_push_settings/i9.png)

Your HubSpot account is now disconnected from Apollo.

## Watch the Video[](#toc_0) ## Overview[](#toc_1) Apollo allows you to manually configure and change the way that HubSpot fields are mapped to Apollo fields. This helps ensure that you map data correctly across both systems. Refer to the sections below for details about how to update data mapping between Apollo and HubSpot. [Back to Top](#top) ## Understand Default Field Mapping[](#toc_2) By default, when you connect Apollo to your HubSpot account, Apollo automatically syncs the following fields with HubSpot: | Type | Synced Data | | --- | --- | | Apollo Contact Push | * Company
* Owner
* First Name
* Last Name
* Email
* Title
* Phone
* Address | | Apollo Account Push | * Owner
* Name
* Address
* Phone
* Domain from Account
* Founded Year | | HubSpot Contact Pull | * Company
* Owner
* First Name
* Last Name
* Email
* Title
* Phone
* Address | | HubSpot Account Pull | * Owner
* Name
* Address
* Phone
* Website/Domain | ## Customize Default Field Mapping[](#h_01HSHM3DMEW1KMC4VXEEEJPX34) You do not need to change the [default field mapping](#toc_2), but you can customize the mapping if you prefer Apollo fields to sync with different HubSpot fields. To customize the mapping between Apollo and HubSpot fields: 1. Launch Apollo and then click the [integrations icon](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations). [![Integrations icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i12.png) 2. Click **View** in the **HubSpot** section. [![View HubSpot Integration](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i3.png) 3. Click the **Contact Mappings** or **Account Mappings** tab, and then click **Default Fields**. [![Default Fields Tab in HubSpot Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i9.png) 4. Click the drop-down arrow next to the HubSpot field for which you want to amend the mapping. Then, select a field from the list. [![Drop-Down Arrow Example](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i10.png) 5. Repeat the process for any other fields that you want to update. Then, click **Save**. [![Save Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i11.png) You have now updated the contact or account mapping for default fields. [Back to Top](#top) ## Map Apollo Stages with HubSpot[](#toc_3) Apollo Stage Automapping Please note, while you can manually map Apollo stages to HubSpot, Apollo automapping is also available. 1. Launch Apollo and then click the [integrations icon](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations). [![Integrations icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i12.png) 2. Click **View** in the **HubSpot** section. [![View HubSpot Integration](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i3.png) 3. Click the **Mappings** tab. [![View Mappings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i4.png) 4. The "Mappings" tab provides you with a view of all of the contact and account stages in Apollo and how they are mapped to status fields in HubSpot. [![Mappings Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i5.png) 5. If you need to change the status field that HubSpot uses for tracking contact stages in Apollo, click the first drop-down on the left and then select a new HubSpot status field. [![HubSpot Contact Status Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i6.png) 6. If you need to change the status field that HubSpot uses for tracking account stages in Apollo, click the first drop-down on the right and then select a new HubSpot status field. [![HubSpot Account Status Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i7.png) 7. Click a different option in the drop-down next to any Apollo contact or account stages that you want to map to a different HubSpot status. [![Apollo Stage Update](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_hubspot_data_mapping/i8.png) Apollo automatically saves all your changes. All For One And One For All Please note, to ensure optimal stage mapping functionality, make sure that you only map one Apollo stage to one HubSpot status and vice versa. If you try to map the same Apollo stage to multiple HubSpot fields or the same HubSpot status to multiple Apollo fields, stage mapping between HubSpot and Apollo may not function accurately. If you ever need to change the name of a HubSpot status after you’ve mapped it in Apollo, or if you add a new status entirely, it’s important to make sure you reflect those changes in Apollo and update your mappings. This way, Apollo can continue to map 1:1 with all of your HubSpot statuses. Similarly, any time you delete a status in HubSpot, you must delete the Apollo stage to which you mapped it and move the contact/accounts associated with that stage to an active one. You must also map this stage to a status in HubSpot. Have additional HubSpot-related questions? Visit [the HubSpot section of the Apollo Knowledge Base](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/sections/4409222292621-HubSpot) for more info! Or, for a general overview of how contact and account stages work in Apollo, [check out this article!](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410623601165-Contact-and-Account-Stages-Overview) [Back to Top](#top)

## Watch the Video[](#toc_7)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

Integrating Salesforce with Apollo enables you to access and keep your data synchronized within both platforms.

Before you integrate Salesforce with Apollo though, there are several important details to remember that can help you streamline the setup process and reduce the risk of unnecessary errors when integrating Salesforce.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Understand Salesforce Pull Settings[](#toc_1)

[![Salesforce Pull Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i1.png)

Pull settings relate to how Apollo pulls data from your Salesforce instance. Apollo must always pull your leads, contacts, and accounts from Salesforce. This allows Apollo to remove any matches from the Apollo database. It also prevents your team from accidentally prospecting records in Apollo that already exist in Salesforce.

Out of Sight, Out of Mind!

You cannot disable the automatic pull feature, but you can hide Salesforce leads, contacts, accounts, and opportunities from view in Apollo. For more information, follow the steps in the [Configure Your Salesforce Pull Settings](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414496822797-Configure-Your-Salesforce-Pull-Settings%20) article.

When Apollo identifies a lead and a contact for the same person in your Salesforce instance, Apollo always pulls the contact, not the lead. This is the only form of deduplication that Apollo runs against your Salesforce instance.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Understand Salesforce Push Settings[](#toc_2)

[![Salesforce Push Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i2.png)

Push settings relate to how Apollo pushes data from Apollo into your Salesforce instance. Unlike the pull settings, you can [enable or disable Salesforce push settings](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414469523981-Configure-Your-Salesforce-Push-Settings).

You can choose whether to sync all your Apollo-sourced records with Salesforce. However, Apollo always syncs all Salesforce-sourced records with Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Avoid Duplicate Records[](#toc_3)

There are several key duplication rules to keep in mind before connecting Salesforce.

When you integrate Salesforce, Apollo mirrors the data in your Salesforce instance. If you have duplicate leads, contact, or accounts in Salesforce, these same duplicates reflect in Apollo too. To avoid duplicate records post-sync, clean and deduplicate your Salesforce instance before you integrate the 2 platforms.

If Apollo pulls a duplicate from Salesforce, Apollo displays a potential duplicate message on the contact or account's profile page to notify you. You can also identify the record creation source from the activity log.

[![Duplicate Notification and Record Source](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i4.png)

When you manually create a duplicate record in Salesforce, Apollo automatically creates the same record. Likewise, if you enable the Salesforce push settings and create a duplicate record in Apollo, Salesforce creates the same record within your Salesforce instance.

Apollo does not automatically delete or merge the duplicates that you manually create. If you decide to delete or merge any of these records, you must do so manually.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Remove Duplicate Records[](#toc_4)

If duplicate records have already been synced from Salesforce to Apollo, you have 2 options for removing them:

*   **Delete**: If you enable the appropriate settings in Apollo, you can delete duplicate records in either Apollo or Salesforce and the deletion will sync for both.
*   **Merge**: If you enable the appropriate settings in Apollo, you can merge duplicate records in Salesforce and the changes will sync to Apollo. Once you merge a duplicate, Apollo will only sync information for the remaining record with Salesforce.

To change these settings, launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations). Click **View** for the Salesforce integration, and then click **Edit** for the Salesforce authentication settings.

Here, you can adjust the deletion and merge sync settings for the Salesforce integration.

[![Edit the merge and deletion sync settings.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i22.png)

It Pays to Be Proactive!

If you pull duplicate records from Salesforce and then [merge them in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413326420621-Merge-Duplicate-Records-to-Consolidate-Your-Data), Apollo does not merge them in Salesforce. To prevent the records from syncing again, either delete them or merge the duplicate in Salesforce.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Map Fields[](#toc_5)

[![Auto-Fill and Auto Overwrite](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i20.png)

If you decide to enable autofill or auto overwrite for mapped fields, keep the following in mind:

*   When you select **Autofill**, Apollo automatically uses information within the Apollo database to fill in the field from Salesforce. This only happens if a field is empty and Apollo has relevant information available.
*   When you select **Auto Overwrite**, Apollo automatically overwrites the existing information in the field from Salesforce with the information within Apollo. This only happens if the information differs between the 2 platforms and Apollo has relevant information available.

To configure autofill or auto overwrite, refer to the [Map Default Apollo Fields in Salesforce](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/7699404190221-Map-Apollo-Default-Fields-to-Salesforce) article. Autofill and auto overwrite only run when Apollo pulls information from Salesforce.

Manual Has the Last Word

Manual actions always take precedence. If you manually enrich a field from the CRM Enrichment page, Apollo pushes that update even if you have disabled the autofill or auto overwrite setting for the field.

[Back to Top](#top)

## View Errors[](#toc_6)

[![Error Log](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i13.png)

Leverage the [error log in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/7683909560845-Access-the-Salesforce-Error-Log-in-Apollo) to view any sync errors that Apollo receives from your Salesforce instance.

The error log only displays errors that Apollo receives when pushing information to Salesforce. These errors are responses from Salesforce, and they usually indicate a restriction on Salesforce's side, such as hitting a custom validation rule or rate limits for your connected instance.

If you are still unsure whether your data is syncing correctly, you can gain a more granular view of [error sync history at the contact or account level](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/7683909560845-Access-the-Salesforce-Error-Log-in-Apollo#toc_3).

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

Integrating HubSpot with Apollo enables you to access and keep your data synchronized within both platforms.

Before you integrate HubSpot with Apollo though, there are several important details to remember that can help you streamline the setup process and reduce the risk of unnecessary errors when integrating HubSpot.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Understand HubSpot Pull Settings[](#toc_1)

Apollo must always pull your contacts and accounts from HubSpot. This allows Apollo to remove any matches from the Apollo database. It also prevents your team from accidentally prospecting records in Apollo that already exist in HubSpot.

You can also [manually pull contacts and accounts from HubSpot](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416606988941#toc_3) at any time.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Understand HubSpot Push Settings[](#toc_2)

[![HubSpot Push Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_hubspot_integration_works_in_apollo/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_hubspot_integration_works_in_apollo/i2.png)

Push settings relate to how Apollo pushes data from Apollo into your HubSpot instance. Unlike the pull settings, you can [enable or disable HubSpot push settings](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416606988941#toc_4).

You can choose whether to sync all your Apollo-sourced records with HubSpot. However, Apollo always syncs all HubSpot-sourced records with Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Avoid Duplicate Records[](#toc_3)

There are several key duplication rules to keep in mind before connecting HubSpot.

When you integrate HubSpot, Apollo mirrors the data in your HubSpot instance. If you have duplicate contacts or accounts in HubSpot, these same duplicates reflect in Apollo too. To avoid duplicate records post-sync, clean and deduplicate your HubSpot instance before you integrate the 2 platforms.

If Apollo pulls a duplicate from HubSpot, Apollo displays a potential duplicate message on the contact's or account's profile page to notify you. You can also identify the record creation source from the activity log.

[![Duplicate contact message.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_hubspot_integration_works_in_apollo/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_hubspot_integration_works_in_apollo/i4.png)

When you manually create a duplicate record in HubSpot, Apollo automatically creates the same record. Likewise, if you enable the HubSpot push settings and create a duplicate record in Apollo, HubSpot creates the same record within your HubSpot instance.

Apollo does not automatically delete or merge the duplicates that you manually create. If you decide to delete or merge any of these records, you must do so manually.

I've Already Got Duplicates!

As much as you try, you might still have duplicate records in Apollo. To delete or merge duplicate records in Apollo, refer to [Configure HubSpot Basic Settings](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416606988941).

[Back to Top](#top)

## Map Fields[](#toc_4)

[![Autofill and Auto Overwrite](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_hubspot_integration_works_in_apollo/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_hubspot_integration_works_in_apollo/i3.png)

If you decide to enable autofill or auto overwrite for mapped fields, keep the following in mind:

*   When you select **Autofill**, Apollo automatically uses information within the Apollo database to fill in the field from HubSpot. This only happens if a field is empty and Apollo has relevant information available.
*   When you select **Auto Overwrite**, Apollo automatically overwrites the existing information in the field from HubSpot with the information within Apollo. This only happens if the information differs between the 2 platforms and Apollo has relevant information available.

Autofill and auto overwrite only run when Apollo pulls information from HubSpot.

Manual Has the Last Word

Manual actions always take precedence. If you manually enrich a field from the CRM Enrichment page, Apollo pushes that update even if you have disabled the autofill or auto overwrite setting for the field.

[Back to Top](#top)

## View Errors[](#toc_5)

Leverage the [HubSpot error log in Apollo](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations/hubspot/errors) to view any sync errors that Apollo receives from your HubSpot instance.

The error log only displays errors that Apollo receives when pushing information to HubSpot. These errors are responses from HubSpot, and they usually indicate a restriction on HubSpot's side, such as hitting a custom validation rule or rate limits for your connected instance.

[![View the error log for the HubSpot integration.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_hubspot_integration_works_in_apollo/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_hubspot_integration_works_in_apollo/i5.png)

Ready to Rock 'n' Roll!

Now that you know more about how the Apollo-HubSpot integration works, you are ready to set up the integration! Start by following the steps in [Connect Apollo to Your HubSpot Account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416619021837).

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Apollo allows you to sync data to and from Salesforce with your personal Salesforce credentials or with your **Team Sync** credentials. Apollo can synchronize record ownership and activity logs with Salesforce depending on which credentials you use.

Connect Salesforce to Apollo First

Please note, in order to configure data synchronization between Apollo and Salesforce, you must first connect Salesforce to your Apollo account. Refer to the "[Connect Apollo to Your Salesforce Account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414356051725-Connect-Apollo-to-Your-Salesforce-Account)" article for additional information.

Refer to the sections below for information about the different types of credentials you can use to synchronize data between Apollo and Salesforce.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Personal Salesforce Credentials[](#toc_2)

The **My Salesforce Credentials** setting in Apollo is user-specific and represents your personal Salesforce account.

[![My Salesforce Credentials](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_credentials/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_credentials/i1.png)

Once you add your Salesforce credentials, Apollo can sync your actions in the platform with your actions in Salesforce when you configure the **[Pull](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414496822797-Configure-Your-Salesforce-Pull-Settings)** and **[Push](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414469523981-Configure-Your-Salesforce-Push-Settings)** settings in your Salesforce integration.

Apollo expects that all users with Salesforce accounts will connect their own credentials to sync with Apollo.

One Set of Salesforce Credentials to an Apollo User

Please note, you must connect a different set of Salesforce credentials for every user in Apollo. Apollo does not allow 2 or more users to connect with the same Salesforce credentials.

Connecting your personal Salesforce account allows you to sync the following information with the data record:

*   **Ownership**: When you are assigned as the owner of a contact or an account in either Apollo or Salesforce, you are shown as the owner in both places. For more information on ownership, see the "[Which Apollo record owner is assigned to a contact or account in Salesforce?](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415275645069)" article.
*   **Logs**: When Apollo logs activity for a contact in Apollo, Salesforce also logs you as the record creator of the corresponding log in Salesforce. This applies to emails, notes, tasks, calls, and meetings/calendar events.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Team Sync Credentials[](#toc_3)

Salesforce **Team Sync** authentication credentials are always applied app-wide for all users. They are used as the primary connection between Apollo and Salesforce.

Salesforce lets you configure many different levels of permissions. It is essential that the login you use for your **Team Sync** authentication credentials belongs to a Salesforce user with both "read and write" permissions for all of the objects and fields you're syncing to ensure that Apollo can save them successfully.

Admin Connections

Please note, you must first connect a Salesforce account to Apollo before it is available as Salesforce **Team Sync** authentication credentials. If the chosen superuser doesn't have full admin permissions in Salesforce, the Salesforce integration will not work as expected.

For more information about connecting **Team Sync** credentials to your Salesforce integration, please see the "[Connect 'Team Sync' Authentication Credentials To Your Salesforce Integration](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415294638733)" article.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Salesforce Record Owner[](#toc_4)

Whether or not you want to authenticate your personal Salesforce credentials, if you have an existing Salesforce account, you should assign it to your account in your Apollo **You** profile. To update your profile, click **Settings** and then search for your user name in the **Salesforce** section on the "General" tab.

[![My Salesforce Credentials](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_credentials/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_credentials/i4.png)

This allows Apollo to assign all of the contacts, accounts, or activities that you own to your account once you sync with Salesforce. Without this information, Salesforce will use the Salesforce credentials assigned to **Team Sync** as the record owner.

[Back to Top](#top)
