## Overview[](#toc_2)

If you have data in Salesforce that you'd like to make available in Apollo or if you want to keep your data in Apollo synchronized with Salesforce, you need to first integrate your Salesforce instance with Apollo.

Let's Go Play In the Sandbox!

Please note, Apollo recommends you create a new or separate Apollo instance to [connect your sandbox](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations/salesforce/link-sandbox?_k=v1cn7w). This allows you to experiment with your sandbox first without risking any conflicts or duplicates of the data synced between Salesforce and your regular instance. Then, once you're ready to link your actual Salesforce account to Apollo, you can do so in your regular Apollo instance.

Having trouble connecting? You may need to allow OAuth username-password flows in your Salesforce account first. Refer to [this Salesforce article](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=release-notes.rn_security_username-password_flow_blocked_by_default.htm&release=244&type=5) for further information.

Refer to the following steps to connect Apollo with your Salesforce account.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Connect Apollo to Salesforce[](#toc_3)

Hold Your Horses!

Have you read [this article](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/7525314188173-Important-Information-about-the-Apollo-Salesforce-Integration) on how the integration works? If not, sneak a quick peek before you connect so you can streamline the set-up process and reduce the risk of unnecessary errors when integrating your Salesforce account with Apollo.

To connect Apollo to Salesforce:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations).
2.  Click **Connect** in the Salesforce integration menu. [![Connect](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_salesforce_account/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_salesforce_account/i3.png)
3.  Click **Yes, Continue**. [![Continue](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_salesforce_account/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_salesforce_account/i4.png)
4.  Click **Allow**. [![Allow](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_salesforce_account/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_salesforce_account/i5.png)
5.  You have now connected Apollo to your Salesforce account. [![Complete](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_salesforce_account/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/connect_apollo_to_your_salesforce_account/i6.png)
    
    IP Range Restrictions
    
    Please note, Apollo does not support fixed IP ranges in Salesforce. Apollo IPs are dynamic, which means that they are subject to change over time. If you have set up IP range restrictions in Salesforce and encounter issues when linking Salesforce with Apollo, please refer to [this Salesforce help doc](https://developer.salesforce.com/forums/?id=9060G0000005n72QAA) for more information on disabling IP range restrictions.

### Configure "Pull Records" Settings[](#toc_3)

From the "Salesforce Integration Setup" page, click **View** under "Pull Records."

[![Get Started](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i4.png)

#### Contacts/Leads[](#toc_4)

On the "Contacts/Leads" tab, click **Yes** or **No** on the first toggle to enable or disable whether Salesforce contacts and leads are visible in Apollo.

[![Enable Lead Visability](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i6.png)

Salesforce Contacts and Leads in Apollo

Please note, Apollo automatically pulls all Salesforce contacts and leads into Apollo to dedupe records. You cannot disable this feature, only hide Salesforce contacts and leads by switching the first toggle to **No**.

Click **Yes** or **No** on the second toggle to enable or disable whether Salesforce contacts pulled into Apollo should automatically be matched to accounts/companies in Apollo. [![Enable Automatic Match](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i7.png)

Contacts Vs. Leads

Please note that when Apollo pulls a _contact_ from Salesforce, Apollo respects the specific account assigned to it in Salesforce. For example, if you have duplicate accounts for Example.io in Salesforce, Apollo pulls those duplicates into Apollo and associates the contact with the right duplicate using the Salesforce account ID.

However, Salesforce _leads_ do not have accounts with which to pull into Apollo by default. This means that Apollo randomly assigns a lead pulled from Salesforce to any account that matches the domain for that lead. For example, if a lead's email is joansmith@example.io and you have more than 1 Example.io account in your Salesforce instance, Apollo randomly assigns the lead to one of those Example.io accounts.

Click **Pull all Salesforce Leads/Contacts to Apollo contacts** to trigger a manual pull of your Salesforce data.

[![Pull all Salesforce Leads/Contacts to Apollo contacts](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i8.png)

Automatic Data Sync

Please note, Apollo automatically pulls contact and lead data from Salesforce every 15 minutes.

Click **Save** to finalize your changes.

[![Save](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i16.png)

Salesforce Accounts in Apollo

Click **Yes** or **No** on the second toggle to enable or disable whether Apollo should try to intelligently infer missing company name or website information for Salesforce accounts that are missing one of those pieces of information and then try to further enrich account information from the Apollo database.

Error Risk

Automatic Data Sync

## Overview[](#toc_1)

If you use Apollo for data but use Marketo for engagement, you can enrich your existing contacts in Marketo with up-to-date information from Apollo.

The benefits of instant enrichment include:

*   **Accuracy**: Ensure the data you gather from lead capture forms in Marketo is correct and up-to-date.
*   **Streamlined Workflow**: Remove unnecessary steps when working between Apollo and Marketo.
*   **Specificity**: Guarantee the leads that best match your [Ideal Customer Profile](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416471135245-Identify-Your-Ideal-Customer-Profile-ICP-) include all the data points that you need to execute your engagement strategy effectively.
*   **Instant Data Fill**: The data you enrich from Apollo to Marketo is instant.

Enrichment Rate Limit and Cost

Please note, Apollo enriches your records at a rate limit of **100 records per minute** and **300 records per hour**. Each successful enrichment costs **0.01** data credit.

Refer to the sections below for instructions on how to access your Apollo API Key, create a webhook, and set up enrichment field mapping in Marketo to enrich your existing Marketo contacts with Apollo data.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Access Your Apollo API Key[](#toc_2)

You need to access your **Apollo API Key** before you can use Apollo to enrich your Marketo contacts.

Apollo API Key

Please note, if you already have your **Apollo API Key**, you can skip this step.

Launch Apollo and click **Settings**. Then, click **Integrations**.

[![Settings—Integrations](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i1.png)

Scroll to **API** and click **Connect**.

[![Connect API](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i2.png)

This takes you to the **API Settings** page which displays your **Rate Limits** and contains a link to the [Apollo API documentation](https://apolloio.github.io/apollo-api-docs/#introduction). Click **Request API Key** to continue with the setup.

[![Request API Key](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i3.png)

Copy your unique **API Key** to your clipboard with `ctrl+c` on PC or `cmd+c` on Mac.

[![Copy API Key](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/api_setup/i4.png)

API Key Safety

Please note, you need to keep this key in a safe place. Anyone with access to this key can take action through your Apollo account.

## Create a Webhook in Marketo[](#toc_3)

Launch Marketo, click **Admin**, then click **Webhooks**.

[![Admin_Webhook](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/marketo_integration/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/marketo_integration/i5.png)

Copy and paste the link below into the **URL** field:

https://api.apollo.io/v1/people/match?api\_key=YOUR\_API\_KEY&first\_name={{lead.First 
Name:default=}}&last\_name={{lead.Last Name:default=}}

## Set Up Enrichment Field Mapping in Marketo[](#toc_4)

Scroll to the **Response Mapping** section and click **Edit**. Then, click **Add**.

Under **Response Attribute** select the **Apollo Attribute** that you want to use.

[![Response Attribute](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/marketo_integration/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/marketo_integration/i8.png)

You can choose from the following **Apollo Attributes**:

| Attribute Type | Apollo Response Attribute | Description | Value Format |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **Contact First Name** | person.first\_name | Refers to the contact's first name (if it exists) | String |
| **Contact Last Name** | person.last\_name | Refers to the contact's last name (if it exists) | String |
| **Contact Name** | person.name | Refers to the contact's full name (if it exists) | String |
| **LinkedIn Profile** | person.linkedin\_url | Refers to the contact's LinkedIn profile | String |
| **Facebook Profile** | person.facebook\_url | Refers to the contact's Facebook profile | String |
| **Twitter Profile** | person.twitter\_url | Refers to the contact's Twitter profile | String |
| **Job Title** | person.title | Refers to the contact's job title | String |
| **City** | person.city | Refers to the current city whereby the contact resides | String |
| **State** | person.state | Refers to the current state whereby the contact resides | String |
| **Country** | person.country | Refers to the current country whereby the contact resides | String |
| **Company Name** | person.organization.name | Refers to the name of the company in which the contact is currently employed | String |
| **Company Website** | person.organization.website\_url | Refers to the company website (e.g. http://www.google.com) | String |
| **AngelList URL** | person.organization.angellist\_url | Refers to the company AngelList URL | String |
| **Company LinkedIn Profile** | person.organization.linkedin\_url | Refers to the company LinkedIn profile | String |
| **Company Twitter Profile** | person.organization.twitter\_url | Refers to the company Twitter profile | String |
| **Company Facebook Profile** | person.organization.facebook\_url | Refers to the company Facebook profile | String |
| **Company Domain** | person.organization.domain | Refers to the company domain (e.g. google.com) | String |
| **Company Headcount** | person.organization.estimated\_num\_employees | Refers to an estimate of the company size (e.g. 13) | Integer |
| **Company Phone Number** | person.organization.phone | Refers to the company's primary phone number | String |
| **Alexa Ranking** | person.organization.alexa\_ranking | Refers to the Alexa ranking of the company's primary website | Integer |
| **Company Languages** | person.organization.languages | Refers to a list of the languages that the company website supports | Array of String |
| **Company Logo** | person.organization.logo\_url | Refers to the company's logo | String |
| **Industry** | person.organization.industry | Refers to the industry in which the company is located | String |
| **HQ Address** | person.organization.raw\_address | Refers to the raw address of the company's global headquarters | String |
| **HQ City** | person.organization.city | Refers to the city in which the company's global headquarters is based | String |
| **HQ State** | person.organization.state | Refers to the state in which the company's global headquarters is based | String |
| **HQ Country** | person.organization.country | Refers to the country in which the company's global headquarters is based | String |
| **Publicly Traded Symbol** | person.organization.publicly\_traded\_symbol | Refers to the company's ticker symbol, if it is publicly traded (e.g. AAPL for Apple) | String |
| **Publicly Traded Exchange** | person.organization.publicly\_traded\_exchange | Refers to the name of the stock exchange in which the company is listed (e.g. NYSE) | String |
| **Company SEO Description** | person.organization.seo\_description | Refers to the brief description that the company uses to describe itself for SEO purposes | String |
| **Total Funding** | person.organization.total\_funding | Refers to the total funding the company has raised in USD (e.g. 120000000) | Integer |
| **Latest Funding Round Date** | person.organization.latest\_funding\_round\_date | Refers to the date of the latest funding the company has received, if any (e.g. 2016-05-01T00:00:00.000+00:00) | String |
| **Latest Funding Stage** | person.organization.latest\_funding\_stage | Refers to the stage of the company's latest funding, if any (e.g. Series A) | String |
| **Number of Retail Locations** | person.organization.retail\_location\_count | Refers to the total number of retail locations that the company has | Integer |
| **Annual Revenue** | person.organization.annual\_revenue | Refers to an estimate of the company's current revenue in USD (e.g. 120000000) | Integer |
| **Technology** | person.organization.technology\_names | Refers to a list of the technologies that the company currently uses | Array of String |

No Spaces

Please note, if you experience any issues, double-check that there are no extra spaces before or after each **Response Attribute**. Please verify this is the case before you click **Save** in Marketo.

Value Formats

Please note, you do not need to know the value formats in order to set up **Enrichment Field Mapping** in Marketo. However, if you use the **Apollo API** regularly, you may wish to know what each value format stands for:

*   **String** fields show a series of characters that correspond to one value. For example:  
    `“person.organization.country”: "Brazil"`  
    Please note, in the **Apollo API**, you need to wrap **Strings** in quotations marks.
*   **Integer** fields return a single number value. For example:  
    `“person.organization.annual_revenue”: 4000000`  
    Please note, in the **Apollo API**, you should not use quotations marks for **Integers**.
*   **Array of String** fields return a series of characters that correspond to multiple values. For example:  
    `“person.organization.technology_names” : ["Cloudflare DNS", "Mailchimp Mandrill"]`  
    Please note, in the **Apollo API** you need to wrap all **Arrays of Strings** in brackets.

Under **Marketo Field** select the corresponding field in Marketo.

[![Marketo Field](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/marketo_integration/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/marketo_integration/i9.png)

Add Additional Fields

Please note, you can add as many fields as necessary. Repeat the above process to add additional fields.

When you are ready, click **Save**.

[![Save](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/marketo_integration/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/marketo_integration/i10.png)

You are now ready to trigger your webhook in Marketo.

Enrich Leads with Marketo Triggers

For more information about how to use your new **Webhook** to enrich leads with Marketo's built-in **Triggers**, please refer to the ["Use a Webhook in a Smart Campaign"](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/docs/marketo/using/product-docs/core-marketo-concepts/smart-campaigns/flow-actions/use-a-webhook-in-a-smart-campaign.html) article in the Marketo Knowledge Base.

## Overview[](#toc_2)

Once you've [connected your Salesforce account to Apollo](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations/salesforce), you can configure how Apollo pushes data from the platform into Salesforce.

Refer to the section below to [configure the push settings](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations/salesforce/push/contacts) for Salesforce contacts/leads, accounts, opportunities, activities, tasks, meetings, and notes.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Step 0: Access Your Salesforce Integration Settings[](#toc_3)

To access your integration settings:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations).
2.  Click **View** under the Salesforce integration. [![View](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_integration_settings/i3.png)

You can now configure the various Salesforce integration settings.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Step 1: Configure Push Records Settings[](#toc_4)

To configure the push records settings:

1.  From the [Salesforce Integration Setup page](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations/salesforce), click **Not Started** under "Push Records."
2.  On the [Push Records to Salesforce](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations/salesforce/push/contacts) page there are 4 tabs to configure the various items that Apollo can pull from Salesforce:
    
    *   Contacts/Leads
    *   Accounts
    *   Opportunities
    *   Activities, Tasks, Meetings, and Notes
    
    [![Push Records to Salesforce](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i3.png)

#### Contacts/Leads[](#toc_5)

To configure push record settings for your contacts and leads:

1.  On the "Contacts/Leads" tab, click the first toggle to enable or deactivate the pushing of new Apollo contacts to Salesforce. [![Lead Visibility](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i2.png)
    
    Beware of Mischievous Duplicates
    
    Please note that when you request a net new contact in Apollo and push it to Salesforce as a contact, if the contact matches multiple existing accounts in Salesforce, Apollo randomly chooses which account to sync the contact to. For example, let's say you save John Smith from Example.io to your team but in your Apollo or Salesforce instances, you have 2 Example.io accounts. Apollo randomly assigns John Smith to 1 of the 2 duplicate accounts.
    
2.  After you have enabled pushing new contacts to Salesforce, you can configure several other options on the page. In **Create new records in Salesforce as Contacts or Leads?** click the drop-down to determine whether you want to use the contact or lead object in Salesforce for new people records. [![Contact or Lead](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i4.png)
3.  Click the second toggle on the page to enable or deactivate the pushing of contacts from Apollo to Salesforce based on their Apollo stage. [![Push contacts based on their stage in Apollo](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i5.png)
4.  Once you have enabled that setting, click any of the stages in your account that you would like to use for pushing Apollo contact data to Salesforce. [![Contact Stages](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i6.png)
5.  If you would like the source field in Salesforce to show something other than "Apollo," type a new name in the **For Contacts that are pushed to Salesforce, what should their “Source” be?** text box. [![For Contacts that are pushed to Salesforce, what should their “Source” be?](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i7.png)
6.  If you would like to push [Apollo guessed emails](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4420547185933) to Salesforce, click the third toggle to enable this feature. [![Push guessed emails into Salesforce](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i8.png)
7.  When you're finished, click **Save** to preserve your changes. [![Save](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i9.png)
    
    The Golden Oldies Vs. The Newbies!
    
    Please note, the **Salesforce Push Settings** only apply to net new contacts that you save in Apollo or [import from a CSV file](hhttps://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409161532045-Upload-a-CSV-of-Contacts-to-Apollo). Apollo pushes any updates to your existing contacts automatically, whether you activate this setting or not.
    

[Back to Top](#top)

#### Accounts[](#toc_6)

To configure push record settings for your accounts:

1.  On the "Accounts" tab, click the first toggle to enable or deactivate the pushing of new Apollo accounts to Salesforce. [![Save](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i10.png)
2.  Click the second toggle on the page to enable or disable pushing accounts from Apollo to Salesforce based on their Apollo stage. [![Push accounts based on their stage in Apollo](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i11.png)
3.  Once you have enabled that setting, click any of the stages in your account that you would like to use for pushing Apollo account data to Salesforce. [![Push accounts based on their stage in Apollo](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i12.png)

[![Which Salesforce field should we use for Account source?](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i14.png)
6.  When you're finished, click **Save** to preserve your changes. [![Save](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i15.png)

#### Activities, Tasks, Meetings, and Notes[](#toc_8)

On the "Tasks" tab, there are several sections you can configure to fine-tune which data Apollo pushes to Salesforce:

1.  In the **Emails** section, click the toggles to enable or deactivate the following options:
    
    *   Push outgoing emails sent within Apollo
    *   Push outgoing emails not sent within Apollo
    *   Push incoming emails that are replies to emails sent within Apollo
    *   Push incoming emails from all other sources
    *   Push emails even if sender or recipient doesn't exist in Salesforce
    
    [![Email Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i18.png)
    
    Push emails even if sender or recipient doesn't exist in Salesforce
    
    Please note, you should enable the **Push emails even if the sender or recipient doesn't exist in Salesforce** setting with caution as it may result in creating contacts in Salesforce that you do not want to see.
    
2.  Click **View Advanced Settings** if you would like to customize the **Title Template** that Apollo uses when pushing email data to Salesforce. [![Advanced Email Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i19.png) [![Customize Title](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i20.png)
    
    Update With Caution
    
    Please note, you should exercise caution when you edit this setting. Apollo will use this template to push emails to Salesforce. Unexpected changes to the template may make it difficult to quickly locate pushed emails in Salesforce.
    
3.  Click the toggle in the **Notes** section to enable whether or not Apollo should push notes from the platform to Salesforce. [![Push Notes to Salesforce](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i21.png)
4.  Click the toggle in the **Tasks** section to enable whether or not Apollo should push completed tasks from the platform to Salesforce. [![Push Tasks to Salesforce](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i22.png)
5.  Click **View Advanced Settings** if you would like to customize the **Title Template** that Apollo uses when pushing task data to Salesforce. [![Advanced Task Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i23.png) [![Customize Title](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i24.png)
    
    Update With Caution
    
    Please note, you should exercise caution when you edit this setting. Apollo will use this template to push completed tasks to Salesforce. Unexpected changes to the template may make it difficult to quickly locate these tasks in Salesforce.
    
6.  Click the toggle in the **Calls** section to enable whether or not Apollo should push calls made from Apollo to Salesforce. [![Push Calls to Salesforce](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i25.png)
7.  Click **View Advanced Settings** if you would like to customize the title template that Apollo uses when pushing call data to Salesforce. [![Advanced Call Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i26.png) [![Customize Title](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i27.png)
    
    Update With Caution
    
    Please note, you should exercise caution when you edit this setting. Apollo will use this template to push calls to Salesforce. Unexpected changes to the template may make it difficult to quickly locate these calls in Salesforce.
    
8.  In the **Meetings/Calendar Events** section, click the toggles to enable or deactivate the following options:
    
    *   Push Meetings to Salesforce
    *   Push all calendar events even if the participants don't exist in Salesforce
    
    [![Meetings / Calendar Events Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i28.png)
    
    Enable Push Meetings To Salesforce First
    
    Please note, if you want to enable the **Push all calendar events even if the participants don't exist in Salesforce** setting, you must first also enable **Push Meetings to Salesforce**. Enable this setting with caution. It may create contacts in Salesforce that you don't want to see.
    
9.  When you're finished, click **Save** to preserve your changes. [![Save](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i29.png)
    
    Default Push to Contacts and Accounts
    
    Please note, once you configure and save your **Push Settings** preferences, by default, Apollo pushes activities, tasks, meetings, and notes to both **Contact** and **Account** profiles in Salesforce.

## Step 2: (Optional) Push Individual Records to Salesforce[](#toc_9)

You can also manually push individual records to Salesforce from the contact or account's profile page.

Breaking Your Limits!

Please note, if you select this option, you agree to overwrite all of the **Push Settings** you have configured. This means that Apollo overwrites any limitations you previously set and pushes the record to Salesforce regardless of **contact stage** or any other restrictions you enabled in the **Push Settings**.

To manually push individual records to Salesforce:

1.  Launch Apollo, click **Search**, and then click the [**People**](https://app.apollo.io/#/people) or [**Companies**](https://app.apollo.io/#/companies) tab.
2.  Click the individual record you want to manually push to Salesforce. [![Individual Record on Search Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i31.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i31.png)
3.  Click **More** and then click **Push to Salesforce**. [![More Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i32.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/configure_your_salesforce_push_records_settings/i32.png)

You have now manually pushed the record to Salesforce.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

If you use Apollo for data but use Outreach for engagement, you can integrate your Apollo instance with your Outreach account.

The benefits of this integration include:

*   **Unified Data**: Push Apollo contacts directly into Outreach.
*   **Ease of Execution**: Deploy Apollo contacts into your Outreach sequences.
*   **Streamlined Workflow**: Remove unnecessary steps when working between Apollo and Outreach.
*   **Automatic Synchronization**: Contacts you push from Apollo to Outreach will automatically sync with the same fields.

Automatic Synchronization

Please note, when you push contacts to Outreach, the following fields will sync—provided they are also present in Apollo: **First Name**, **Last Name**, **LinkedIn URL**, **Website URL**, **Title**, **City**, **State**, **Country**, **Email**, **Phone**, **Street**, **Postal Code**, and **Time Zone**.

Refer to the sections below for instructions on how to connect Apollo and Outreach, how to push contacts from Apollo to Outreach, and how to add contacts to an Outreach sequence.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Connect Apollo to Outreach[](#toc_2)

Permission to Succeed!

Please note, for optimal functionality, make sure you have permission to create prospects within the Outreach platform before you connect Apollo to Outreach. If you do not have permission, please contact an admin user of your Outreach account. For more information about permission settings in Outreach, refer to the [Outreach Governance Profile Settings Overview](https://support.outreach.io/hc/en-us/articles/115004080054-Outreach-Governance-Profile-Settings-Overview) article in the Outreach Knowledge Base.

Launch Apollo and click **Settings**. Then, click **Integrations**.

[![Settings—Integrations](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i1.png)

Scroll to the **Outreach** section and click **Connect**.

[![Connect Outreach](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i2.png)

To connect the platforms, you need to authenticate your account. Click **New Authentication** in the **Outreach Authentication** modal.

[![New Authentication](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i4.png)

Auto-Populate Credentials

Please note, the authentication modal detects if you are already logged into Outreach in another tab or window and will populate your credentials for you. If you want to access Outreach from an alternative account, make sure you log out of Outreach in all other tabs and windows first.

When the **Outreach Authentication** drop-down reads: "Outreach Connected," click **Next**.

[![Outreach Connected](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i5.png)

Click **Finish** to complete the connection.

[![Finish](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i6.png)

Your Outreach account is now connected with your Apollo instance.

[![Connected to Apollo](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_outreach/i7.png)

Admin Access

Please note, you can only connect one Outreach account to Apollo at a time. To ensure that all account users can access all Outreach sequences from Apollo, make sure you connect an Admin account to Outreach.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

If you use Apollo for your data and Salesloft for engagement, you can integrate your Apollo instance with your Salesloft account. The benefits of this integration include:

*   **Unified Data**: Push Apollo contacts directly into Salesloft.
*   **Ease of Execution**: Deploy Apollo contacts into your Salesloft cadences.
*   **Streamlined Workflow**: Remove unnecessary steps when you work between Apollo and Salesloft.
*   **Automatic Synchronization**: Contacts you push from Apollo to Salesloft will automatically sync with the same fields.

Automatic Synchronization

Please note, when you push contacts to Salesloft, the following fields will sync, provided they are also present in Apollo: **First Name**, **Last Name**, **LinkedIn URL**, **Website URL**, **Title**, **City**, **State**, **Country**, **Email**, and **Phone**.

Refer to the sections below for instructions on how to connect Apollo and Salesloft, how to push contacts from Apollo to Salesloft, and how to add contacts to a Salesloft cadence.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Connect Apollo to Salesloft[](#toc_2)

Admin Access

Please note, to ensure that all account users can access all Salesloft cadences from Apollo, make sure you connect an Admin account to Salesloft.

Launch Apollo, click settings in the navbar, and then click **Integrations**.

[![Settings—Integrations](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i1.png)

To connect the platforms, you need to authenticate your account. Click **New Authentication** in the "Salesloft Authentication" modal.

[![Authenticate Salesloft](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i3.png)

Auto-Populate Credentials

Please note, the authentication modal detects if you are already logged into Salesloft in another tab or window and will populate your credentials for you. If you want to access Salesloft from an alternative account, make sure you log out of Salesloft in all other tabs and windows first.

Type your Salesloft email address into the "Salesloft modal" and click **Next**.

[![Email Address](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i4.png)

Click **Finish** when the **Salesloft Authentication** drop-down displays "Salesloft Connected."

[![Finish Authentication](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i6.png)

Auto-Populate Credentials

Type your Salesloft email address into the **Salesloft modal** and click **Next**.

[![Email Address](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i4.png)

Add your credentials and then click **Sign In**.

Click **Finish** when the **Salesloft Authentication** drop-down displays "Salesloft Connected."

Your personal Salesloft account is now connected with your Apollo instance.

[![Connected to Apollo](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_apollo_with_salesloft/i10.png)

Restricted Access

## Overview[](#toc_1)

If you already actively use SendGrid for transactional or marketing emails, you can connect your account with Apollo to send higher volumes of emails.

Refer to the sections below to integrate your SendGrid account with Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Connect Your SendGrid Account to Apollo[](#toc_2)

Admin Superpowers

Please note, you need to be an admin in Apollo to connect your SendGrid account and configure the settings in Apollo. You also need an Apollo paid plan to integrate SendGrid with Apollo. If you are on a free plan or a free trial and want to upgrade, check out our [pricing page](https://www.apollo.io/pricing/) or reach out to the [Apollo Sales Team](mailto: sales@apollo.io) for more information.

Once you [configure your SendGrid account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414449230093-Set-Up-Configure-and-Troubleshoot-Your-SendGrid-Account), you can connect it to Apollo.

To set up the Apollo<>SendGrid integration:

1.  Click the [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations) icon.
2.  Scroll to SendGrid and click **Connect**. [![Connect](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i2.png)
3.  Fill in your SendGrid **API Key** and click **Link SendGrid**. [![Link SendGrid](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i3.png)
4.  Any time you update your API key, copy the new key into the **SendGrid API key** field. Then, click **Update API key**. [![Update API key field in SendGrid settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i27.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Enable SendGrid As Default for All Users[](#toc_3)

If you are an admin and want to set SendGrid as default for all users:

1.  Click the [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations) icon. [![Integrations](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i1.png)
2.  Scroll to **SendGrid** and click **View**. [![View SendGrid](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i5.png)
3.  Click the **Use SendGrid as default for entire team** toggle. [![SendGrid Default](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i6.png)
4.  Then, click **Make SendGrid default**. [![SendGrid default confirmation modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i21.png)
5.  You have now enabled SendGrid as default for all users in your team. [![SendGrid default toggle enabled](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i22.png)
Team members can still decide whether or not they use SendGrid for each of their email accounts. To disable SendGrid for a particular email address:6.  Click **Settings** and then click the [**Mailboxes**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/account/mailboxes) tab.
7.  Click the **Additional options (...)** button next to an email address. Then, click **Stop sending emails from SendGrid**. [![Stop sending emails button in mailboxes tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i24.png)
8.  To disable SendGrid as default for all users, click the default toggle again and then click **Stop using SendGrid as Default**. [![Stop using SendGrid as default modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i26.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Configure the Event Webhook Settings[](#toc_4)

To ensure accurate email event tracking when you integrate Apollo with SendGrid, you must configure the event webhook settings in Apollo. To do so:

1.  Scroll to **Event webhook settings** and click **Fix settings**. [![Fix settings button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i28.png)
2.  Apollo populates the HTTP Post URL field, configures the necessary event types and tracking options, and enables the webhook authentication toggle for you. [![Populated webhook event settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i29.png)
    
    The Toggle is Your Friend!
    
    Please note, you **must not disable the webhook authentication toggle**. This provides an additional layer of security and allows Apollo to track your SendGrid events. **If you turn the toggle off, Apollo _cannot_ track your email events**.
    
3.  Apollo automatically saves the changes after you click **Fix settings**. To enable additional engagement events, click the checkboxes and then click **Save**. [![Save button in webhook event settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i30.png)

Time Travel is Tricky!

Please note, when you configure the event webhook settings in Apollo, your SendGrid statistics sync with Apollo moving forward. The sync is not retroactive. You must review previous statistics directly on SendGrid.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Enable SendGrid for a Mailbox[](#toc_5)

To enable SendGrid for a mailbox you've connected to Apollo:

1.  Click **Settings**. Then, click the [**Mailboxes**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/account/mailboxes) tab in your **Personal Profile**.
2.  Click the **Additional Options (...)** button for the mailbox you want to enable with SendGrid. Then, click **Send emails from SendGrid**. [![Send from SendGrid](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i4.png)

Looking for Your Sent Emails?

Please remember that when you send emails via SendGrid, the emails do not appear in your mailbox sent folder. For more information, please reach out to [SendGrid support](https://support.sendgrid.com/hc/en-us).

[Back to Top](#top)

## Confirm You're Set Up[](#toc_6)

Add a contact to a sequence to confirm you've integrated SendGrid correctly.

Add Contacts to a Sequence

For full instructions on how to add a contact to a sequence, please read the [Add Contacts to a Sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396985741-Add-Contacts-to-a-Sequence) article.

When you add a contact to a sequence and choose **Send Emails From:**, you will see **(SendGrid)** next to an email address. This confirms you've set up SendGrid correctly.

[![Confirm](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i14.png)

## Edit Your Daily and Hourly Send Rates[](#toc_7)

To make changes to your sending limits for a connected mailbox in Apollo:

1.  Click [**Settings**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/account). Then, click **manage sending limits under each linked Mailbox**. [![Manage Sending Limits](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i15.png)
2.  Click the mailbox for which you want to adjust the sending limits. [![Mailbox](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_apollo_config/i16.png)
3.  From here, you can adjust the **Daily Sending Limit** and the **Maximum # of Emails to Send Per Hour**. ## SendGrid and SPAM Filters[](#toc_8)

SendGrid replaces the tracking URLs and directs them to SendGrid servers to resolve deliverability issues. If you connect your Apollo account to SendGrid, you do not need to configure a **Tracking Subdomain** because SendGrid manages your tracking links on their end. For additional information, please see the "[Set Up, Configure, and Troubleshoot Your SendGrid Account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414449230093)" article.

SendGrid and SPAM Filters

Please note, if your emails are flagged as SPAM when your Apollo account is connected to **SendGrid**, you may need to replace the tracking link in the emails within your **SendGrid** account itself. **SendGrid** includes a feature called **Link Branding** that functions the same as Apollo's **Tracking Subdomain**. This **Link Branding** feature provides the URL that you must replace to reset the deliverability on your account. In this scenario, contact **SendGrid** Technical Support so that they can help you update this configuration and provide any additional information about deliverability within your account.

For more information about SPAM filters, please read the "[Avoid SPAM Filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409225311885)" article.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Which SendGrid Plan Do I Choose?[](#toc_9)

The Apollo integration works with all SendGrid plans, so the world is your oyster! You can connect your SendGrid account with Apollo whether you have an Email API plan or a Marketing Campaigns plan. This includes free or paid plans.

However, please note that if you are on one of their free plans, SendGrid limits the number of emails you can send per day and month. For more information about SendGrid pricing, sneak a peek at the [SendGrid pricing page](https://sendgrid.com/pricing/).

For Old-Timers Only!

Please note that Apollo only recommends integrating with your SendGrid account if you already actively use their platform for transactional or marketing emails. If you don't, consider using [this Apollo partner](https://agencies.apollo.io/partners/senders) to help you follow deliverability best practices.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

SendGrid allows you to send a higher volume of emails that can bypass the regular sending limits that major email providers have in place. Your ability to send more emails increases when you set up and integrate a SendGrid account with Apollo.

Refer to the sections below for information about how to prepare your SendGrid account to integrate with Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## SendGrid Setup[](#toc_2)

SendGrid Account

Please note, if you do not have a SendGrid account, visit the "[Getting started with the SendGrid API](https://docs.sendgrid.com/for-developers/sending-email/api-getting-started#third-pane)" article on the SendGrid knowledge base for more information on account creation.

Wondering what plan to sign up for? The Apollo integration works with all SendGrid plans, so the world is your oyster! This includes free or paid Email API or Marketing Campaigns plans. However, please note that SendGrid limits the number of emails you can send per day and month if you are on one of their free plans. For more information about SendGrid pricing, sneak a peek at the [SendGrid pricing page](https://sendgrid.com/pricing/).

IP Whitelisting

Please note, Apollo does not support IP whitelisting in SendGrid. If you enable IP whitelisting, you cannot deliver SendGrid messages through Apollo. For more information on IP whitelisting, please read [this SendGrid article](https://docs.sendgrid.com/ui/account-and-settings/ip-access-management).

[Back to Top](#top)

### Domain Authentication[](#toc_3)

Domain authentication shows email providers that SendGrid has your permission to send emails on your behalf. In the SendGrid application, you can provide the necessary information to point your DNS entries from your DNS provider to SendGrid. In SendGrid, under **Settings**, click **Sender Authentication** and then click **Authenticate Your Domain**.

[![Auth Domain](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i1.png)

Use the drop-down to identify your DNS host. Click **Yes** or **No** to answer if you would like link branding. For more information on link branding, refer to the "[What is Link Branding](https://docs.sendgrid.com/ui/account-and-settings/how-to-set-up-link-branding#what-is-link-branding)" article on the SendGrid knowledge base. Click **Next**.

[![Link Branding](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i2.png)

Fill in your **From Domain**. For example, jane.doe@`company.com` and then click **Next**.

[![Email Domain](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i3.png)

You must manually install the CNAME records that SendGrid provides. If you don't have access to your company's DNS records, you can email the CNAME records to a coworker.

Tutorial Videos

For more information on how to add your CNAME to some popular DNS service providers, [check out these videos](https://docs.sendgrid.com/ui/account-and-settings/dns-providers).

[![CNAME](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i4.png)

Once you add the CNAME records to your DNS host, return to the [Sender Authentication Page](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/sender_auth) and click **Verify**.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Troubleshoot SendGrid Domain Authentication[](#toc_4)

You may encounter an authentication error when you try to link SendGrid to Apollo.

[![Error](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i5.png)

You must verify **all** domains that are used as both **mailboxes** and as **user logins** over Apollo before completing the integration. You must authenticate through SendGrid:

*   All domains you're using for user logins
*   All domains you're using for multiple **mailboxes** linked to Apollo, as well as **aliases**.

If you have multiple mailboxes linked to Apollo, they must all be verified through SendGrid.

You won't be able to link your SendGrid account to Apollo until you complete this. The **Sender Authentication** section in SendGrid shows your domains as **Verified** if your setup was successful.

[![Verified](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i6.png)

Check out the "[Sender Identity](https://docs.sendgrid.com/for-developers/sending-email/sender-identity)" article on the SendGrid knowledge base for more information.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Generate a SendGrid API Key[](#toc_5)

You must generate a SendGrid API key before you can integrate with Apollo. To generate an API key, load SendGrid and expand the **Settings** accordion. Then, click **API Keys**.

[![API Keys](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i7.png)

Click **Create API Key**.

[![Create API Key](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i8.png)

Type a name in the **API Key Name** field. Then, choose the level of access you want to give SendGrid in the **API Key Permissions** section.

[![API Key Name](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i9.png)

To customize your SendGrid access permissions, choose **Restricted Access**. From there, you can choose the access details for SendGrid.

[![API Key Access](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i10.png)

Settings You'll Need if You Want to Succeed!

Please note, although you can use a full-access API key without issues, Apollo **strongly recommends** restricting the permission set of the API and only enabling full access to the necessary API settings that give you full functionality of the SendGrid-Apollo integration. The API settings you must enable in SenGrid before moving forward are:

*   Mail Send [![Mail send setting](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i13.png)
*   Event Notifications [![Event notifications setting](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i14.png)
*   Click Tracking and Open Tracking [![Open tracking setting](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i15.png)

After you make your access selection, click **Create & View**.

[![Create & View](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i11.png)

In the modal, click the **API Key** to copy it to your clipboard and then click **Done**.

[![Done](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sendgrid_setup_troubleshoot/i12.png)

API Key

Please note, you should place a copy of your API Key in a safe place. Once you have closed the **API Key** window, you cannot return for a copy of it from SendGrid again.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

It Depends on Your Plan

Please note, if you created your Mailgun account with a domain from an EU server, unfortunately, you cannot currently integrate your Mailgun account with Apollo.

Access to the Mailgun integration also depends on your Apollo plan. For more information, check out the [pricing comparison chart](https://www.apollo.io/pricing#compare). To upgrade your plan, head to the [manage plan settings](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/plans) in Apollo or reach out to the [Apollo Sales Team](https://apollo.na.chilipiper.com/router/sales_router?leadsource=Inbound&lead_source_details__c=KnowledgeBase) for further guidance.

If you already actively use Mailgun for transactional or marketing emails, you can integrate your account with Apollo to send higher volumes of emails.

(Remember) Before you set up the Mailgun integration, you need to:

*   [Link your mailbox(es)](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409127806093-Link-Your-Mailbox-to-Apollo-io) to Apollo.
*   Have an active Mailgun account. Head to the [Getting Started](https://help.mailgun.com/hc/en-us/sections/200437784-Getting-Started) section of the Mailgun Knowledge Base if you have Mailgun setup questions.

Refer to the following sections for the steps to integrate your Mailgun account with Apollo.

[Back To Top](#top)

## Connect Your Mailgun Account to Apollo[](#toc_2)

To integrate your Mailgun account with Apollo:

1.  Launch Apollo, click **Settings**, and then click the [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations) icon.
2.  Scroll to Mailgun and then click **Connect**. [![Connect Mailgun Button on Integration Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i2.png)
3.  Fill in your Mailgun **primary account API key** and click **Link API key**. [![Link Mailgun Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i3.png)

Getting the Goods!

Please keep in mind that the primary account API key must be a private key. If you're not sure where to find your key, fear not! Mailgun has got you covered! Check out the [Where Can I Find My API Key and SMTP Credentials?](https://help.mailgun.com/hc/en-us/articles/203380100-Where-Can-I-Find-My-API-Key-and-SMTP-Credentials-) article on the Mailgun Knowledge Base. Please also note that Apollo does not support Mailgun domain sending keys. For more information about the different API keys in Mailgun, read [this section](https://documentation.mailgun.com/en/latest/api-intro.html#authentication-1) of the Mailgun API Reference Guide.

You have now connected your Mailgun account to Apollo.

[![Mailgun Integrated](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i12.png)

(Reminder) Apollo does not support IP whitelisting in Mailgun. If you enable IP whitelisting, you cannot deliver Mailgun messages through Apollo. For more information on IP whitelisting, please read [the IP Reputation/Management section](https://help.mailgun.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006037914-IP-Reputation-Management) of the Mailgun Knowledge Base.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Add Mailgun Webhooks for Your Domains[](#toc_3)

You Snooze, You Lose!

This is an important step, folks! To ensure full functionality of the Mailgun integration, add a webhook for each domain you use to send emails from in Apollo. But don't worry—it's not as scary as it sounds. Follow the simple steps below, and voila! Like magic, you can start tracking the performance of your [sequences](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview) and identify bounced emails with accuracy to improve your email deliverability rates.

Now that you have connected Mailgun, Apollo displays all the domains connected to your Mailgun account.

[![Mailgun domains](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i13.png)

To add Mailgun webhooks for your domains:

1.  Click **Add tracking** next to each of the domains that you want to connect. [![Add webhook button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i15.png)
2.  You have now added a Mailgun webhook to Apollo. [![Success modal on Mailgun integrations page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i16.png)

To delete a connected webhook from Apollo:

1.  Click **Remove tracking**. [![Delete webhook](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i17.png)
    
    Making Lemonade Outta Lemons!
    
    Please note, Apollo only automatically pulls in the list of domains from Mailgun when you first integrate Mailgun with Apollo. This means that if you add or delete a domain in Mailgun, the change does not immediately reflect in the list of domains in Apollo. However, no need to panic! If you make any changes in Mailgun, you can click **Refresh List**. Apollo then refreshes the list as well as the status of the Mailgun webhook in Apollo. [![Refresh List button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i14.png)
    
2.  If you try to add or remove a webhook from a domain that no longer exists in Mailgun, Apollo displays an error message. [![Error message](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i18.png)
    
    Whoops!
    
    Deleted the wrong domain? You'll need to reconnect the domain in Mailgun before you can add the Mailgun webhook in Apollo. For more information about how to add and delete domains in Mailgun, [hop into this article](https://help.mailgun.com/hc/en-us/articles/203637190-How-Do-I-Add-or-Delete-a-Domain-) in the Mailgun Knowledge Base.
    
3.  You can only connect 1 webhook per domain with the Apollo<>Mailgun Integration. If you encounter the following error, you can delete a non-Apollo webhook from Mailgun or manually add the webhook in Mailgun. [![Error message 2](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i19.png) ](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i19.png)</>

For more information about how to add or delete webhooks in Mailgun, please refer to the [Guide to Using Mailgun Webhooks](https://www.mailgun.com/blog/product/a-guide-to-using-mailguns-webhooks/#chapter-1) in the Mailgun Knowledge Base. Alternatively, you can use another domain instead.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Enable Mailgun for a Mailbox[](#toc_4)

To enable Mailgun for a mailbox:

1.  Click **Settings**. Then, click the [**Mailboxes**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/account/mailboxes) tab in your **Personal Profile**. [![Personal Profiles Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i4.png)
2.  Click the **Additional Options (...)** button to select the mailbox that you would like to enable with Mailgun. Then, click **Send emails from Mailgun**. [![Send Emails from Mailgun Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i11.png)

You have now enabled Mailgun for a mailbox in Apollo.

You Call the Shots

Please note, you can stop sending emails from Mailgun at any time. To do so, click the **Additional Options (...)** button again and then click **Stop sending emails from Mailgun**.

[![Stop Sending Emails from Mailgun Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i5.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Confirm You're Set Up[](#toc_5)

To confirm that you've integrated Mailgun correctly:

1.  Launch Apollo, click **Settings**, and then click the [**Mailboxes**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/account/mailboxes) tab.
2.  You will see **Send From Mailgun** below the default email address. This confirms that you have set up Mailgun correctly in Apollo. [![Send From Mailgun Text Below Default Email](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i7.png)

Emails Not Showing in Apollo?

Do you follow best practices and use [tracking subdomains](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415240542733-Set-Up-a-Custom-Tracking-Subdomain-URL-) to protect your domain reputation? Do you also forward the emails that you send from Mailgun via a secondary domain onto your primary domain? If so, make sure you link both mailboxes with Apollo. If you don't connect your primary domain with Apollo but do forward the emails you send via Mailgun to it, please note that those emails will not appear in Apollo. For help linking more mailboxes, refer to [this article](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409127806093-Link-Your-Mailbox-to-Apollo-io).

[Back to Top](#top)

## Edit Your Daily and Hourly Send Rates[](#toc_6)

To adjust your daily and hourly send rates for a connected mailbox in Apollo:

1.  Click [**Settings**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/account). Then, click **manage sending limits under each linked Mailbox**. [![Manage Sending Limits](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i8.png)
2.  Click the mailbox for which you want to adjust the sending limits. [![Mailbox](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i9.png)
3.  From here, you can adjust the **Emails sent per day** and the **Emails Sent Per Hour** fields. [![Email Sending Limits](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/integrate_mailgun_with_apollo/i10.png)

You have now edited your email sending limits in Apollo. For more information, refer to the [Email Sending Limits Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409233349005-Email-Sending-Limits-Overview) article.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

If you want to include video in your email campaigns, you can link Vidyard from within your Apollo account.

The benefits of this integration include:

*   **Dynamic Email Campaigns**: Offer your **contacts** engaging content that piques their interest and provides value.
*   **Increased Engagement**: Provide personalized video messages that speak directly to your customers' needs to increase your **Open**, **Click**, and **Response** rates.
*   **Streamlined Workflow**: Simplify the way you use Vidyard with Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Connect Vidyard From Within an Apollo Sequence[](#toc_2)

Launch Apollo, click **Engage**, and then click **Sequences**.

[![Engage⁠—Sequences](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i1.png)

Click the **Sequence** that you want to edit.

[![Click the Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i2.png)

Click an **Email** step in the **Sequence**.

[![Select Email](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i3.png)

Once you've loaded the template, click the **Vidyard** icon.

 [![Vidyard Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i4.png)⁠ Click **Sign In**.

[![Sign In](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i5.png)

Enter your email credentials and click **Sign In** on the "Welcome back" modal.

[![Add Credentials](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i12.png)

If you do not have a Vidyard account, click **Sign Up** to create a new account directly from within Apollo.

[![Sign Up](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/link_vidyard_to_apollo/i13.png)

You have now connected Vidyard to Apollo. Follow the steps in the "[Import Vidyard Videos into Apollo Emails](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4422999587469-Import-Vidyard-Videos-into-Apollo-Emails)" article to start sending videos to the **contacts** in your Apollo sequences.

Calling All Apollo Newbies

If all this talk of **Sequences** is getting you in the mood for some sweet email action, but you haven't set up any sequences yet, don't panic. Refer to the "[Create a Sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409231193101-Create-a-Sequence)" article and all of your **Sequence** worries will be laid to rest.
