We're Fine Tuning the Magic Formula!

Please note, this feature is currently only available for new direct dial requests. Apollo is working hard behind the scenes to bring you Do Not Call screening for your existing, saved numbers as well as the numbers in your connected CRM, so stay tuned for further updates.

To help you stay compliant and give you more visibility, Apollo offers screening against US and UK Do Not Call (DNC) lists for new phone numbers that you request.

Refer to the following steps to turn on DNC screening and see the feature in action when you request new direct dial numbers in Apollo.

Admin Only

Please note, only admin users can activate DNC screening in Apollo. If you do not have access but want to turn the feature on for your team, please contact an admin.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Turn On DNC Screening For UK and US Numbers[](#toc_2)

On the Other Side of the Pond?

Based in the UK and wondering what all this DNC business is about? Fear not! When you turn on the **Do Not Call** toggle and request a new direct dial, Apollo displays the **Do Not Call** tag for any numbers on the US Do Not Call registry or the UK Telephone Preference Service (TPS). It's the same concept, just a different name for our friends across the pond. The steps below still apply. For more information on the DNC registry, refer to the [Federal Trade Commission website](https://www.ftc.gov/business-guidance/resources/qa-telemarketers-sellers-about-dnc-provisions-tsr-0). To learn more about the TPS, please refer to the [TPS website](https://www.tpsonline.org.uk/pages/what_is_tps).

To turn on the DNC screening of new direct dial numbers for you and your team:

1.  Launch Apollo and then click **Settings** > [**Prospecting Config**.](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/org)
2.  Scroll to **DNC list screening** and click the toggle to activate it. [![DNC Toggle](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i1.png)
3.  You have now turned on DNC list screening for your new direct dial requests in Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Direct Dial Requests[](#toc_3)

If you turn on DNC screening, Apollo runs the number against the DNC registry when you request a new direct dial in Apollo. If the number is on the registry, Apollo displays a **Do Not Call** tag in the following 3 places:

1.  From the search page, when you hover your mouse over the dialer icon of a saved contact or account. [![Do not call tag on search screen](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i4.png)
2.  From a contact's profile page. [![Do not call tag](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i2.png)
3.  From within your active tasks. [![Do not call tag from tasks](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i3.png)

Apollo charges 1 credit for every new direct dial request you make, regardless of whether you turn on the DNC toggle. If you activate the toggle and a number you request is on the UK or US registry, Apollo still charges you 1 credit for the request. It is then at your discretion to decide if you call the contact or not.

DNC screening provides add-on value to help you identify which numbers are protected against telemarketing and should only be contacted for [a permitted reason](https://www.ftc.gov/business-guidance/resources/qa-telemarketers-sellers-about-dnc-provisions-tsr-0).

Make Sure You're Sure!

Please note, you can call any direct dial number from the [Apollo dialer](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409140527757-Configure-the-Dialer). However, unless you have a permitted reason to contact the prospect, Apollo advises that you do not call contacts on the DNC registry. Additionally, if Apollo notifies you that a contact has requested to be removed from the Apollo database, you should not contact them unless you have a separate legal basis to do so. You are responsible for ensuring that any call that you make from the Apollo dialer is compliant with law.

### Request a Direct Dial in Apollo[](#toc_4)

To request a direct dial number in Apollo and identify if a number is on the DNC list:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Search**](https://app.apollo.io/#/people). Then, [apply filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview) to your search.
2.  Scroll to the **Phone** column next to a contact's details and click **Request Mobile Number**. [![Phone column in search](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i5.png)
3.  Apollo displays the company number and initiates the verification process for the direct dial. Apollo may take a few minutes to verify the contact's mobile number. [![Direct dial verification](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i6.png)
4.  You have now requested a direct dial for a contact in Apollo. If Apollo finds a verified mobile number for the contact, you can view the number from the **Saved** tab on the search page, from their [profile page](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5995459280525-Contact-Profile-Overview), or within your active tasks. If the contact is on the UK or US registry, you will see a **Do Not Call** tag next to their number. [![Do Not Call Tag](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/enable_dnc_list_screening/i2.png)

## Try it Out in Apollo[](#toc_5)

Now It's Your Turn!

Ready to take the DNC feature for a spin? There's no time like the present. Head to the [**Prospecting Config**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/org) setting in Apollo and turn that toggle on!

Apollo does not charge you for more than 1 email per contact. You do have the option to access both business and personal emails. However, Apollo only charges you 1 credit per **Primary** email.

Bear With Us, It's in Beta!

Please note, the option to access personal emails and set a **Primary** email type is currently in Beta. If you do not have access just yet, we haven't forgotten you! We're just busy fine tuning the magic formula.

Refer to the table below for further information about how Apollo charges email credits based on your **Primary** email settings.

| Primary Email | Credit Details |
| --- | --- |
| Business | This is the default setting. If your **Primary** email is set to "Business," Apollo only charges you for **Net New Contacts** with verified business emails. Even if Apollo can verify a **contact's** business and personal email, Apollo _only_ displays the business email and charges 1 credit. However, if Apollo can _only_ verify a personal email, Apollo does not display the information or charge you any credits. |
| Personal | If your **Primary** email is set to "Personal," Apollo only charges you for **Net New Contacts** with verified personal emails. If Apollo can verify a **contact's** business and personal email, Apollo displays both and charges you 1 credit. However, if Apollo can only verify a business email, Apollo does not display the information or charge you any credits. |
| Any | If your **Primary** email is set to "Any," Apollo charges 1 credit and displays all available emails for the **contact**. If only 1 verified email is available, Apollo still charges 1 credit. |

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Personas are filters comprised of sets of titles, departments, and attributes that define different groups of people that you can target in a search. Use personas to quickly target contacts that meet your [ideal customer profile](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416471135245-Identify-Your-Ideal-Customer-Profile-ICP).

Refer to the section below to learn how to create a persona and use advanced filters.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create a Persona[](#toc_2)

1.  To create a persona, launch Apollo and click **[Search](https://app.apollo.io/#/people)**.
2.  Expand the Personas filter on the left and click **\+ Persona**. [![On the search page, the + Persona button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_persona/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_persona/i1.png)
3.  Give your persona a name, and use filters like job title, industry, location, or number of employees to narrow your search.
    
    A Wide Net
    
    Use multiple versions of a job title to improve your results. For example, if you search for a Chief Marketing Officer, include the job titles "Chief Marketing Officer" and "CMO" to catch more contacts.
    
    [![On the new persona page, filters are set to technical directors in animation in the Los Angeles area, and the Save Persona button is highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_persona/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_persona/i2.png)
    
4.  As you select each persona attribute, Apollo filters the results on the right. You can browse through the results and click on a specific contact to take a closer look at their profile.
    
5.  When finished, click **Save Persona**.

Once complete, Apollo applies the persona filter to your search results.

[![A persona named Technical directors in LA is shown applied to search results](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_persona/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_persona/i3.png)

Use the persona in combination with other filters to narrow your search when [prospecting in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us#section-18207855857933), and [edit, deactivate, or delete personas](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/6128371592845-Access-Edit-Deactivate-and-Delete-Personas) as needed.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Advanced Filters for Personas[](#toc_3)

You can use advanced filters on personas for more granular control over your search results. You can create personas with filters to exclude certain job titles, filter by departments, or search for industry-specific keywords.

[![Example advanced filters are highlighted on the new persona page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_persona/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_a_persona/i4.png)

Less is More

Only add filters that are vital to your ideal persona. The more specific your persona, the fewer contact results you’re likely to see. For instance, if you use a very specific job title, you may want to avoid additional filters. Learn more about using [search filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview) successfully.

| Filter | Usage |
| --- | --- |
| Is not any of | Restrict job titles or industries from appearing in your results. For example, filter out “Junior” or “Jr” to target individuals with more seniority. |
| Include past job titles | Include contacts who previously had the job title. |
| Boolean search | Use [Boolean operators](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/25826173417485-Search-Job-Titles-with-Boolean-Operators) like `AND`, `OR`, and `NOT` to target exact results. |
| Is known | Target contacts whose job title is known. |
| Is unknown | Target contacts whose job title is unknown. |
| Management level | Target by seniority like owners, managers, or interns. |
| Departments and job function | Find contacts from specific departments or job functions, like finance or marketing. |
| Industry | Find contacts from specific industries like animation or hospitality. |
| Company keywords | Find contacts with industry-specific keywords associated with the company's name, social media, or SEO descriptions. |
| Location | Target contacts by city, state, country, or zipcode. |
| \# Employees | Find contacts by the number of employees at the company. |

## Watch the Video[](#toc_0)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Apollo Meetings empowers your prospects to schedule meetings with you in seconds. When you sync your calendar with Apollo, you can manage your availability for meetings, create different types of meetings, and view your scheduled meetings.

There are several advantages of leveraging meetings in your sales workflow, including:

*   **Streamline the Scheduling Workflow**: Sync your calendar, configure your default meeting settings, and set your availability for each type of meeting to automate the scheduling process.
*   **Encourage Proactive Engagement**: Make it easy for your prospects to reach you first so you can spend more time engaging in meaningful conversations and less time on administrative tasks.
*   **Facilitate Ease of Attendance**: Eliminate friction between third-party platforms and reduce the risk of no-shows with automated meeting reminders.

Refer to the following sections for an overview of the different Meetings features available.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Meeting Types[](#toc_2)

Meeting types are the different meetings that you want to host. This is useful if you want to encourage different types of contacts to schedule different types of meetings with you. Example meeting types could include scoping calls, demos, brainstorming sessions, and partnership meetings.

Leverage meeting types to remain in control of your schedule and provide your prospects with more context about the type of meetings they can book with you.

[![Meeting Types Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/apollo_meetings_overview/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/apollo_meetings_overview/i15.png)

Up to Your Eyeballs in Meetings?

Trying to keep on top of all those many meetings? You can create numerous meeting types to help you clearly define the types of meetings participants can schedule with you. If you are on a free plan, you can activate up to 6 meeting types at a time.

However, if you are on a paid plan, the world is your oyster! You can create and activate as many meeting types as you need.

There are 3 different types of meetings that you can create:

*   **Single-host**: This meeting type only ever has one host. Single-host meetings should be used for one-on-one discussions with your prospect.
*   **Multi-host**: This meeting type has multiple hosts that co-host the meeting. When a prospect schedules a meeting of this type, all hosts must be available at the same time for the calendar slot to be available.
*   **Round robin host**: This meeting type rotates between different hosts each time it is used to schedule a meeting. Round-robin meetings should also be used for one-on-one discussions. You can choose to rotate hosts based on either the availability of hosts for certain time slots or the equal distribution of hosts so that each host is booked as part of a rotation one by one.

When you create a **Meeting Type**, you can specify the duration of the call, provide the appropriate meeting links, add a description, and set your availability.

Let's Get Those Meetings Started!

For more information about how to manage, edit, and personalize your meeting types, follow the steps in the [Manage Your Meetings in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/9040988124173-Manage-Your-Meetings-in-Apollo) article.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Scheduled Meetings[](#toc_3)

Go to the **Scheduled Meetings** tab to view your upcoming meetings and keep track of the meetings that you previously attended. Meetings include details about the participants, the scheduled time for the meeting, and the meeting's duration.

[![Scheduled Meetings Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/apollo_meetings_overview/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/apollo_meetings_overview/i16.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Inbound Routers and Web Form Integration[](#toc_4)

[Inbound routers](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/17919970244109) enable Apollo admins to automate the flow of scheduled meetings to different meeting types based on several factors, including contact names, emails, company sizes, and more. By setting up the appropriate logic for your inbound routers, you can ensure that specific prospects can easily schedule meeting with the right teams or sales reps.

Only Apollo admins can create inbound routers. Other users can be assigned meetings via inbound routers and view them, but cannot create them.

[![Inbound routers for meetings.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_inbound_routers_for_your_meetings/i35.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_inbound_routers_for_your_meetings/i35.png)

In addition to inbound routers, you can also [integrate your own web forms with Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/19083452478733). With this option, prospects enter information into the web forms that you build on your own websites, and then schedule meetings with your team as they would with the inbound router workflow.

Apollo provides a JavaScript snippet that connects your web form to Apollo meetings. You will need a resource knowledgeable in front-end web engineering to help build the integration on your website.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Settings[](#toc_5)

To update your meeting settings, go to the **Settings** tab. From here, you can view your connected calendar, personalize your meeting link, edit your video conference link, adjust your default availability, and set your minimum schedule notice to avoid participants from booking you up at the last minute.

[![Settings Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/apollo_meetings_overview/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/apollo_meetings_overview/i17.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Admin Console[](#toc_6)

If you are an Apollo admin, the **Admin console** tab enables you to view and edit all of the meeting types, inbound routers, and intake forms that you have created for your organization from a single location.

[![Admin Console Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/apollo_meetings_overview/i20003.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/apollo_meetings_overview/i20003.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Meetings in Gmail[](#toc_7)

If you install the [Apollo Chrome Extension](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409154350477-Download-and-Install-the-Apollo-Chrome-Extension), you can use meeting functionality directly in Gmail. The **Meetings** tab in the Chrome extension enables you to:

*   Provide a link in your email for one of your single-host meetings. The guest can book any time you have availability based on the chosen meeting's settings.
*   Set aside specific times for a meeting. The guest can only book the times you make available, and in the meantime, you can make sure those times are not scheduled for any other purpose.

[![Add meeting links to emails.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_apollo_chrome_extension_in_gmail/i40.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/use_the_apollo_chrome_extension_in_gmail/i40.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## FAQ: Help Prospects Add Meeting Invites to Their Calendars[](#toc_8)

Email providers, including Google and Microsoft, might prevent meeting invites from being automatically added to prospects' calendar. For example, Google provides users the ability to control whether invites are automatically added to Calendar based on whether they have previously interacted with an email address. If a prospect books a meeting with you and never receives the meeting invitation, these settings could be causing the problem.

If a prospect does not receive a meeting invitation, first tell them to check the spam folder of their mailbox.

For Google mailboxes, advise them to click the **I know the sender** option in the email if they find the invitation. This adds the sender to Google Calendar's safe sender list, which means future invites from the same email address will be automatically added to the prospect's calendar.

[![Add the sender to the safe list in Google Calendar.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/apollo_meetings_overview/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/apollo_meetings_overview/i5.png)

If a prospect prefers to automatically add meeting invites from all senders to their calendar, advise them to change the **Add invitations to my calendar** setting in Google Calendar to **From everyone**. Provide Google's [Manage invitations in Calendar](https://support.google.com/calendar/answer/13159188) support article to help them change the setting.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1) A tracking domain is a secondary (or sub) domain name related to your original domain. It allows Apollo to redirect a tracking pixel added to emails to track opens, clicks, and unsubscribes. Tracking pixels are often flagged as spam. Set up a custom tracking subdomain to improve the delivery rates for the emails you send through Apollo. Refer to the sections below to create, connect, and manage a new tracking subdomain. [Back to Top](#top) ## Create a Custom Tracking Subdomain[](#toc_2) To create a custom tracking subdomain, you need to first create a CNAME record. To do so, you need admin access to your domain management account. Domain Management Interface Please note, every domain provider has a different domain management interface. If you need help creating a CNAME record, visit the online knowledge base for your domain provider and search for "create CNAME". The table below provides more details about the type of information you will need. | Field | Definition | Field Information | Additional Notes | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | **DNS Record Type** | DNS Records include essential information about your domain or host. To set up a tracking subdomain, you need to select the record type: **Canonical Name (CNAME)**. | CNAME | A CNAME record maps an alias name to a canonical domain name. | | **Host/Host Name/Name** | Choose any name that is not directly related to your website. This name will become the subdomain in the URL that you create: subdomain.yourdomain.com | `subdomainexample` | * Do not include spaces.
* This must be text only.
* Do not include periods.
* Do not include any words that SPAM filters can easily identify, such as `tracking`. | | **Value/Data/Points To** | The value you enter establishes the connection between your subdomain and the Apollo tracking servers. | `aplolinks.com` | This field must be `aplolinks.com`. | | **TTL** | TTL is a technical term that refers to how often your subdomain information will be rechecked by relevant servers. | Leave as Default | You can leave this field as whatever value your domain provider uses by default. | As an example, here's the layout from an Amazon Web Services (AWS) account, one of the most popular providers. You will need to add data into all of the same CNAME record fields. Once you create and save your CNAME record, it can take between 2-24 hours to fully propagate. [![Create CNAME example](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i1.png) Fields May Vary If you're using other providers like GoDaddy or Cpanel, reference their documentation on subdomains to ensure you're reviewing the most up-to-date information specific to your use case. [Back to Top](#top) ## Connect a Custom Subdomain to Apollo[](#toc_3) To connect a custom subdomain to Apollo: 1. Launch Apollo, click the settings icon in the navbar, and then click [**Tracking Subdomains**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/tracking-subdomains). [![Tracking Subdomains](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i2.png) 2. Click **New Subdomain**. [![Add New Subdomain](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i3.png) 3. Enter the custom subdomain in the **Domain** text-box. [![Subdomain Search Bar](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i4.png) 4. Click **Create**. [![Create Subdomain](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i5.png) Default Subdomain Please note, you can only use 1 tracking subdomain at a time. If you connect several tracking subdomains, Apollo will only use the one you set as default. When you connect your CNAME record, the word healthy appears on the right-hand side of your screen. [![Healthy Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i6.png) You have now connected your custom tracking subdomain. As a best practice, please check your subdomain settings 24 hours after you finish the setup steps to ensure a healthy connection. [Back to Top](#top) ## Troubleshooting Errors[](#toc_4) If you receive an error message or see the word **Unhealthy** on the right of your tracking subdomain after you connect it with Apollo, there are 2 main causes: 1. CAA permission error 2. CNAME error Refer to the following information to help troubleshoot the issue. Speak to Support If you're still having issues connecting a custom subdomain to Apollo, we're only a message away! Reach out to [Apollo support](https://www.apollo.io/submit-a-request) for more help. [Back to Top](#top) ## Manage Tracking Subdomains in Apollo[](#toc_5) Refer to the section below for more information about how to make a tracking subdomain the default domain, check the statistics, and deactivate a subdomain. ### Make a Tracking Subdomain Default in Apollo[](#toc_6) You can only use one tracking subdomain at a time. The tracking subdomain you set as default is the one that Apollo will use. To set a tracking subdomain as default, click the **additional options (...)** button on the right-hand side of the tracking subdomain. Then, click **Make Default**. [![Make Default](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i7.png) You have now changed the default tracking subdomain. ### View Tracking Statistics[](#toc_7) To evaluate the performance of the emails you send and keep track of the open, click, and unsubscribe rates, you can access the Apollo tracking statistics. To view tracking statistics, click the **additional options (...)** button on the right-hand side of the tracking subdomain. Then, click **Check Stats**. [![Check Stats](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i8.png) The **Stats** modal includes key statistics related to the performance of the emails sent with the default tracking subdomain. [![Stats Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i9.png) Apollo Tracking Stats Please note, few contacts open an email immediately after you send it. For this reason, Apollo tracking stats reflect data from the previous week and month rather than from the current week and month. ### Deactivate a Tracking Subdomain[](#toc_8) Tracking Subdomain Status If your tracking subdomain is **Healthy**, your recipients’ email servers are not flagging your emails as spam. When you check your [email statistics](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409233647373-Sequence-Statistics-Overview#toc_3) in Apollo, you should see high open rates and low bounce rates. If your tracking subdomain is **Unhealthy**, your recipients’ email servers are flagging your emails as spam. You can expect that email servers will still occasionally flag your emails as spam. If you start to see a dramatic decrease in your open rates or an increase in spam-blocked emails, you can follow the instructions in the [Create a Custom Tracking Subdomain](#1) section to create a new tracking subdomain. Then deactivate the current tracking subdomain to remove it from your options and reset your deliverability. Also, remember to follow [email deliverability best practices](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409225311885-Avoid-Spam-Filters#toc_3) to avoid that pesky spam filter. To deactivate a tracking subdomain, click the **additional options (...)** button on the right-hand side of the tracking subdomain. Then, click **Deactivate**. [![Deactivate Subdomain](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/set_up_a_custom_tracking_subdomain_URL/i10.png) You have now deactivated the tracking subdomain. Tracking Links Do Not Expire Please note, tracking links that utilize your custom tracking subdomain do not expire unless you delete the domain. [Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

Your sales teams have ambitious goals to meet, whether that be scheduling a certain number of meetings or sending a certain number of emails to prospects. Apollo’s goal tracking helps your teams meet those goals.

Sales managers can set goals for emails sent and meetings scheduled. Sales managers set goals for their entire team, so these goals should be applied to all team members at the same time. Then, the Apollo control center shows how the team is progressing against those goals.

[![Team goals overview.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i2.png)

The following sections detail how to set goals for your team in Apollo and track those goals.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Step 1: Map Salesforce Stages to Apollo[](#toc_1)

Salesforce Integration Required

Apollo relies on Salesforce stages to track the goals you set, which means you need to integrate Salesforce to Apollo to use this feature. Refer to [Connect Apollo to Your Salesforce Account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414356051725) to get started setting up the integration.

To map your Salesforce stages to Apollo:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Goals**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/goals).
2.  Click the checkbox for each stage you want to map from Salesforce to Apollo. Then, click **Save**. [![Map Salesforce stages to Apollo.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i11.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Step 2: Set Goals in Apollo[](#toc_2)

To set goals for your team:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Home**](https://app.apollo.io/#/control-center).
2.  Make sure that you are in the **Sales manager control center**. [![Access the Sales manager control center.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i12.png)
3.  Click **Set goal**. [![Set a goal.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i13.png)
4.  Enter a name for your goal, add the team members you want to measure against the goal, and decide whether you want to measure on a weekly, monthly, or quarterly basis.
    
    Then, click **Next**. [![Enter your team details.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i14.png)
    
    There is No I in Team
    
    Team goals are truly for the entire team. The goals you set are for the team as a whole, not for individuals.
    
    For example, if you set a weekly goal of 50 emails for 5 team members, the 5 individuals need to combine to send a total of 50 emails. If a single team member sends 20 emails, they have contributed 40% towards your weekly email goal!
    
5.  Set your team goals for emails sent and, if you choose, meetings set. You are not required to set a goal for meetings. To better inform your decisions, Apollo shows the previous performance of your selected team members in terms of average meetings set and emails sent. This data includes up to 200 previous instances of the timeframe you set, whether that be weeks, months, or quarters.
    
    You can also choose to receive email updates about how the team is progressing towards the goals set.
    
    Then, click **Next**. [![Set goals for your team.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i6.png)
    
6.  To measure the performance of the emails your team sends, set a benchmark percentage for each of the 4 email rates benchmarks. All email benchmarks need to be set to a number above 0.
    
    Toggle the **Email notification** slider on to receive email updates for a specific rate. If you opted out of Apollo emails in the past, updating the email notification preferences will resubscribe you only to the email notifications that you choose here.
    
    Then, click **Next**. [![Set email rates benchmarks.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i15.png)
    
7.  Review the details of your goal. If your selections look accurate, click **Save**. [![Save your entries.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i16.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Review Goals Progress for Team[](#toc_3)

You’ve set goals for your team. Now you want to see how the team is progressing against those goals.

To view your team’s progress, launch Apollo and click [**Home**](https://app.apollo.io/#/control-center). Then, make sure that you are in the **Sales manager control center**.

From here, you can view how many meetings your team has scheduled and how many emails they’ve sent. The percentages show how close the team is to meeting each goal based on the timeframe you chose.

[![Review your team's progress against goals.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i7.png)

Patience is a Virtue

Goal data refreshes on its own every 10 minutes. So relax, take a coffee break, and come back in 10 for the latest information.

You can also view the email rates funnel to see how your team is progressing against each of the 4 email benchmark rates you set. The benchmark line (orange) shows where each rate was set as a percentage, and the current line (blue) shows how the team currently measures against each of those benchmarks.

[![Review the email rates for your team.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i17.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Review Goals Progress for Individuals[](#toc_4)

You’ve reviewed the progress your team is making against goals, and now you want to understand how each member of your team is contributing to meeting those goals. The goal dashboard page makes that information available to you.

To access the goal dashboard page:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Home**](https://app.apollo.io/#/control-center).
2.  Make sure that you are in the **Sales manager control center**.
3.  Click **View individual performance**. [![View the performance of members of your team.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i8.png)
4.  Click **Run** to refresh the data on the page.
    
    The **Meetings Set By Goal Users** and **Emails Sent By Goals Users** charts shows how individuals on your team are helping to meet team goals. [![Caption](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i8.png)
    

[Back to Top](#top)

## Update Goals[](#toc_5)

Have members of your team changed? Is your team smashing the goals you’ve set and you want to aim higher? If so, you’ll want to update the goals for your team.

To edit an existing goal:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Home**](https://app.apollo.io/#/control-center).
2.  Make sure that you are in the **Sales manager control center**.
3.  Click **Edit goal**. [![Update your team's goal.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i9.png)
4.  Make changes to your current goals for your team. To help set your goals, Apollo provides you with historic data that shows the average meetings booked and emails sent across your selected team members. This data includes up to 200 previous instances of the timeframe you set, whether that be weeks, months, or quarters.
    
    After making changes to each section, click **Update** to save those changes. [![Save your goal changes.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i0.png)
    
5.  With all updates made, click **Save**.

Your updated goals should now reflect in both the email notifications you chose to receive and in the **Home** tab of Apollo.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Delete Goals[](#toc_6)

To delete goals:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Home**](https://app.apollo.io/#/control-center).
2.  Make sure that you are in the **Sales manager control center**.
3.  Click **Edit goal**. [![Delete your team's goals.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i9.png)
4.  Click **Delete**. [![Delete goals.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/track_team_goals/i19.png)
5.  Click **Delete** again.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Understand Team Goal Metrics Calculations[](#toc_7)

The meetings set goal metrics are based on your mappings from Opportunity stages. Apollo calculates the number of meetings that have been set in the designated time period.

The email rates benchmark metrics vary based on how each benchmark is calculated:

*   **Deliver rate**: The number of emails that have been delivered divided by the number of emails that have been sent. For example, 100 emails delivered / 105 emails sent = 95% deliver rate.
*   **Open rate**: The number of emails that have been opened divided by the number of emails that have been delivered.
*   **Reply rate**: The number of emails that have received replies divided by the number of emails that have been delivered.
*   **Interested rate**: The number of emails that have been marked as interested divided by the number of positive replies and/or meetings booked.

You might see differences in open, reply, and interested rates when comparing them in the Apollo Control Center and sequence reports.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1) While there are many strategies to use Apollo effectively, we've identified a few key steps to help you connect with new customers. When you optimize Apollo for your business and strategize your search, you can use our highly accurate database of people and companies to find and connect with your ideal customers at scale. [Book meetings](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/8792552682125-Set-Up-Meetings-in-Apollo), [secure deals](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415062486669-Create-Deals-in-Apollo), and learn from [reporting](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410826842381-Build-and-Access-Reports-In-Apollo) to constantly improve your performance. Check out the following sections to find and connect with the contacts most relevant to your business. [Back to Top](#top) ## 1\. Identify Your Ideal Customers[](#toc_2) A successful sales strategy requires identifying the types of companies you want to do business with. > _Do you sell best to enterprise or startups? Are your target companies in a specific vertical? Are they located in key geographies?_ Answering questions like these will help create your [ideal customer profile](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416471135245-Identify-Your-Ideal-Customer-Profile-ICP) (ICP), a fictitious company that combines key characteristics that best portray your ideal customer. Firmographics such as company size, industry, location, annual revenue, and budget can help define the types of companies that you serve best. The following table shows an example of one of Apollo's ideal companies: | ICP | Key Firmographics | CSAT Score | ROI | CLV Ratio | Customer Health | \# of Referrals | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | Company Type #1 | * Industry: Computer Software
* Size: Medium
* Headcount: >200
* ARR: $50 million
* HQ Location: North America | 95% | 30% | 3:1 | Healthy | \>5 | Use data points from your own ICP and apply them as [search filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview) to find real prospects. Search filters allow you to include or exclude specific subsets of data when you [search for people](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412658716941-Use-Person-Info-Filters-to-Search) or [companies](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412658766477-Use-Company-Info-Filters-to-Search) in Apollo. 1. Launch Apollo and click **Search** \> [**Companies**](https://app.apollo.io/#/companies). 2. Use search filters that match the data points from your ICP. [![Example filters are set on a company search](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i5.png) Follow the Filters Refine your search with more advanced filters like [buying intent](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview#h_01HV4NJR6Q8T2A53R6QCSQF13V) or [signals](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview#h_01HVM2G5JQR2QRZ51FQWCFTP30) to find the most promising companies. Use [Search Filters Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview) to learn more about all of the search filters in Apollo. 3. [Create a list](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409728608525-Create-and-Edit-a-Contact-or-Company-List) of your ideal companies, and [save the search](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409803718669-Create-and-Subscribe-to-Saved-Searches). [![An example search is shown with the Save search button highlighted](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i6.png) You can easily return to saved searches, or [share them with teammates](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409803718669-Save-Share-and-Set-Alerts-for-a-Search#toc_2). [Back to Top](#top) ## 2\. Create Personas and Prospect Lists[](#toc_3) Next, use your company list to search for people to engage with at your target businesses: 1. [Create a persona](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409500253837-Create-a-Persona) that identifies the key characteristics of your buying customers. This could be a set of job titles, functions, departments, or locations. [![An example persona is shown comprised of a job title of owner in the travel industry in Europe with 51-100 employees](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i7.png) 2. Click **Search** > [**People**](https://app.apollo.io/#/people), then combine filters like the [persona filter](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview#h_01HVKZKRHZ49HJ92ZBFCCXCVQG) and the [list filter](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661-Search-Filters-Overview#h_01HVKXNZY517JCQNQDGE685P2X) to narrow your search to the companies you identified and the personas most likely to buy your product or service. [![An example people search shows results with persona and list filters applied](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i8.png) You can easily return to saved searches, or [share them with teammates](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409803718669-Save-Share-and-Set-Alerts-for-a-Search#toc_2). Once you have a list of refined contacts, you're ready to reach out and engage with them. [Back to Top](#top) ## 3\. Engage and Win[](#toc_4) [Sequences](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview) allow you to manage outbound engagement campaigns. You can automate outreach and customize messaging to your target audiences with the help of [Apollo's AI writing assistant](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/15396174946445-Use-the-AI-Writing-Assistant-in-Your-Emails). Use sequences to [A/B test your emails](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410749683597-Add-an-A-B-Test-to-an-Email-Step-in-a-Sequence), [personalize your approach](https://www.apollo.io/academy/how-to-write-cold-emails-anyone-will-respond-to), and automatically follow-up when people show interest. Keep people engaged with a multi-channel strategy by [calling contacts](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4734516058893-Make-Calls-with-Local-Phone-Numbers-from-the-Dialer) and [reaching out on LinkedIn](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5646233248269-Add-and-Complete-LinkedIn-Tasks-in-a-Sequence). [![An example sequence is shown for travel agent owner outreach](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i9.png) Use insights about your email performance, sequences, and team outreach to refine your engagement over time through [email analytics](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4425592135821-Access-Apollo-Email-Analytics) and [reports](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410826842381-Build-and-Access-Reports-In-Apollo). Apollo has built a few [reports to get you started](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410826842381-Build-and-Access-Reports-In-Apollo#toc_9). When you have hot prospects, you can [book meetings](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/8792552682125-Set-Up-Meetings-in-Apollo) and [secure deals](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415062486669-Create-Deals-in-Apollo) — all within Apollo. [![An example closed/won deal is shown for Everfar](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/leverage_the_apollo_database_to_find_new_customers/i10.png) [Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

It's For Everyone!

The data health center is available to all users no matter which Apollo plan you are on. The number of updates you can leverage depends on the credit limits within your plan.

Use the data health center to uncover your total addressable market and identify market gaps between your data and the data available in Apollo.

[![Data health center dashboard](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i42.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i42.png)

Refer to the following sections to best leverage the data health center and manage the dashboard settings.

It's Connection Time!

Without connecting a CRM, you can use the data health center to analyze all the data saved in Apollo, including data uploaded via CSV and previous data requests from Apollo.

To gain full functionality of the data health center, connect your CRM. For more information about how to integrate Apollo with Salesforce, refer to the "[Connect Apollo to Your Salesforce Account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4414356051725-Connect-Apollo-to-Your-Salesforce-Account)" article. To integrate Apollo with HubSpot, refer to the "[Connect Apollo to Your HubSpot Account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416619021837)" article.

[Back to Top](#top)

## View Contact Data[](#toc_1)

The data health center shows how many of your contacts currently have accurate data. It also shows how many of the contacts with out-of-date data Apollo can enrich.

To view your contacts data:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Data enrichment**](https://app.apollo.io/#/data-health-center).
2.  From here, you can view the data health of your contacts. The job changes graph displays the number of contacts with accurate, up-to-date job role and organization data. The missing emails graph shows how many contacts do and don't have an email address. [![Overview of data for job changes and missing emails.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i2.png)
3.  Click **View contacts** on either graph to review the data by individual contacts. [![View more contacts data.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i3.png)
4.  A graph displays the percentage of data that is up-to-date or eligible for enrichment. Scroll down the page to find a listing of individual contacts.
5.  You can filter the list of contacts by account segments and/or personas. To filter, click either the **Select account segments** or the **Select personas** drop-down, choose the segments or personas you want to include in the contacts list, and then click **Apply**.

If you want to enrich the contact data that you have viewed and filtered, proceed to the [Enrich Contacts Data](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/18093170146061#toc_2) section.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Enrich Contact Data for Job Changes, Missing Emails[](#toc_2)

You've [viewed and filtered your contacts](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/18093170146061#toc_1) in the data health center. Now, you want Apollo to enrich the data for those contacts. You can choose to enrich individual contacts or enrich multiple contacts at the same time.

To enrich the data for a single contact, click **Fix data** or **Update with new email**.

[![Enrich a single contact's data.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i4.png)

To enrich the data for multiple contacts:

1.  Click the checkbox beside the name of each contact you want to enrich. Then, click **Update selected**. [![Update your selected contacts' data.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i5.png)
2.  You can choose to add the selected contacts to a list. For job changes, you can also choose to update the existing contact information, or to create a new contact and assign an owner to them.
3.  Then, click **Enrich contacts**. Once Apollo completes the enrichment process, the contacts you enriched disappear from the list. [![Start the enrichment process.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i6.png)

The data enrichment process is complete. If you are an Apollo admin and would like to automate this process, continue to the [Schedule Data Enrichment](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/18093170146061#toc_3) section.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Schedule Data Enrichment (Admins Only)[](#toc_3)

If you are an Apollo admin, you can schedule the data enrichment process for contacts. This automates the task of enriching contact data based on a schedule you choose. It also saves your team the hassle of repeatedly enriching contacts one at a time.

Before scheduling data enrichment, you should ensure that relevant settings have been enabled. To do so, launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Prospecting Config**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/org), then toggle the settings in the **Job Change Alerts** section on.

[![Enable job change settings.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i43.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i43.png)

To schedule data enrichment for contacts:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Data enrichment**](https://app.apollo.io/#/enrichment-status/data-health-center).
2.  Click **Schedule enrichment**. [![Schedule the enrichment process.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i35.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i35.png)
3.  Click **Add new**. [![Add a new scheduled process.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i36.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i36.png)
4.  Decide which type of data you want to enrich: **Job change** or **Missing email addresses**.
    
    If you choose **Job change**, click the **Update existing** tab to update existing contacts, or click **Create new** to create new contacts and update the stage for the existing contact. [![Choose the data to enrich.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i37.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i37.png)
    
5.  Set whether the enrichment process runs on a weekly or monthly schedule, and enter the maximum number of credits you want to use each time this process runs. Then, click **Next**. [![Set an enrichment schedule and credit limit.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i38.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i38.png)
6.  Enter a name for your scheduled process. [![Name your process.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i39.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i39.png)
7.  (Optional) If you want to use credits to enrich data for only high-priority contacts, filter the contacts that are included in your schedule process.
    
    To filter contacts, click **Add filters**. Choose the filters that you want to apply, then click **Apply Filters**. [![Add filters to your process.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i40.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i40.png)
    
8.  If you are enriching data based on job changes and choose to create new contacts, select an owner for the new contacts created as a result of this data enrichment process. Then, set the contact stage for the outdated contacts. [![Add new contact owner.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i41.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i41.png)
9.  Click **Schedule**. A pop-up confirms that you have successfully scheduled the data enrichment process.

Your data enrichment process is now scheduled to run. If you want to adjust or delete the scheduled process, continue to the [Change Schedules for Data Enrichment (Admins Only)](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/18093170146061#toc_4) section.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Change Schedules for Data Enrichment (Admins Only)[](#toc_4)

You've already [**scheduled processes for contact data enrichment**](https://app.apollo.io/#/data-health-center), but now you want to adjust those processes or stop them from running entirely. As an Apollo admin, you can adjust every detail of your enrichment schedules.

To adjust a scheduled process and keep it running, go to the data health center and click **Schedule enrichment**. Then, click the **pencil** icon for the schedule you want to edit. From here, follow the steps in the [Schedule Data Enrichment](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/18093170146061#toc_3) section to make your changes.

To stop a scheduled process from running, you have two choices: pause the schedule, or delete the schedule.

Freeze!

Pausing the schedule keeps the process available to reactivate and edit in the future. If you delete a scheduled process, it is gone forever!

To pause a schedule, go to the [data health center](https://app.apollo.io/#/enrichment-status/data-health-center) and click **Schedule enrichment**. Then, click the **pause** icon.

[![Pause your scheduled process.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i30.png)

To reactivate a paused schedule, return to the same place and click the **resume** icon.

To delete a schedule, go to the data health center and click **Schedule enrichment**. Then, click the **trash can** icon.

[![Delete your scheduled process.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i14.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Uncover New Contacts and Save to Lists[](#toc_5)

Beyond identifying contacts with missing emails and job changes, the data health center also shows how many net new contacts are available compared to your current contact count. Filter this data by account segments and/or personas to uncover your addressable market, and then save the contacts to your Apollo lists.

To filter the data for net new contacts and save them to lists:

1.  Launch Apollo and click [**Data enrichment**](https://app.apollo.io/#/data-health-center).
2.  Scroll down to the total available contacts section. Here, you can filter the data displayed by account segments and/or personas. To filter, click either the **Select account segments** or the **Select personas** drop-down, choose the segments or personas you want to include in the contacts list, and then click **Apply**. [![Filter data by personas](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i28.png)
3.  Click **Preview contacts**. [![Preview the contacts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i31.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i31.png)
4.  Enter the name of the list that you want to add contacts to, and then click the checkbox for each persona you want to add to the chosen list. The personas you select must have less than 50,000 contacts combined. Then, click **Confirm**. [![Filter data by personas](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i32.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i32.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Manage the Settings[](#toc_6)

From the [data health center](https://app.apollo.io/#/data-health-center) in Apollo, you can:

*   Use account segments to filter the contacts in the data health center and better determine your data coverage.
*   (Admins only) Confirm that data is syncing appropriately to a connected CRM, pull data from the CRM, and disconnect the CRM.
*   Create and target different personas.

[![Settings in data health center.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i15.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Account Segments[](#toc_7)

To set up account segments and use them to filter data in the [data health center](https://app.apollo.io/#/data-health-center):

1.  Click the **Dashboard settings** drop-down, then **Account segments**. In the account segment settings pop-up, you can manage existing account segments, and create new account segments.
2.  (Optional) To create a new account segment, click **Create account segment**. Give it a name, add filters, and then click **Save Account Segment**. [![Create a new account segment.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i18.png)
3.  Toggle an account segment's slider on/off to enable or disable a segment in the data health center. Then, click the X in the top-right corner to return to the data health center. [![Turn a segment on or off.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i29.png)
4.  To filter data using your account segments, click the **Select account segments** drop-down. Click the checkbox for the segments you want to use, and then click **Apply**. Apollo immediately filters the data in the total available contacts section based on your selections. [![Filter data using account segments.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i19.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### CRM Connection (Admins Only)[](#toc_8)

To manage your CRM connection in the [data health center](https://app.apollo.io/#/data-health-center), click the **Dashboard settings** drop-down, then **CRM connection**.

From here, you can check if all the data from your CRM has correctly synced with Apollo.

[![Check the CRM sync status.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i20.png)

To pull data from your CRM:

1.  Click the **additional options** (...) button, then **Pull data from CRM**. [![Pull data from your CRM.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i21.png)
2.  Click **Pull Now**. [![Pull the data.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i22.png)

If you disconnect your CRM, you can no longer access data health center features in Apollo. To disconnect a CRM, click the **additional options** (...) button, then **Disconnect from CRM**.

[![Disconnect a CRM.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i23.png)

To make changes to your mapped fields, click **Fields mapping**. Edit the mapped fields, and then click **Save**.

[![Edit your field mappings for your CRM.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i24.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Personas (Admins Only)[](#toc_9)

To manage your personas in the [data health center](https://app.apollo.io/#/data-health-center):

1.  Click the **Dashboard settings** drop-down, then **Personas**.
2.  In the manage personas pop-up, you can create new personas, and edit, clone, or delete your existing personas. [![Manage your personas.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i26.png)

1.  Toggle a persona's slider on/off to enable or disable a persona in the data health center. [![Enable personas.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i27.png)
2.  The data and filtering options available to you adjust based on changes you make to personas. For example, if you enable a persona, Apollo automatically compares the data in your connected CRM with the data in Apollo for the specific records that meet the criteria of that persona. Apollo then displays the results in the total available contacts section and adds the persona as an option for filtering that graph. [![Filter data by personas](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_the_data_health_center_in_apollo/i28.png)

Cockpit Status

Cockpit is only available for customers that joined Apollo prior to October 31, 2023. Apollo continually works with our user base to assess, improve, and update features that make your go-to-market strategies successful. As a result, Apollo has utilized learnings from cockpit usage to refine and build even better features.

If you are an existing cockpit user, you can continue to leverage the feature in [analytics](https://app.apollo.io/#/analytics). Apollo will keep you posted if any further changes occur.

## Overview[](#toc_0)

The Apollo cockpit provides you with a customizable at-a-glance view of various reports and data in the Apollo platform. This includes details like your own daily tasks, email and call stats, job-change alerts, team activity, and more.

Refer to the sections below for details about how to access and configure the Apollo cockpit.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Access the Cockpit[](#toc_1)

To access the cockpit:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Analytics** > [**Cockpit**](https://app.apollo.io/#/cockpit).
2.  Click the drop-down to select the layout that you'd like to use. Apollo offers 2 default layouts: **Sales Rep Cockpit** and **Sales Manager Cockpit**. [![Select the cockpit layout.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/cockpit_overview/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/cockpit_overview/i18.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Sales Rep Cockpit[](#toc_2)

[![Sales Rep Cockpit Layout](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/cockpit_overview/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/cockpit_overview/i6.png)

The Sales Rep cockpit layout provides the following views and reports:

*   Last Week's Email Stats
*   Complete My Daily Tasks
*   Last Week's Call Stats
*   My Scheduled Emails
*   This Week's Email Stats
*   This Week's Call Stats
*   Job Changes At My Accounts

Cockpits and Account Data

Please note, all cockpit layouts use data about the tasks, interactions, and actions you've taken or scheduled in Apollo. That means that the data in your layout may differ from other users in your account.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Sales Manager Cockpit[](#toc_3)

[![Sales Manager Cockpit Layout](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/cockpit_overview/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/cockpit_overview/i3.png)

The Sales Manager cockpit layout provides the following views and reports:

*   Team Activity Report
*   Team Activity Report - Chart
*   Percentage Of Emails Marked Interested By Rep
*   Percentage Of Emails Marked Interested By Rep - Chart
*   How Many Calls Have We Made This Week?
*   How Many Calls Have We Made This Week? - Chart
*   Rep Calls With A Positive Outcome
*   Rep Calls With A Positive Outcome - Chart
*   How Many Contacts Have We Added To Sequences This Week?
*   How Many Contacts Have We Added To Sequences This Week? - Chart
*   High Performing Sequences

Cockpits and Account Data

## Watch the Video[](#toc_0)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Credit is the currency that Apollo uses to retrieve **contact** data within the Apollo platform. When you request **contact** data, Apollo charges you credits for the verified information it finds.

What About Accounts?

Please note, Apollo does not charge any credits for **accounts**. This means that you can save and export up to 300,000 **accounts** in your Apollo instance without paying a penny.

Apollo provides you with a monthly allowance of credits based on the terms of your billing cycle and the type of Apollo plan that you are on. Therefore, the number of credits in your plan correlates with the number of **contacts** that you can prospect each billing cycle.

Push Your Limits

Want to customize your plan and access more email and mobile credits each billing cycle? Refer to the "Customize Your Credit Allowance" section of the [Customize and Manage Your Apollo Plan](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4677130104333-Customize-and-Manage-Your-Apollo-Plan) article. For more general information on Apollo pricing, click [here](https://www.apollo.io/pricing/).

Refer to the sections below for more information about the different types of credits in Apollo, the cost of enrichment, tracking your usage of credits, and checking credit refunds in Apollo.

## Credit Types in Apollo[](#toc_2)

Apollo categorizes credits into 2 types:

### Email Credits[](#toc_3)

When you request a contact's personal or business email address in Apollo, Apollo verifies the data and charges you 1 email credit for the verified emails it finds.

In the Mood for Multiple Emails?

Please note, Apollo does not charge you for more than 1 email per **contact**. You can choose to access a **contact's** personal email, business email, or both. For more information about how Apollo charges email credits based on your **Primary** email settings, please refer to the credit details table in the "[Will Apollo Charge Me for More than One Email per Contact?](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/6319289281805-Will-Apollo-Charge-Me-for-More-Than-One-Email-per-Contact-)" article. To find out how to change your primary email type and access both business and personal emails, please refer to [this article](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/6217107598861-Prospect-with-Personal-and-Business-Emails).

If Apollo cannot fully verify an email or mobile number but is 60%-90% confident that the details are correct, Apollo shares a **Guessed Email**. You do not pay any credits for **Guessed Emails**.

How Do You Do It?

Wondering how we do what we do? For more information about the verification process in Apollo, please refer to the "[How Do Data Requests Work?](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4738396786701-How-Do-Data-Requests-Work-)" article.

### Mobile Credits[](#toc_4)

When you request a **net new contact's** phone number or enrich one of your **saved contact's** phone numbers, Apollo verifies the data and charges you 1 mobile credit for the verified phone number it finds.

Apollo charges 1 mobile credit per **contact** for any of the following personal phone numbers:

*   **Mobile**: A **contact's** personal mobile number
*   **Direct**: A **contact's** direct work number
*   **Office Extension**: A company phone number with a **contact's** personal extension

Apollo retrieves data from public sources. This means that a **contact's** personal number is not always available. If Apollo cannot find a personal number for a **contact**, Apollo does not charge you any credits.

Because You're Worth It!

Please note, mobile credits are not used for corporate numbers. When you request a **contact's** email address, Apollo also verifies their office phone number at the same time. Apollo doesn't charge you any credits for this corporate number.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Enrichment Requests[](#toc_5)

There are 3 types of enrichment in Apollo:

*   [CRM Enrichment](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4413921630989-CRM-Enrichment-Overview)
*   [CSV Enrichment](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409226361229-Improve-Your-CSV-Data-With-CSV-Enrichment)
*   [API Enrichment](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416625121421-Improve-Your-Data-With-API-Enrichment)

For each enriched email or enriched mobile number you request, Apollo charges one credit. If you request to enrich a **contact** that has an existing email or mobile number and Apollo finds that the information it contains is accurate, the verification process still costs you one credit.

All Things Enrichment!

For more information about how enrichment works in Apollo, please refer to the [Enrich section](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us#section-18213864947469) of the Apollo Knowledge Base.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Check Your Email Credit Refunds[](#toc_6)

There are 2 scenarios in which Apollo refunds your email credits:

*   When Apollo cannot find a requested **contact's** email
*   When you send an email to a **verified contact** within 30 days of requesting the details and the email bounces

Only in Apollo

Please note, Apollo can only refund your email credit(s) for the email(s) that you send within Apollo.

To check your email credit refunds, launch Apollo and click **Settings**.

[![Settings Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_data_requests/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_data_requests/i3.png)

Scroll to **System Activity** and click **Data Request History**.

[![Data Request History Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_data_requests/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_data_requests/i4.png)

Check the statistics from the **Email Requests** tab to identify any refunded email credits.

[![Email Requests Statistics](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_data_requests/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_data_requests/i5.png)

For a contact-level view of the data, click the **Additional Options (...)** button on the right of the data you want to view. Then, click **View in Contacts**.

[![View in Contacts Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_data_requests/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_data_requests/i6.png)

Apollo displays the batch of **contacts** that you purchased. Hover your mouse over the **Email** icon next to each **contact** to identify the emails that Apollo could and could not verify in this batch.

[![Email Icons](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_data_requests/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/faq_data_requests/i7.png)

No Mobile Refunds

## Track Your Credit Usage[](#toc_7)

You can track your credit usage throughout your billing cycle and check when your credits are due to reset.

New Cycle, New Credits

Please note, both email and mobile credits reset every billing cycle. **Credits do not roll over** into the next cycle, so please keep this in mind when you are making any changes to your plan.

Launch Apollo and click **Settings**.

On a Free Plan?
