## Overview[](#toc_1)

Apollo displays standard default contact and account fields you can map to Salesforce contact, lead, or account fields. You can also manually enable the "autofill" or "auto overwrite" setting for each field.

Refer to the steps below to manually map default Apollo fields to Salesforce and enable the appropriate setting.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Map Default Apollo Fields to Salesforce, Enable the Autofill or Auto Overwrite Settings[](#toc_2)

To map Apollo's default fields to Salesforce:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Integrations**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/integrations).
2.  Click **View** beside the Salesforce integration. [![View Salesforce Integration](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i25.png)
3.  Scroll to **Stage and Field Mappings** and click **View**. [![View Stage and Field Mappings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i26.png)
4.  Click either the **Contacts**, **Leads**, **Accounts**, or **Deals** tab depending on the record type you want to map. The process to map Apollo default fields to Salesforce fields is the same for all record types, so repeat these steps to map additional fields to Salesforce. [![Contacts, Leads, and Accounts Tabs](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i27.png)
5.  In the Default Field Mappings section, click **View**. [![Default Field Mappings Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i31.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i31.png)
6.  For each Apollo field in the Name column, select a Salesforce field from the corresponding drop-down to map. Unmapped fields do not sync. [![Map fields.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i29.png)
7.  Click the **Autofill** checkbox if you want Apollo to automatically use the information within the Apollo database to fill in the field from Salesforce. Apollo only autofills a default field if the Salesforce field is empty and Apollo has relevant information available.
    
    Click the **Auto Overwrite** checkbox if you want Apollo to automatically overwrite the existing information in the field from Salesforce with the information within Apollo. Apollo only overwrites a default field if it has relevant information available for the field that differs from the data in Salesforce. [![Auto Overwrite and Autofill](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/30.png)
    
    Manual Has the Last Word
    
    Manual actions always take precedence. If you manually enrich a field from the [CRM enrichment page](https://app.apollo.io/#/enrichment-status/enrichment), Apollo pushes the update even if you have disabled the autofill or auto overwrite setting for that field.
    
8.  Click **Save**.

You have now manually mapped Apollo's default fields to Salesforce. If you make future [changes in your Salesforce environment after mapping](#toc_3), make sure those changes reflect in Apollo.

All Good Things in Moderation

When you enable autofill or auto overwrite, the feature only runs when Apollo pulls information from Salesforce.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Keep Apollo Updated with Salesforce Changes[](#toc_3)

If you change or add a stage in Salesforce after you've mapped it to Apollo, make sure those changes match your stage mapping in Apollo.

If you delete a stage in Salesforce, remember to move the lead/contact/account/deal information into an active stage that is in use. For more information about mapping best practices, refer to [Automatically Create and Map Stages Between Salesforce and Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4416454481805).

For a general overview of how contact and account stages work in Apollo, check out [Contact and Account Stages Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410623601165).

## Overview[](#toc_1)

The **Error Log** in Apollo allows you to view any sync errors that Apollo receives when pushing information from Apollo into Salesforce. From this page, you can browse through your error history, access further information about the error, filter by date and timeframe, and retry a failed sync.

Refer to the sections below for the steps to take to access the **Error Log**, retry a "push" job, and gain a more granular view of a specific record's sync history.

[Back to Top](#top)

## View Sync Errors and Retry the Push[](#toc_2)

Launch Apollo to view any sync errors that Apollo receives from your Salesforce instance, click **Settings**, and then click **Integrations**.

[![Settings-Integrations](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i5.png)

Click **View** in the connected Salesforce integration.

[![View Salesforce Integration](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i6.png)

Then, scroll to **Error Log** and click **View**.

[![View Error Log](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i12.png)

From this page, you can view any errors that occur when Apollo attempts to push information from Apollo into Salesforce.

[![Error Log](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i13.png)

Click the **Errors** drop-down on the right to filter by push type.

[![Error Type Filter](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i14.png)

You can also click the **Dates** drop-down to filter by date or timeframe.

[![Date and Timeframe Filter](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i15.png)

To find out what caused an error, check the **Error Description** column.

[![Error Description Column](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_error_log/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_error_log/i3.png)

Check the **Automatic Retry** column to view if and when Apollo will automatically retry a failed push.

[![Automatic Retry Column](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_error_log/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_error_log/i1.png)

Hover your mouse over the information to view the date and time that Apollo plans to retry the push.

[![Date and Time of Automatic Retry](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_error_log/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_error_log/i2.png)

Fifth Time's a Charm!

Please note, Apollo automatically attempts to retry a failed push 5 times. If this still does not work, you will need to address the error source and then manually retry the push.

If you want to manually retry a failed push, click the checkbox(es) of the error(s), and then click **Retry Selected**.

[![Retry Selected Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i16.png)

You have now requested for Apollo to re-attempt the push. If the push fails again, Apollo displays this on the Error Log.

[Back to Top](#top)

## View Error Sync History for a Specific Contact or Account[](#toc_3)

For a more granular view of a specific record's sync history, navigate to the **contact** or **account** profile page and click **More**.

[![Profile Page-More](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i17.png)

Click **CRM Sync History**.

[![CRM Sync History](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i18.png)

Apollo displays a modal with the sync history for the specific **contact** or **account**. From here, you can view information about both push and pull-related errors.

[![Sync History Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/understand_how_the_salesforce_integration_works_in_apollo/i19.png)

You have now accessed the error sync history for the contact or account.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

When you create a contact or account in Apollo, the system considers you, the user logged in to Apollo, as the owner of the record. This is slightly different from what occurs when Apollo synchronizes records (which may include contact or account creation, emails, tasks, and calls) to Salesforce. In this instance, Apollo uses your personal Salesforce credentials (if they have been authenticated), the Salesforce account used as the **Team Sync** credentials, or the credentials from the authenticated user with the most permissions.

Refer to the sections below for an explanation of how record ownership works.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Personal Salesforce Login Connected[](#toc_2)

Generally speaking, when you have your personal Salesforce credentials linked to your Apollo account, the system will always use your user-specific account to sync contact and account ownership and the activity logs for emails, tasks, and calls to Salesforce.

[![Authenticated User](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_credentials/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_credentials/i2.png)

There are specific cases when Apollo assigns a different record creator when you sync to Salesforce. Depending on how the contacts are created in Apollo, Apollo determines which user account is updated as **Created By** in Salesforce.

| Personal Salesforce Account | Team Sync Credentials |
| --- | --- |
| Contacts/Accounts manually created in Apollo | Contacts created from Apollo's Chrome extension in LinkedIn |
| Contacts/Accounts created from a CSV upload | Contacts/Accounts created from Apollo's Search |
| Contacts created from Apollo's Chrome Extension in Gmail | Contacts created from Apollo's Job Change trigger |

[Back to Top](#top)

## Team Sync Credentials Connected, but not a Personal Salesforce Account[](#toc_3)

When you link Salesforce to Apollo using a specific user for the **Team Sync** integration, but you have not authenticated your own credentials in your user profile, any contacts that you create will have your user assigned as the owner on Apollo. However, when you sync that data to Salesforce, the record creator assigned will be the user connected on the **Team Sync** configuration or the Salesforce account user with most permissions.

[![Team Sync](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_credentials/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/salesforce_credentials/i3.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

Things Can Only Get Better

Please note, Salesforce is currently reviewing this feature for official release. Stay tuned for further updates. If you have already installed the Apollo for Salesforce app and want to uninstall the beta version, follow the instructions in this article. If you experience any issues, our technical support team is here to help. You can [send us an email](mailto: support@apollo.io), [submit a request](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/requests/new), or reach out via our chatbot at any time.

If you work primarily within Salesforce but like to use Apollo to keep your data up-to-date, you may have installed the beta version of the Apollo app to enrich the records within your Salesforce account. You can uninstall Apollo from Salesforce at any time.

Refer to the section below for the steps to uninstall the Apollo for Salesforce app.

## Uninstall Apollo for Salesforce[](#toc_2)

To uninstall the Apollo for Salesforce app:

1.  Launch Salesforce, click the **Settings** icon, and then click **Setup**. [![Settings Tab in Settings Drop-Down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i1.png)
2.  Scroll to the **Users** drop-down and then click **Permission Sets**. [![Permission Sets Tab on Setup Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/install_the_apollo_for_salesforce_app/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/install_the_apollo_for_salesforce_app/i10.png)
3.  Click **Apollo User**. [![Apollo User Field in Permission Sets Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/install_the_apollo_for_salesforce_app/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/install_the_apollo_for_salesforce_app/i11.png)
4.  Click **Manage Assignments**. [![Manage Assignments Button on Apollo User Permission Sets Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/install_the_apollo_for_salesforce_app/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/install_the_apollo_for_salesforce_app/i3.png)
5.  Click the first checkbox to select all users and then click the **Delete** icon. [![Delete Icon on Current Assignments Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i2.png)
6.  Click **Remove** in the **Remove permission sets assignments?** modal to confirm your decision. [![Remove Button in Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i3.png)
7.  Scroll to **Platform Tools** on the left. Click the **Apps** drop-down, click **Packaging**, and then click **Installed Packages**. [![Installed Packages in the Menu on the Left](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i4.png)
8.  Scroll to **ApolloAppEnrichment** and click **Uninstall** on the left. [![Uninstall Button for Apollo for Salesforce App](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i5.png) ](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i5.png)Review the information in the warning modal at the top of the page. [![Warning Modal on Uninstall Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i6.png)
9.  Then, scroll to the bottom of the page and click the **Save a copy of this package's data for 48 hours after uninstall** radio button if you want to save a backup of your enriched records. [![Radio Button to Save Data in Salesforce](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i7.png)
10.  Alternatively, click the **Do not save a copy of this package's data after uninstall** radio button. Salesforce displays a warning modal. Click **Ok** if you are sure that you do not want to save a backup of your enriched records. [![Radio Button to Delete Data in Salesforce](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i8.png)
11.  Click the **Yes, I want to uninstall this package and permanently delete all associated components** checkbox. Then, click **Uninstall**. [![Uninstall Button in Salesforce](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i9.png)
12.  If you clicked the radio button to save a backup of your enriched records, refresh the page and click **Data** to download a Zip file of your data. [![Data Button Under Uninstalled Packages Section](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i10.png)
13.  If you want to permanently delete the Apollo for Salesforce app, click **Del**. [![Delete Button Under Uninstalled Packages Section](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/uninstall_apollo_for_salesforce/i11.png)
You have now successfully uninstalled the Apollo for Salesforce app from your Salesforce account.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

It Depends On Your Plan

Access to this feature is dependent on your Apollo plan. Please refer to the pricing comparison chart on the [Apollo pricing page](https://www.apollo.io/pricing#compare) for more information. If you do not currently have access to this feature and want to upgrade plans, please reach out to the [Apollo sales team](https://apollo.na.chilipiper.com/router/sales_router?leadsource=Inbound&lead_source_details__c=KnowledgeBase).

A billing and seat manager is a free Apollo seat for leadership team members who only need access to administrative features in your Apollo instance.

You may want to become a billing and seat manager in Apollo if you are not directly involved in your team's sales activities but still want:

*   Access to billing and payment settings.
*   The ability to configure your team's account settings and manage seats.

Got Admin Superpowers?

Please note, only admin users can invite, edit, assign, and deactivate billing and seat manager users in Apollo.

As a billing and seat manager in your team's account, you have access to the following Apollo features:

*   Admin and billing settings.
*   Tracking subdomain and integration settings.
*   System activity settings.
*   Apollo homepage.
*   Analytics and reporting.

As a billing and seat manager, you can configure all the core admin settings in your team's instance. However, you do not have access to the full functionality of Apollo. This means you can view your team's performance but can't leverage Apollo's prospecting and engagement tools yourself. If you want full access to Apollo, [upgrade your seat](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/21231183878797#toc_3) to leverage full admin or user rights.

Refer to the following steps to add, edit, or deactivate billing and seat manager permissions to users in your Apollo account.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Add a Billing and Seat Manager User to Your Apollo Account[](#toc_2)

To invite a new user to your account as a billing and seat manager:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Users**](https://app.apollo.io/#/users)
2.  Click **New user**. [![New user button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/assign_apollo_managers_to_collaborators_in_your_team/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/assign_apollo_managers_to_collaborators_in_your_team/i1.png)
3.  Then, click the **Set permission profile** drop-down and select **Billing and seat manager**. Enter the email address(es) of the new user(s) you want to add as billing and seat managers and click **Send Invites**. [![Invite your team pop-up](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/assign_apollo_managers_to_collaborators_in_your_team/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/assign_apollo_managers_to_collaborators_in_your_team/i2.png)

### Will I be Charged for Billing and Seat Manager Users?[](#toc_5)

Seats for billing and seat managers are free of charge in Apollo. If you have access to this feature within your [Apollo plan](https://www.apollo.io/pricing), you can invite up to 5 team members to join your account as billing and seat managers.

As Apollo does not charge you for billing and seat manager users, please keep in mind that:

*   If you change a full Apollo user into a billing and seat manager, the user loses paid access to Apollo and gains [restricted admin access only](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/21231183878797#toc_1). Apollo frees up their paid seat. You can then invite another user to take their place. Please only continue with the downgrade if you agree with the seat change.
*   If you change a billing and seat manager into a full Apollo user when you don't have any available seats remaining on your plan, Apollo charges you for the extra seat. Apollo warns you of the purchase and confirms the cost. Please only continue with the upgrade if you agree with the seat change.
*   If you change a billing and seat manager into a full Apollo user when you have available seats in your plan, Apollo upgrades the user to full access at no extra cost. Apollo warns you of the seat consumption. Please only continue with the upgrade if you agree with the seat change.
*   If you deactivate a billing and seat manager, no changes to your billing will occur. You will have a free Apollo manager seat available and can invite another team member to replace them as a billing and seat manager if you want to.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Apollo provides admin with a robust set of controls to limit the actions each user can take. For your team, this gives you the ability to employ the principle of least privilege, ensuring that everyone can undertake the actions needed to be successful without being burdened by permissions they don't require.

Admin Only Ahead

To make changes to users and their roles, you must have an [admin account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409154208269-Create-and-Assign-Permission-Profiles) in Apollo.

The following sections explain how to add, deactivate, and reactivate users.

## Deactivate Users[](#toc_3)

Offboard Two-Step

If someone leaves your company and you want to revoke their access to Apollo, deactivate their user account first, then [unlink their mailboxes](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/19883438029069).

To deactivate a user:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Users**](https://app.apollo.io/#/users).
2.  Click **...** next to the person that you want to deactivate, then click **Deactivate**.

[![Deactivate user button is highlighted beside a user named Jarrod Manning](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_deactivate_and_reactivate_users/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_deactivate_and_reactivate_users/i30.png)

3.  Click **Deactivate** to confirm.

The user is now deactivated. To complete offboarding, [unlink their mailboxes](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/19883438029069).

If you've set up [SCIM user provisioning](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/15570877535757%20), Apollo automatically creates a new user in Apollo when you assign a user in Okta. The same applies when you deactivate or update a user.

Encountering issues? There are 2 reasons Apollo may not have created a newly assigned Okta user in Apollo:

*   **[Your team](http://apollo.io/) has hit your plan's seat limit**: You can [upgrade your plan here](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/plans/upgrade) to increase your seat limit. Or, if you would like assistance, please [contact support](mailto:%20support@apollo.io).
*   **The user is part of another team in Apollo**: Apollo sends the user an invitation to join your team. The user must accept the invite for the SCIM user provisioning to work.

For more information about all things Okta, refer to the [Set Up Single Sign-On (SSO) with Okta for Your Apollo Account](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/12667892496141) article.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

As an Apollo admin, you can manage and upgrade your plan, add additional sets, and increase or decrease the number of recurring minutes and [credits](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/credits/about) that your team can access each billing cycle.

Apollo add-on credits allow you to:

*   Access the right number of verified emails and mobile numbers for your team every billing cycle.
*   Adapt your Apollo plan to your needs without speaking to a sales representative first.

Got credits on the mind?

Team on a roll and want to access more credits? To upgrade your plan, follow the steps in the [upgrade or edit your plan](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4677130104333-Customize-and-Manage-Your-Apollo-Plan#toc_3) section, or reach out to the friendly [Apollo sales team](https://apollo.na.chilipiper.com/router/sales_router?leadsource=Inbound&lead_source_details__c=KnowledgeBase) for further advice.

If you are on a plan with unlimited email credits, please remember that Apollo operates under a fair use policy to prevent potential abuse. For additional info, refer to [Apollo's terms](https://www.apollo.io/terms#:~:text=g.,order%20to%20prevent%20potential%20abuse).

Apollo add-on minutes allow you to:

*   Access the right number of dialer minutes for your team every billing cycle.
*   Adapt your Apollo plan to your needs according to your team's minutes usage.

You can also monitor the number of [AI-generated words](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/15396174946445-Use-the-AI-Writing-Assistant-in-Your-Emails) and [conversation minutes](https://app.apollo.io/#/conversations) your team consumes each billing cycle. To increase your limits, [upgrade your plan](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4677130104333-Customize-and-Manage-Your-Apollo-Plan#toc_3) or add more seats.

Refer to the sections below for the steps to access the manage plan settings, customize your team's credit and minute usage, and upgrade your plan.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Step 0: Access Your Plan Settings[](#toc_2)

As an Apollo admin, you can access the **Manage Plan** settings in Apollo. To do so:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Manage Plan**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/plans).
2.  From the **Plan Overview** tab, you can:
    *   Access a breakdown of what's included in your plan.
    *   View your team's credit, minute, and word usage for the current billing cycle and purchase add-ons.
    *   Upgrade plans, add or remove seats, and customize credits from the [**Manage Subscription**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/plans/upgrade) button.
3.  Click the [**Billing**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/plans/billing) tab to update your credit card, edit your billing information, and review and download your invoices. For more information, refer to the [Manage Your Billing Information in Apollo](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/14140209188621-Manage-Your-Billing-Information-in-Apollo%0A) article. [![Billing tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i13.png)
4.  Click the [**License Settings**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/plans/license-settings) tab to configure domain and seat management preferences, create an invite link for your team, assign default permission profiles, and request a domain change. [![License settings tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i14.png)

Refer to the steps in the following sections if you want to upgrade or customize your existing plan.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Step 1: Upgrade or Edit Your Plan[](#toc_3)

Skip Ahead for Those Sweet, Sweet Credits!

Please note, if you're happy with your existing plan and just want to add extra credits or minutes, feel free to skip this section. Head straight to the [Customize Your Credit Allowance](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4677130104333-Customize-and-Manage-Your-Apollo-Plan#toc_4) section for more details about purchasing add-ons for your current plan.

To upgrade or edit your plan:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Settings** > [**Manage Plan**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/plans)
2.  Click [**Manage Subscription**](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/plans/upgrade). [![Manage Subscription](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i2.png)
3.  Select your preferred billing schedule, then click the **+** or **\-** button next to **How many users do you have?** to select the number of Apollo seats you need. [![Amend user setting](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i15.png)
4.  Browse through your options to choose the right plan to match your business needs and click **Show plan comparison** for a more comprehensive breakdown. [![Browse Plan](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i16.png)

[![Select Plan](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i17.png)

## Step 2: Customize Your Credit Allowance[](#toc_4)

Scaling and Upgrading Like a Boss!

Please note, you can only customize your credit and minute allowance if you are on a paid Apollo plan. If you are on a free plan and want to purchase credits or minutes, you need to upgrade to a paid plan first. Then, if you would like to add additional credits on top of that plan, the world is your oyster—customize those credits to your heart's content.

Next, scroll to the slider and drag the bar to amend any additional credits or minutes per billing cycle you want to add to your plan.

[![Customize Credits](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i6.png)

Recurring Purchase Only

Please note, the credit slider bar is for recurring purchases only. Apollo adds the cost of the additional credits to your existing billing cycle. This means you cannot add extra credits to your plan as part of a one-time transaction; however, you can adjust your extra credit allowance at any time.

## Step 3: Finalize Your Purchase[](#toc_5)

Now that you've selected your new plan, added any additional users you need, and customized your credits, you're ready to confirm the changes.

To finalize your purchase:

1.  Click **See Price Breakdown** in the **Summary** bar to review a detailed overview of the changes to your plan. [![See Price Breakdown](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i7.png)
2.  Click the **X** to return to the previous screen. [![Exit Price Breakdown Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i8.png)
    
    Time it Right!
    
    Apollo syncs the changes to your plan according to your billing cycle. This means that the charges are not pro-rated. If you upgrade or purchase add-on credits in the middle or toward the end of your billing cycle, Apollo still charges the full amount and deposits all the credits to your account. Unused credits expire at the end of your billing cycle. It pays to be organized! Make sure you take full advantage of your new plan from the first month by making changes in sync with the dates of your billing cycle.
    
3.  Click **Upgrade** to confirm the purchase. [![Confirm Changes](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i10.png)
    
    Don't See the Upgrade Button?
    
    Please note, if you want to upgrade to a custom or organization plan, you'll need a helping hand to tailor your plan according to your team's needs. Click **Talk to Sales** to finalize the changes with a friendly Apollo human!
    
4.  Apollo loads a confirmation modal. Read the information and click **Continue**. [![Continue](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i11.png)
5.  If you upgrade from a free plan or need to update your billing details, Apollo displays the "Payment Information" modal. Confirm your credit card details and fill in your information. Then, click **Add Credit Card & Pay Now**. [![See Price Breakdown](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i9.png)
6.  Once Apollo verifies your payment information, you can access your new plan and any add-ons you purchased. [![Success](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/self_serve_credits/i12.png)

Need a Helping Hand?

Have additional questions? For more information on all things credits, refer to the [What are credits page](https://app.apollo.io/#/settings/credits/about). For additional support upgrading or amending your plan, reach out to the [Apollo sales team](https://apollo.na.chilipiper.com/router/sales_router?leadsource=Inbound&lead_source_details__c=KnowledgeBase). And if you've made it this far but couldn't find the answers you're looking for, reach out to the friendly [Apollo support team](https://www.apollo.io/contact-us) for more help.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

**Sequence diagnostics** helps you easily identify and resolve any issues with your domain health, email deliverability, and contact data accuracy to improve the performance of your **sequences** in Apollo.

Access Apollo recommendations and take action in the **sequence diagnostics** tool to:

*   Check your domain health and take precautionary steps to protect your primary domain
*   Review best practices to send mass emails safely and connect Mailgun or SendGrid
*   View your tracking domain status and learn best practices to avoid SPAM filters
*   Identify and pause any unverified **contacts** in your **sequences**

Follow the steps in the sections below to access **sequence diagnostics** and follow email best practices.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Run Sequence Diagnostics[](#toc_2)

Launch Apollo, click **Engage**, and then click **Sequences**.

[![Sequences Tab on the Engage Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i1.png)

Click **Run diagnostics**.

[![Run Diagnostics Button on Sequences Page](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i2.png)

There are 4 categories available in the **Sequence diagnostics** modal.

[![4 Tabs in the Sequence Diagnostics Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i3.png)

Just a Heads Up

Please note, if your linked mailbox belongs to a free domain, such as example@gmail.com or example@yahoo.com, you can only access the **Unverified contacts** tab in the **Sequence Diagnostics** modal. [![1 Tab in the Sequence Diagnostics Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i32.png) ](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i32.png)To access all sequence diagnostics insights, you need to [connect a mailbox](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409127806093-Link-Your-Mailbox-to-Apollo-io) from a paid domain.

### Domain Setup[](#toc_3)

Click the **Domain setup** tab if you want to check the health of your primary domain.

[![Domain Setup Tab in Sequence Diagnostics Modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i4.png)

From here, Apollo displays all the primary domains mapped to your Apollo account. If you have any problems with your domain, you will see a **Fix** icon under the associated issue.

[![Fix Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i5.png)

Hover your mouse over the icon to access more detailed insights. Then, click the links to take action on these insights and improve your domain's health.

[![Apollo Suggestions Under Fix Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i6.png)

Hang Tight While We Work Our Magic!

Please note, when you take any actions to protect your domain, it can take between 2-4 hours for the change to reflect in Apollo.

If you make any changes, click the **Refresh** icon after 2-4 hours to re-diagnose your domain.

[![Refresh Icon on the Right of the Screen](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i7.png)

When you have set up everything correctly, you should see a **Good** icon under each category.

[![Good Icon in Domain Setup Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i8.png)

Hover your mouse over the title of an email authentication method to view its definition and access more information.

[![Email Authentication Method Tooltip](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i31.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i31.png)

Now That You're Here...

There are 3 email authentication methods that Apollo recommends you set up to ensure a healthy domain:

*   **Sender Policy Framework (SPF)**: SPF records authorize your emails so that you can more easily detect and prevent unauthorized IP addresses from sending emails on your behalf. To set up SPF records, follow the steps in [this article](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5046457454861-Set-Up-Sender-Policy-Framework-SPF-Records-to-Authorize-Your-Emails).
*   **Domain Keys Identified Mail (DKIM)**: the DKIM method adds an encrypted digital signature to your company's outgoing emails. This helps the receiving email servers to confirm that you authorized and sent an email from your domain. To set up DKIM, follow the steps in [this article](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5046544644365-Set-Up-Domain-Keys-Identified-Mail-DKIM-to-Authenticate-Your-Email).
*   **Domain-based Message Authentication Reporting and Conformance (DMARC)**: this method allows you to limit sent emails to those authenticated by your company and leverages SPF and DKIM to help prevent email spoofing. To set up DMARC, follow the steps in [this article](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5046576375437-Set-Up-Domain-based-Message-Authentication-Reporting-and-Conformance-DMARC-to-Authenticate-Your-Emails).

If you want to more learn about the best practices you can follow to protect your domain reputation, click the **Purchase a secondary domain** drop-down for more information.

[![Apollo Recommendations](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i9.png)

You have now leveraged domain best practices in **sequence diagnostics**.

[Back to Top](#top)

### SendGrid / Mailgun[](#toc_4)

Click the **SendGrid / Mailgun** tab if you want to improve email deliverability. From here, Apollo displays your SendGrid or Mailgun status and provides further information about why a mass email delivery service provider is important.

[![SendGrid/Mailgun in Sequence Diagnostics](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i10.png)

If you have already connected SendGrid or Mailgun to Apollo, Apollo displays a **Connected** icon. This means that you have taken the necessary steps to protect your domain and ensure higher email deliverability.

[![Connected Icon in SendGrid and Mailgun Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i11.png)

If you don't have SendGrid or Mailgun set up yet, click **Learn More** to access further information.

[![Learn More Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i12.png)

Then, click **Connect service** to get started with the setup and follow the instructions in the "[Integrate Mailgun with Apollo](hhttps://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/8688131737229-Integrate-Mailgun-with-Apollo)" or the "[Set Up Apollo's Integration with SendGrid](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415867175693-Set-Up-Apollo-s-Integration-with-SendGrid)" article.

[![Connect Service Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i13.png)

For a summary of the best practices to follow to improve your deliverability, click the **Connect Apollo to a mass mailing service provider** drop-down.

[![Best Practices Drop-Down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i14.png)

You have now leveraged email deliverability best practices in **sequence diagnostics**.

[Back to Top](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/top)

### Tracking Domain[](#toc_5)

Click the **Tracking domain** tab if you want to check your tracking domain status and learn more about best practices.

[![Tracking Domain Tab in Sequence Diagnostics](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i15.png)

From here, Apollo displays your tracking domain status and provides further information about how tracking opens, pixels, and unsubscribes with a secondary domain can help you avoid SPAM filters.

If you have already connected a custom tracking subdomain, Apollo displays a **Connected** icon.

[![Connected Icon in Tracking Domain Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i16.png)

You see a **Healthy** badge if your tracking subdomains are in good condition. This means that you have taken the necessary steps to protect your primary domain, avoid SPAM filters, and ensure higher email deliverability.

[![Healthy Badge in Tracking Domain Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i17.png)

If you see an **Unhealthy** badge next to a tracking subdomain, click **View Subdomains** to take a closer look at the stats. Then, consider following the steps in the "[Deactivate a Tracking Subdomain](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415240542733-Set-Up-a-Custom-Tracking-Subdomain-URL-#toc_7)" section of the **Set Up a Tracking Subdomain (URL)** article to deactivate the unhealthy subdomain.

[![UnHealthy Badge in Tracking Domain Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i21.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i21.png)

Hold Your Horses!

Before you deactivate an unhealthy subdomain, make sure you create a new tracking subdomain to replace it first. For more information, follow the steps in the [Set Up a Tracking Subdomain (URL)](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415240542733-Set-Up-a-Custom-Tracking-Subdomain-URL-) article.

If you don't have a custom tracking subdomain connected yet, Apollo displays a **Not set up** icon.

[![Not set up Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i18.png)

Click **Learn More** to access further information about tracking subdomains.

[![Learn More Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i19.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i19.png)

Then, click **Settings** to get started with the setup.

[![Settings Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i20.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i20.png)

Apollo directs you to the **Tracking Subdomains** section in the Apollo **Settings**. You can then follow the instructions in the "[Set Up a Custom Tracking Subdomain (URL)](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415240542733-Set-Up-a-Custom-Tracking-Subdomain-URL-)" article to create and add a new subdomain to Apollo.

[![Tracking Subdomains Tab in Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i22.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i22.png)

For a summary of the best practices to avoid SPAM filters, click the **Set up a tracking domain to track opens, pixels, and unsubscribes** drop-down.

[![Best Practices Drop-Down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i23.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i23.png)

You have now leveraged tracking domain best practices in **sequence diagnostics**.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Unverified Contacts[](#toc_6)

Click the **Unverified contacts** tab to check which sequences have the most unverified emails.

[![Unverified Contacts Tab in Sequence Diagnostics](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i24.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i24.png)

From here, you can take action to pause or remove the **contacts** associated with the unverified emails from your **sequences**. To do so, click the **arrow** icon on the right of a **sequence**.

[![Arrow Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i25.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i25.png)

Apollo directs you to a list of all the **contacts** with unverified emails in that **sequence**.

[![Unverified Emails List](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i26.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i26.png)

Click the **select all** checkbox. Then, click **Select all people** to bulk select all the unverified emails.

[![Select All Checkbox](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i27.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i27.png)

Custom is Convenient!

Please note, you can only bulk select if you are on a Custom plan. If you are on a Free, Basic, or Professional plan, you can select up to 25 records at a time.

Then, click the **Pause** icon if you want to pause the selected **contacts** in the **sequence**.

[![Pause Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i28.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i28.png)

If you want to remove them from the **sequence** entirely, click the **Remove** icon.

[![Remove Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i29.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i29.png)

The world is your oyster!

Please note, Apollo recommends that you pause or remove unverified **contacts** from low-performing **sequences**. However, these are not the only 2 actions you can take. For example, you can choose to mark the **sequence** as finished, set an auto-resume date, or remove them from a list, among other actions. Hover your mouse over the icons to review your options and take any alternative actions on the selected **contacts**.

[![Other Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i30.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/access_apollo_diagnostics/i30.png)

You have now identified the **sequences** with the most unverified emails and taken action on those **contacts** to protect your domain reputation.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

Every account in Apollo has a profile page. By default, these pages feature a variety of information about each company, including basic account details, market insights, activity timelines, and assigned tasks. Additionally, you can rearrange the layouts of these pages to ensure that you view the most relevant information first.

The following sections detail how to access an account profile, the type of information at your disposal, and how to edit profile page layouts.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Access Account Profiles[](#toc_1)

To access the profile page of an account:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Search** > [**Companies**](https://app.apollo.io/#/companies).
2.  To find an account to review, either type a specific company name in the search bar, use the [search filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661) to narrow your search, or click **Saved** to access your saved accounts. [![Find an account.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i45.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i45.png)
3.  Click the company's name to access a full-page version of their profile, or click the blank space around the company's name to access a slide-out version of their profile. [![Access account profile.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i46.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i46.png)

From this page, you can access all the information available for this account in Apollo, including a company overview, account details, [signals](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/13152837789837), and an activity timeline. You can also add the contact to sequences.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Understand the Default Profile Layout and Widgets[](#toc_2)

Apollo displays several default widgets on account profile pages, including:

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Company overview | This widget features basic info about the company, including annual revenue and industry classifications. |

[![View the company overview widget.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i47.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i47.png)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| New prospects | This widget displays a list of prospects that have recently joined the company. |

[![View the new prospects widget.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i48.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i48.png)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Account details | This widget displays account information, including company phone numbers, account owners, and the account stage. |

[![View the account details widget.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i49.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i49.png)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Insights | This widget provides a summary of various events for the company, including job postings, technologies, employee trends, funding rounds, and, if enabled, [website visitors](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/20544185285389). |

[![View the insights widget.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i50.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i50.png)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Activity | This widget displays a log of all interactions between your company and the account. From here, you can log new activities, filter by activity type, and review the activity history. |

[![View the activity widget.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i52.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i52.png)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Signals & communication advice | This widget shows the account's [signals](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/13152837789837), which enables you to prospect based on demographic and behavioral filters of your choosing. |

[![View the signals widget.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i51.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i51.png)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Tasks | This widget shows all of the tasks that have been assigned in Apollo for the account. Click **+** to [create a new task](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4411331110925). You can also choose to complete or skip tasks from this widget. |

[![View the tasks widget.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i53.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i53.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Edit Account Profile Data[](#toc_3)

You can edit certain information for an account from their profile page. Not all details can be changed. To edit contact information, click **Actions** > **Edit company info**.

[![Edit contact details.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i54.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i54.png)

You can also edit information when reviewing specific sections of the profile page. To do so, hover your mouse over the data that you would like to change. If Apollo permits you to make edits, you will see one of the following icons.

[![Edit, Delete, Copy Icons](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i55.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i55.png)

For some fields, all of these icons appear. For others, just 1 or 2 appear. If you hover your mouse over a field and no icon appears, it means that you cannot edit the data for it.

If you believe that information for an account is inaccurate, click **Actions** > **Flag as inaccurate** to submit feedback so Apollo can review the account's data.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Create and Edit Profile Page Layouts[](#toc_4)

By default, contact profile pages are arranged in the **Account overview** layout. You can create your own layout and rearrange the cards on the profile page.

To create a layout:

1.  Go to an account's profile page.
2.  Click **Account overview**. [![Access layouts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i56.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i56.png)
3.  Click **Create layout**. [![Create a layout.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i57.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i57.png)
4.  Enter a name for your layout, then click **Save**. [![Name your layout.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i58.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i58.png)
5.  Click the **layouts** icon again. It will have the name of the layout you just created. [![Access layouts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i59.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i59.png)
6.  Click the layout that you just created to start using it. Then, to rearrange your layout, click **...** > **Edit layout**. [![Edit your layout.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i60.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i60.png)
7.  To rearrange where the widgets appear in your layout, click and hold the handle at the top-left of a widget, then drag it to a different spot in your layout. To remove a widget from your layout, click the trash can icon. [![Move widgets.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i61.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i61.png)
8.  To increase or decrease the size of a widget, click and hold the handle at the bottom-right of a widget, then drag it up or down. [![Resize widgets.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i62.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i62.png)
9.  When you have finished arranging your layout, click **Save** > **Save current layout**. [![Save changes to your layout.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i63.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i63.png)

Apollo saves your layout selections, so your new layout will be in use when you access account profile pages in the future.

To change your layout, repeat these steps to edit it. To use a different layout, including the default **Account overview** layout, click the **layouts** icon and choose a layout.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Add Custom Widgets to Your Layouts[](#toc_5)

By default, account profile pages feature several widgets with information ranging from account details to company insights. If you would prefer to view information in different groupings or unique information such as custom fields, create custom widgets that feature the desired information.

To create a custom widget for account profile pages:

1.  Go to an account's profile page.
2.  Click the **layouts** icon. It will have the name of the layout you are currently using. [![Access layouts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i64.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i64.png)
3.  Find the layout you want to change, then click **...** > **Edit layout**. [![Edit your layout.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i65.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i65.png)
4.  Click **Add widgets**. [![Access widgets.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i66.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i66.png)
5.  To add an existing widget to your layout, hover on the widget and click **+**. [![Add an existing widget to layout.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i67.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i67.png)
6.  To add a new widget, click **Create widget**. [![Create a new widget.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i68.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i68.png)
7.  If you choose to create a new widget, enter a new name for the widget and click the checkbox for each field that you want to add to the widget. Then, click **Create**. [![Add fields for new widget.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i69.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i69.png)

By default, the newly added widget is placed at the top-right of the layout. Follow the steps in the [Create and Edit Profile Page Layouts](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5995865049229-View-and-Edit-Account-Profiles#toc_4) section to move the widget.

[Back to Top](#top)

## View Existing Contacts for Account[](#toc_6)

Click the **Existing contacts** tab to access all existing contacts from the same company, including contacts' email addresses and phone numbers. You also have the option to take immediate action from this page by calling, emailing, prospecting on LinkedIn, or adding them to a sequence or list.

[![View existing contacts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i74.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i74.png)

View all existing contacts from the **Total** tab, or click a stage tab to view contacts that are currently in a specific stage.

[![Select contact stages](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i75.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i75.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## View All Company Employees[](#toc_7)

Click the **Employees** tab to access all of the company's employees, including employees that you do not have saved as contacts.

[![View all employees.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i76.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i76.png)

The **Quick Actions** column provides you with options to take immediate action on the contacts, including saving and accessing emails, exporting contacts to a CSV file, emailing them, or adding them to a sequence or list.

[![Take action on the contacts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i77.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i77.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## View Sequences, Deals, and Conversations Related to Accounts[](#toc_8)

To view any sequences, deals, or conversations related to an account, go to an account's profile page, then click the tab for **Sequences**, **Deals**, or **Conversations**.

[![Access sequences, deals, or conversations for account.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i78.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i78.png)

The **Sequences** tab shows all of the sequences that include the company. Use the toggle for a sequence to enable or disable it for the contact you are currently viewing.

[![View sequences for the account.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i70.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i70.png)

The **Deals** tab shows any deals that feature the account, including the current deal stage. To [create a new deal](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415062486669), click **New Deal**.

[![View sequences for the account.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i71.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i71.png)

The **Conversations** tab shows all of the recorded conversations in Apollo that included a member of the account. Click a conversation to [access the recording](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/9632855570701).

[![View conversations for the account.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i72.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i72.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## View and Edit Custom Fields[](#toc_9)

To [view and edit custom fields](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412498825869), go to an account's profile page and click the **Custom fields** tab.

[![View and edit custom fields.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i73.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/account_profile_overview/i73.png)
