## Overview[](#toc_1)

If you use LinkedIn to find and engage with your ideal contacts in a personalized way, you can leverage Apollo automation. LinkedIn task automation helps you increase the efficiency of your workflow while keeping your engagement personal as you scale.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Before You Start[](#toc_2)

Before you can automate your tasks on LinkedIn, there are several steps you need to take first:

*   **Install the Apollo Chrome extension**: The Chrome extension is required to automate tasks. If you haven't set up the Apollo Chrome extension yet and aren't sure where to begin, review [Apollo Chrome Extension Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409226637453) for an introduction to all things extension!
*   **Create LinkedIn tasks**: If you haven't created any Linked tasks for your Apollo sequences yet and need a helping hand, review [Add and Complete LinkedIn Tasks in a Sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5646233248269). Refer to [Sequences Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837) for an introduction to Apollo sequences and [Create a Sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409231193101) to add other types of steps to your sequence.
*   **Enroll contacts in a sequence**: If you create a sequence, you also need to enroll a list of contacts into it before you can leverage LinkedIn task automation. For more information about how to add contacts to a sequence, please refer to [Add Contacts to a Sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396985741).

Now that you have created new tasks or sequences, you can start to automate your LinkedIn tasks.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Automate Your LinkedIn Tasks[](#toc_3)

To automate your LinkedIn tasks using the Chrome extension:

1.  Launch LinkedIn and click the Apollo Chrome extension widget on the right side of your screen. [![Apollo's LinkedIn profile page ](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i1.png)
2.  Click the **Tasks** tab. [![Tasks tab in the extension](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i2.png)
3.  You can view a summary of the pending tasks in the pipeline from this tab. [![Tasks in the extension](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i3.png)
4.  To automate the tasks in bulk, click **Execute Tasks**. [![Execute tasks](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i4.png)
5.  To select specific contacts, click the checkboxes on the left of every task you want to execute. Then, click **Execute Selected Tasks**. [![Task checkboxes in the extension](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i5.png)

Apollo automatically starts executing all the selected tasks.

[![Tasks queue modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i6.png)

When Apollo successfully executes a task, you will see a green checkmark in the tasks queue pop-up next to the contact's name.

[![Green tick in tasks queue modal](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/automate_linkedin_tasks/i7.png)

Wanna Get Granular?

If you navigate to a contact's LinkedIn page, Apollo also displays any pending tasks you may have for that specific contact.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

The [Apollo Chrome extension](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409226637453) enables you to access key Apollo features directly within Gmail, LinkedIn, and across many company websites. As with any browser extension, you might encounter issues while you use the Apollo Chrome extension.

The following sections detail troubleshooting tips that you can utilize if you encounter any problems. The troubleshooting steps in this article are only applicable to extensions for the Google Chrome web browser.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Troubleshooting Steps[](#toc_1)

### Reload the Extension[](#toc_2)

Reloading browser extensions can resolve many issues. To reload the Apollo extension:

1.  Click the **extension** icon in the Chrome browser. Then, find the Apollo extension and click the **vertical ellipsis** for it. [![Find the extension.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/i7.png)
2.  Click **Reload Apollo Extension**. The extension should reload in a few seconds. [![Reload the extension.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/i6.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Update the Extension[](#toc_3)

Make sure the Apollo extension is up-to-date. Type `chrome://extensions` in your browser's address bar, click the **Developer Mode** toggle in the top right corner, and then click the **Update** button that appears at the top of the page to confirm your extensions are up to date.

[![Chrome Extension Dev Mode](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/developer_mode_updates.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/developer_mode_updates.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Update the Chrome Browser[](#toc_4)

Make sure the Chrome browser is up-to-date. Type `chrome://settings/help` in your browser's address bar. The page that loads will display whether Chrome is up to date or provide you with an option to update it.

[![Chrome Browser Up-To-Date](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/chrome_browser_up_to_date.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/chrome_browser_up_to_date.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Check For Blocked Cookies[](#toc_5)

Type `chrome://settings/content/cookies` in your browser's address bar and double check that you aren't blocking third-party cookies.

[![Cookies](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/cookies.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/cookies.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Perform a Hard Refresh[](#toc_6)

Perform a hard refresh on your browser with the keyboard shortcut Command+Shift+R for Macs or Ctrl+F5 for PCs. This clears the browser's cache for a specific page.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Clear Your Browser Cache[](#toc_7)

Try clearing the entire browser's cache. Type `chrome://settings/privacy` in your browser's address bar and click **Privacy and Security** to get to your browsing data. Click **Clear Browsing Data** to bring up the menu that allows you to clear your cache.

[![Privacy and Security](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/privacy_and_security.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/privacy_and_security.png)

Once you see the menu, you can change the time range the data that you would like to clear. Click the drop-down and select **All Time**. Then, on the bottom right, click **Clear Data** to clear your cache.

[![Cache](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/cache.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/cache.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

### Check For Multiple Instances of Apollo[](#toc_8)

Double check that only one instance of Apollo is open and only one instance of Gmail or Salesforce is open in another tab or in another window.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Verify Extension Compatibility[](#toc_9)

To check which extensions you have running, type `chrome://extensions/` in your Chrome browser address bar. You can turn each extension on or off by clicking the toggle.

[![Extensions Toggle](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/extensions_toggle.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/extensions_toggle.png)

To test if you are having compatibility issues with other extensions, give the Apollo Chrome Extension permission to run in incognito mode by clicking **Details**.

[![Extension Details](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/extension_details.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/extension_details.png)

From the **Details** menu, scroll down to **Allow in Incognito** and click the toggle to allow the Apollo Chrome Extension to run in incognito mode.

[![Allow in Incognito](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/allow_in_incognito.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/allow_in_incognito.png)

After you enable the Apollo Chrome Extension to run in incognito mode, launch an incognito window. Click the three vertical dots in the righthand corner and select **New Incognito Window**. If the Apollo Chrome Extension works properly when you log into Gmail or Apollo in the incognito window, then you likely have a compatibility issue with one of your other extensions.

[![Incognito Window](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/incognito_window.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_the_apollo_chrome_extension/incognito_window.png)

Known Compatibility Issues

Apollo is aware of compatibility issues with the following extensions:

*   Chili Piper
*   Ghostery
*   Grammar.ly
*   CirrusInsights
*   Salesforce IQ
*   Outreach.io
*   Persist IQ
*   Webex

If you encounter compatibility issues with a different extension, Apollo recommends that you disable or remove the interfering extension. You can also whitelist the website you have issues with if the incompatible extension offers that functionality. Finally, you can operate the incompatible extension in a separate [Chrome Profile](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/2364824?hl=en).

If the steps in this article do not resolve your issues, please contact the [Apollo Technical Support](https://www.apollo.io/contact-us) team.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Many sales teams leverage calls to engage with prospects at different stages within the buyer's journey. If your team uses the Apollo in-app dialer to communicate with your ideal prospects, you can also take advantage of the active call feature to coach in real-time and improve call performance.

Professional and Custom Plans Only

Please note, this feature is only available for customers on **Professional** and **Custom** plans. If you have questions or if you'd like to upgrade your plan, please reach out to the [Apollo Technical Support](mailto: support@apollo.io) team.

Refer to the sections below for the steps to take to configure the permission settings and then view, monitor, coach, and participate in active calls.

[Back to Top](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/3top)

## Configure Call Permissions[](#toc_2)

Permission Restrictions

Please note, only users with access to managing permission profiles can configure the call permission settings. If you do not have access to permission profiles and you want to view, join, listen, or participate in your colleagues' active calls, please contact an admin user to enable the permissions for your account.

Launch Apollo, click **Settings**, and then click **Permission Profiles**.

[![Settings-Permission Profiles](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i1.png)

Click the team for which you want to configure permissions.

[![Select Team](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i2.png)

Then, click the **Can view and filter for Active calls** checkbox.

[![Can View and Filter Checkbox](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i4.png)

Click the **Join call mode** drop-down to further specify permission levels. You can choose whether the users of this team can listen, coach, or participate fully in active calls.

[![Call Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i5.png)

You have now configured the call permissions for a team. Repeat this process for any other teams that want to join active calls.

[Back to Top](#top)

## View and Filter Active Calls[](#toc_3)

Now that you have configured the call permissions, the selected users can view and filter active calls.

Launch Apollo, click **Engage**, and then click **Calls**.

[![Calls](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i3.png)

Click the **Active Calls** tab and scroll through the calls taking place in real-time.

[![Show Active Calls](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i7.png)

Compatible By Nature!

Apollo detects all active calls taking place in real-time through the Apollo dialer, no matter which platform the user is calling out of.

Click the **Filters** icon and use the filters on the left to easily locate a specific call that you want to join. You can filter by contact, user, purpose, direction, date, duration, or contact lists.

[![Call Filters](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i17.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i17.png)

Refer to the sections below for further information about how to join an active call.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Join Active Calls[](#toc_4)

Once you have found an active call that you would like to join, click the **Join Call** drop-down. You have 3 options available: **Listen-only**, **Coach**, and **Participate**.

[![Join Call Drop-Down](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i8.png)

You Call the Shots

Please note, you can only join active calls if you have already set up the dialer. If you have not done so, Apollo prompts you to configure the dialer first.

Click **Set Up Dialer**. Then, follow the instructions in the "[Configure the Dialer](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409140527757-Configure-the-Dialer)" article.

[![Show Active Calls](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i9.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i9.png)

### Listen-only[](#toc_5)

Choose this option if you want to listen to everyone and stay muted. Ideal for monitoring—you can evaluate progress and then refer back to the call in your next coaching session without interrupting the flow of the call as it takes place.

To join an active call in **Listen-only** mode, click the **Join Call** drop-down on the right-hand side of the call you want to enter.

[![Join Call](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i8.png)

Then, click **Listen-only**.

[![Listen](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i10.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i10.png)

Hang tight while Apollo connects you. You have now joined the call in listen-only mode.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Coach[](#toc_6)

Choose this option if you want to listen to everyone but only speak to your team. Ideal for training—you can listen, support, and guide your team in real-time as they speak to prospects and customers.

Click the **Join Call** drop-down on the right-hand side of the call in which you want to coach.

[![Join Call](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i8.png)

Then, click **Coach**.

[![Coach](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i15.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i15.png)

Hang tight while Apollo connects you. You have now joined the call in **Coach** mode.

[Back to Top](#top)

### Participate[](#toc_7)

Choose this option if you want to listen and engage with everyone on the call. Ideal for collaboration—you can support your team members, interact with all participants, and lead by example.

Click the **Join Call** drop-down on the right-hand side of the call in which you want to participate.

[![Join Call](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i8.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i8.png)

Then, click **Participate**.

[![Participate](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i16.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i16.png)

Hang tight while Apollo connects you. You have now joined the call in **Participate** mode.

Too Many Cooks Spoil the Broth!

Please note, up to 250 users can join each call that you make with the Apollo dialer. Please keep this in mind before you decide which calls to join.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Call Settings[](#toc_8)

When you join an active call, Apollo displays the dialer at the bottom of your screen.

[![Listen-Only Mode](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i11.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i11.png)

To view who else is present, click the **People** icon.

[![Attendees](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i12.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i12.png)

A Quick Heads Up Never Hurts

Remember that the sales rep hosting the call can also see if you join them, so use your superpower wisely and respectfully!

Click **Show Caller Details** to find out more about the caller.

[![Caller Info](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i13.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i13.png)

If you join in **Coach** or **Participant** mode, you can mute yourself at any time. To do so, click the **Microphone** icon.

[![Mute Icon](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i18.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i18.png)

To leave the call, click **Hang Up**.

[![Hang Up Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i14.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/join_your_team_in_active_calls_with_the_apollo_dialer/i14.png)

Is This Really Goodbye?

If you're worried that hanging up early will end the call for all participants, fear not. Only the call host has that power. Other users can hang up when they please, but the show must go on!

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_0)

If you have set up the [Salesforce integration](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/sections/4409216721549) and want to add the contacts you've prospected in Apollo to your [Salesforce campaigns](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.campaigns_def.htm&type=5), refer to the following section.

Outside the Apollo Box

New to Salesforce campaigns? Follow the steps in Salesforce's [Create a Campaign](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.create_a_campaign.htm&type=5) article to get started.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Add Contacts to Salesforce Campaigns[](#toc_1)

To add Apollo contacts to your Salesforce campaigns:

1.  Go to Apollo, click **Search**, and then click [**People**](https://app.apollo.io/#/people).
2.  Use the [search filters](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412665755661) to find the contacts you want to add to the Salesforce campaign. [![Filter your contacts.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_salesforce_campaigns/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_salesforce_campaigns/i1.png)
3.  Click the checkbox for each contact you want to add to the campaign.
4.  Click the **Salesforce** drop-down, then click **Add to Salesforce Campaign**. [![Add your contacts to a Salesforce campaign.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_salesforce_campaigns/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_salesforce_campaigns/i2.png)
5.  Enter the name of the Salesforce campaign to which you want to add the contacts. It must match the name in Salesforce, but it is not case-sensitive. Then, click **Save**. [![Enter your Salesforce campaign name.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_salesforce_campaigns/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_salesforce_campaigns/i3.png)
6.  Apollo adds the contacts to the Campaign Members section of your Salesforce Campaign. This process typically completes within a few minutes. However, the number of contacts and other processes might delay the process. [![Members added to your Salesforce campaign.](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_salesforce_campaigns/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/add_contacts_salesforce_campaigns/i4.png)

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

There may be times when you need to manually remove a contact from [a sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409237165837-Sequences-Overview). For example, let's say you enroll multiple contacts from the same company in a sequence. If one of those contacts responds and you close the deal, you may want to remove the other contacts from the sequence.

No Rash Decisions Here!

Not ready to remove a contact from a sequence just yet? Fear not! You can manually pause a contact in a sequence at any time. Please read the [Pause a Contact in a Sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/6793821340429-Pause-a-Contact-in-a-Sequence) article for further information.

Refer to the following sections for the steps to remove or mark a contact as finished in a sequence.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Manually Remove a Contact from a Sequence[](#toc_2)

To manually remove a contact from a sequence:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click the sequence from which you want to remove a contact. [![Choose Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/pause_a_contact_in_a_sequence/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/pause_a_contact_in_a_sequence/i2.png)
3.  Click **Contacts**. Then, click the checkbox(es) next to the contact(s) you want to remove from the sequence. [![Contacts Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/pause_a_contact_in_a_sequence/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/pause_a_contact_in_a_sequence/i3.png)
4.  Click the **Remove From Sequence** icon. [![Remove from Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/remove_a_contact_from_a_sequence/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/remove_a_contact_from_a_sequence/i1.png)
5.  Apollo displays a **Remove Sequence** pop-up. If you are sure that you want to remove a contact from the sequence, click **— Remove**. [![Remove Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/remove_a_contact_from_a_sequence/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/remove_a_contact_from_a_sequence/i2.png)
6.  You have now removed a contact from a sequence.
    
    Easy Does it!
    
    Please note, when you remove a contact from a sequence you agree to bypass the safety checks that notify you if you are about to re-deploy the contact to the same or another sequence, or to more than one sequence at a time. Apollo recommends you use your power with caution! If a contact replies to an email or unsubscribes, Apollo recommends you mark them as finished instead. Refer to the following section for further instructions.
    
    **(Reminder)** If you remove a contact from a sequence and then re-add them, Apollo remembers their progress and adds them back to the same step in the sequence. If you want the contact you removed to start from step 1 again, you need to [clone that sequence](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409396985741-Add-Contacts-to-a-Sequence#toc_3) first and then add the contact to the newly cloned one instead.
    

[Back to Top](#top)

## Manually Mark a Contact as Finished in a Sequence[](#toc_3)

By default, sequences end when a contact replies to an email. However, there are certain situations when you may want to manually mark a contact as finished. For example, if you changed the default trigger settings for sequences and a contact wishes to [unsubscribe](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409140379661-Configure-Your-Opt-Out-Unsubscribe-Email-Link) or if a contact [changes jobs](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/5130064363661-Use-Job-Change-Alerts-to-Update-Contacts).

To manually mark a contact as finished in a sequence:

1.  Launch Apollo and click **Engage** > [**Sequences**](https://app.apollo.io/#/sequences).
2.  Click the sequence from which you want to mark a contact as finished. [![Choose Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/pause_a_contact_in_a_sequence/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/pause_a_contact_in_a_sequence/i2.png)
3.  Click **Contacts** and then click the checkbox(es) next to the contact(s) that you want to mark as finished in the sequence. [![Contacts Tab](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/pause_a_contact_in_a_sequence/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/pause_a_contact_in_a_sequence/i3.png)
4.  Click the **Mark Sequence As Finished** icon. [![Mark As Finished](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/remove_a_contact_from_a_sequence/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/remove_a_contact_from_a_sequence/i3.png)
5.  Apollo displays a **Finish Sequence** pop-up. Click the **Why Mark as Finished?** drop-down to select the reason. [![Select Drop-Down Option](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/remove_a_contact_from_a_sequence/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/remove_a_contact_from_a_sequence/i4.png)
6.  Then, click **Mark Finished**. [![Mark Finished Button](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/remove_a_contact_from_a_sequence/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/remove_a_contact_from_a_sequence/i5.png)
7.  Now, you have marked a contact as finished in a sequence.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Sequences are outreach campaigns with any number of sequential contact points and tasks that are customized to personally engage your target audiences at scale. They help your team deliver communications to your customers and complete the right tasks at the right time to speed your prospects through your pipeline and turn them into paying customers as efficiently as possible. 

By default, sequences end when a contact replies to an email, but there may be situations where you want the contact to continue through the sequence.

Refer to the steps below to learn how to change the default setting for sequences.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Change the Default Setting[](#toc_2)

Launch Apollo, hover your mouse over **Engage** in the navbar, and then click **Sequences**.

[![Sequences](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_templates/sequences.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/create_and_edit_templates/sequences.png)

Click the sequence for which you want to change the default setting.

[![Sequence](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i1.png)

Click the **More** drop-down and then click **Settings**.

[![Settings](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i2.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i2.png)

Click **Change** under **Sequence Ruleset:**.

[![Change](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i3.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i3.png)

Click the **X** to change the setting to **No Ruleset**.

[![No Ruleset](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i4.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i4.png)

Under **Mark emails as Not Sent when the contact stage is any of:**, click **Replied** to remove the condition.

[![Replied Condition](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i5.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i5.png)

Click **Show Default Triggers**.

[![Default Triggers](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i6.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i6.png)

Uncheck **Mark contact as finished in sequence when there is a reply**.

[![Uncheck](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i7.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/sequence_after_reply/i7.png)

## Sync Mailboxes with UIDValidity[](#toc_1)

Apollo uses a third-party service called Nylas to connect custom mailboxes to your account. Nylas uses UIDValidity to sync mailboxes on their end. Some configurations lead to inconsistent UIDValidity, which affects sync consistency.

If the UIDValidity of your mailbox changes, Nylas attempts to resync the original value until too many failures cause it to stop. When this happens to a mailbox that you've synced with Apollo, Nylas disconnects it.

Two easy ways to prevent this from happening are:

*   Ensure each folder in your email account has at least one message in it
*   Delete all empty folders in your email account

UIDValidity Guide

For more information on UIDValidity, read Nyla's [UIDValidity Guide](https://developer.nylas.com/docs/support/troubleshooting/uidvalidity/#inconsistent-uidvalidity-value).

[Back to Top](#top)

## Changes to Your Linked Mailbox that Effect Your Apollo Mailbox Settings[](#toc_2)

If Apollo can't authenticate your email account's login credentials, Apollo removes the mailbox. Authentication failure can happen for a few reasons:

*   You change your email account password
*   You set up two-factor authentication for the first time
*   You deny Apollo access to your email account
*   You make changes to your email account security settings that prevent Apollo from authenticating your mailbox

If Apollo detects changes to the email linked to the mailbox, Apollo notifies you through email that you have invalid credentials.

Microsoft Exchange

Please note, if you have two-factor authentication enabled for a Microsoft Exchange email account, you must generate an **app password** from Microsoft. Click [here](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/account-billing/using-app-passwords-with-apps-that-don-t-support-two-step-verification-5896ed9b-4263-e681-128a-a6f2979a7944) for instructions from Microsoft. You must **use the app password** to authenticate your mailbox with Apollo. Nylas does not directly support two-factor authentication.

If you delete the email account linked to the Apollo mailbox, Apollo deletes the connected email account.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Re-Link a Mailbox[](#toc_3)

If you need to re-link your mailbox, please read the [Link Your Mailbox to Apollo.io](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4409127806093-Link-Your-Mailbox-to-Apollo-io) article.

## Overview[](#toc_1)

When you integrate Salesforce with Apollo, you can take advantage of Apollo **Analytics** to access key insights from your Salesforce **Opportunities** data. If you analyze your Salesforce **Opportunities**, you can more easily identify and better understand the key demographics of your ideal prospects. This can directly impact your success when prospecting in Apollo.

Seize the Opportunity!

For further information about **Opportunities** in Apollo, please refer to the [Opportunities Overview](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415062467725-Opportunities-Overview) article. If you want to understand more about **Opportunity** Stages and Salesforce, please read [this article](https://knowledge.apollo.io/hc/en-us/articles/4415294726029-Understand-Opportunity-Stages-and-Salesforce-).

Refer to the sections below for more information on how to access Salesforce **Opportunity Analytics** in Apollo and how to leverage these insights when prospecting.

We're Here to Help!

## Overview[](#toc_1)

Any time you send a message through Apollo, there is a chance that when you open that message in your email, Apollo registers it as an open event. You want to be sure that you do not count self-opens in your data.

Read the information below to see how to identify self-opens.

[Back to Top](#top)

## When Apollo Can't Detect Self-Opens[](#toc_2)

Apollo can't detect self-opens if you open one of your emails on a different device than the one you used to send it from. Most likely, this would be from a smartphone.

[Back to Top](#top)

## When Apollo Can Detect Self-Opens[](#toc_3)

### The Apollo Chrome Extension[](#toc_4)

The [Apollo Chrome Extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/apolloio-email-finder-and/alhgpfoeiimagjlnfekdhkjlkiomcapa?hl=en-US) can detect self-opens and makes sure they are not counted. The connection between the extension and your Gmail account ensures that self-opens are nullified.

[Back to Top](#top)

### IP Address[](#toc_5)

If you have not installed the Apollo Chrome Extension, Apollo will check the network IP address of the opener and compare it against the address that was most recently associated with the sender.

IP Address Security Settings

Please note, if Apollo can't read your network's IP address then it can't reliably exclude your self-opens in this manner.

Unsubscribe Links and Tracking Links

Please note, interactions with unsubscribe links and tracking links are intelligently excluded in the same way as opens. When Apollo detects that the unsubscriber and email sender have the same network IP address, Apollo automatically excludes the unsubscribe link in the sent message.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Overview[](#toc_1)

There are several reasons why you may receive sending errors within your Email Service Provider (ESP). For Microsoft Outlook, one of the more common and frustrating errors is `Message delivery submission failed 120 / HTTP 422 (Microsoft)`. There are a few different tactics that you can use to diagnose and troubleshoot this error.

Refer to the sections below for information about how to troubleshoot this error.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Troubleshoot "Message delivery submission failed 120 / HTTP 422 (Microsoft)" Errors[](#toc_2)

This delivery error is specific to users with a linked Microsoft Outlook mailbox.

`Microsoft Exchange rejected your message. Message delivery submission failed 120 / HTTP 422 (Microsoft)`

[![Error](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_microsoft_failed_120_http_422_errors/i1.png)](https://storage.googleapis.com/apollo-public-assets/kb_images/troubleshoot_microsoft_failed_120_http_422_errors/i1.png)

Messages sent from Apollo are routed through the Nylas Application Programming Interface (API). If you receive this error for any of your sent messages, confirm the following:

*   Is your send-from email address the same as the address synced within Apollo?
    *   For example, if you've connected the account `user@email.com`, but you set the from email as `new_user@email.com`when sending through the Nylas API, you might receive the `120 / 422 error` from Microsoft. You may also see an exception like `Exception message: MapiExceptionSendAsDenied: Unable to submit message.` in your Exchange logs.
*   Has your Microsoft Exchange server quarantined the [syncing devices](https://docs.nylas.com/docs/checking-for-quarantined-eas-devices) Nylas uses to sync?
    *   Check to see whether Outlook has any of the following potential issues:
        *   The **Mobile** —> **Mobile Device Access** menu lists no quarantined devices.
        *   You've enabled mobile device provisioning.
        *   There are no conflicting device access rules as defined by the [Suggested Office 365 Settings](https://developer.nylas.com/docs/the-basics/provider-guides/microsoft/suggested-office-365-settings/) on the Nylas Docs site.

If you have additional questions about troubleshooting this error, refer to the [Message Delivery Submission Failed](https://developer.nylas.com/docs/support/troubleshooting/microsoft/sending-failures/) article on the Nylas Knowledge Base.

[Back to Top](#top)

## Whitelist Nylas IP Addresses[](#toc_3)

If your settings in Outlook all match the expected settings listed above, it's possible that your mail server has blocked Nylas from sending messages on your behalf. If your email account settings have a whitelist security feature, you should add the Nylas IP addresses to your whitelist.

Apollo recommends that you reach out to your company's email administrator to confirm whether you can add IPs to a whitelist. Then, refer to the instructions on the [AWS Public IP Address Ranges Now Available in JSON Form](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/aws-ip-ranges-json/). You should whitelist all IP ranges designated as "us-west-2" in the [JSON file](https://ip-ranges.amazonaws.com/ip-ranges.json). This file is available on the Amazon AWS site of IPs.

[Back to Top](#top)
